Title: The OG Of Early Morning Biryani! MANI DUM BIRYANI Hoskote | Over 1000 Kilos Biryani On Sundays!
Description:
#manidumbiryani #hoskote #biryani 

hoskote biryani, mani dum biryani, spicy mutton biryani, hoskote, hosakote, mark wiens, world no 1 food youtuber, kripal amanna, mark wiens kripal amanna food tour in bengaluru, mark wiens kripal amanna collab food series, bangalore, migrationology, mark wiens tastes hoskote biryani, popular hoskote biryani shop, mani dum biryani, no branches, mani biryani, biryani trail, inspiring stories, karnataka, india food tour, mark wiens food, indian food, bengaluru food tour, bangalore food walk, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

In this episode, we visit the OG of the early morning biryani, the iconic Mani Dum Biryani in Hoskote. A tiny biryani shop that began with a two-kilo biryani pot in 1982 to feed a handful of  truckers on the route, but is today an iconic destination where a few thousand converge each week to feast on a spicy mutton biryani that is dished out in the hundreds of kilos.

Hope you‚Äôre enjoying this series. Catch the complete Bengaluru food tour with Mark Wiens series at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLri_37vf6mmpNCyKIJcnP_HlItIX1PYeC 

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Also, hop over to @MarkWiens ' channel to catch our Bengaluru food tour through his lens. Cheers!


Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

Subscribe To our second channel at https://www.youtube.com/c/KripalAmannaVlogs 

ADDRESS -  Mani Dum Biryani, Hoskote Malur Rd, beside Sri Satya Convention Hall, Dandupalya, Hoskote, Karnataka 562114; tel: +91 96112 96212
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/kqUtDU14PkpJV4gT6
TIMINGS: 6am to 930am on Tuesday, Friday and Sundays only. The biryani can run out early at times.
Note: It can get crowded, especially on Sundays. Get early to beat a long queue. Mani Dum Biryani Hoskote has no branches.

Title: From Losing Everything To Building 50 Restaurants! Lunch With SANGEETHA Chennai Founder, Mr. Suresh!
Description:
#sangeethavegrestaurant #lunch #chennai
 
sangeetha veg restaurant, adyar, chennai, most popular veg restaurant in chennai, sangeetha veg, tamil nadu meals, lunch at sangeetha chennai, sangeetha veg restaurant chennai, sangeetha restaurant owner, suresh, inspiring story, kitchen tour, veg meals, best chennai food, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

45 years ago, a young lad found himself at a difficult crossroad.He was interested in photography and cinema, but the financial situation at home compelled him to give up his education and take up a job in a restaurant. Working 18 hours a day, life was tough, he spent many nights with no roof over his head. Things got better, when he and his family set up two restaurants in Chennai. Unfortunately, the restaurants failed and they had to begin all over again. This is hardly the kind of backstory one would expect to hear of Chennai‚Äôs iconic Sangeetha vegetarian chain of restaurants. But these are exactly the kind of challenges Mr. Suresh and his family endured to build 50 restaurants over the years. I caught up with him at their flagship Adyar restaurant, where I relished a delightful Tamil Nadu meal which in addition to highlighting the cuisine of the land is also accommodative enough to encompass flavours beyond the borders of the state. 

I hope you enjoy my last saapad from this Gourmet On The Road, Chennai tour. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Tamil Nadu Meals
Rs. 290
10/10

Title: India's Longest Dining Table Can Seat 100+ Guests! 10 Chefs! 10 Indian Cuisines! #chennai #foodvlog
Description: Watch full video at https://youtu.be/AB1CnJFnL-0

Title: India‚Äôs Longest Dining Table! 10 Chefs, 10 Indian Cuisines, 100 Guests! Culinary History In Chennai!
Description:
#indiancuisine #topchefsofindia #chennai

india‚Äôs longest dining table, single table, 156 feet long, hanu‚Äôs table, hanu reddy raghava farm chef regi mathew, chennai, top 10 chefs of india, regional indian cuisine, top dishes of india, indian fine dining, 100 guests, indian gastronomy, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

A few weeks ago, I was invited to witness culinary history in Chennai. A single dining table, 156 feet long, would play host to 106 guests who would be dining on 10 courses representing 10 regional Indian cuisines presented by the top 10 chefs of the country. Curated by Chef Regi Mathew who found an equally passionate partner in 'India champion', connoisseur and entrepreneur, Mr. Hanu Reddy to support this initiative, this evening at Hanu Reddy Farms, 40 kilometres outside Chennai was nothing short of magical! This was truly a dining experience unlike any other.

I hope you enjoy my video account of this evening. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

Title: ‚ÄòFull Menu‚Äô Tasting & Kitchen Tour At ERODU AMMAN MESS! Chennai‚Äôs Most Popular Kongunadu Cuisine!
Description:
#eroduammanmess #chennai #kripalamanna
 
erodu amman mess, most popular non veg restaurant in chennai, annanagar, erode cuisine, konganadu cuisine, full menu tasting, kitchen tour, veg meals, mutton biryani, japan chicken, chintamani chicken, nalli fry, mutton biryani, annur fish curry, chicken chintamani, naati kozhi fry, vanjaram fry, fish kuzhambu, chennai biryani review, popular biryani in chennai, best chennai food, chennai biryani, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

Going by the number of recommendations I received to visit this place,  all roads seem to lead to Erodu Amman Mess currently when it comes to non vegetarian fare in Chennai. Although only a few years old, this restaurant seems to have built for itself a solid reputation on the back of a legacy that traces its Konganadu cuisine offerings to Erode, Tamil Nadu. I spent the greater part of an afternoon exploring the kitchens here and left only after partaking of most of their popular dishes including a delicious vegetarian meal and mutton biryani. This video is a slightly lengthy watch, but one that should have you salivating for more.

I hope you enjoy this very special episode from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Must Try Dum Ka Roat, Ande Ki Mithai At This 108 Year-Old Sweet Shop! BASHA HALWAWALA Chennai
Description:
#bashahalwawala #dumkaroat #chennai
 
basha halwawala, original basha halwawala, basha halwa chennai, zam bazar, jam bazar, triplicane, chennai, dum ka roat, dum ka roat triplicane, ande ki mithai, egg sweet, gulab jamun, carrot halwa, triplicane basha halwa, chennai sweetshop review, popular sweet shop in chennai, chennai mithai shop, best chennai food, chennai biryani, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

If you have a sweet tooth and find yourself in Chennai, this 108-year-old sweet shop in Zam Bazaar, Triplicane is a must visit. Especially for its dum ka roat, a delicious baked dessert of semolina, khoa and ghee that has all of Chennai flocking here. My other favourite from a quick tasting here was their ande ki mithai, a rich cake-like-texture creation that belies its core ingredient in its subtle flavour and aroma. The popularity of this Chennai institution has spawned imitators, so make sure you head to the original store in Zam Bazar, Triplicane to get your share of their iconic sweet treats.

I hope you enjoy this episode from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

9/10

Title: Delicious Old World Flavours At This 62-Year-Old Humble Eatery! SRI VENKATESHWARA, Yercaud‚Äôs First
Description:
#yercaud #srivenkateshwara #vegetarian
 
yercaud, sri venkateshwara veg restaurant, yercaud street food, where to eat in yercaud, tamil nadu, yercaud famous street food, yercaud food tour, idli vadai, onion dosai, ghee dosa, podi dosa, yercaud food walk, yercaud food trail, tamil nadu food tour, yercaud food series, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

It is rare these days to find old world eateries that haven‚Äôt succumbed to the compromises of time, in their approach, way of life, and most importantly the flavours they present. 62-year-old Sri Venkateshwara is one such place where time seems to have stood still. Yercaud‚Äôs first restaurant has seen many dignitaries pass through its doors in its early existence, since then much has changed, but the second generation family holds on to its good old fashioned approach to serving tasty, honestly priced vegetarian fare. I stopped here on my last evening in Yercaud to relish a tasty tiffin that also included three of their must-try dosae.

Hope you enjoy the first episode from this short Yercaud food series. Stay tuned for more; take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Experience Authentic Yercaud Tribal Cuisine Cooked In Claypots, Coconut Shells, Bamboo & Leaves!
Description:
#tribalcuisine #yercaud #lafourseasonsresort
 
yercaud, yercaud tribal cuisine, tribal food, food cooked in claypots, coconut shells, bamboo and banana leaves, where to eat in yercaud, tamil nadu, yercaud food tour, claypot chicken, banana leaf fish fry, bamboo biryani, coconut shell prawns, mudavattukal kilangu soup, yercaud food trail, tamil nadu food tour, yercaud food series, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

A few months ago, I heard of this culinarian in Yercaud, Kathiravan Karthikeyan, who had spent considerable time researching the lost tribal cuisine of Yercaud, and had made an attempt to revive age-old food traditions. Cooked only in natural mediums - clay pots, coconut shells, bamboo and banana leaves, the dishes presented to me were rustic and flavourful, a delicious ode to the tribal cuisine of the land. If you find yourself in Yercaud, this is certainly a cuisine to take in.

Hope you enjoy this watch. Stay tuned for more; take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Bengaluru Street Food With MARK WIENS! Egg Rice, Avarebele Dosae, Akki Rotti & More! Pt 1
Description:
#markwiens #kripalamanna #bangalore 

mark wiens, world no 1 food youtuber, kripal amanna, mark wiens kripal amanna food tour in bengaluru, mark wiens kripal amanna collab food series, bangalore, migrationology, mark wiens bangalore, bangalore street food, india food tour, mark wiens food, indian food, bengaluru street food tour, uncle egg rice, vv puram food street, sri vasavi mane thindi, bengaluru food tour, bangalore food walk, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, chennai food series, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

Back in 2009 when YouTube was only five years old and most didn‚Äôt know what to make of it, leave alone do with it, Mark Wiens began his food channel on the platform. 15 years later, there isn‚Äôt perhaps a YouTube food storyteller who is as popular as he is, with over 10 million subscribers. And so it was an absolute honour and privilege when he reached out to me, to introduce to him the food culture of Bengaluru. Over three days, we tasted about 50 dishes in a mega food tasting session. In the first episode of this epic collab series, we explore the street food fare of this city - egg rice, avarebele delicacies, gobi manchuri, bonda bajji and more. Hope you enjoy this watch and the others that will come up in our Bengaluru food tour with Mark Wiens.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Also, hop over to Mark's channel at @MarkWiens to catch our Bengaluru food tour through his lens, and subscribe. Cheers!

Title: Dinner With Chef VENKATESH BHAT! His Success Mantra, YouTube Journey, Food Philosophy & More! Pt 1
Description:
#chefvenkateshbhat #kripalamanna #royalindianaa 
 
chef venkatesh bhat, venkatesh bhat's idhayam thotta samayal, youtube, hugely popular youtuber in chennai, cooking channel, venkatesh bhat channel, cook with comali, royal indiana restaurant, vegetarian restaurant, the accord metropolitan hotel, chennai, tamil nadu, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

Chef Venkatesh Bhat stands tall as Tamil Nadu‚Äôs much-loved culinary personality with an enormous following across the globe. A hugely popular television cookery show host, YouTuber, whose channel ‚ÄòVenkatesh Bhat's Idhayam Thotta Samayal‚Äô achieved prolific virality in a very short span of time, culinary powerhouse, entrepreneur and hospitality head honcho, he wears many hats. I know him from his time in Bengaluru over two decades ago. And so it was a pleasure to catch up with him after all these years over a memorable dinner at his vegetarian flagship restaurant, Royal Indianaa at The Accord Metropolitan in Chennai. 

We spent a couple of hours eating, speaking of his journey, his mantra to success, his culinary philosophy, and lots more. Hope you find this special two-part episode as interesting as I did filming this conversation. 

Stay tuned for more from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Watch These Chefs Set Guinness World Record With 123.03 Feet Long Dosa!!! MTR Foods Bengaluru
Description:
#mtrfoods #worldslongestdosa #guinnessworldrecord

world's longest dosa,  guinness world record, official guinness world record, longest dosa in the world by mtr foods, longest dosae, mtr foods, world record for biggest dosa, bengaluru, bangalore, karnataka, bengaluru food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

You know I love my dosae - watching it being made, learning what makes each version special, and savouring it with joy. Imagine my excitement then to learn of dosae history being made, right here in Namma Bengaluru. Well, that‚Äôs exactly what MTR Foods chose to do to celebrate 100 years of MTR‚Äôs iconic culinary legacy. In a move truly befitting of the time, the chefs at this food brand chose to shatter the previous Guinness record for the world‚Äôs longest dosa. And they did so convincingly, by going more than twice the distance!

The dosae is iconic and fabled here in Bengaluru, and now it stands tall, or should I say long :-), with this Guinness record - the world‚Äôs longest dosae. I was privileged to be invited to the MTR Foods factory on this momentous occasion, and in this special Gourmet On The Road episode, we bring you the excitement from the day when dosae history was made!

Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: The Chicken 65 Was Invented Here! BUHARI Chennai | Must Try Bun Butter Jam, Mutton Samsa, Biryani‚Ä¶
Description:
#buhari #chicken65 #chennai
 
buhari mount road, buhari restaurant chennai, buhari chennai, chicken 65 was first made here, chicken 65, buhari chicken 65, chicken 65 recipe, bun butter jam, mutton samsa, tea, mutton biryani, chennai buhari biryani, buhari biryani, ceylon parotta, mutton parotta, cassatta ice cream, chennai biryani review, popular biryani in chennai, best chennai food, chennai biryani, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

This iconic Chennai landmark has spawned many branches, but those in the know head to the original outpost on Mount Road that began in 1951 when its founder Mr. A. M. Buhari returned to Chennai from Colombo with his eponymous restaurant post Indian independence. Back in the day, the restaurant was associated with a number of firsts, the first espresso machine, the first jukebox, and the first eatery to serve its patrons in fine, imported bone china. Today though, Buhari is perhaps most famous as the place where the chicken 65 was invented. I tasted their creation and was surprised to find it unlike any other version that passes off as a dish. Also partook of the other popular rituals here - the bun butter jam, mutton samsa with tea, mutton biryani et al.

I hope you enjoy this episode from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Must Try Tiffin At Chennai‚Äôs Popular Vegetarian Restaurant, MATHSYA Egmore! 100 Year History!
Description:
#mathsyaegmore #chennai #vegetarian
 
mathsya restaurant, mathsya egmore, chennai, tamil nadu, vegetarian restaurant, evening tiffin, udupi restaurant in chennai, rasam vada, ghee roast dosa, chilli cheese toast, kotte kadubu, kootu, menaskai, chennai, tamil nadu, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

When I polled viewers on restaurants to cover in Chennai, Mathsya in Egmore came much recommended. Not surprising though, with a culinary legacy that spans decades to when Mr. Shama Bhat, a native Udupi set up Udupi Shri Krishna Bhavan in 1947, which eventually morphed into this popular vegetarian eatery in 1980.

I caught up with the fourth-generation, present-day custodians of this iconic Chennai institution, and in the course of doing so, also relished many of their much-ordered tiffin treats, including the rasam vada, kotte kadubu with kootu, menaskai and ghee roast dosae.

Hope you enjoy this vegetarian evening outing in Chennai. Stay tuned for more from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Most Memorable Traditional Kerala Food At KAPPA CHAKKA KANDHARI, Chennai With Chef Regi Mathew!
Description:
#kappachakkakandhari #chennai #keralafood
 
kappa chakka kandhari, chennai, tamil nadu, idichakka porichatthu, tender jackfruit roast, koorka ularthiyathu, chinese potatoes fry, coconut prawns, mutton coconut fry, lobster tawa fry, kallummakaya fry, mussels fry, pomfret tawa masala, breadfruit curry, mutton curry, chicken curry, chatti meen curry, pearlspot curry, best kerala food in chennai, kappa chakka kandhari bengaluru, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

I‚Äôve eaten in Kappa Chakka Kandhari, Bengaluru, and it was a great meal all right, but when I found myself in Chennai recently, I had to visit its first restaurant, which also gave me an opportunity to share a table with my dear friend, Chef Regi Mathew after 25 years. For those who don‚Äôt know him yet, this culinary doyen, a master in many cuisines, has made it his life‚Äôs work to promote regional cuisine, especially that from his homeland Kerala. The dishes that I tasted at this lunch were the sort that left an indelible impression on my palate. Made to age old home recipes, sourcing the best ingredients from God‚Äôs own country - tender jackfruit, breadfruit, chinese potatoes, pearl spot fish, mussels and more -  Chef Regi‚Äôs menu is a triumph in showcasing regional Malayalee cuisine. And has also, deservedly, earned him a recent accolade as India‚Äôs top chef.

The next time you find yourself in Chennai or Bengaluru, definitely book a table at his restaurant. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay tuned for more from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Chennai‚Äôs Popular Biryani Shop, YAA MOHAIDEEN Pallavaram Began As A Push Cart 30 Years Ago!
Description:
#yaamohaideen #biryani #chennai
 
yaa mohaideen biryani, yaa mohaideen pallavaram, tambaram, chennai, tamil nadu, mutton biryani, chicken biryani, chicken pakoda, mutton chukka, chennai biryani review, ya mohideen biryani, yaa mohaideen shop, popular biryani in chennai, chennai food tour, chennai food walk, chennai food trail, tamil nadu food tour, chennai food series, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

Chennai loves its biryani, and when it comes to the city‚Äôs most popular biryani kadai (shop), many point in the direction of Yaa Mohaideen, an enterprise that first came to life in a push cart nearly 30 years ago. Now with branches and restaurants across the city, old timers still prefer to visit its first outlet in Pallavaram, in the southern part of the city, where it is de rigueur to queue for and taste the biryani, whilst standing! We tasted both versions of the Yaa Mohaideen biryani, chicken and mutton, and also a couple of popular sides. 

Hope you enjoy this biryani episode. Stay tuned for more from Gourmet On The Road, Chennai. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Let‚Äôs Help This Brave Lady Rebuild Her Delicious KARI DOSA Shop, Bengaluru! Support Small Business
Description:
#karidosa #streetfood #bengaluru

kari dosa, street food, kari dosae, kari dosai, kari dosa in bangalore, mutton kari dosa, chicken kari dosa, prawn kari dosa, veg curry dosa, egg dosae, btm layout, bt, 2nd stage, south bengaluru, lady entrepreneur, support small business, must try dosa spot, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A few months ago, I featured an episode with a brave lady entrepreneur who despite facing physical hardships after a serious accident had given up an IT job to pursue her passion in food. Your response to it was amazing, and soon Veena‚Äôs Kari Dosa street food stall was thriving. Until one day when she returned to her spot to find that the entire lot had been razed to the ground!  

Left with no recourse but to begin from scratch again, this time Veena opted for the safety of a shop. Pooling her savings and borrowing some more, she has set up a small Kari Dosa shop in BTM 2nd Stage, Bengaluru. However, the going has been anything but smooth with poor sales and not enough people knowing of her delicious fare. So, she reached out to us requesting support for her enterprise. I rarely ever do this, revisit a place for an episode in less than a span of six months, but I felt this delicious initiative had to be supported. I hope you enjoy the episode and will also be motivated to support Veena‚Äôs Kari Dosa stall.

Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Found This Delicious Vegetarian Highway Stop! 92-Year-Old SHENOY RESTAURANT, Guruvayanakere
Description:
#shenoyrestaurant #guruvayanakere #vegetarian
 
shenoy restaurant, guruvayanakere, 92 year old restaurant, vegetarian restaurant, shenoy restaurant guruvayanakere, mangalore highway, driving through charmady, close to dharmasthala, gsb cuisine, family restaurant, biscoot rotti, bajjil, avalakki, mangalore buns, vegetarian breakfast, vegetarian lunch, vegetarian snacks, savouries, potato bonda, chatambade, popular vegetarian restaurant on highway, mangalore food tour, mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

When I asked viewers for recommendations on my recent drive back from Mangalore, a few recommended that I visit Shenoy Restaurant in Guruvayanakere. Open since 1932, this modest eatery is run by the very hospitable Shenoy family who dish out a range of vegetarian delicacies breakfast through lunch and evening snacks. The food is the sort that‚Äôs homely, wholesome making use of produce in season. On this visit, I sampled a few of their snacks including the best biscoot rotti I have ever eaten. The flavours were the sort that hit home, also compelling me to make note to return here for a more substantial meal.

This is definitely one of those hidden spots that needs to be on every travellers list when driving towards Mangalore on the Charmady route. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Couple Serves A Delicious, Homely Non Veg Lunch! Hidden 50-Year-Old EDDIE‚ÄôS MESS, Mudigere!
Description:
eddies mess, mudigere, eddie‚Äôs mess mudigere, non vegetarian restaurant, mangalore highway, charmadi ghat route, mutton chops curry, fish fry, fish curry, pork dry, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

Around 50 years ago, Mrs. Lucy D'Souza began a tiny mess to cater homestyle meaty meals to a handful of customers in the coffee town of Mudigere, Karnataka. The reputation of her homely fare comprising mutton, fish and pork delicacies prepared to an interesting confluence of Mangalorean, Kodava and Mudigere culinary influences, grew over the years making Eddies Mess a mandatory lunch stop for meat lovers in the know, locals and travellers alike, Today this mess is tended to by her son Eddie and his wife, Lavin D‚ÄôSouza. If you love your non-vegetarian oota, this place is a definite must-visit when in the area.

Hope you enjoy this lunch stop. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

New Shivabhag Caf√© is not just another eatery but a way of life for the denizens of Manguluru. Founded over 80 years ago by Mr. Madhav Kamath, this bustling, culinary destination is now tended to by his grandsons. A stellar reputation built on the back of some solid culinary fare that‚Äôs light on the pocket and good old fashioned hospitality is what draws loyal customers here day after day. No matter which part of the world they may live in, logging a visit here is de rigueur for most Mangaloreans when they return home. I drop in impromptu for a chat with the amiable owners and also partake of some of the dishes that are a favourite with regulars at this iconic caf√©.

Title: Everyone Stops At Ashok Anna Hotel For Kappa Rotti! LAXMI JANARDHAN Yermal,  Mangalore Udupi Highway
Description:
#ashokannahotel #yermal #mangalorehighway
 
hotel laxmi janardhana, yermal, ashokanna hotel yermal, mangalore udupi highway, kappa rotti, mangalore udupi highway, kappa roti chicken curry, veg curry, breakfast stop, highway stop, mangalore food tour, south canara, mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

What began 20 years ago as a highway stop to provide breakfast sustenance to truckers has now morphed into a must-visit on the informed traveller‚Äôs itinerary for its comforting, earthy kappa rotti, a fluffy rice flatbread cooked on a clay pan minus sans any oil. The thing to do is to taste it with the thick curries, chicken or vegetarian, that are dished out by Ashok Anna and his family at this eatery, Hotel Laxmi Janardhana, located in a town called Yermal, about 30 kilometres from Mangalore. The setting is quite rustic, and the crowd an eclectic mixed lot. But it is the food that rules here, as I discovered during a busy morning here. 
Hope you enjoy this one. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

9/10

10/10

Title: This Stall Cooks 500 Eggs Each Day! DEVDAS CHARMURI Egg Roll, Chilli, Stumbler Mangalore Street Food
Description:
#mangalore #streetfood #eggstumbler

devdas egg stall, devdas charmuri, court road, kodialbail, mangalore, street food, kudla, egg roll, egg chilli, egg stumbler, charmuri, boiled egg charmuri, sesame juice, carrot juice, juices and shakes, manguluru street food, late night spots, egg shop, mangalore food walk, fruit juices, south canara, mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food 

On a recent visit to Mangalore, I came across this egg stall that though relatively unknown is quite the hit with regulars for its punchy egg wraps, chilli and stumbler, a quintessential egg dish from Kudla. Its owner, Devdas, is rather shy and prefers to let his food do the talking. However, I learnt from regulars that while making a living as a waiter during the day, he would tend to his egg stall at night, and it is by dint of his hard work over a decade and pleasing demeanour that Devdas‚Äôs motte angadi (egg shop) is fast emerging as the spot for a late evening ‚Äòeggy‚Äô snack. Hope you enjoy this street food episode from namma Kudla.

Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Kochi‚Äôs Most Popular Karimeen Pollichathu! GRAND HOTEL, Must Try Traditional Kerala Cuisine!
Description:
#grandhotelkochi #grandhotelrestaurant #kochi

grand hotel, kochi, ernakulam, grand hotel kochi, kerala cuisine, grand hotel restaurant kochi, grand hotel kochi food, traditional kerala food, karimeen pollichathu, karimeen fry, pearl spot fish, konju roast, tiger prawns roast, poth erachi fry, alleppey fish curry, ernakulam food tour, kochi food walk, kerala food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

What makes Grand Hotel in Kochi a bastion of traditional Kerala delicacies is its retinue of experienced cooks led by Chef Joseph who has helmed the kitchens here for the last 30 years. When it comes to authentic preparations like the karimeen pollichathu, koonju (tiger prawns) roast, Alleppey fish curry and suchlike, the dining room here has found much favour amongst the city‚Äôs denizens for 60 years now. On this short Kerala visit, I stopped by for a delicious lunch and also caught the making of its most famous dish, the karimeen (pearl spot fish) pollichathu. If you have time for only one traditional meal when in Kochi, this place is it! 

Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

10/10

pai brothers dosa, ernakulam, 266 varieties of dosa, pai dosa, rinoos cool bar, avocado shake, milk shake, mattancherry, fort kochi, kochi, street food, late night spots, dosa shop, avocado shake, egg dosa, ernakulam food tour, kochi food walk, gokul oottupura ernakulam, kerala food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I thought I had tasted all possible dosae until I walked into Pai Brothers Dosa, Ernakulam, a 30+ year-old eatery that makes a mind-boggling 266 varieties! The offerings here are vegetarian, with the inclusion of eggs that seem to be a huge hit with the locals. I tasted two spicy creations, one with quail eggs and the other with chicken eggs. Needing some respite from the heat, we found our way to Mattancherry, where we tasted the thickest avocado shake at Rinoos Cool Bar. Hope you enjoy this street food amble in Kochi.Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: A Delicious Vegetarian Breakfast In Kochi! GOKUL OOTTUPRA Ernakulam | Puttu Kadala, Yelle Adda‚Ä¶
Description:
#gokuloottupura #vegetarian #kochi

gokul oottupura, ernakulam, kochi, kerala cuisine, traditional kerala food, breakfast, ghee roast dosa, dosae, button idli sambar, peri peri idli, puttu kadala curry, yelle adda, ernakulam food tour, gokul oottupura ernakulam, kochi food walk, kerala food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When I walked in for breakfast and perused the menu at this 60-year-old eatery located right opposite Ernakulam‚Äôs historic Siva temple, I couldn't help but wonder if there was a connection to Udupi. A fact that was corroborated by the owner, Mrs. Meena Mohan, whose husband‚Äôs family migrated from South Canara nearly a century ago to perform religious duties in Kochi. And Gokul Ooottupra, too, seems to cater to its patrons in the same attitude of service and tradition, I discovered over my leisurely meal here. From staple classics like the vada, dosae, kadla puttu curry, yelle adda to a few inspired creations like the peri peri idli, the vegetarian fare here is the sort that draws in customers by the hundreds each day. If you find yourself in Kochi and are craving a vegetarian meal, look no further. Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

8/10

8.5/10

Title: Tasting Famous Mandagadde Fish At HOTEL BHAVANI, Shimoga | Must Try Fish Fry & Fish Curry
Description:
#hotelbhavani #mandagaddefishrestaurant #shimoga

bhavani fish hotel, mandagadde, mandagadde fish restaurant, mandagadde fish, mandagadde bhavani hotel, fish fry, fish curry, mandagadde fish restaurant review, freshwater fish variety, gujole fish, owlu fish, katla fish, gowri fish, dam fish, tunga river, tungabhadra dam, shimoga, shivamogga, seafood, river fish, must visit, family business, support small business, shimoga food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Drive 30 kilometres outside Shimoga, past areca nut plantations, serene forest scapes, and the roar of the mighty Tunga river, to Mandagadde, a village known for its bird sanctuary and equally popular eateries that proffer a variety of freshwater fish delicacies. In this episode, I visit Bhavani Fish Hotel, a rustic dining spot set in a home that began the Mandagadde fish tradition 27 years ago. I met the owner, Ramesh Rao and his family to learn what makes the Mandagadde fish special, and also savour some of the delicacies on offer. When in Shimoga, definitely make the trek here; the fry and curries certainly are worth the effort.

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Fish Fry Masala
10/10

Gujole Fish Fry 
10/10

Owlu Fish Fry
8/10

Katla Fish Fry 
7/10

Gowri Fish Fry
8/10

Fish Curry
9/10

Surgi Fish Curry
9/10

We paid Rs. 990 for the abovementioned dishes, in addition to a couple more.

Title: She Began AVAREBELE MELA To Support Farmers 24 Years Ago! Shree Vasavi Condiments, Bengaluru
Description:
#avarebelemela #shreevasavicondiments #bengaluru

avarebele mela, avarekai festival, avarebele mela 2024, culinary festival, shree vasavi avarebele mela, shree vasavi condiments, annual festival, bengaluru festival, bangalore, karnataka, street food, avarebele snacks, avarebele chikki, avarebele vada, avarebele dosae, avarebele sweets, mysore pak, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When Mrs. Geetha Shivkumar saw farmers unable to sell their stock of avarebele (hyacinth beans) 25 years ago, she co-opted them into an initiative that would make use of this delicately flavoured ingredient in a myriad of savouries, sweets and snacks. What began as a humble initiative out of her home then has today bloomed into an inspiring ‚Äòfarm to table‚Äô movement, the Shree Vasavi Condiments Avarebele Mela that has spread awareness on this humble bean and also provided much needed livelihood to many farmers in Karnataka. 

Now in its 24th year, this festival is being staged in a large venue at the National College grounds, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru from 5th to 9th January. Hope this episode inspires you to visit this one-of-a-kind culinary festival and savour the avarebele in a variety of tasty forms. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Kripal Amanna

Title: This Mega Food Factory Cooks Delicious Dishes In The Most Hygienic Way! TASTY NIBBLES Kochi
Description:
#tastynibbles #foodfactory #kochi

tasty nibbles, food factory, aroor, kerala, kerala cuisine, sadya, kochi, traditional kerala food, shappile meen curry, fish curry, aviyal, vegetable sambar, coconut fish curry, pepper chicken, idiyappam, kadala curry, stew, chemmeen manga curry, prawn mango curry, pal adda, chakka payasam, duck mappas, kuttanadan duck roast, chicken biryani, ghee rice, kappa biryani, tasty nibbles, taste of kerala, ready to eat foods, kerala food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Having tasted their unbelievably tasty read to eat products, I wrangled for myself an invitation to visit the Tasty Nibbles food factory. And was amazed at their fastidious approach to hygiene that goes into the making of each of their delicious preparations. I also got a peek into the Retort technology that makes it possible for them to pack for shelf storage at room temperature without any added preservatives. Before I left the factory, I also partook of some more of their specialties, including a first tasting of their to be launched Duck Mapapas and Kuttanadan curry. If you‚Äôre looking to taste authentic flavours of Kerala, in a jiffy, anywhere in the country, do check out the Tasty Nibbles website (details below).

I hope you enjoy this factory tour and tasting episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna

Title: Amazingly Tasty Yet Healthier Chaats Here In Shimoga! HARSHINI CONDIMENTS Ravindra Nagar | Must Try!
Description:
#harshinicondiments #shimoga #streetfood

harshini condiments, ravindra nagar, harshini condiments shimoga, raghavendra, shimoga, shivamogga, chaats, nippat masala, bread masala, methi masala, fenugreek masala, bread masala, corn masala, mirinda masala, shimoga street food, shimoga food tour, snacks, family business, must try, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Raghavendra was employed in a bakery 33 years ago when he decided to set up a small business on his own. His original thought was to set up a stationery store requiring minimal capital, but given his interest in food, he began experimenting with all sorts of snacks and condiments and soon hit upon combinations of chaat. Thus was born Harshini Condiments in a tiny bylane of Ravindra Nagar in Shimoga. The fare here is chaat but in a healthier avatar. Think ingredients like fresh fenugreek, banana stem, cabbage, pomegranate, corn, et al tossed together with savoury elements of crunch and punchy homemade chutneys. Creations that are not only wholesome but also hit home in the flavour department. A must try for street food lovers when in Shimoga! Happy eating!

Nippat Masala
8/10 

Menthye Soppu (fresh fenugreek) masala
10/10 

Bread Masala
8.5/10 

Corn Masala
9/10 

Mirinda Masala
8/10 

The items we tasted were priced between Rs. 50  to Rs. 60, we paid Rs. 450 in all for about 6 to 7 chaats and 3 drinks.

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

Title: Breakfast At 100 Year Old SRI MEENAKSHI BHAVAN Shimoga! Best Masala Dosae, Vade, Avalakki! Must Try!
Description:
#srimeenakshibhavan #shimoga #karnataka

meenakshi bhavan, shimoga, shivamogga, 100 year old restaurant in shimoga, sri meenakshi bhavan shimoga, breakfast, south canara meal, dakshina kannada food, must visit, benne masala dosa, idli vada, paddu, avalakki mosaru, coffee, family business, shimoga food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When I survey a new city for a Gourmet On The Road series, I usually invite recommendations from viewers, and post due diligence and research, these form the basis for what one eventually explores. When I called out for Shimoga, this restaurant received the most recommendations. And those in the know may not be surprised given the fact that Sri Meenakshi Bhavan has been an integral part, actually a pioneer of the city‚Äôs culinary landscape for over a century now. The space that it occupies was once the owning family‚Äôs ancestral abode and that energy also seems to permeate through the homely old-fashioned decor and the South Canara inspired fare here. The food is tasty, sumptuous and satisfying, made to traditional recipes by cooks, many who have served in the kitchens here for decades. Whilst the benne masala dosae may come as the most recommended dish, the vade, avalakki mosaru, paddu too are as rewarding as I found during a breakfast visit where I also had the opportunity to converse with the restaurant‚Äôs third generation owner, Mr Chandrashekar and his daughter, Ganavi.

If you are in Shimoga, or are making plans to visit, this is one eatery you must not miss. Hope you enjoy this breakfast episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Tasting Shimoga‚Äôs Unique Chaat Flavours At DVS Circle PANI PURI! Hugely Popular 40 Yr Old Chaat Shop
Description:
#dvspanipuri #shimoga #chaat

dvs circle pani puri, dvs paani puri, shimoga, shivamogga, chaats, sev puri, masala puri, pani puri, shimoga street food, snacks, family business, must try, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When it comes to chaats, every city has its own style, and Shimoga is no different. Be it the masala puri, sev puri or paani puri, each one hits differently as I discovered during this outing to DVS Circle Pani Puri, a chaat shop that has held sway over the city‚Äôs penchant for its spicy fare for nearly four decades. I was told these unique flavours were a result of Shimoga‚Äôs purveyors not being influenced by chaat traditions of the North and therefore developing a unique palate of their own. Hope you enjoy this streetfood outing; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Iconic NEW KRISHNA BHAVAN Will Close On 6th Dec 2023 After Serving Bengaluru For 69 Years!
Description:
#newkrishnabhavan #malleshwaram #bangalore

new krishna bhavan, malleshwaram, nkb malleshwaram, malleshwara, closing of iconic restaurant, west bengaluru, south indian, south canara, vegetarian, bangalore food trail, bengaluru food tour, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

There are only a handful of culinary institutions in this city that have stood the test of time for half a century or more. Serving their patrons faithfully, not just in their fare that harks back to the days when things were simple, but also conveying the nostalgia of many memories across generations. And so it is indeed a sad day when one of them has to close doors soon. 

I have visited New Krishna Bhavan in Malleshwaram a few times, to film and to partake of their trademark, unfussy South Canara fare. This time at the restaurant felt different though, its imminent closure palpable in the sentiments echoed by the owners, cooks and many customers for whom NKB was part of their life. 

This is an episode I wish I didn‚Äôt have to film. But here it is nonetheless. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating! 

Note: The restaurant‚Äôs last day of operation is 5th Dec 2023.

Title: Shimoga‚Äôs Most Famous VENKATESHA SWEET HOUSE Mysore Pak Making, 60 Year Recipe! Must Try Items Here!
Description:
#venkateshasweethouse #mysorepak #shimoga

venkatesha sweet house shimoga, venkatesha sweets mysore pak, shimoga mysore pak, shivamogga, karnataka, mysore pak, doodh halwa, milk halwa, champakali, mixture, sweetmeats, snacks, family business, must try, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A couple of years ago I was at an eatery in Mysuru, when a few lads walked up to me and in the course of our conversation told me that the Mysore Pak to try was in their hometown, Shimoga. I was amazed at their courage and conviction, standing in Mysuru and praising a Mysore Pak from their hometown. Nonetheless, I made note of their recommendation. And so when I recently did a tour of Shimoga, the Venkatesha Sweet House Mysore Pak was top of my list. Not only did I taste this hugely popular sweet alongside a few other treats, I also caught its making with third generation owner, Prasanna, and his sweet makers of decades. When in Shimoga, definitely visit this 60 year culinary institution.

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Most Popular Shimoga Highway Stop! PREETHI CANTEEN Birur | Must Try Benne Dosae, Curd Vada & More
Description:
#preethicanteen #birur #karnataka

preethi canteen, preethi canteen birur, shimoga highway, birur, shivamogga, karnataka, preethi canteen masala dosa, benne khali dosae, benne masala dosa, dosae, curd vada, rava idli, mandakki, popular highway stop, national highway 206, family business, mangalore bajji, goli baje, coffee, must try dosa spot, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Over 40 years ago, Mr. Chandrashekar, originally from Sasthan in Dakshina Kannada, had to wind up his long running restaurant in Shimoga during the emergency. Forced to once again begin from scratch, he chose a spot in Birur, then a sleepy village around 240 kilometres from Bengaluru to set up an eatery. Since then Birur has grown to a bustling trading town, the spot where his venture, Preethi Canteen stands, is now a busy highway. And this tiffin restaurant has been elevated to legendary status by its many patrons for whom a halt here is a must when on the road around here. Over time, I have received many requests to taste their iconic masala dosae, and so on a recent drive to Shimoga, I stopped here and caught not just a taste of their tasty fare, but also a conversation with its second generation owner, Mr. Prakash Holla on what makes Preethi Canteen a hugely popular culinary institution.

Hope you enjoy this tiffin episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: She Wants to Take Namma Bengaluru‚Äôs Donne Biryani Across India! Making Of Popular RNR Donne Biryani
Description:
#rnrbiryani #donnebiryani #bangalore

rnr biryani, popular donne biryani, rnr biryani, rt nagar, rnr biryani bengaluru, most popular donne biryani available across bengaluru, authentic bangalore biryani, authentic donne biryani, rnr biryani recipe, donne biryani recipe, grandma recipe, famous biryani of bangalore, must try biryani, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A couple of years ago when we were all stuck at home during the pandemic, I was craving for a donne biryani. That‚Äôs when I chanced upon RNR donne biryani on a delivery app. I had never heard of them before, and so Intrigued, I ordered. And was pleasantly surprised with what I tasted, so much so that I even filmed an impromptu vlog. 

Now whilst most businesses that opened during this period to cater to consumers at home were unable to make it beyond the pandemic, RNR has not only survived but scaled across multiple kitchens (at last count there were 18!) in the city and also a couple of restaurants on the back of the popularity of its donne biryani that is made to a family recipe. In this episode I visit their newest restaurant in RT Nagar, Bengaluru, where I catch up with Ramya Ravi, co-owner of the chain, who articulates that ‚Äútheir vision is to take Bengaluru‚Äôs donne biryani offering across the country!‚Äù And going by what I witnessed during the step by step making of their signature chicken donne biryani, and also what I tasted, they certainly seem to be on the right path to doing so.

I hope you enjoy this biryani making episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!  

Kripal Amanna

Title: Tasty,  Honestly Priced Tiffin At 98-Yr-Old MAHALAKSHMI TIFFIN ROOM! Khali Dosae, Sambar, Goli Bajje
Description:
#mltr #basavanagudi #bangalore

mahalakshmi tiffin room, mltr, basavanagudi, south bengaluru, tiffin eatery, vegetarian, khaali dosae, dosa, idli, vade, sambar, carrot halwa, mangalore bajji, goli baje, coffee, must try dosa spot, bangalore food trail, bengaluru food tour, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When it comes to tiffin eateries in Bengaluru, there are those that are celebrated, even venerated, and splashed across media, both traditional and new. Nothing wrong with that. And then there are those that quietly go about their work, serving customers for decades on end, content to not bask in the limelight. A great example of the latter is Mahalakshmi Tiffin Room in Basavanagudi, South Bengaluru, though open since 1926 is still unknown to most in the city. I visited them one afternoon to meet the second and third generation owners, and to also taste an assortment of their honestly-priced fare, including a deliciously light and fluffy khali dosae and a satisfying sambar. Hope you enjoy this tiffin episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

It had been a while since I‚Äôd savoured a good military (local) style oota (meal). I had heard on and off about this 10-year-old eatery located at Devanahalli on the outskirts of Bengaluru, but never ventured out given the distance to be traversed for a meal. And boy oh boy was I pleasantly surprised when I finally did. The place may be rustic, but the food that‚Äôs dished out by Suresh Gowda and his family in the kitchen here is the sort that makes the 50-km drive here worthwhile. I savoured their biryanis, meaty fries and the curries that have earned this military hotel a strong fan following.

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This MBA Is Cooking Delicious Comfort Food! MASKAA Bengaluru
Description:
#maskaa #bangalore #koramangala

maskaa, maskaa caf√©, koramangala, bangalore, comfort food, maharashtrian, vada pav, misal pav, thalipeeth, sabudana vada, pav bhaji, paneer bhurji, chicken kheema pav, omelet, bun maska, masala tea, passion enterprise, lady entrepreneur, support small business, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A former corporate executive, Pooja Patil realized her heart was in food, more specifically the regional specialities and dishes of her family, originally from Solapur in Maharashtra, but Bengaluru residents for decades. Honing recipes, adding her touch, she opened Maskaa, a small, cosy caf√© in Koramangala, to serve comfort fare - from vada pav, thaalipeeth, sabudana vadas, misal pav, pav bhaji, omelets, paneer bhurji, even a couple of interesting chicken dishes, and in sync with the eatery‚Äôs name, a butter-laden bun that pairs deliciously with a masala tea, brewed with a secret blend of 17 spices prepared by her father.

I dropped in for a ‚Äòsnacky‚Äô lunch one afternoon to chat with this enterprising lady entrepreneur, and also taste some of her dishes. Definitely check out Maskaa when in the neighbourhood and support this unique initiative. Hope you enjoy this one; take care, safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This 15 Rs. Thatte Idli Took Him From Street Cart To Own Shop In 2 Years! AKASH KUNIGAL THATTE IDLI
Description:
#thatteidli #streetfood #bengaluru

thatte idli, akash kunigal thatte idli, banashankari, south bangalore, bengaluru, street food, best tomato rice, masala vade, masala dosae, dosa, thatte idli in bangalore, inspiring story, support small business, must try dosa spot, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Channe Gowda moved to Bengaluru from his native place, Kunigal 10 years ago to eke out a living and supplement his family‚Äôs marginal farming income. He tried his hand at many a job and trade, barely managing to make ends meet. A couple of years ago, he set up a food cart in Banashankari, South Bengaluru on the back of non vegetarian recipes gleaned from his well wishers. This too met with limited success, it was at this point that he introduced a thatte keeping in mind the clientele in the area. And that was when things changed. His soft and spongy 15 rupee thatte idli served with butter and two delicious chutneys caught the attention of locals and demand grew to an extent that he gave up the non veg menu to only focus on the idli, vade and a single rice preparation. Unable to cope with the stream of customers, Channe Gowda eventually moved operations to a house in the area, from where he continues to serve hundreds of his now famous Kunigal thatte idli each day. 
From a street cart that would barely support him, he now provides livelihood to a team of fifteen! I set out this evening to meet this hard-working gent, and in the course of doing so, not only tasted his satisfying idlis, but also stumbled upon a flavourful tomato rice that he makes to an aromatic biryani recipe.

I hope you enjoy this inspiring tiffin thindi outing. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Hidden Eatery Serves Delicious Family Cooked Karnataka Dishes! KUTUMBA KITCHEN
Description:
#kutumbakitchen #bengaluru #smallbusiness

kutumba kitchen, new bel road, bangalore, karnataka cuisine, family owned restaurant, bengaluru, mysuru, hassan, local cuisine, mutton chops, mutton palav, chicken biryani, mushroom biryani, ghee roast, chicken curry, akki roti, thatte idli, badam halwa, support small business, family business, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

About a year ago, I received a request from a family that had just opened a cloud kitchen to serve dishes made to family recipes handed down through generations. Much as their fare - a smorgasbord of meaty regional Karnataka delicacies seemed interesting - we couldn‚Äôt explore it further as we rarely ever cover cloud kitchens. Emboldened by the interest from customers, the family eventually set up a small eatery to seat all of 10 in the setback of a building on New Bel Road, North Bengaluru. And this of course, provided me with just the excuse to make the trek to Kutumba Kitchen, meet the family and taste some of the dishes that have earned this small enterprise quite a few fans in a short span of time.

Hope you enjoy this one, please do your best to support deserving small businesses like this. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

An initiative of folks passionate about propagating hitherto unseen (in eateries) Karnataka delicacies, and Adukale Foods, I hope they are able to sustain and take forward their delicious vision. Do check them out at Banashankari, South Bengaluru.

In this episode, I taste a biryani tradition that goes back a century at Taj Hotel in Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru. One of the earliest eateries in the city, it has perhaps also kindled Bengaluru‚Äôs love affair with the biryani. Alongside a wholesome chicken and a nuanced mutton biryani, I also taste some of the other popular dishes here - an aromatic ghee rice, spicy kheema masala, robustly flavoured lamb chops, and an akhni that made its way from the owner‚Äôs home to my table.

Hope you enjoy this special episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Making Of Famous TAJ HOTEL BIRYANI! 100 Year Recipe! Shaadi Ki Biryani Mutton, Chicken Recipe
Description:
#tajhotel #biryani #bengaluru

taj hotel, taj hotel shivaji nagar, taj biryani, biryani making, 100 year old recipe, taj biryani bangalore, authentic bangalore biryani, shaadi ki biryani, mutton biryani, chicken biryani, chichabas taj biryani recipe, wood fire biryani, shivaji nagar, central bengaluru, biryani trail, chichabas taj, famous biryani of bangalore, must try biryani, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

It had been a while since I had filmed a biryani making episode. And so when the opportunity arose to film the complete process of a biryani whose recipe has remained constant for over a century, I lost no time to head to Taj Hotel Shivaji Nagar, an eatery that  dates back to the early 20th century, and today churns out over 500 kilos of biryani each day. I met with the third and fourth generation of the family of the late Janab Abdur Rahman, who are committed to preserving the ancient traditions that go into the making of their biryani, including cooking it over a wood fire only.

Hope you enjoy this very special biryani making episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Brave Lady Gave Up IT Job To Pursue Her Food Passion! Must Try KARI DOSA, Rs.10 Veg Dosa
Description:
#karidosa #streetfood #bengaluru

kari dosa, street food, kari dosae, kari dosai, kari dosa in bangalore, chicken kari dosa, prawn kari dosa, veg curry dosa, egg dosae, jp nagar, south bengaluru, lady entrepreneur, support small business, must try dosa spot, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A few weeks ago, I heard of a lady entrepreneur who despite facing physical hardships after a serious accident had given up an IT job to pursue her passion in food. Resources were limited, so she set up a small streetside stand. Extremely hardworking, Veena‚Äôs day begins at 4 in the morning when she wakes up to prepare the dosae batter, curries, thokku and kurmas that go into her delicious kari dosa. After sending her two young children to school, she arrives at her stand in JP Nagar, South Bengaluru, where customers queue up to savour her scrumptious fare that begins as low as Rs. 10 for a delightful plain dosae with spicy peanut chutney and aromatic vegetable gravy, and Rs. 30 for an egg topped version. What lends the stall its name though are the Tamil Nadu style kari dosai, chicken and my favourite, a prawn thokku topped dosae. If you love dosae, especially the non vegetarian kind, head here. And in doing so, you will also be supporting a deserving small enterprise.

Hope you enjoy this find; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Is This India‚Äôs Oldest Running Bakery? 143 Years Old NEW IMPERIAL BAKERY, KGF KOLAR GOLD FIELDS
Description:
#indiasoldestbakery #newimperialbakery #kgf

new imperial bakery, india‚Äôs oldest bakery, 143 year old bakery, kolar gold fields, kgf, karnataka, wood fired oven, veg puff, dil pasand, muffin, coconut biscuit, spicy cookies, vanilla cookies, old fashioned bakes, plum cake, bread, karnataka food trail, kolar food tour, near bengaluru, bangalore, small business, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

On a recent road drive through Kolar, we made a detour to Kolar Gold Fields, once famous across the world for its gold mines. The mines have long closed, and the town is now a pale shadow of its former glory. What has endured however is a bakery that first opened in 1880 and still continues to dispense its baked wares in an old school tradition that harks back 143 years! I met its fourth generation owner and also tasted many of the scrumptious treats on offer that are still popular with the inhabitants of this verdant town 70 kilometres from Bengaluru.

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Note: I enjoyed most of the baked treats on offer. Standouts for me though were the veg puff, muffin (dilpasand), coconut biscuit, spicy cookies and plum cake.
Biscuits are priced at Rs. 30 for 100gm, the puffs and muffins at Rs. 13, and a loaf of bread, Rs. 30.

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

Title: Love The Original Davanagere Benne Dosae? Must Try This Then! DOSE OF DAVANGERE Jayanagar, Bengaluru
Description:
#doseofdavangere #davanagerebennedosa #bangalore

dose of davanagere, original davanagere butter, original davanagere wood fire dosae, dose of davangere, jayanagar, bengaluru, davanagere benne dosae to try in bangalore, butter dosa, special masala dosa, open butter dosa, special benne khaali dosae, benne thatte idli, paddu, south bangalore, must try dosa spot, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Sometime ago, I had put out a tweet asking for underrated dosae recommendations in Bengaluru. From the many suggestions I received, I picked this tiny shop in Jayanagar, South Bengaluru. What first drew me to Dose Of Davangere initially was the fact that they still roast the dosae over a wood-fired stove, a cooking tradition that is fast disappearing in cities. And their commitment to procuring unsalted village butter from Davanagere. All in all, I was rewarded with the best expression of a Davanagere dosae that I have tasted in Bengaluru thus far. If you love your butter drenched dosae, especially the original Davanagere kind, this is a must-visit! In fact, I would go as far as endorsing it as a must-try dosae when here in namma ooru!

Hope you enjoy this find; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Found This Hidden Restaurant MAA DA DHABA At Bengaluru Airport! No Check-In Required To Try This!
Description:
#maadadhaba #bangaloreairport #northindian

maa da dhaba, maa da dhaba airport, bengaluru airport, hidden restaurant at bangalore airport city, north indian cuisine, dal makhani, chicken tikka, hara bhara kabab, chicken hyderabadi biryani, paneer mutter, kadai chicken, lassi, indian chinese, crispy potato, butter garlic fish,  bengaluru, bangalore, north bangalore, affordable airport restaurant, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I recently discovered this restaurant that although open at Bengaluru Airport City for a few months now, is largely unknown to food lovers in the city. Fronted by a veteran chef with a creditworthy reputation for North Indian cuisine, the food at Maa Da Dhaba certainly delivers. From punchy kebabs to silken dals and robustly flavoured curries and kadais, there is a popular selection of Sino Indian fare on the menu too. What also adds to its appeal is the pleasant drive to get here and its location - only a couple of minutes to the airport terminal but yet far removed from its bustle. Definitely check it out, and yes, at prices that are quite honest too.

Hope you enjoy this find; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Food Lovers TV Fan Meet | Jolada Rotti Oota At Basaveshwar Khanavali, Bengaluru!
Description:
#joladarottioota #kripalamanna #basaveshwarkhanavali

food lovers tv meet up, kripal amanna fan meet up, food lovers tv viewer meet, basaveshwar khanavali, koramangala, bengaluru, bangalore, jolada rotti oota, jowar rotti meal, uttara karnataka food, north karnataka cuisine, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

This was an amazing afternoon! To catch up with nearly 150 food lovers - who had come not only from all parts of Bengaluru but also beyond - and learn from them first hand their special connection with our show. I‚Äôve always known that our work connects with a wide cross section of viewers, but here for the first time, we were meeting them. Our youngest participant was just over two and the oldest, in their eighties. Truly felt blessed to meet each one of them over a delicious jolada rotti oota at one of my favourite Uttara Karnataka restaurants, the legendary 60-year-old Basaveshwar Khanavali, here in Koramangala, Bengaluru. Hope you enjoy this leisurely afternoon of conversation and catch-up over a sumptuous baale yele oota. 
Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Village Style Non Veg At VENKOB RAO MESS, 70 Year Old Eatery In Malur! Near Bengaluru | Mutton Chops
Description:
#venkobraomess #malur #nonvegetarian

venkob rao mess, venkob rao mess malur, maratha style food, karnataka maratha cuisine, malur, hoskote, bengaluru, karnataka, khaima unde, mutton, meatballs, mutton chops, mutton liver fry, mutton fry, non vegetarian restaurant, hidden gem, hoskote food trail, karnataka food tour, near bengaluru, bangalore, must try food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Amongst the many culinary traditions that prevail in this state, an interesting one is that of Maratha-Karnataka fare. A cuisine that took birth a few hundred years ago when Marathas migrated to Karnataka and settled into the local culture and practices of the land. Over time, their food evolved to assimilate local produce and ingredients. Many of the ‚Äòmilitary‚Äô eateries in and around Bengaluru trace their roots to this style of cooking, although the offerings of some have morphed beyond recognition. To find examples of this unique fare that is comparatively true to its origin, one has to travel a bit out of the city. Like this 70-year-old eating house that we discovered in Malur, a town located 50 kilometres from Bengaluru. Where rustic meaty preparations are cooked with home made masalas over wood-fired stoves.

Hope you enjoy this lunch at Venkob Rao Mess. Take Care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Mutton Chops
9/10

Khaima Unde
8.5/10

Boti
8/10

Mutton Liver Masala
7/10

Mutton Fry
8.5/10

We paid Rs. 1020 for our meal in total

Description:
#rohanbopanna #kripalamanna #maverickandfarmer

rohan bopanna, tennis icon, world no 7, kripal amanna, tiffin talk, maverick & farmer coffee, coffee shop, world coffee conference, wcc 2023, coffee conversations, coffee pour over, rohan bopanna master blend, clarified cappuccino, arabica, robusta, coffee, fermented coffee, coffee board, bengaluru, bangalore, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try coffee, popular eatery, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

In the last episode, we introduced tennis ace Rohan Bopanna to the delicious joys of a Mavalli Tiffin Rooms breakfast. In this episode, he returned the favour by showcasing an amazing array of coffee brews and styles, including some from his coffee estate in Coorg, at Maverick & Farmer, a new age caf√© and restaurant in the heart of Bengaluru. We caught up with some coffee experts and also learnt more about the upcoming World Coffee Conference 2023, being held for the first time in Asia, with Bengaluru playing host and Rohan Bopanna as ambassador. Definitely pencil your dates, 25th to 28th September. 

Hope you enjoy this conversation over a few brews. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Log on to https://wccindia2023.com/ for more details on the World Coffee Conference 2023 from 25th to 28th September 2023 in Bengaluru.

Title: This Tennis Star Loves Coffee, Dosa & Idli! #rohanbopanna #shorts #kripalamanna #bangalore #mtr
Description:
‚ÄúCoffee chennage idhrey sugar beda!‚Äù If the coffee is good, one doesn‚Äôt need sugar! Not exactly what I was expecting tennis icon @rohanbopanna0403 to say, but boy o boy, did he have a few aces up his sleeve including the manner in which he consumes his masala dosae and his passion for coffee! ‚òïÔ∏è

Title: Breakfast & Coffee With Tennis Star ROHAN BOPANNA! His First Time Mavalli Tiffin Rooms! Tiffin Talk
Description:
#rohanbopanna #kripalamanna #mavallitiffinrooms

rohan bopanna, tennis icon, world no 7, kripal amanna, tiffin talk, mavalli tiffin rooms, breakfast at mavalli tiffin room, mtr lalbagh, world coffee conference, coffee conversations, rava idli, masala dosa, gulab jamun, dumrot, coffee board, bengaluru, bangalore, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, popular eatery, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

It was wonderful to meet tennis ace, our very own Bengaluru boy, Rohan Bopanna, soon after his return from Wimbledon and being recently ranked World No. 7 for the second time in a decade. However, his constant travel on the circuit has meant that there are aspects of namma ooru that he hasn‚Äôt been able to explore yet, including Mavalli Tiffin Rooms in Lalbagh. And so we took it upon ourselves to introduce this icon to a Bengaluru tiffin legend over a leisurely, indulgent-breakfast conversation where we also caught a glimpse of his passion for coffee, and his role as the ambassador for the World Coffee Conference, to be held in India for the first time in our city in September.

Hope you enjoy this tiffin talk. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Tried The Famous HOSKOTE KABAB & Hoskote Chicken Biryani For First Time! RAVI KABAB CENTER
Description:

Almost everyone has heard about and many have tasted the early morning biryani at Hoskote, a pre-sunrise ritual 40 kilometers from Bengaluru. However, few visitors seem to know about a fried kabab evening tradition that is hugely popular with locals. On a drive back from Kolar a few weeks ago, we took a detour into this highway town to savour a quick meal of chicken kabab, egg rice, and a chicken biryani too. The last wasn‚Äôt on our plan, but then, we were in biryani country after all. Definitely check out Ravi Kabab Center when in the area, and be prepared to jostle with the crowd to get your share of bisi bisi (hot) kababs.

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Loved This Biryani & Mutton Phaal At 50-Year-Old NASHEMAN, Mysuru! Didn‚Äôt Expect It To Be This Good!
Description:
#nashemanhotelmysore #nashemanbiryani #mysuru

nasheman restaurant, mysuru, mysore, nasheman mysuru, mutton biryani, mutton phaal, kaleji masala, mutton kheema, mutton chops, non vegetarian restaurant, hidden gem in mysuru, lashkar mohalla, mysore food trail, mysuru food tour, mysore food tour, must try street food, nasheman hotel mysore, nasheman biryani, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I had heard much about this tiny eatery located in a bylane of old Mysuru, especially of its biryani that back in the day would be cooked over a wood-fired stove. And so when I received recommendations in response to a recent ‚Äúwhere should I lunch in Mysuru‚Äù post, I lost no time in making tracks to Nasheman. The place is drab, and that‚Äôs putting it mildly, a handful of tables sit cheek by jowl in a modestly-sized room, and the service is industrial at best. But it is the mutton biryani here and other meaty delicacies, especially a delicious twice cooked mutton phaal that draw customers to this 50-year-old restaurant. In this outing, I tasted most of what was on offer for lunch, after an insightful kitchen tour.

Hope you find this episode enjoyable. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: HOTEL ADITYA Super Naati Non Veg Oota In Classy Ambience! Tasty Mutton, Chicken Fry, Biryanis & More
Description:
#hoteladitya #mahalaxmipuram #bangalore

hotel aditya, mahalaxmipuram, hotel aditya non veg, naati oota in classy setting, non vegetarian restaurant, chicken biryani, mutton biryani, mutton nalli fry, brain pepper dry, kaal soup, chicken fry, chicken kabab, bengaluru, bangalore, food tour bengaluru, must try restaurant in bangalore, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food trail, support local, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Over the last few months, I had received numerous requests from our viewers to visit Hotel Aditya in Mahalaxmipuram, a eatery that in just over 12 years has managed to create for its local non vegetarian fare the sort of fan loyalty that some of Bengaluru‚Äôs revered culinary institutions have taken multiple decades to garner. The people behind the eatery are extremely low profile, preferring to let their food do the talking, and therefore reluctant to let cameras in. Which is also why you may not have seen a single in depth video or feature on the place thus far. 

We managed to get our cameras not only into the restaurant, but also deep in the kitchen where we took an in-depth look at the making of some of their iconic dishes, from the meaty curries to the terrific biryanis and fries. The best part we found at Hotel Aditya, not only is the food great, but so is the ambience that it is served in. Making it one of the very few local style non vegetarian restaurants where you can savour your meal in peace and air conditioned comfort too.

If you've been putting off tasting some great naati oota because of concerns of ambience and crowd, Hotel Aditya is certainly the place to dive into local non veg cuisine. Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Lost His Job And Created A Delicious Fruit & Sugarcane Drink! AMBAARI JUICE, Must Try In MYSURU
Description:
#ambaarijuice #mysore #sugarcanejuice

ambaari juice centre, mysuru, mysore, ambaari sugarcane and fruit juice, healthy juice, season fruits, small business, smart business, inspiring business, must try juice in mysuru, fresh fruit, mysore food tour, bengaluru food, must try street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Jayaramu was working in the food and beverage department of a hotel in Mysuru when he lost his job during the pandemic. Left with no recourse to earn a living, he began a sugarcane juice stall, but with a twist. Given his experience in mixing cocktails and mocktails in his previous job, he tried crushing seasonal, fresh fruits and herbs in the cane to create an interesting, healthy yet refreshingly delicious take on the humble sugarcane juice. I visited Ambaari Juice stall a few weeks ago and tasted a bevy of his offerings - malabar plum, mango, mixed fruit, pomegranate, muskmelon, et al - in sugar cane juice. Definitely something to try when you are in the palace city next.

Do support enterprising small entrepreneurs like Jayaramu who in the course of earning a livelihood are also bringing something deliciously different. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Note: plain sugarcane juice with mint, lime, ginger is priced at Rs. 30, the fresh fruit and sugarcane juices are priced Rs. 60 upwards. My top picks were plain, jamun and mango amongst others.

Title: Veg Meals With Ashwini Puneeth Rajkumar & Sindhu Sreenivasa Murthy! AACHAR & CO. Tiffin Talk
Description:
#aacharandco #ashwinipuneethrajkumar #sindhusreenivasamurthy

kripal amanna, aachar & co film, ashwini puneeth rajkumar, sindhu sreenivasa murthy, sindhu s murthy, prk productions, puneeth rajkumar, puneeth rajkumar productions, prk audio, new modern hotel, minerva circle,south canara lunch, vegetarian thali, bengaluru, bangalore, sandalwood, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, popular eatery, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A Gourmet On The Road episode that‚Äôs dearest to me is the one where I shared a meal with ‚Äònamma priyaru‚Äô, Karnataka Ratna Puneeth Rajkumar. How one wishes things had turned out differently, but alas! He wore Karnataka on his sleeve, and part of his vision was to promote young talent in Kannada cinema, a role that is now being bravely carried forward by his wife, Ashwini Puneeth Rajkumar. And when I recently received a call from her inviting me to a conversation on Aachar & Co., a film made by a near-all-women-team led by Sindhu Sreenivasa Murthy, somewhere, I felt this would be an apt continuation of my conversation with Appu Sir. 
We met over a delicious South Canara lunch at New Modern Hotel, an appropriate venue given the film‚Äôs setting in Bengaluru of the sixties. We discussed the film, which promises to be a witty family entertainer, rich in its cinematic value, food, pickles, family, a lot more‚Ä¶ and also basked in the warming memory of our dearest Appu, Puneeth Rajkumar.

I am looking forward to watching the film, you should too. Hope you enjoy this special conversation. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

Thriveni and Narayana Bairy‚Äôs SLV Coffee Thindi sits in a distant suburb of South Bengaluru. But in the nine years that it‚Äôs been around, this darshini style eatery has garnered quite the reputation amongst locals for its soft idlis, part of a short menu of only five or six tasty tiffin dishes that are personally prepared and served with much care and attention by the husband-wife duo. On weekends, their children chip in too. The fare served also draws from Narayan‚Äôs experience at some fabled eateries where he first worked when he came to Bengaluru from Kundapura 25 years ago, Do taste their delicious tiffin thindi and support this hard working family‚Äôs business.

Take care. Stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Tasting A Delicious True Kashmiri Wazwan! I Tried 12 Authentic Dishes At SARPOSH Bengaluru! Must Try
Description:
#kashmiricuisine #sarposh #bangalore

sarposh experience kashmir, sarposh restaurant and tea room, bakery, wazwan, authentic kashmiri cuisine, kashmiri food, tabak maaz, seekh kebab, dani phol, meith maaz, rogan josh, marchewangan kormeh, ristae, goshtabae, wazzeh palak, razmah dal, nadur yakhin, kong kahwe, maaz traem, sarposh restaurant, sarposh indiranagar, sarposh foods, sarposh owner, indiranagar, bengaluru, bangalore, inspiring story, lady entrepreneur, small business, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

My meal at Sarposh was an eye opener into the traditions of true Kashmiri cuisine that restaurateur Azmat Ali Mir seeks to showcase. In ingredients that she procures from the valley, to the brigade of wazas (cooks) from Srinagar who have made Bengaluru their home! To enjoy a meal here, park aside all notions you may have of the cuisine based on the odd so-called Kashmiri dish you may have tasted on a menu here and there. For the fare here is anything but that.
I opted for the maaz traem, a traditional celebratory meal and what followed was a procession of 12 dishes. From the initial methi maaz, soft and velvety tripe, served on a bed of rice, to a ghee-fried tabak maaz (ribs), dani phol (stewed lamb shanks) and a finely minced seekh kebab, to the hearty mains, rogan josh, the subtly flavoured sort you have never eaten before, rista (juicy meatballs), a comforting palak and razmah dal, creamy nadur (lotus stem) yakhni, marchewangan korma, the only searingly spicy dish of the lot, and gushtaba (meatballs stewed in yoghurt and dried mint), each preparation I found exquisite and subtly distinct in its flavour and taste. 
If you‚Äôre looking to try wazwan fare true to its roots, far removed from the ginger-garlic-chilli-cream infused heavy dishes that get passed off as Kashmiri elsewhere, definitely check out Sarposh restaurant and tea room in Bengaluru. 

Hope you enjoy part two of my Sarposh outing. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Link to part one:
She Brings Authentic Kashmiri Cuisine & Culinary Traditions At SARPOSH Bengaluru!
https://youtu.be/tX0L22-0xZk

The festive wazwan (maaz traem set meal) that I tasted is priced at Rs. 2300 (excl. taxes), this platter can easily feed two including the main course dishes. Since this was a non vegetarian wazwan, we ordered the vegetarian dishes separately on a la carte basis, these are priced at Rs. 325. One can also order individually the non vegetarian dishes that we tasted, chicken dishes begin at Rs. 425, mutton at Rs. 600.
