Title: She Brings Authentic Kashmiri Cuisine & Culinary Traditions At SARPOSH Bengaluru!
Description:
#kashmiricuisine #sarposh #bangalore

sarposh experience kashmir, sarposh restaurant and tea room, bakery, wazwan, authentic kashmiri cuisine, kashmiri food, tabak maaz, seekh kebab, dani phol, meith maaz, rogan josh, marchewangan kormeh, ristae, goshtabae, wazzeh palak, razmah dal, nadur yakhin, kong kahwe, maaz traem, sarposh restaurant, sarposh indiranagar, sarposh foods, sarposh owner, indiranagar, bengaluru, bangalore, inspiring story, lady entrepreneur, small business, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When Azmat Ali Mir moved from Srinagar to Bengaluru after marriage, she yearned for authentic Kashmiri food, but ‚Äúthere was none to be found‚Äù, she says. A casual idea of staging a Kashmiri pop-up for a few friends ‚Äòavalanched‚Äô into a dinner for 1000 guests, compelling her to fly in wazas (Kashmiri cooks) to prepare the meal. Encouraged by the response, and her husband Azeem Syed, she embarked on setting up a space that sought to not only celebrate true Kashmiri cuisine, but also its culture and traditions. Thus was born Sarposh restaurant and tea room in Indiranagar, Bengaluru. Needless to say, the cooks (wazas) stayed back. I visited her for lunch one afternoon and was blown away by the sheer depth of cuisine and culture that this young entrepreneur seeks to showcase in her cozy dining space, which also offers a fascinating insight into the traditions of her land in its decor and artifacts. What was intended as a typical review lunch turned into an engrossing conversation with Azmat and her team, thereby resulting in this rare two-part Gourmet On The Road episode. Hope you enjoy part one.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

It had been a while since I visited South Canara, and so when a craving for a good Mangalorean meal hit me, I found my way to this tiny eatery that‚Äôs almost hidden in a bylane of Malleshwaram. Run by Ravi Shetty, an affable native of Kundapura who has been cooking since the age of 17, Karavali Lunch Home offers a delicious smorgasbord of coastal flavours from Dakshina Kannada featuring unique dishes like the country chicken uppu koli, that has earned it loyal patrons in its 15 years of existence. What also finds favour here is the freshness of the seafood that Ravi procures each day. and also their pocket friendly fish thaalis that are priced upwards of Rs. 140.

If you are craving authentic flavours of kudla, check them out. Hope you enjoy this episode.  Take care. Stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Must-Try Tiffin & Vegetarian Meals At THE MADHRAS KITCHEN! She Is Honouring Her Late Husband‚Äôs Wish!
Description:
#themadhraskitchen #bengaluru #vegetarian

Sumathi was content being a homemaker, when her husband Charles, a software engineer, encouraged her to open a small eatery given her passion for cooking. She began one and ran it for a few months, when tragedy struck, and her husband was no more. Left with no recourse to fend for her three children and herself, Sumathi Charles ploughed her entire savings into setting up a modest eatery serving Tamil Nadu style vegetarian tiffin and meals. I visit The Madhras Kitchen early one evening and leave thoroughly impressed with most of the dishes I taste. I have no doubt that if this eatery remains true to its cuisine philosophy, it will certainly emerge as a must-eat-at place on Bengaluru‚Äôs culinary trail. Located in the heart of Bengaluru on Castle Street, this clean, hygienic eatery is certainly worthy of more than one visit. Do taste their delicious fare, and in doing so, support yet another deserving small business.

Take care. Stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Lucknowi Biryani & Kebabs At Bengaluru‚Äôs Smallest Biryani Shop Run By A Brave Lady! BIRYANI DELICACY
Description:
#biryanidelicacy #lucknowibiryani #bangalore 

biryani delicacy, biryani shop, lucknowi biryani, awadhi biryani, galouti kebab, seekh kebab, chapli kebab, shami kebab, goat meat biryani, non vegetarian, akshayanagar, south bengaluru, bangalore, inspiring story, lady entrepreneur, small business, bengaluru, bangalore, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

The pandemic was a difficult time for Mahi and her husband Majeed. Their little son fell seriously ill and to nurse him back to health, this young couple had to borrow a fair bit of money. However soon thereafter Mahi lost her job. Left with no recourse, she turned to her love for cooking and opened a small shop near her home in Akshayanagar, a distant suburb in South Bengaluru, where she serves Lucknowi biryani and kebabs made to her grandmother‚Äôs recipe at home. There‚Äôs only a table to seat four and a few regulars in the area who order takeaways. But business has been tough, and the young couple have been having a tough time trying to make ends meet and repay their loans. I received an appeal from Mahi, and after making discreet enquiries, visited them for a meal. While the tiny size of the shop, it‚Äôs no more than a kiosk, with a table outside to seat four, did surprise me, what floored me completely was the taste of the fare that is served out of Biryani Delicacy. I will definitely return for the biryani and the kebabs. And needless to say, you should visit too. To savour a unique Lucknow style biryani that has been tweaked a bit to suit Bengaluru‚Äôs palate, and to also support a deserving small enterprise.

Hope you enjoy this episode. Tackle care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: He Does Not Speak Or Hear But Serves The Best Teas To His Customers! GANESH GREEN TEA Natural Teas
Description:
#ganeshgreentea #teashop #bangalore 

ganesh green tea, natural teas, herbal teas, tea shop, lemon teal, green tea, basil seed tea, gum tea, isabgol tea, jaggery tea, menthol tea, refreshing teas, basaveshwara nagar, special abilities, speech disability, hearing disability, special ability, inspiring story, small business, bengaluru, bangalore, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Ganesh may not speak or hear, but he certainly knows the pulse of his customers when it comes to preparing and serving them fresh teas, each one brimming with the goodness of natural ingredients. I am told he began this enterprise when he lost his father owing to some ailment that couldn‚Äôt be cured. Ganesh took it upon himself to research and prepare a variety of teas that he believed could help his customers stay healthy and restore them from day to day health niggles. It was inspiring to watch this one-man-army go about his work serving the community when I dropped in unannounced at his small store one evening.

Please do support this small business and share this video to encourage differently abled entrepreneurs like Ganesh who notwithstanding their challenges  are bravely standing on their own, and are in many ways an inspiration to society.

Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Note: Each tea dispensed by Ganesh is unique. Whilst some of them may taste a bit medicinal, they are extremely beneficial to one‚Äôs health, say regulars. My favourites were green tea, lemon tea and jaggery tea. Teas are priced upwards of Rs. 20.

Title: This Doctor Brings Mangalore‚Äôs Ice Cream Creations To Bengaluru! SCOOPS OF MANGALORE Gadbad Tiramisu
Description:
#icecreams #malleshwaram #bangalore 

ice creams, mangalore ice cream in bengaluru, scoops of mangalore, gadbad, gudbud, tiramisu, parfait, ideal ice creams, pabba‚Äôs ice creams, desserts, mangalore ice cream, malleswaram, malleshwaram, chaat, chat, small business, family business, bengaluru, bangalore, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When Dr Gani Ganeshwar was studying medicine in Mangalore, he fell in love with the port city‚Äôs iconic Ideal Ice Creams and Pabba‚Äôs. Over the years of studying medicine, he consumed many of their creations and pondered over the possibility of bringing these to Bengaluru. Nearly a year ago, the thought finally came to fruition when this enterprising doctor began Scoops of Mangalore, where Ideal ice creams are not only sold in retail packs, but also fashioned into the most popular Mangalore Gadbad‚Äôs, Tiramisu‚Äôs, Parfaits and the like. I dropped by one evening to check if these ice cream concoctions hit the spot like they would in Kudla (Mangalore)!

Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Family‚Äôs Homestyle Chaats Are A Local Hit! SRI RANGANATHA, Bengaluru | Support Small Business
Description:
#chaat #malleshwaram #bangalore 

street food, sri ranganatha chats corner, ranganatha chats malleswaram, malleshwaram, chaat, chat, small business, family business, bengaluru, bangalore, street food, masala puri, boti masala, pani puri, bhel puri, dahi puri, support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Ranganatha was only in the fifth grade when he began assisting his brother-in-law at his chat cart after school. Soon, his interest in making chaat overtook any academic inclinations and after completing seventh grade, he gave up school. Soon, his family joined in too, his father giving up his profession as an automotive mechanic, his mother, and much later, his wife, assisting in preparing the masalas, chutneys, etc. at home. Over the last two decades or so, the cart has made way to a tiny shop and Sri Ranganatha Chats Corner has emerged as a favourite chaat spot in the neighbourhood, not only for their homestyle, simple preparations, but also the friendliness with which they interact with customers, many who have been tasting their fare over years.

Meet them when you‚Äôre in Malleshwaram next, and do your best to support small neighbourhood enterprises like these. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Description:
#soundaryahotel #chikkamagaluru #vegetarian

hotel soundarya, vegetarian restaurant, chikmagalur, chikkamagaluru, soundarya hotel chikmagalur, breakfast, idli, vade, benne masala dosae, coffee, chikmagalur restaurants, best veg restaurants in chikmagalur, famous hotels in chikmagalur, famous eatouts in chikmagalur, chikmagalur food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When travellers alight at Chikmagalur bus stand, they cross the road and head to this eatery that has a reputation for serving simple, unfussy, old fashioned vegetarian fare for over three decades now. In the transformation that has swept through most of this coffee town, one is thankful for places like Soundarya Hotel that stands resolutely holding on its old fashioned decor and values, serving tasty tiffin, meals and coffee at extremely affordable prices, endearing it to both travellers (in the know) and locals alike. On my last morning in Chikmagalur, I stopped here for a quick breakfast and made a mental note to return for more.

Hope you enjoy this one too. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Support This Hard Working Couple‚Äôs Delicious Seafood Fry Truck! KFDC MOBILE CANTEEN Bengaluru
Description:
#streetfood #rajajinagar #bangalore 

kfdc mobile canteen, small business, rajajinagar, bengaluru, bangalore, seafood fry, karnataka fisheries development corporation, seafood fry, fish fry, prawn fry, anjal, seer, mackerel, sardine, indian salmon, king fish, support small business, small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When Narasimha Murthy‚Äôs livelihood as a masala salesman was disrupted owing to covid, he set up a tiny eatery serving seafood. Thrice, but each one failed. As a last resort, he approached Karnataka Fisheries Development Corporation, and they suggested he explore the model of a seafood mobile canteen that he set up a couple of years ago. Murthy still keeps his day job, selling spice mix packets throughout Bengaluru whilst his wife, Sunanda cleans the fish and prepares the masala throughout the day. And in the evening, they drive their seafood fry truck to Rajajinagar, where this hard working couple cook, and serve the neighbourhood. The fish that they serve is fresh, sourced from KFDC each day, and their fries, delicious as I discovered when I paid them an impromptu visit a few weeks ago.

I salute their work ethic, and hope many of you will be inspired to support this small enterprise. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Description:
#towncanteen #chikkamagaluru #masaladosa

town canteen, town canteen chikmagalur, butter masala dosae, town canteen masala dosa, vegetarian restaurant, chikmagalur, tiffin, breakfast, masala vade, gulab jamun, coffee, dosa at chikmagalur, chikmagalur dosae, chikmagalur restaurants, best veg restaurants in chikmagalur, famous hotels in chikmagalur, famous eateries in chikmagalur, chikkamagaluru food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Ask most locals in Chikmagalur where they go for their dosae fix, and chances are they will mention this eatery, also one of coffee town‚Äôs earliest. Over the last 63 years, Town Canteen, that sits on the edge of IG Road, has emerged as the place to go for the scrumptiously crisp, buttery, benne masala dosae, chased de rigueur with soft, cardamom sugar syrup soaked gulab jamuns, and their special blend filter coffee. Although I tasted these two years ago, I couldn‚Äôt miss an encore when we were filming a Gourmet On The Road series in coffee town a few weeks ago.

A definite must-try when in Chikkamagaluru. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Enjoyed A Big Malenadu Lunch At This Homestay! The Vintage Chikmagalur!
Description:
#thevintage #chikkamagaluru #homestay

the vintage homestay, malenadu lunch, malnad cuisine, vegetarian, non vegetarian, tender jackfruit curry, malenadu chicken curry, fish fry, raw banana fritters, banana podi, sweet potato fry, horse gram chutney, chikmagalur, chikmagalur, karnataka, the vintage, home stay, the vintage home stay, chikmagalur resorts, chikmagalur homestay, travel, chikamagalur, orchard, chikmagalur food trail, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I first discovered The Vintage in Chikmagalur a couple of years ago when Sree and I, having emerged from the pandemic, were looking to take a break in a safe environment. This villa homestay set in an orchard came recommended. Since then, we have returned twice again to the endearing hospitality of its owner, Charles Baptist, who personally leaves no stone unturned to ensure his guests enjoy a refreshing Chikmaglur experience. On this visit to film a Gourmet On The Road series in coffee town, we camped here and left only after partaking a delicious Malenadu brunch, highlights of which included a tender jackfruit curry, tasty Malnad chicken, kadak fish fry and a surprising bottle gourd payasa. Definitely a spot to consider when you‚Äôre planning your next weekend break.

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Description:
#pandurangacoffeeworks #coffeeshop #chikkamagaluru

panduranga coffee works, chikmagalur, panduranga coffee chikmagalur, panduranga coffee review, chikkamagaluru, coffee retail, coffee shop, filter coffee, artisan coffees, coffee tours, coffee trail, chikmagalur coffee, best coffee in chikmagalur, coffee roasting, aroma gold, made in chikmagalur, monkey coffee, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I first came across this 85-year-old coffee institution when I visited Chikmagalur over two years ago. Since then, their Grand Aroma blend has been a staple in our coffee shelf at home. On this visit though, I was pleasantly surprised to find that not only is this heritage coffee roasting and blending house holding on to its traditional blends, but has since made notable strides in creating an assortment of coffee varieties to suit every palate. If you‚Äôre visiting Chikkamagaluru, a visit to this old-school coffee retail shop is a must. And when there, do chat up with the Setty brothers and request to take a peek at the making of some of their blends.

Hope you enjoy this coffee episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Election Special! He Served Over 5000 Free Benne Dosae, Mysore Pak To Those Who Voted! Nisarga Grand
Description:
#nisargagrand #electiondosa #bengaluru

nisarga grand, nisarga grand bengaluru, benne khali dosae, mysore pak, juiuce, karnataka elections, kripal amanna, krishnaraja sp, hotel nisarga grand, nrupathunga road, bengaluru, bangalore, small business, support small business, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A chance conversation with students at his eatery, Nisarga Grand in Bengaluru, five years ago led Krishnaraja SP to offer free dosae to them if they exercised their civic duty and voted! Since then, this humble restaurateur has offered free dosae to anyone who walks into his restaurant on election day and shows their inked finger. I stepped into his eatery too, having exercised my franchise, to avail of a free benne khali dosae, mysore pak and juice this year. In doing so, I learnt of the challenges he faced this year, and also the fact he was foregoing most of his normal business on election day to cater to voters, over 5,000 of them!

Hope you enjoyed this episode that promotes a social cause. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Couple Makes 100% Natural Ice Creams! CHURN Bengaluru | No Artificial Colours Or Flavours!
Description:
#churnicecream #bangalore #naturalicecream

churn  ice cream, churn gelato, rmv 2nd stage, new bel road, sadashivnagar, bengaluru, churn ice cream bangalore, bangalore, natural ice cream, natural flavours, chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, salted caramel, cashew, blackberry, wood apple, must try ice creams, ice cream parlour, small business, , support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When Vani, a dietician, and her husband, Harsha, a IT professional, chanced upon an ice cream churner at an exhibition in Bengaluru, they saw in it an opportunity bring to fruition their plans of creating 100% natural ice creams, made only with fresh fruits and nuts, sans any artificial flavours, colours or additives. A trip to Italy to learn the art of making gelato, low fat ice creams, followed by months of honing recipes at home, led to the birth of their ice cream parlour, Churn in a leafy bylane of RMV 2nd Stage. The ice creams here are made fresh everyday using only seasonal ingredients. Although Churn has its share of loyal patrons in and around the neighbourhood, their ice creams are perhaps unknown to most of Bengaluru. I visit Churn to meet the friendly couple, learn the art of making gelato and taste every flavour that‚Äôs in the store. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Support small businesses. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

When I visited Chikmagalur a few months ago, I dropped into Tasty World Food Factory unannounced, and was taken in by the concept of the place that has provided for visitors an air-conditioned viewing gallery to look into the hygienic production of traditional Karnataka snacks and namkeen here. I hope you enjoy this walk though what will soon be on every must-visit list in this coffee town, and my tasting of some of their interesting, homely tiffin preparations.

Title: Ultimate Chikmagalur Coffee Tasting Experience! WORLD OF COFFEE | Brew Filter Kaapi To Civet Coffee!
Description:
#worldofcoffee #coffeeexperience #chikkamagaluru

world of coffee, chikmagalur, chikkamagaluru, coffee experience zone, coffee shop, filter coffee, artisan coffees, coffee tours, coffee roasting, coffee estate, 4d coffee, coffee tour, coffee tasting, civet coffee, karnataka food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food


It is said that coffee first found its way into India through a Sufi saint, Baba Budan who, having smuggled seven coffee beans from Arabia in his beard, planted these in the hills around Chikkamagaluru in the late 17th century. Fitting therefore that this coffee town is also home to a unique coffee store that offers customers an immersive walk through the history, brewing and experiential tasting of coffee. I visited World Of Coffee on a recent trip and tasted a host of coffee - new age artisan varieties like pineapple fermented, honey infused, foraged civet coffees, and traditional filter coffee. When in Chikmagalur, you must explore coffee and this store is a great place to start.

Hope you enjoy this heady brew of an episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Tasting:
Each of the coffees tasted left a mark. My favourites though, in descending order of preference - civet coffee, filter coffee, cold brew, fruit and honey infused coffee. And to taste coffee in a dessert form, the panna cotta is highly recommended.

The coffee panna cotta is priced at Rs. 170, and the artisan coffees around Rs. 170.

Kripal Amanna
Gourmet On The Road & Founder, Food Lovers TV

Title: RAGHAVENDRA STORES Tiffin With Jaggesh, Santhosh Ananddram,  Shwetha Srivatsav!
Description:
#raghavendrastores #jaggesh #santhoshananddram

kripal amanna, raghavendra stores film, jaggesh, navarasa nayaka jaggesh, santhosh ananddram, shwetha srivatsav, sri raghavendra stores, malleshwaram, malleswaram, idli vada, chutney, bengaluru, bangalore, sandalwood, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, popular eatery, small business, support small business, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

This isn‚Äôt a typical Gourmet On The Road episode. What appealed to me most about Director, Santhosh Ananddram‚Äôs upcoming film, Raghavendra Stores, set in a fictional eatery in Malenadu, wasn‚Äôt just its earthy, realistic portrayal of culinary traditions, but also its message. That tackled headlong the social challenges faced by those in the food trade, the protagonist in this film unable to find a bride due to his profession as a cook or ‚Äòadige bhatta‚Äô. In this fun conversation, I catch up with Santhosh Ananddram, and actors, Navarasa Nayaka Jaggesh and Shwetha Srivatsav over a delicious tiffin thindi at a Malleswaram icon, Sri Raghavendra Stores.

Am definitely looking forward to watching the full film, if you‚Äôre a food lover, you must too. Hope you enjoyed this special episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Rediscovered 41-Year-Old HOTEL PARIMALA, Kunigal! Good Old Fashioned Food At Honest Prices!
Description:
#hotelparimala #kunigal #hassanhighway

hotel parimala, vegetarian restaurant, kunigal, hotel parimala kunigal, highway restaurant, idli vada, rava idli, dosae, benne khali dosae, khali dosae, coffee, highway eatery, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, popular eatery, small business, , support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Long before the current Mangalore highway was built, travellers from Bengaluru enroute to Hassan, Coastal Karnataka and beyond took the state highway that would meander through towns along the way. Kunigal was an important stop back then, and I remember pit stops for breakfast here in the nineties when quality eateries were hard to find, barring places like Hotel Parimala that first opened doors over four decades ago. Since then, a new highway has emerged that bypasses most such places. On a recent road trip to Chikmagalur though, I decided to stop at Hotel Parimala and rediscovered for myself a culinary institution that takes great pride in its age-old traditions that places great emphasis on serving quality fare to customers at prices that also seem to be an honest echo to the past.

I hope you enjoy this episode enough to revisit old eateries like Hotel Parimala that have been bypassed by modern highways. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Tasty, Old Fashioned South Canara Veg Lunch At UDUPI SRI KRISHNA BHAVAN, Bengaluru | 100 Years Old!
Description:
#udupisrikrishnabhavan #lunch #bangalore

pure vegetarian restaurant, oldest restaurant, bengaluru, south canara cuisine, sambar, idli, vegetarian thaali, plate meals, thaali, lunch, popular bengaluru restaurants, balepet, chickpet, must try restaurant, historical restaurant, heritage eatery, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, vegetarian, eateries in bangalore, support local

My last visit to Udupi Sri Krishna Bhavan in Balepete for an early tiffin coincided with the conclusion of their lunch service. I watched some of the lunch crowd relishing their thali meals, and made a note to return for the same someday. And so when on a recent visit to Chickpete, a lunch opportunity suddenly opened up, I lost no time in heading to this near-100-year-old eatery to taste their South Canara lunch. It‚Äôs a simple affair - couple of vegetable preparations, lentils, rasam, poori and rice, even a sweet - quite homely in its taste and sumptuous enough to fill one‚Äôs belly for a very affordable Rs. 110 only. And consumed in the restaurant‚Äôs heritage setting, it is also the sort of meal that transports one back to ‚Äògood ole yesteryear‚Äô! Definitely plan a lunch here when in the area.  

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Must-Try Unique Gowdagere Village SLR BIRYANI, Mutton Sambar Meal At Channarayapatna, Hassan Highway
Description:
#slrbiryani #gowdagere #hassanhighway

slr biryani, slr biryani gowdagere, channarayapatna,  hassan mangalore highway, highway eatery, gowdagere, slr biryani corner, slr biryani channarayapatna, mutton biryani, mutton chops, mutton sambar, ragi mudde, finger millet, khushka, karnataka, non vegetarian, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, popular eatery, small business, , support small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

A farmer by profession, Mr. Rangaswamy opened a small thatched eatery on his property abutting the highway in Gowdagere, near Channarayapatna, 15 years ago to serve tea and snacks to travellers on the Bengaluru Hassan route. As the eatery became popular, his family also introduced their unique village style biryani along with other meaty preparations like the mutton sambar, thale kaalu and chops. He has since passed on, but his family continues his culinary traditions at SLR Biryani. Notwithstanding the recent construction of a flyover that bypasses this humble home eatery and has impacted business here, it still manages to hold on to its loyal patrons. The popularity of their wood-fire-cooked biryani is such that it runs out in a few hours each morning, after which it is the mutton dishes served with ragi mudde, plain rice or khushka that occupy centrestage. I dropped in impromptu for lunch one afternoon and was elated to find, through a tremendous stroke of luck, the biryani that was prepared for a special order.

Hope you enjoy this rustic episode. Please do support deserving, small enterprises like this. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Only Seasonal Fruits & No Sugar, Says This Age Old Juice Shop Owner! LAKSHMI JUICE CENTRE, Bengaluru
Description:
#lakshmijuicecentre #seshadripuram #bengaluru

lakshmi juice centre, seshadripuram, bengaluru, bangalore, amla orange, mango shake, strawberry shake, mango pulpy, beetroot carrot amla ginger juice, fresh fruit juices, seasonal juices, milk shakes, summer coolers, lakshmi juice, lakshmi juice centre seshadripuram, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Mr. Srinivas Padiyar, a native of Kundapura, set up a sugarcane juice shop in Seshadripuram in 1977. However, fed up with the flies that would swarm around sugar cane, he shifted to making fruit juices, his attempt being to offer fruit juices with no sugar to the extent possible, by juicing only the freshest produce in the prime of their season. This coupled with his honest approach, ‚Äúto offer customers full value for their hard earned money‚Äô has earned for Lakshmi Juice Centre a loyal following through the years. I visited the store one warm evening to taste some of his most popular offerings.

Hope you enjoy this refreshing episode. Take care, stay safe and strong.

Title: This BHATS CANTEEN Family Has Fueled Bengaluru‚Äôs Factories For 34 Years! HOTEL GURUKRUPA
Description:
#hotelgurukrupabhatscanteen #peenya #bangalore

hotel gurukrupa bhats hotel, peenya, bengaluru, bangalore, peenya, bhatru hotel, vegetarian, idli vade chutney, sangeeta mixture, dry fruit carrot halwa, gulab jamun with banana and ice cream, poori channa masala, thatte idli, mysore pak, coffee, maddur vade, idli vada, sambar, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular restaurant, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

When Mr. and Mrs. M. Mahadev Rao moved to Peenya on the outskirts of Bengaluru, this area was a remote industrial outpost where a few factories lay scattered amongst fields. With a family of seven children to feed and educate, this couple rented a shed to run a small tiffin shop that fueled workers and staff in the manufacturing units around. Over time, the popularity of their homely vegetarian tiffin fare and meals grew, also earning for the humble eatery the moniker ‚ÄòBhatru Hotel‚Äô, as the couple were constantly cooking and feeding customers. 34 years on Gurukrupa Bhats Canteen stands strong as a cornerstone in this now bustling suburb, a daily ritual for many of its patrons, for whom a day is incomplete without coffee, tiffin or a meal here. Now in his nineties, Mr Rao has left the running of the eatery to his sons who are involved in every aspect of the operation - from the cooking to the serving and speaking a kind word or two with their customers, many who share decades-old relationships with the place. I dropped in for a quick tiffin, but felt compelled to linger on and savour many of the dishes on offer.

Shyam Mishra moved from Allahabad to Bengaluru 35 years ago to set up a small juice shop in a narrow alley of Chickpet. That in itself wasn‚Äôt an event perhaps, but it was his recipes for fresh juice blends and rich creamy milk shakes created only with seasonal produce that over time has made Shyam Mishra Juice Centre a destination not only in the area but am told also in the dozen or so outlets it operates in Bengaluru, manned by the extended family that has since migrated to the city to support the trade. I dropped in at their original store to taste nine of their popular offerings, each one special and refreshing. Definitely a juice shop to add to your summer cooler list.

Description:
#streetfood #vegetarian #bangalore
 
sri sai veg bbq, banashankari, south bengaluru, bangalore, street food, vegetarian barbeque, vegetarian, punjabi masala, haryali, malai, malai broccoli, aloo tikka, honey pineapple, healthy street food, grills, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business, family business, inspiring story

When Amudha‚Äôs husband, Manikanta lost his small trade owing to the pandemic, she decided to convert her tiny cook-at-home enterprise into something that would enable the family to earn a livelihood. She came up with the idea of a street side vegetarian barbecue shop as a concept that was healthy and would perhaps also resonate with customers. However, not one to take the easy way out, she took assistance to learn barbecue recipes and practices from a five star chef before launching Sri Sai Veg Bbq in Banashankari, South Bengaluru. Over the last two years, this family has won the hearts of food lovers in the neighbourhood for their delicious warming fare that is prepared with a whole lotta love, care and packs a tasty punch.

Please do your best to support deserving small enterprises like this that are doing tasty work in your neighbourhood. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Locals Call This The Veena Stores Of Vidyaranyapura! HEGDE‚ÄôS FAST FOOD Best Idli, Vade, Khara Bath
Description:
#hegdefastfoodvidyaranyapura #idlivada #bangalore

hegde‚Äôs fast food, idli, vada, vade, chutney, khara bath, kesari bath, vidyaranyapura, north bangalore, bengaluru, vegetarian, tiffin, south indian, vegetarian, idli chutney, hedge fast food vidyaranyapura, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular tiffin shop, small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

Prabhakar Hegde moved from his native Sirsi in Uttara Kannada to Bengaluru in the nineties to earn a livelihood. He found employment at the iconic Veena Stores in Malleshwaram, and after a few years of working there decided that cooking and serving tiffin was his calling. He went on to open a tiny store in Vidyaranyapura, a far flung locality in North Bengaluru, 23 years ago, a place so remote that back then only a handful of buses would ply there each day. However today, the area has grown into a bustling suburb, and so has Hegde‚Äôs Fast Food which is now a cornerstone of the neighbourhood for its idli, vade and a couple of other thindi items. Having received a bunch of recommendations in support of this shop, I visited Hegde impromptu for a chat one evening with him, and also with the locals who have monikered this place as the Veena Stores of Vidyaranyapura.

Please do your best to support tiny small businesses like these that need all the help that they can get for the delicious work they do. Hope you enjoy this one; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Karnataka Ratna Dr. PUNEETH RAJKUMAR‚Äôs Most Favourite Dishes At HOTEL NAVAYUGA! Biryani, Meals
Description:
#puneethrajkumar  #hotelnavayuga #biryani 

hotel navayuga, mutton biryani, andhra food, bangalore, dr puneeth rajkumar, power star puneeth rajkumar favourite restaurant, appu, appu sir, navayuga andhra restaurant, mutton biryani, fish fry, chicken kebab, chilli chicken, mutton fry, mutton roast, navayuga, gandhinagar, bengaluru, bangalore, eating out in bangalore, bengaluru food tour

When Mr Mohan Rao couldn‚Äôt find a job in Bengaluru after completing his engineering degree, he hired a cook from Nellore and began a restaurant in 1981. Over time Hotel Navayuga became popular amongst its patrons for the biryanis, kebabs and fries. Its patrons include not just with the common man and hordes of travelers given its location in Gandhinagar, but its fare has also endeared itself to luminaries of Karnataka, most noteworthy being the Dr Rajkumar parivar. 

I was told about this place by Karnataka Ratna, Dr. Puneeth Rajkumar, Appu Sir, and more recently shared a meal with his nephew, Vinay Rajkumar and Anushree when I tasted some of Dr Puneeth Rajkumar‚Äôs most favourite dishes here. In this Gourmet On The Road episode, I return to taste some of the delicacies that have transformed Hotel Navayuga from an eatery that was born out of the need for a livelihood to a Bengaluru culinary icon.

I hope you enjoy this very special episode, also catch part one where I visit the kitchens of Navayuga to explore what makes their iconic biryani special, in addition to watching the making of the other favourites here like the chicken kebab, fish fry and more.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

I was first introduced to Hotel Navayuga during the course of my most memorable meal, with Karnataka Ratna, Dr Puneeth Rajkumar, Appu Sir. We were relishing a traditional jolada rotti oota, but somewhere our conversation veered to tasting a biryani during our next meal. Alas, that wasn‚Äôt meant to be, but deep down I feel that if it would have been at Hotel Navayuga, a 40-year-old eatery that Appu Sir spoke about quite fondly. I did make a visit to the eatery later, to record a tribute episode to commemorate his last film over a meal with his nephew, Vinay Rajkumar and Anchor Anushree. It was also during the course of this meal that I decided I must return to film a full-fledged Gourmet On Episode.

I hope you enjoy part one of this episode, where I visit the kitchens of Navayuga to explore what makes their iconic biryani special, in addition to watching the making of their other favourites like the chicken kebab, fish fry and more.

Title: Softest, Fluffiest SRI LAKSHMI BHAVAN TIFFIN ROOM Khaali Dosae Making & Tasting! 68 Year Recipe!
Description:
#lakshmibhavantiffinroom #chitradurga #khaalidosa

lakshmi bhavan tiffin room, chitradurga, lakshmi bhavan tiffin room chitradurga, lakshmi tiffin room chitradurga, khaali dosae, masala dosa, dosa making, idli sambar, gulab jamun, tiffin, vegetarian, south indian, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

Over the last couple of years, I have received innumerable requests from our viewers to taste the khaali dosae at Chitradurga‚Äôs popular Sri Lakshmi Bhavan Tiffin Room. And so, on a recent drive through the area, I stopped at this 68-year old institution where I enjoyed my short conversation with the humble second-generation proprietor, Mr Mahabala, and also caught the making of what is perhaps one of the fluffiest khaali dosae that I‚Äôve eaten. Khaali means ‚Äòempty‚Äô in kannada, there is no oil deployed in the dosae‚Äôs cooking, but ironically the tradition here is to serve it with some tuppa (ghee), and palya (potato stuffing) to make for an enjoyable, filling thindi. And they say, you shouldn't leave here without tasting their soft gulab jamun, which is what i savoured too in addition to a lovely idli sambar.

Hope you enjoy this tiffin watch, definitely pencil the place into your travel plans when in and around Chitradurga. Happy eating.

chaape reddy hotel, chitradurga, mutton fry, khaima, mutton chops, mutton sambar, chicken curry, mutton curry, chicken pepper dry, mutton khaima dry, highway eatery, chitradurga, karnataka, chaape reddy hotel chitradurga, non vegetarian, tiffin, military hotel, south indian, karnataka food tour, karnataka food, must try dishes, small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

Not enjoying his vocation as a public works contractor, Satyanarayana Reddy converted a part of his home into a rustic eatery in Chitradurga, seeking to serve non vegetarian delicacies made to his wife‚Äôs recipes. The eatery had no signboard for many years, but gained immense popularity amongst locals for its unique mutton and chicken dishes. However, it is still largely undiscovered to most travellers which is ironic given its location just off the highway. The atmosphere of this 31-year-old eatery is rather rudimentary, but the fare served here is the sort that will have you reminiscing its robust flavours well into your journey.

Hope you enjoy this delicious find; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: These High Fruit, All Natural Jams, Relishes & Condiments Were Born Out Of Hardship During Pandemic!
Description:
#supernaturalsociety #jams #chutneys

jams, condiments, preserves, chutneys, chef amit wadhawan, supernatural society, order online, high fruit content jams and preserves, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, small business, support small business

The pandemic was tough on the hospitality industry and the people who worked in it, many who found themselves out of employment. My good friend, Chef Amit Wadhawan however saw in this adversity an opportunity to convert an interest, that of bottling traditional and modern expressions of flavours in a hand crafted range of jams, chutneys, pickles and preserves, into a small business. Sold under the name, Supernatural Society, these delicious offerings are cooked by him personally in small batches sans any preservative, low sugar and with perhaps the highest concentration of fruits and other natural ingredients. I caught up with Amit in Delhi over a delightful tasting of some of his jars.

Hope you enjoy this watch. Please do your best to support small businesses like this. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Title: This 36-Year-Old RAJKUMAR HOTEL Serves A Great Village Style Thatte Idli! Avarebele Usli, Khali Dosa
Description:
#rajkumarhotel #thatteidli #tumkur

rajkumar thatte idli, tumkur, thatte idli, acrey idli, avarebele usli, masala vada, ghee khali dosae, dosa, tiffin shop, highway eatery, tumkur, karnataka, vegetarian, tiffin, south indian, vegetarian, idli chutney, karnataka food tour, Karnataka food, must try dishes, popular tiffin shop, small business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

Brothers Basavaraju and Shivakumar are huge fans of Dr Rajkumar and family. So much so that their 36-year-old eatery has no name board, but is simply known to locals as Rajkumar Idli hotel in Tumkur. In my tasting of their old-fashioned thatte idli, a harkback to the 'acrey' idli of yore, when idlis where steamed on large plates prior to the advent of modern idli steamers, I discover that their devotion to Kannada cinema‚Äôs most iconic family is also mirrored in their pursuit to preserving an age old idli tradition. This unpretentious shop is definitely worth a stop when on the route.

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: These Sisters Are Serving Authentic, Homely Andhra Flavours! CURRYCE ANDHRA BHOJANAM, Bengaluru
Description:
#curryceandhrabhojanam #andhracuisine #bangalore

curryce andhra bhojanam, andhra restaurant, rt nagar, north bangalore, bengaluru, vegetarian andhra bhojanam, andhra food, andhra thali, chicken gongura, kodi vepudu, royulu roast, pappu, majjiga pulusu, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular restaurant, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

Sisters Chandrakala and Shoba were running a successful catering business which was unfortunately brought down by the pandemic. They lay low for 27 months before bouncing back with a small eatery to serve up Andhra delicacies made to the recipes of their parents and grandparents. Curryce Andhra Bhojanam, located in RT Nagar, North Bengaluru is only four tables large, but in my opinion, the food that they serve is destined for bigger things ahead. Join me in this homely episode where I taste a full-fledged veg bhojanam, kodi vepudu, gongura chicken royulu roast and a memorable Hyderabadi style biryani.

Please do your best to support tiny small businesses like these that need all the help that they can get for the delicious work they do. Hope you enjoy this one; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Description:

In this episode, I seek out a dosae memory from 20 years ago! A unique reddish-orange-hued dosae that found its home in the erstwhile Samrat restaurant at Chalukya Hotel, Bengaluru. Sadly, the place closed its doors a few months ago, however second generation restaurateur, Santosh Shanbag is committed to preserving the near 50-year-old culinary legacy of his father. I caught up with him and also a masterclass in the technique that goes into the making of their signature Chalukya Samrat ghee roast dosae. 

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Bengaluru‚Äôs Famous But Hidden CHANDRAPPA HOTEL! 46 Years Of Non Vegetarian Tradition! Must Try!
Description:
#chandrappahotel #nonvegetarian #bangalore

chandrappa hotel, mathikere, old but unknown eatery, north bengaluru, military hotel, non vegetarian eatery, mutton chops, mutton curry, brain pepper fry, pork pepper fry, pork garlic dry, mutton biryani, rasam, akki roti, ragi mudde, guntur chicken, local cuisine, chandrappa hotel mathikere, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, popular restaurant, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

When Mr. Chandrappa moved to Mathikere, then a remote corner of Bengaluru nearly half a century ago, he set up a vegetarian eatery to cater to the local populace. This met with limited success, however things clicked when he added in the non vegetarian dishes that he and his wife would cook at home. Eventually, his sons joined in to support this family enterprise that in a span of 46 years has come to be the de facto eatery for naati (local style) non-vegetarian oota in the area. However, there are still many outside the immediate area who are yet to discover the homely taste of the fare here. I was one of them, until I paid a surprise visit one afternoon. In doing so, I caught up with the second and third generation of Chandrappa‚Äôs family and also his culinary legacy in a smorgasbord of meaty dishes.

Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Vada Pav Seller Makes A Secret, Spicy Chutney That His Father Taught Him! MODERN VADA PAV
Description:
#streetfood #vadapav #bengaluru

modern vada pav, btm 2nd stage, south bangalore, bengaluru, vada pav, bread pakoda, mumbai vada pav, butter vada pav, cheese vada pav, jp nagar, bengaluru, vegetarian, snacks, tiffin, south bengaluru, bangalore food tour, bengaluru food, must try dishes, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business

After completing his education, Kamalesh Gowda decided to put up a vada pav stall and deploy his father‚Äôs recipe of a spicy chutney that the latter had picked up during his days in Mumbai decades ago. Tucked in a quiet bylane of BTM 2nd Stage in South Bengaluru, one-man army, Kamlesh goes about his business quietly, particular about his ingredients resulting in his regular customers being quite vocal for him. Which is how I discovered him through a twitter poll a few weeks ago. Please do support small enterprises like Modern Vada Pav Centre that are trying to earn an honest living serving delicious fare.

I hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

In our last Old Delhi outing this season, we stumbled upon the best biryani that we tasted in the walled city. Getting to Taufiq Dilpasand Biryani Point requires some effort given its location in the inner recesses of Galli Haveli Azam Khan, a bit of a walk from Jama Masjid. Title: Delhi‚Äôs Best Chicken Fry At HAJI MOHD HUSSAIN, Amazing Nahari At SHABRATI | Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 9
Description:
#hajimohammadhussainchickenfry #shabratinahari #jamamasjid

purani delhi, old delhi, non vegetarian, food tour, jama masjid, haji mohd hussain fried chicken, haji mohammad hussain chicken, haji mohammad hussain chicken fry, fried chicken of old delhi, delhi jama masjid chicken fry, chicken fry old delhi, shabrati nahari shop, shabrati nihari wale, shabrati nahari centre, purani dilli ki asli nahari, old delhi nahari, mohabbat ka sharbat, delhi food walk, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

They call Haji Mohd Hussain‚Äôs fried chicken the KFC of Old Delhi, a moniker well earned by the hard working septuagenarian for his single minded focus to making his version of a double fried, crisp and juicy, spicy chicken. Speaking of one-dish eateries, further down the road, one also finds Shabrati Nahari Shop that has been making a slow-braised eight-hour nahari twice a day each day since 1954. And in between the fried chicken and nahari, I also gulped down a few glasses of mohabbat ka sharbat, a delightful refreshing concoction that I instantly fell in love with. 

Hope you love this episode too. Subscribe and hit the bell to stay tuned for a couple more in our Old Delhi series. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Delhi‚Äôs Most Famous ASLAM BUTTER CHICKEN, Tea At SALEEM STALL | Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 8
Description:
#aslamchicken #saleemteastall #delhifoodwalk

purani delhi, old delhi, non vegetarian, food tour, jama masjid, aslam chicken, aslam butter chicken, butter chicken, aslam chicken old delhi, aslam chicken jama masjid, aslam chicken tikka, saleem tea stall, saleem tea, delhi food walk, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Park aside whatever notions you may have of the butter chicken, for Purani Dilli‚Äôs most famous Aslam Butter Chicken is anything but that. Made to a seemingly simple recipe with secret masalas, this roasted and charcoal grilled chicken bathed in copious amounts of molten butter has built for this Jama Masjid eatery an iconic status over a span of 25 years. We catch the making of this indulgent chicken tikka, but before that take respite in the reinvigorating offerings of a tea stall that goes back seven or eight decades. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Subscribe and hit the bell to stay tuned for a couple more in our Old Delhi series. Take care; stay safe and strong. 

Happy eating!

Saleem‚Äôs Tea Stall
9/10

Aslam Butter Chicken
Rs. 300 for half portion, Rs. 6 for roomali roti
8.5/10

Title: AVAREBELE MELA 2023 With Sudha Murthy, Sihi Kahi Chandru | 23 Year Festival Shree Vasavi Condiments
Description:
#avarebelemela #shreevasavicondiments #bengaluru 

avarebele mela, avarekai festival, culinary festival, shree vasavi avarebele mela, shree vasavi condiments, annual festival, bengaluru festival, bangalore, karnataka, street food, avarebele snacks, avarebele chikki, avarebele vada, avarebele dosae, avarebele sweets, mysore pak, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

What began as Mrs. Geetha Shivakumar‚Äôs home cooking initiative 23 years ago to bridge with farmers and bring a seasonal produce to Bengaluru‚Äôs consumers in a myriad range of savoury and sweet delicacies is now a culinary institution called the Avarebele Mela. Farmers congregate from Magadi, Karnataka bringing the pick of their crops and the cooks from Shree Vasavi Condiments cook up a host of preparations, each one featuring the avarebele. I was recently invited to open this festival with a host of other dignitaries including Mrs. Sudha Murthy, Sihi Kahi Chandru Sir and others. Hope you enjoy this vlog account of my experience there. The mela runs through 9th January 2023 at National College Grounds, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Link to previous Avarebele Festival video:
Exploring BANGALORE‚ÄôS  Tasty AVAREBELE FESTIVAL| VV PURAM FOOD STREET |Avarebele Vada, Dosa, Jalebi! https://youtu.be/xxTaQDRJpSQ 

Note: The Avarebele Festival is held in January each year, this edition runs at National College Grounds ( https://goo.gl/maps/LUSiX2xhzDGeRGmeA ) until 9th January 2023. After the festival, you will find some of the avarebele delicacies at Sri Vasavi Condiments (address below).
Shree Vasavi Condiments,  #78 3rd Block 5th Main Road, Thyagarajnagar Bull Temple Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560028; tel +91 97432 69356

Alongside other Mughlai fare, we also tasted a unique Shahi Sheermal, a rich, fortified bread cooked in a tandoor at Haji Nizamuddin.

Description:
#delhi #kuremalkulfiwale #chandnichowk

purani delhi, old delhi,vegetarian, food tour, chandni chowk, kuremal mahavir prasad kulfi wale, kuremal kulfi wale, pure fruit kulfi, mango kulfi, jamun kulfi, anaar kulfi, pomegranate, jamun kulfi, dessert, ice cream, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Our last stop on an epic Delhi 6 vegetarian food tour features Kuremal Mahavir Prasad Kulfi Wale, a tiny shop that is perhaps Purani Dilli‚Äôs most famous dessert stop. Picture whole mangoes, apples, oranges, pomegranate set with pure fruit kulfi, and also a bevy of traditional fruits like jamun, phalsa, tamarind, et al hand-churned into tantalising, chatpata granitas and sorbets. That‚Äôs what draws customers here for over 115 years!

Stay tuned for the Jama Masjid, Old Delhi food tour coming up next, subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Tasting GIANI‚ÄôS DI HATTI Most Popular Chole, Rabri Falooda & Lassi! Old Delhi Food Tour Ep 4
Description:
#delhi #gianidihatti #chandnichowk

purani delhi, old delhi, vegetarian,  food tour, chandni chowk, giani‚Äôs di hatti, chole bhature, chole chawal, chana chawal, rabri falooda, faluda, giani ice cream, lassi, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Established in 1956, Giani‚Äôs Di Hatti is a legendary Old Delhi institution for its chole bhature, chana chawal, rabri falooda, malai lassi, among other offerings. Tended to by the third generation of a family that migrated to Delhi post partition, the old fashioned fare here is the sort that endears to locals for its wholesome goodness laced with a tinge of nostalgia. When in Chandni Chowk, Giani‚Äôs Di Hatti is a definite must-visit. 

Hope you are enjoying our Old Delhi series. Plenty more coming up, subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Old Delhi Most Popular Street Food! Padam Chaat, Lotan Chole Kulche, Hazari Lal Khurchan | Ep 2
Description:
#delhi #chandnichowk #vegetarian

purani delhi, old delhi, food tour, chandni chowk, hazari lal jain khurchan wale, lotan chole kulche, padam chaat corner,  khurchan, khurchan roll, badam milk, chole kulche, golgappa, kalmi vada, paani puri, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

In this sweet and savoury episode, we cover three must-visit Old Delhi favourites. Our first stop is at Hazari lal Jain Khurchan Wale where we taste the pure dairy goodness of a traditional reduced milk dessert and some more. This is followed by a piquant introduction to Old Delhi‚Äôs famous Lotan Chole Kulche. This is perhaps the spiciest chole that I have tasted, and the reason, I am told, for its popularity especially in Delhi‚Äôs nippy winters. Our last halt, Padam Chaat comes as a wonderful respite for its tantalizing chaats that work marvelously well to tease our taste buds with a broad array of textures and delicate flavours. 

Hope you enjoy this one too, lots more coming up in this exciting food tour. Subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Old Delhi Best Street Food Tour Ep 1 | Old Famous Jalebi, Paranthe Wali Galli | Chandni Chowk
Description:
#delhi #chandnichowk #vegetarian

purani delhi, old delhi, food tour, chandni chowk, old and famous jalebi, jalebi rabri, ghee jalebi, larantha chowk, paranthe wali galli, parantha, paratha, papad parantha, green peas parantha, mixed parantha, old delhi street food, purani delhi ka zaika, street food old delhi, delhi best food, delhi food tour, must try restaurants, street food in delhi, eateries in delhi, must try delhi food, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, truth in food

Hi folks, welcome to our first Delhi food tour, where I team up with my good friend, Chef Amit Wadhawan to relish and bring to you the enormous array of delicacies that the narrow alleys of Old Delhi have to offer. In the first few episodes, we explore a gamut of vegetarian street fare, beginning with two iconic eateries that date back to the close of the nineteenth century. One serves a scrumptious ghee soaked jalebi with thick rabri, and the other revels in its incredible variety of paranthas, that are decadently fried in pure desi ghee.

Hope you enjoy this one, lots more coming up in this exciting food tour. Subscribe to stay tuned, Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: SURYAWANSHI, A Family‚Äôs Devotion to True MAHARASHTRIAN Food | Throwback
Description:
#suryawanshi #maharashtriancuisine #bengaluru

Authentic Maharashtrian Food at Suryawanshi Restaurant, Bengaluru, Bangalore, Kolhapuri Mutton, Mutton Thali, Pune Vegetarian Food, Pandra Rasa, Tamba Rasa, Misal pav, Vada Pav, Sabudana Vada, Whitefield, Bangalore, Prawn Fry, Pomfret Fry, Malvan Fish Curry, eating out in bengaluru, bangalore,  food trail, must try restaurant 

When Kailash Suryawanshi moved from Kolhapur to Bengaluru with his family nearly a decade ago, the one cuisine he couldn‚Äôt get any of was his own. Such was his yearning for food from his land, that this entrepreneur decided to take upon himself the onerous task of introducing Bengaluru to authentic Marathi fare. After months of travel through the hinterlands of Maharashtra, gleaning recipes and cooks, Suryawanshi was born, a restaurant where conversations in Marathi waft through the dining room, as if in endorsement of the food served here.

In this throwback #gourmetontheroad episode, I catch up with the Suryawanshi family and also tuck into some delicious Maharashtrian cuisine, tasting everything from Pandra Aani Tambda Rasa, Misal Pav, Sabudana Vada, Puneri Veg Thali, Kolhaprui Mutton Thali, Puran Poli, Amras, Shrikhand and more. Enjoy!

Sri Sai Vihar at Fairlands in Salem, was an eatery that came recommended for its meals and tiffin items. The restaurant that features an all-vegetarian menu had humble beginnings, starting out as a mess that served Tamil meals over 40 years ago. 

In this throwback episode, we savour the special meal served here. One that is loaded with wholesome dishes, each delicious and distinct in its flavours. And what makes it a great lunch option is the fact that it's unlimited and honestly priced!

Title: Authentic Mappila Meal & Chicken Biryani At ZAIN‚ÄôS HOTEL, Kozhikode | Mutton Stew | Throwback
Description:
#chickenbiryani #zainshotel #calicut

zain‚Äôs hotel, kozhikode, mappila cuisine, chicken biryani, muton stew, calicut food tour, must try restaurant in calicut, kozhikode best restaurants, kerala, eating out in kozhikode, calicut food tour

Zain‚Äôs Hotel Kozhikode stands testament to Mrs Zainabi Noor‚Äôs firm resolve to showcase the Mappila cuisine of her family. Kozhikode‚Äôs first lady restaurateur, she began her culinary enterprise 32 years ago as a small tea stall dispensing evening snacks. Spurred by the love she received from her customers, Zain‚Äôs today stands tall in Calicut as the address for homestyle Malabar cuisine.

In this throwback episode, I visit  this cosy restaurant set in a home and meets the mother-daughter duo of Zainabi Noor and Shireen Mustafa who oversee every detail of the operation. And also look at the making of their popular chicken biryani, ghee rice and chicken masala in their kitchen ‚Äòmanned‚Äô only by lady cooks, before sitting down to a generous lunch.

Gourmet On The Road,

Description:
#mangalavilas #salem #nonvegetarian

mangala vilas, salem, kongunadu cuisine, non vegetarian restaurant, tamil cuisine, naatu kozhi roast, vanjaram fry, kothu parotta, mutton chukka, eating out in salem, salem food trail, tamil nadu, must try restaurant, salem food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv

A restaurant that has been in existence since 1958, Mangala Vilas in Salem is known for its entirely non-vegetarian menu that features homestyle dishes made using spice blends ground fresh every day. 

In this throwback episode, we visit their relatively newer, 15-year-old outlet of Mangala Vilas on New Bus Stand Road Salem to savour a hardcore robustly flavoured non-vegetarian feast! 

Before getting to the table, we step inside the kitchen to watch the making of the signature Mangala masala that is used in the making of every dish on the restaurant‚Äôs menu. And taste 12 of the most popular dishes here  - Kothu Parotta, Vanjaram Fry, Naatu Kozhi Leg Roast, Mutton Pepper Fry and more!

Title: Tasting The Mumbai PAV BHAJI At SHIV SAGAR Bengaluru! Throwback
Description:
#shivsagar #pavbhaji #bangalore

shiv sagar, mumbai pav bhaji, bengaluru, pav bhaji making, vegetarian restaurant, eating out in bangalore, bengaluru food trail, vegetarian, popular restaurant

A dish that finds its origins in leftover vegetables tossed by street vendors into an inexpensive but tasty mash and served with local bakery bread as cheap sustenance to Bombay‚Äôs mill workers at the turn of the last century, the pav bhaji evolved to its buttery, cheesy, somewhat indulgent avatar courtesy savvy restaurateurs in the seventies and eighties. My memories of a Mumbai pav bhaji go back to Shiv Sagar, Juhu and Vile Parle, a hop and a skip away from college, where I relished many a plate. So when a craving for the Mumbai style pav bhaji hit me one cold evening, I found my way to the Bengaluru outpost of Shiv Sagar, where brothers Ram and Shyam, second generation restaurateurs trained in the Mumbai restaurant, dish up this quintessential Mumbai fast food that is quite close to the real deal. 

Hope you enjoy this throwback episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

Title: Massive 18-DISH SEAFOOD LUNCH In Kerala! Samudra Sadhya At HOTEL AMBIKA, Calicut | Throwback
Description:
#seafoodsadya #ambikahotel #calicut

ambika hotel, kozhikode, seafood feast, seafood sadya, best seafood offering, calicut food tour, must try restaurant in calicut, kozhikode best restaurants, kerala, eating out in kozhikode, calicut food tour

If you love your seafood, Ambhika Hotel in Kozhikode is where you have to be for their legendary seafood sadhya that serves up over 18 varieties on a banana leaf. From pickles to chutneys to porichatu, peera, avial, pulisherry, aviyal, curries, kappa to even the sambar and rasam, every sadhya staple is made in a seafood version! Kingfish, prawns, crabs, squid, sardines, pomfret, mussels, silverfish‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs every conceivable marine form on offer on the banana leaf.

In this throwback episode, I savoured their super sumptuous lunch and also indulged in a couple of their legendary fish fries.

Title: Famous AHMEDIA VANIYAMBADI BIRYANI New 250-seat Restaurant On Bengaluru Chennai Highway! Must-Try!
Description:
ahmedia restaurant, nh 48, highway, ahmedia hotel, vaniyambadi, best mutton biryani, chicken biryani, mutton nalli soup, paya, mutton dishes, vaniyambadi cuisine, mutton bheja fry, brain pepper fry, kaleji fry, gurda fry, liver, kidney pepper fry, parotta, mutton kheema, highway restaurant, highway stop, bengaluru chennai highway, best non vegetarian restaurant on highway, vaniyambadi biryani, ahmedia hotel, must try restaurant, tamil nadu food tour, eating out in vaniyambadi, eateries in vaniyambadi, support local
 
47 years ago, Janab Ahmed Basha Sahib set up a modest eatery in Vaniyambadi, a town in Tirupattur district of Tamil Nadu, famous for its leather industry. The fare at Ahmedia Hotel was mostly Mughlai,  inspired by the culinary traditions of erstwhile North Arcot principality. Over decades the kitchens here have perfected time-honored recipes, amongst them a wood-fire-cooked biryani that, unusual for Tamil Nadu, favours the basmati over seeraga samba rice. I discovered Ahmedia three years ago on a #gourmetontheroad tour through the region when I met the founder and his enterprising sons. Janab Ahmed Basha has passed on since, but his sons seem determined to build on their father‚Äôs legacy. And have now opened a massive 25,000 sq. ft., 250-seat Ahmedia branch on the Bengaluru Chennai highway with the conveniences required to cater to travellers. I visited them on a recent trip to Chennai, where I tasted most of my favourite dishes here, including the biryani that has put Vaniyambadi on the culinary map.

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: South India‚Äôs Biggest Sweets & Snacks Factory! ADYAR ANANDA BHAVAN | A2B Pure Ghee Sweets Making Pt1
Description:
#adyaranandabhavan #a2b #sweetsfactorytour

adyar ananda bhavan, a2b, south india‚Äôs largest restaurant and sweets chain, family run, adyar ananda bhavan factory tour, a2b food factory tour, 100% vegetarian, pure ghee sweets, snacks, kaju katli, kaju katli making, dodda burfi, jangiri, jangiri making, mysore pak, mysore pak making, chennai, bengaluru, tamil nadu, karnataka, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

I recently received an invitation that compelled me to drive 350 kilometres to visit the Adyar Ananda Bhavan Sweets & Snacks Factory in Ambattur, Chennai. A2B, as the group is popularly known, is now perhaps South India‚Äôs most recognised restaurant, sweets and snacks brand, with over 150 outlets across Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and overseas, however its origins are rather humble and trace an agricultural family‚Äôs inspiring 60-year journey through Rajapalyam, Bengaluru, Chennai and beyond. As I learnt from the second and third generation of the Adyar Ananda Bhavan family when I visited their facility that can produce over 40,000 kilos of savouries and 10,000 kilos of sweets evry single day! 

What is heartening though is the family‚Äôs commitment to sourcing quality ingredients, even making their own ghee to ensure 100% purity, and fostering an environment where the skill and craft involved in making artisanal handmade sweets is also encouraged alongside automated production lines to meet the burgeoning demand for their sweets and savouries. I hope you enjoy the first part of this very special episode this Deepavali weekend.

Happy Diwali! Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

In this special episode, we pay a culinary tribute to Karnataka Ratna, Power Star, Dr. Puneeth Rajkumar in a conversation with his nephew and actor, Vinay Rajkumar, and popular Kannada anchor, Anushree, at the late actor‚Äôs favourite restaurant in Bengaluru, Navayuga. Title: Nearly 100 Years, UDUPI SRI KRISHNA BHAVAN Is Bengaluru‚Äôs Best Kept Secret! Sagu Dosae, Best Sambar
Description:
#udupisrikrishnabhavan #balepete #bangalore

pure vegetarian restaurant, oldest restaurant, bengaluru, south canara cuisine, sambar, rava idli, vada, vade, sagu dosae, masala dosa, south indian tiffin, dumrot, badam halwa, gulab jamun, filter coffee, popular bengaluru restaurants, balepet, chickpet, must try restaurant, historical restaurant, heritage eatery, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, vegetarian, eateries in bangalore, support local

Although established at its present location in 1926, its culinary provenance dates back to the early 1900s. One of Bengaluru‚Äôs oldest eateries, Udupi Sri Krishna Bhavan has not received the kind of recognition other eateries of its ilk have perhaps due to its location amidst the hustle and bustle of Balepete. The food here is prepared the old-fashioned way, not the sort that swims in rivers of ghee or is buried under mounds of butter, khoa, or other such dairy decadence. Which is good, especially if you want to indulge, sans any guilt, in its tasty South Canara fare, like many of its regular patrons, some who have been visiting for 50 years! I soak in some charming old-world vibe as I make a tasty meal of some of their must-try dishes including a scrumptious, very popular sagu dosae and perhaps the most impressionable sambar you will find in this city. A sambar that we also watched the making of. 
Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This AMMA Began A Street Food Pizza Van To Survive Lockdown! AMMA‚ÄôS ITALIAN PIZZAs With Spicy Punch!
Description:
#streetfood #bengaluru #pizza 

amma‚Äôs italian pizza, vegetarian, flavourful pizzas, spicy, koramangala, bengaluru, south bengaluru, delicious pizzas, margherita pizza, karnataka pizza, fresh pizzas, bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, roadside eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

When Mrs. Padma and her husband, Prakash mulled the idea of a new street food enterprise in the throes of the pandemic to stay afloat, they thought it would be unique to introduce the pizza but in a flavourful avatar that would resonate the punchy flavours that people expect in street fare. And thus was born Amma‚Äôs Italian Pizza, first on a cart and now a van. Padma Amma experimented with vegetarian topping combinations for days on end at her home, also sharpening her secret recipe for a piquant pizza sauce, a sprightly medley of herbs, spices, sour, sweet and heat. From a spiced-up Margherita to a Karnataka pizza that basically incorporates almost every ingredient she has available, Amma‚Äôs pizzas are slowly but surely gaining favour with the locals of Koramangala, South Bengaluru for her hygienic approach to using fresh quality ingredients and creating flavours of the sort that appeal to most mainstream palates. The name may say ‚ÄòItalian‚Äô, but these are the sort of pizzas that resonate the ‚Äòkadak‚Äô, street vibes of namma ooru, Bengaluru.

Title: Found This Hidden 36-Year-Old Village Style Eatery! RAJANNA MILITARY HOTEL, Best Mutton Kaima, Kurma
Description:
#rajannaamilitaryhotel #villagefood #bangalore

rajanna military hotel, magadi road, vijayanagar, village style eatery, naati oota, kaima unde, mutton mince balls, mutton kurma, sambar, boti, west bengaluru, bangalore, west bangalore, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, support local, support small business

After picking up recipes from a stint in a Maratha military hotel kitchen in Bengaluru, Rajanna, a native of Kunigal, began serving non vegetarian meals in a small shed off Magadi Road in Vijayanagar 36 years ago. The menu comprised only nine items, mostly mutton, cooked by Rajanna himself with a single masala that would be ground by him at home. He passed on shortly after, but his wife and brother in law have continued his work over decades, preserving the flavour and character of the food. From a shed, it is now a tiny eatery, sans any name board, where customers queue up for rustic, village style fare served on banana leaves off granite slabs that serve as benches and tables. A recent addition also includes a basic but functional family room. I caught up with my chef friend, Sushil Dwarkanath to explore the cooking here and also make a tasty meal of their mutton delicacies. If you love meaty, rustic flavours, this is the place to savour it. 

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

10/10

Title: Left WIth No Jobs This Couple Began An All-Women REDDY MANE BIRYANI To Serve Food At Honest Prices!
Description:
#reddymanebiryanirestaurant #biryani #bangalore

reddy mane biryani, non vegetarian food, small business, homely biryani, biryani, chicken biryani, mutton biryani, chicken kebab, karivepaku chicken, mutton kaima vade, mutton kaima gojju, mutton fry, vidyaranyapura, north bengaluru, bangalore, north bangalore, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, support local, support small business

When Gautham Reddy, a DJ, and his wife, Christine, a pastry chef, suddenly found themselves out of work due to the pandemic, they put together their savings into a culinary enterprise, a caf√©, that met with limited success. Lesson learnt, they turned next to a home delivery business focused on non vegetarian fare derived from family recipes. Orders followed, giving them the confidence to set up a tiny eatery in the suburb of Vidyaranyapura. Things have been slow though, and when they reached out to us to help spread the word, we stepped in for a surprise visit one Wednesday afternoon. Manned by an all-women team, the fare here is the sort that is homely, tasty and most importantly, honestly priced. We tasted around 10 dishes, the sort that would happily feed a hungry party of four, and worked up a bill of just over Rs. 1200. I hope you have the heart to support enterprises like these that are committed to honest work, and trying to do their best to stay afloat in these trying times.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Tiny, Hidden 30-Year-Old PUNJABI PURE VEG Serves Honestly Priced Amritsari Khaana In Bengaluru!
Description:
#punjabifood #chickpet #bangalore

punjabi pure veg restaurant, chickept, balepet, bengaluru, amritsari cuisine, vegetarian punjabi food in bengaluru, bangalore, dal makhani, yellow dal, paneer patiala, bhindi subzi, amritsari naan, laccha paratha, tandoori kheer, gulab jamun, south bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, vegetarian, eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

Over 30 years ago, Dinesh Sood and his brother Deepak Sood, originally from Ludhiana, set up a tiny four-table eatery in the old market area of Balepet, Bengaluru to serve North Indian khaana to traders and travellers who would visit the area. Gaining popularity over time, Punjabi Pure Veg moved to a slightly larger first floor nook eventually, where it still stands 28 years on. The ambience, service and the decor is rather basic, but it is the rustic flavours of the food dished out by second generation owner, Aman Sood and his motley retinue of cooks that seems to hold sway over regular patrons. Also, the fact that the fare is delightfully cheap further adds to its draw. Hope you enjoy this one, visit here only for the food, nothing else.

Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

christ university, bangalore, student restaurant, young chefs, lady chefs, mudaliar cuisine, naidu cuisine, uttar pradesh cuisine, student cooking, young chefs, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru

I was recently invited to a delicious initiative spearheaded by the Department of Hotel Management at Christ University, Bengaluru, where students operate an Indian restaurant every Friday. I went in expecting, well, the sort of meal that would be cooked by chefs in learning, but was simply blown away by the depth and sheer variety of traditional dishes that these young students had prepared from scratch to their mother‚Äôs recipes. If this is what our upcoming chefs are capable of, surely, our culinary traditions are in good hands. 
If you manage to get in on this rather limited-seats experience, certainly something to check out. Hope you enjoy this special episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: They Lost Their Shop But Not Hope! Let‚Äôs Help Them Rebuild. EGG FACTOR Gourmet Omelettes, Bengaluru
Description:
#eggfactoromelets #streetfood #bangalore

egg factor, gourmet omelets, omelette, hsr layout, south bengaluru, delicious omelets, eggs, cheese omelet, vegetarian omelet, mutton kheema omelet, chicken omelet, tiger prawn omelet,  north bangalore, street food, bangalore food tour, eating out in bengaluru, roadside eateries in bangalore, support local, support small business

A couple of years ago, I had visited Kumar, a trained chef, who had turned his passion for omelets into an interesting enterprise, Egg Factor, where he would dish up gourmet ‚Äòeggy‚Äô creations out of a tiny stall in HSR Layout, South Bengaluru. Soon after the video was released, customers turned up in plenty to support him and it looked like nothing could go wrong. Until he arrived one morning to find his streetside eatery demolished without notice, and to make matters worse, the pandemic followed soon after. Today, Kumar and his wife, Rajalakshmi are once again trying to rebuild their lives and their small omelet  business with a borrowed push cart that is parked outside a supportive store. Hope you enjoy this episode. Do try your best to support fledgling businesses like this that are going through tough times. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Note: each omelet is made of four eggs and can easily serve two, or perhaps even three people with modest appetites. Please keep this in mind when considering prices here.

Title: Found This Small Eatery In This Farmer Couple‚Äôs Home! HOTEL KARAVALI FISH LAND, Mudigere
Description:
#seafoodrestaurant #mudigere #karavalifishland

karavali fish land, home eatery, homely seafood, mudigere, spice town, ganganamakki, mudigere, hassan charmadi highway, seafood lunch, traditional fish curry, fish fry, crab ghee roast, kande fry, kodai fry, disco fish fry, pullimunchi, mangalorean cuisine, food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

We stumbled into this tiny home eatery in Mudigere run by a young couple, Ravi and Vidya Pujari who began this to supplement their marginal coffee growing income. The food is Mangalorean, revolving around seafood that is procured fresh. We landed on the second Saturday of a month, a day when they supposedly don‚Äôt have too many customers and therefore do not procure a large variety of seafood. But what we tasted was the sort that was satisfying enough. The fries may have been slightly overdone, but was tasty nonetheless and the curries the sort that hit the spot along with a pleasing crab ghee roast. What‚Äôs nice overall is the warming hospitality with which the couple serve you in their modest eatery. Definitely a lunch spot to try should you be in and around Mudigere in Karnataka. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Having worked in Mumbai to learn the quintessential Mumbai street food, vada pav and pav bhaji, Lakshminarayan moved back to Bengaluru to set up a small eatery, Sri Ganesha Bombay Vada Pav Stores 15 years ago. Located on a busy street in Seshadripuram, North Bengaluru, this store seems to have built a tasty reputation for itself over the years catering to the neighbourhood's pandering for Mumbai style street food. I drop into this eatery to taste the vada pav, a kutchi dabeli, samosa, and the erstwhile Mumbai mill worker staple, pav bhaji. Hope you enjoy this street food episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!
