Although only six years old, this tiny dosae angadi is creating waves in Malleswaram for its take on the Davanagere benne dosae, smeared with a spicy red chutney to accommodate Bengaluru‚Äôs penchant for a piquant punch. My good friend, Jimmy Amrolia, and I visit here for an early Friday lunch, where we make quick work of a buttery, crackling crisp, benne masala dosae followed by an open pudi dosae. We wash it down with a cup of Hunkal Heights filter coffee at a kiosk a few meters away from Malleshwaram Dose Corner. Hope you enjoy this dosae outing; take care, stay safe and strong. Title: Samosa Chaat At Sudha Chaats, Bengaluru #shorts #streetfood #bengaluru #samosa #chaat #foodloverstv
Description:
Originally from Satna in Madhya Pradesh and raised in Bengaluru, Jawahar Lal always dreamt of being an entrepreneur when he worked as a North Indian cook in eateries in Bengaluru. A friend pointed him to a tiny shop on Berlie Street in Langford Town, and thus began Sudha Chaats, named after his wife, 39 years ago, to introduce Bengaluru to the joys of khasta (crisp) samosas and kachoris. Watch the complete video at https://youtu.be/hHSRNZOysyI

Title: Brittos Baga Beach Goa #shorts #goa #goafoodtrail #brittosbaga  #stuffedcrab #beach #beachshack

Title: BRITTOS Baga, Calangute, North Goa‚Äôs Most Popular Beach Restaurant | Chicken Cafreal, Stuffed Crabs
Description:
#brittosrestaurant #goa #baga

britto‚Äôs baga beach, calangute, goa, beach restaurant, brittos restaurant goa, eating out in goa, chicken cafreal, stuffed crab, non vegetarian cuisine, goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local

It has been over 15 years since I last visited Brittos. A lot has changed in and around this 57-year-eatery since. North Goa, Baga has become perhaps the busiest part of Goa, its streets chock a block with people and the resulting din and bustle all times of day or night. And it was only inevitable that some of this would find its way into Brittos too, I discovered when I visited here early one evening. Whilst a lot has changed, what hasn‚Äôt changed is this beach restaurant‚Äôs ability to attract travellers for its chilled out vibe. As for the food, it is the sort that complements the atmosphere here. Hope you enjoy this last episode in the Goa series. Take care; stay safe and strong.

Title: Delicious BENGALI Macher Rani, HILSA Lunch! Ilish Bhaja, Bhapa, Paturi, Jhol! ESPLANADE Bengaluru
Description:
#esplanaderestaurant #bengalicuisine #bangalore

esplanade restaurant, bengali food, indiranagar, ilish, hilsa fish, hilsa festival, ilish mach bhaja, ilish paturi, kumro beguner ilish jhol, pumkin eggplant hilsa curry, bhappa ilish, steamed ilish fish, aam achari ilish jhol, seafood, river fish, bengali restaurant, bengaluru, bangalore food tour, restaurants in bangalore

Known as the macher rani, or the queen of fish, the hilsa, or ilish, is a prized monsoon delicacy for Bengalis. And when I learnt from Chef Subhankar Dhar about a hilsa festival underway at his restaurant, Esplanade, with prized specimens of the fish caught in the Padma river of Bangladesh, which incidentally is where most of the fish originate, I wasted no time in meeting him. We caught up over a delicious repast of hilsa dishes, an insightful introduction to this prized fish, and a showcase of Bengali cuisine‚Äôs delightful nuances. Hope you enjoy this episode as much as I did. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Description:
#sandeeprossomelette #goa #streetfood

sandeep ross omelette, panjim, goa, ros omelet, street food, chicken liver fry, xacuti masala, chicken xacuti, traditional goan food, sandeep ros omelet, sandeep ross omelette panjim, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local, support small business

Sandeep Bhosle had to give up his gaddo (cart) a couple of years ago and move to a tiny stall on Dr Atmaram Borkar road in Panjim. But that hasn‚Äôt diminished the popularity of his ros omelet in any manner whatsoever. When the lights in his shop come on, the street food scene here comes alive. Dining off tables and stools arranged on the sidewalk, Sandeep‚Äôs clientele is a democratic mix of Goa, from the elite to the daily wage earners, for whom a plate of his xacuti gravy laden egg dish is bliss and the sort that Sandeep says,  ‚Äúguarantees a good night's sleep.‚Äù Hope you enjoy this street food episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Tasting A Unique Mutton Pulav At SG Rao‚Äôs Military Hotel, Bengaluru! Soup, Kheema, Chicken Udaygiri
Description:
#sgraosmilitaryhotel #bangalore #muttonpulav

sg rao‚Äôs military hotel, cottonpet, family run eatery, military hotel, naati cuisine, local cuisine,  biryani, pulaos, palav, mutton pulav, chicken pulav, chicken udaygiri, chicken kebab, kabab, kaal soup, trotters, mutton kheema, khaima, pepper chicken, chicken fry, sg rao military hotel bangalore, sg rao military hotel food lovers, bengaluru, bangalore food tour, support local, support small business

Eshwar Rao entered the kitchen of a generations-old military hotel when he was barely into his teens. It was here that he learnt age-old Karnataka-Maratha recipes from his mentor, Rukmini Bai over decades of diligent labor, that he now serves up in his rustic eatery, S G Rao‚Äôs Military Hotel in Cottonpet, Bengaluru. I met this entrepreneur, now in his forties, and caught the making of a unique military style pulav, in addition to a tasting of some of the other must-haves here. The pulav here is cooked only with the gravy of the meat, the meat that is then layered under the rice just before serving. And interestingly, the chicken pulav too is cooked in any mutton gravy that may be available! Hope you enjoy this tasty episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Great Value, Tasty, Hygienic North Indian Meal For Rs. 95 Only! AROGYA AHAARA, Bengaluru
Description:
#arogyaahaara #vegetarian #bangalore

popular vegetarian eatery, low-priced, nutritious and tasty south indian meals, vegetarian lunch, vegetarian thali, north indian, roti, kulcha, dal, kadai paneer, lassi, ladoo, arogya ahaara, arogya ahaara hsr layout, hsr layout, south bengaluru, bangalore, bengaluru

In this episode, I revisit Arogya Ahaara, an eatery that has caught the fancy of South Bengaluru‚Äôs denizens for its simple, straightforward philosophy of serving high quality, tasty nourishing fare at prices that do not pinch one‚Äôs pocket in the least. As a result, people throng here all times of the day, be it for breakfast, lunch, evening tiffin for dinner. This time around, I tasted their ‚Äòdumdaar‚Äô North Indian meal, priced at only Rs. 95 and the sort that provides tasty, well balanced sustenance and notably without sitting heavy on the stomach and lulling diners into a state of slumber. Though limited in its price, the meal packs plenty, a nourishing lentil preparation, paneer curry, choice of breads, palav, freshly cut salads, raitha, a lassi and even a dessert in the form of a modestly-sized motichoor ladoo. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Rs. 95
8/10

This 40-year-old eatery‚Äôs unkempt, garage shed sort of appearance, in sharp contrast to the well-kept decor of restaurants on the Goa tourist trail, may leave the first time visitor a bit perplexed, but I was told that when it comes to the local‚Äôs preferred haunt for fresh seafood, Sharada Bar & Restaurant, now named Gopal Bar after the owner‚Äôs demise a year ago, stands tall. And so I discovered during my visit here, incidentally I was the only tourist on the premises, over a delicious lunch of drumstick prawn curry, clams, mussels, oysters and chonak masala fry. The sort of soulful fare that helps one get past the rustic vibe of the place. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Tucked away in the village of Savoi, a pleasant 50 minute drive from Panjim,  sits a 200-year-old organic plantation where the 6th and 7th generation of the Shetye family welcome guests to an enlightening walk around their lush 19-hectare property followed by a lavish Saraswat meal cooked by the ladies of the house. If you‚Äôre looking to explore the rustic side of Goa far removed from the beachside shacks and bars, a visit to Savoi Plantation, Ponda is highly recommended. Title: Tasted This Delicious GHEE ROAST Village IDLI! GANGADHAR Kesaramadu IDLI HOTEL, Tumkur
Description:
#kesaramaduroastidli #thatteidli #tumkur 

kesaramadu tumkur idli hotel, gangadhar idli hotel kesaramadu, tumkur, ghee roast idli, thatte idli, mini masala dosae,  tumkur kesarmadu hotel, kesaramadu roasted idli, kyathasandra, bangalore highway, nh 48, highway restaurant, bengaluru davanagere highway, idli, vegetarian, village breakfast, breakfast, snack, karnataka, support local, support small business

Gangadhar, real name Krishnamurthy, is a man who wears many hats - former president of the gram panchayat, farmer and eatery owner. It is the last hat though that is relevant here. 16 years ago, he set up a makeshift shed to serve the famous Kyathasandra thatte Idli but away from the bustle of the main Tumkur highway, on a narrow village road leading to a tiny hamlet, Kesaramadu. Slowly but surely the popularity of his solitary village eatery grew for its thatte Idli, dosae and simple rustic lunch that came as a boon to the farming folks around. However, four years ago some customers recommended that he try roasting the Idli in ghee, and thus was born his, now-referred-to-as, Kesaramadu Roast Idli. Thatte idlis are steamed, cooled and then slow roasted on a dosae tawa with liberal lashings of ghee. Ten minutes later, the idlis take on a delicious, buttery crust that sends the palate into raptures brought on by molten streams of ghee. And it is this idli that seems to have put Gangadhar Idli Hotel, Kesaramadu, on the food lovers map! Hope you enjoy this rustic breakfast episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Ghee Roast Idli
Rs. 50 (usd 0.6) per idli including chutney, sagu, palya and masala vada

Title: This Lady Entrepreneur‚Äôs ZAMINDAR RESTAURANT Bengaluru Is A Hit For Andhra, Biryanis, NonVeg Combos!
Description:
#zamindarrestaurant #bangalore #biryani

zamindar restaurant, family run eatery, andhra cuisine, biryanis, pulaos, value for money, unlimited combo meals, unlimited biryanis, unlimited non veg starters, buffets, andhra kodi vepudu, chicken kebab, ulavacharu biryani, hyderabadi chicken biryani, gongura chicken biryani, mutton kheema biryani, chicken tikka, hong kong chicken, singapore chicken, spinach pappu, pootharekulu, hrbr layout, kalyan nagar, east bengaluru,  bangalore food tour, support local

Armed with an MBA, Harini wanted to get into the restaurant business with a concept that would serve tasty fare built on quality ingredients but at a price point that would not have pinched her purse as a student. Despite facing initial resistance to the idea from her father, she persisted, and finally after convincing her family for over six months, Zamindar Restaurant finally opened in HRBR Layout, East Bengaluru, with a menu repertoire that paid homage to her Andhra roots, biryanis, and spanning other cuisine influences to cater to Bengaluru‚Äôs cosmopolitan diners. In a relatively short span of under four years, her restaurant has carved out a significant niche for itself with its offerings that are built around the promise of ‚Äútasty fare at prices that offer maximum value‚Äù. I step into Zamindar for lunch, to meet her and her family who now support her enterprise unflinchingly and also taste some of the signature biryanis like the Hyderabadi biryani, ulavacharu biryani, gongura biryani, and other dishes that are a hit with customers. Hope you enjoy this sumptuous episode. Take care, stay safe and strong; happy eating!

Title: Most Delicious Homemade Goan Sausage & Breakfast At His Shop! LILY‚ÄôS FLOWER Hidden Flavours Of Goa
Description:
#lilyscafe #goansausage #goa

20-year-old caf√© in caranzalem, goa, near tonca, miramar, omelet, best goan sausage, prawn risoi, chicken pattice, tender coconut shake, chikoo shake, potato chops, pies, puffs, local breakfast, traditional goan food, goa, goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local, support small business

A trained pastry chef by profession, Kennedy Dias worked many years overseas crafting fine cakes and pastries. However, he yearned to be back home in Caranzalem, Goa. He finally returned and mustered the courage to set up a cake shop but ‚Äúpeople didn‚Äôt understand fine pastries 20 years ago‚Äù, he says. So, after a couple of unsuccessful years, he began making puffs, pies and chops, the sort of traditional fare that locals appreciate and love. And along the way experimented with a home-smoked curry-leaf infused Goan sausage, that is now a must-try here. Since then, his tiny shop has become much popular with the locals and young students for his omelets, sandwiches, burgers, pies and interesting shakes and juices. This is the sort of honest dive that one should also visit for a true taste of small town Goa, away from the tourist trail. 

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

traditional saraswat cuisine, kokni cuisine, kokni kanteen, goan cuisine, vegetarian, seafood, lunch, dinner, traditional goan food, panjim, goa, gioan thali, viswon fry, kingfish fry, bangda curry, bangda uddamethi, ambot theek, ladyfinger roce curry, theeval, alsande tonak, goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local

Located in the heart of Panjim, Kokni Kanteen seeks to introduce guests to the Kokni, or traditional Saraswat cuisine of Goa,  in a format that is friendly and comfortable. Fitting when one learns that the bungalow it is housed in dates back to Portuguese rule and served as an inn where locals would be fed when they traveled from the villages. I step in here to savour a reasonably priced viswon (kingfish) thali and an interesting array of flavourful GSB preparations, both vegetarian and non vegetarian, that are rarely found outside homes. What began as a local haunt has now evolved to a destination where visitors can help themselves to a delicious serving of Goa‚Äôs rich and varied cuisines. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Title: Must Stop Here For Famous Kadak Rotti, Enne Khara, Sappey Mutton! Hotel Nartaki Ranebennur Karnataka
Description:
#ennekhaara #ranibennur #hotelnartaki

enne khaara mutton, chicken, hotel nartaki, family run eatery, ranebennur, sappey mutton, chicken sukka, mutton chops, boti, khuska, non vegetarian eatery, north karnataka, highway eatery, karnataka food tour, north karnataka food tour, karnataka tourism, north karnataka cuisine, support local

I had heard much about this very special Ranebennur mutton preparation, the enne  khara, translating literally to oil and chilli heat, drawing from its two principal ingredients. And so on our recent drive to Goa, we planned a lunch stop in this agricultural town in North Karnataka at Hotel Nartaki, the home of this iconic dish. Established 30 years ago by N Satish, a tailor turned restaurateur, in a tiny eatery that could only accommodate a few customers at a time. His wife would help him make the masala at home that he would cook into curries. Along the way, he came up with the concept of enne khaara largely to appease the spice-hungry tastebuds of the locals. The dish, in contrast to its fiery name, is a beautiful balance of flavours between the chilli heat (from a combination of 90% local Javannur chillies that also impart a striking colour to the dish, and 10% Guntur chillies) and the oil that rounds off all the sharp edges of the masala aided by the sourness of tomatoes. Mr N Satish has since passed on but the homemade tradition continues with his sons, Chetan and Chandan, in a much larger space today, aided by their mother and wives. If you love your meaty fare, Hotel Nartaki is certainly worth a visit, I would say even a detour should you be travelling in the area. I hope you enjoy this very special episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Found Most Delicious XACUTI MASALA At This Roadside Eatery In Goa! SAI ANANT PARRA | Ros Omelet
Description:
#saianant #xacuti #rosomelet

sai anant, parra, north goa, goa, xacuti masala, chicken xacuti, ros omelet, street food, traditional goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local, support small business

I heard from a few locals that this unassuming roadside eatery on Parra Main Road, North Goa, serves a xacuti that was worth the 20 odd kilometer drive from where we were staying in Dona Paula. But when we arrived, the chicken xacuti was over as were some other popular breakfast eats like egg chops, etc.. Nonetheless, we stepped into the kitchen to check what was available and found the remnants of a xacuti gravy that owner, Mahesh Parsekar‚Äôs mother prepares at home. The roasted spice aroma of the gravy was enticing, and so when Mahesh offered to cook a ros omelet with the gravy, I knew we had to try it. The weighty omelet was elevated a few notches by the aromatic flavours of the xacuti, and I definitely look forward to returning to Sai Anant Parra someday in the hope of tasting more of the traditional home cooked fare. Hope you enjoy this short vlog on a hidden Goa gem. Happy eating; take care, stay safe and strong.

Title: Must-Try Traditional Goan Catholic Cuisine at BHATTI VILLAGE, Goa! Sorpotel, Whitebait, Serradura
Description:
#bhattivillage #goa #catholiccuisine

bhatti village, goan catholic cuisine, 25 year-old home restaurant, bhatti waddo, nerul, north goa, patrick dsouza, breadfruit, neer phanas fry, whitebait, motiyan rava fry, fish roe, recheado masala fry, sorpotel, chilli fry, non vegetarian cuisine, goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local

If you want to savour delicious Goan Catholic culinary traditions, Bhatti Village, a quaint home turned restaurant amidst the lush fields of Bhatti Waddo in Nerul, is where you need to be. Run by the D'Souza family, the food here is the sort that you would taste in a Goan home if they were blessed with an extraordinary cook. The flavours are punchy and the hospitality of the family, warming, and the sort that immerses one in the conviviality of Goa‚Äôs people. A reason why this charming home eatery has endeared itself to locals and travellers for over 25 years. In this dinner episode, I met the family and also made myself comfortable with a large meal in which almost  every dish had me licking my fingers! üòã

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Amazing Ice Cream Combinations At Old Bengaluru‚Äôs Family Run MANTAP ICE CREAM Sheshadripuram
Description:
#vegetarian #icecream #bangalore

mantap ice cream, family run ice cream parlour, oldest ice cream parlour, seshadripuram, bangalore, bengaluru, chilli guava, organic honey, fresh mango, fruit fusion, dry fruit, ice cream, rose falooda, mango falooda,  family enterprise, vegetarian ice cream parlour, mantap ice cream bengaluru, ice cream in bangalore, best ice cream in bangalore, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

An acclaimed Yakshagana artist, Prabhakara Upadhyay began Saligrama‚Äôs Mantap Ice Cream in Bengaluru in 1981 when he realized the need for a business to earn a livelihood. In those days, the denizens of (then) chilly Bangalore were hesitant to eat ice creams afraid they may fall ill, and thus began a long and arduous journey of educating people to appreciate and enjoy these frozen treats. The effort seems to have paid off over the years, making this vegetarian ice cream parlour a household name amongst old Bangaloreans. From multiple outlets, Mantap has now scaled back to only one store in Seshadripuram, where Mantapa Upadhyay, (as he is popularly known) dreams up combinations that he personally puts together each morning with dairy rich ice creams that are sourced from a premium ice cream supplier. In this conversation with him and his family, I savour a range of his delectable creations - from traditional pure organic jaggery, guava chilli, to inspirations like the fruit fusion, red velvet cake, and classics like rich mango cream and caramel, and a couple of delicious faloodas too. This store is a definite must-visit if you love ice cream.

Title: Best Goan Seafood Thali At CAF√â RITZ  Panjim! The Man Who Made Goa‚Äôs Fish Thali World Famous!
Description:
#ritzgoathali #panjim #goaseafood

most popular seafood restaurant in goa, caf√© ritz restaurant and bar, ritz classic,, ritz goa thali, ritz goa fish thali, ritz classic goa, goa seafood restaurant, best seafood restaurant in goa, popular goan seafood, local seafood, fish thali, seafood thali, fish fry, recheado masala, goan fish curry, viswon fry, tisrya sukka,  traditional goan food, panjim, goa, goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan, goan food in goa, goa food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local

46 years ago, Rohidas Desai took over an existing taverna off Eduarte Pacheco street in Panjim to set up his seafood restaurant. Fastidious about the quality of seafood, he would visit the market each day to scour for the best marine produce to be cooked to his wife, Gokula Desai‚Äôs recipes. It is no surprise then that this committed approach had earned for Ritz legions of ardent patrons who now pack the group's six restaurants for lunch and dinner. I caught up with Daad (as he is known to everyone in Goa) Desai in a meeting that was ordained by destiny over a seafood lunch at their very first eatery, Caf√© Ritz. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Seafood Thali
Rs 200 (usd 2.6) The thali is priced at Rs. 300 (usd 3.9) in the other Ritz Classic restaurants, however the quantity and variety on the thaali too may be a bit more.
9/10 (viswon fry 10/10, tisrya sukka 10/10)

Title: This Goan Bakery Is Preserving A Century Of Tradition! Best Bebinca, Risoi, Niro At MR BAKER 1922
Description:
#mrbaker1922 #bakery #goa

For the best traditional Goan desserts and scrumptious savoury treats, locals swear by Mr. Baker, a 100-year-old institution that remains steadfast to its culinary roots. I met with third generation owner, Nenette Fernandes, over a leisurely tasting of bebinca, battica, risoi, croquettes, the sort of baked wares that even her grandfather, Mr. Pedro Vincent Vaz who founded the bakery, would recognise if he were around today. I also discovered a delicious surprise in the Niro, a refreshing cashew juice that took me back to memories from my childhood. Hope you enjoy this short and mostly sweet episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Visit 102-year-old CAF√â BHONSLE, Panjim For Goan Vegetarian Breakfast & Conversations!

They say when locals in Panjim want to catch up on the goings on around town and also some delicious vegetarian fare, they head to Caf√© Bhonsle, a 102-year-old institution that has been patronized by generations of Goans. Some aver that ‚Äúsuch is the connect that ‚ÄòPanjimites‚Äô have with this eatery that they may travel the world, but when they return to Goa, their first stop is at Caf√© Bhonsle‚Äù, presumably for the comforting food - tamata bhaji, sukhi bhaji, alsanna bhaji with poori, pav, goan samosa, mirchi and much more - and also, conversation. I enjoyed my morning here, not just the food but also an interesting t√™te-√†-t√™te with its friendly patrons. Caf√© Bhonsle is a definite must-visit when you are in Panjim, and especially to get a flavour of Goan vegetarian cuisine.

Title: Gourmet On The Road Visits Goa üòéüòá! Preview Video | Food Lovers TV Goa Food Tour
Description:
#kripalamanna #goa #goafoodtour

goan food, goa food tour, street food in goa, goan saraswat cuisine, goan catholic cuisine, street food in goa, goan food in goa, goan fish thali, goa street food, goa food trail, goa, goa travel, goa food, restaurants in goa, gourmet on the road visits goa, goa tourism, kripal amanna in goa, support local

A visit to Goa is always memorable. It‚Äôs tough not to be taken in by its disarming ‚Äòsussegad‚Äô chilled-out vibe, the cheerful attitude of friendly Goans who welcome visitors with open arms, its vibrant culture and customs, and last but not the least, its food that is rich in its traditions, varied and flavourful. We stayed a week in Goa exploring its culinary fare, from meals in fabled, century-old institutions, to establishments that serve up a delightful showcase of community cuisine, Saraswat and Catholic, to uncovering some tiny unsung hole-in-the-wall joints, savoring street food and more. Stay tuned to Food Lovers TV over the next few weeks as we roll out these Goa episodes; each eatery featured a must-add to your next Goa visit. For now, here‚Äôs a preview of what‚Äôs in store. Happy eating!

Description:
#vidyarthibhavanbangalore #sihikahichandru #kripalamanna

south indian breakfast, vidyarthi bhavan bangalore, sihi kahi chandru, karnataka‚Äôs most popular food television personality, kripal amanna, vegetarian, bombat bhojana sihi kahi chandru, tiffin, thindi, masala dosae, vidyarthi bhavan masala dosa, vidyarthi bhavan masala dosae, idli vada, idli chutney, vada sambar, masala khara bath, kesari bath, poori sagu, basavanagudi, bangalore, bengaluru, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local

A couple of weeks ago, I watched a beautiful Kannada play that not only chronicled the iconic Vidyarthi Bhavan but also brought alive the emotional connect that patrons have with this institution over the decades. Amongst the brilliant characters portrayed, a pivotal performance was that of famed actor and food legend, Sihi Kahi Chandru, who gave voice to the Vidyarthi Bhavan masala dosae, the heart of a tiffin experience at the 77-year-old eatery. In the course of our conversation backstage, Chandru Sir and I quickly decided we should savour a full tiffin at Vidyarthi Bhavan soon. This isn‚Äôt your typical Gourmet On The Road episode, but it makes an attempt to capture our experience at the breakfast that followed. Hope you enjoy this one. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Title: Is This Jayanagar‚Äôs Oldest Bajji Bonda Cart? 42 Years KUNDAPURA BONDA BAJJI SHOP, Bengaluru
Description:
#streetfood #jayanagar #bangalore

popular bajji shop in jayanagar, south bangalore, vegetable, pakora, bonda, capsicum masala bajji, aloo bonda, potato, mirchi bajji, street food, jayanagar, 4th block jayanagar, jayanagar street food, bengaluru, vegetarian eatery, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Krishna Poojary migrated from his hometown in Kundapura to Bengaluru nearly half a century ago in search of a livelihood. After a string of odd jobs in eateries, he decided to try his hand at a bajji (fried fritter) gaadi (cart) in Jayanagar 4th block, Bengaluru. It‚Äôs been 42 years since; the location of his cart has changed from one street to another over the years, but the place that his fried wares occupy in the hearts and palates of his neighbourhood patrons remains constant to this day. Also perhaps making Kundapura Bonda Bajji Shop one of the area's oldest street food carts! I visited him one cloudy Bengaluru evening to taste all the bondas and bajjis he and his son have on offer. 

Hope you enjoy this episode in our ongoing initiative to support small businesses, do support your neighbourhood eateries too. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Discovered This Delicious Home Eatery Run By This Brother & Sister! KALEEL‚ÄôS KITCHEN, Mudigere
Description:
#seafoodrestaurant #mudigere #kaleelskitchen

kaleels kitchen, homely seafood restaurant, mudigere, spice town, hassan charmadi highway, seafood lunch, traditional fish curry, fish fry, prawn ghee roast, squid masala, anjal fry, bangda masala fry, mackerel fry, pullimunchi, mangalorean cuisine, food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

On my last drive through the Western ghats into Mangalore, I stopped for lunch in the spice town of Mudigere, around 80 kilometres from Hassan, at an old bungalow converted into a cosy eatery. It was here that I met an incredibly hard working brother-sister duo. Kaleel makes a 240 kilometer return trip every other night to procure fresh seafood from the fishing harbour in Mangalore, that his sister Arshia single handedly cooks to family recipes. The flavours of the homely fare here is reminiscent of what you would taste in kudla (Mangalore)  but with the sort of punchy spicing that they say ‚Äúis suited to the local palate of Mudigere‚Äù. I enjoyed my meal at Kaleel‚Äôs Kitchen, hope you relish this episode too. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Traditional Village Style Kolhapuri Misal Cooked On Wood Fire At GAVRAN MISAL, Bengaluru
Description:
#misalpav #gavranmisal #bangalore

gavran misal, hsr layout, bengaluru, south bengaluru, authentic misal pav, kolhapuri misal, vada pav, rural, maharashtrian cuisine, street food, vegetarian snacks,  gavran misal recipe, gavran misal cooking, vegetarian eatery, bengaluru, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Sujit Lakade missed Kolhapuri Misal Pav when he moved to Bengaluru a few years ago. In this he saw an opportunity to showcase to Bengaluru the village rendition of this quintessential Maharashtrian street food staple, an approach that conveys delicious, spicy flavours with minimal fuss. And so Gavran Misal was born, with ingredients sourced from Kolhapur, given his family‚Äôs lineage in the food grains business. Here, the tari, the spicy rasa (gravy) at the heart of the dish, is cooked over a wood fire, thereby also imbuing this modest eatery, with a rustic smokey appeal, where regulars wolf down the misal pav and vada pav, the only two items served here in addition to kokum and taak (buttermilk) to wash things down. 

If you‚Äôre looking to savour some authentic rural flavours, head here. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

7.5/10

Title: Tasting Andhra Meals & Famous Biryani At Iconic MAYURI JC Road Bengaluru | Must-Try Andhra Food
Description:
#mayuri #andhrameals #biryani 

popular andhra restaurant in bangalore, mayuri andhra restaurant, mayuri jc road, minerva circle, bangalore, andhra veg meals, chicken biryani, mutton biryani, andhra biryani, chilli chicken, sholay kebab, mutton kheema balls, andhra bhojanam, andhra food, lunch, mayuri hotel jc road, bengaluru, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local

When Mr Chenna Reddy migrated from his village in Andhra Pradesh just past the Karnataka border town of Mulbagal in the eighties, he sought employment as a cook in an Andhra eatery in Bengaluru. Such was his impressive hand at cooking, that some of his customers and associates pooled together a restaurant for him, and thus was born Mayuri in 1986, just off Minerva circle on JC Road. 36 years on, the eatery still reigns supreme for its Andhra fare, notably the vegetarian bhojanam and toothsome biryanis, the latter made to a unique recipe that employs minimal spices yet makes a terrific impact on the palate! In this episode, I catch up with Mr. Reddy as he walks me through his kitchen and preparations, his unbridled passion quite inspiring, before sitting down for a big Andhra meal comprising Mayuri‚Äôs most popular hits. Hope you find this slightly lengthy episode enjoyable, well, I certainly did üòâüòã. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Young Engineer Is Showcasing Traditional Tiffin In Her Darshini Startup, BRAHMIN‚ÄôS VEG CORNER
Description:
#brahminsvegcorner #padmanabhanagar #bangalore 

brahmin‚Äôs veg corner, small startup darshini, padmanabhanagar, lady entrepreneur, local thindi, tiffin eatery, vegetarian snacks,  bonda soup, curd vada, mangalore buns, idli vada sambar, chow chow bath,  avalakki bath, jaggery coffee, vegetarian eatery, bengaluru, bangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

An engineer by profession, Apeksha was always interested in the food business. Backed by her husband and a friend, she took the plunge a few months ago in setting up a tiny eatery in Padmanabhanagar, South Bengaluru, where the vegetarian menu is a mix of local favourites and snack items from Dakshina Kannada. Having received a few recommendations from their patrons in the neighbourhood, I ventured out one evening to meet this young, confident entrepreneur and support her fledgling enterprise, in doing so, I taste a satisfying tiffin of idli vade served with a rather impressionable sambar, a subtly-flavoured Mangalore bun, nourishing bonda soup and some more, before rounding off my meal with an organic jaggery coffee. Hope you enjoy this episode; please do support small businesses in your neighbourhood. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Taste These Old World, Rare Breakfast Dishes at SRI RAM BHAVAN, Ayodhya Hotel, Mangalore
Description:
#srirambhavan #ayodhyahotel #mangalore 

sri ram bhavan restaurant, vegetarian, ayodhya  hotel mangalore, popular vegetarian restaurant, mangalore, south canara, dakshina kannada, patholi, patrode, thekrey idli, sanna polo, goli baje, neyyappam, biscuit roti, jackfruit roast, jackfruit halwa, jaggery jilebi, coconut barfi, coffee, 70 year old restaurant, mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local

Stepping into Sri Ram Bhavan at Ayodhya Hotel is akin to stepping back in time. Not just in terms of its decor but the dishes that are served here, many which are found rarely now, and that too mostly in homes that have managed to hold on to their culinary traditions. I drop in for breakfast and and make a big breakfast of many delicacies that I hadn‚Äôt tasted hitherto - like the patholi, a stuffed rice and jackfruit pancake steamed in banana leaf, thekre idli, an unusual steamed rice dumpling made with cucumber, a raw jackfruit roast, patrode, spiced and steamed colocasia leaves, and lots more. If you want to savour an old-fashioned South Canara breakfast, more specifically a GSB meal, this is the place to visit when in Mangalore. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Must-Try Egg Snacks, Fresh Fruits & Juices At SHRI MAHALASA‚Äôs APPU SHET SHOP | Mangalore Street Food
Description:
#appushet #streetfood #mangalore

appu shet mangalore, sri mahalasa appu shet angadi, mangalore, popular egg stumbler, egg roll, bonda lime, fresh fruit, fruit juices, mangalore, south canara, 90 year old shop, mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Dating back to 1932, Sri Mahalasa Appu Shet Shop diversified into cooking egg based dishes around three decades ago. Creations like egg stumbler, a spicy assemblage of scrambled eggs, seasoned and toasted bread dices, a moist egg roll, among others have since made it a delicious habit for the denizens of Mangalore. And what better way to cool off, both from the weather, and spicy heat, than with some seasonal fruit juices and refreshing concoctions. I visited this store, now run by the third and fourth generation of the Shet family, one warm evening to make a big meal of a couple of egg snacks, a few fruit juices and a platter of fresh fruit. Appu Shet angadi certainly merits a visit when in this port city. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Enroute to Udupi, I spotted this old house on the highway in Padubidri, 30 kilometres from Mangalore, with a large signboard that announced its seafood credentials. Curious, I stopped by to discover an old 100-year-old- home with ancient doorways, elegant rosewood pillars and massive wooden beans, and in stark contrast, a rustic eatery manned by local cooks on the premises. The mostly seafood fare is fresh and the sort that makes for a tasty South Canara meal. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Help Rescue This Brave Lady‚Äôs Food Truck! HALLI MANE ROTTIS Mangalore, Delicious Malenadu Cuisine!
Description:
#hallimanerotti #foodtruck #mangalore

halli mane rottis, food truck, mangalore, lady entrepreneur, shilpa, halli mane rotti shilpa, malenadu cuisine, manguluru, south canara, akki rotti, chicken green curry, palav, leg piece, halli mane rotti mangalore, mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

During my very first Gourmet On The Road season over a couple of years ago, I visited this brave lady entrepreneur‚Äôs food truck, Halli Mane Rottis in Mangalore. Emerging through tough circumstances, her delicious Malenadu fare was winning hearts and palates in kudla and she seemed to be doing well, also winning numerous accolades for her grit and determination. However things are far from good for Shilpa and her family currently, I discovered when I chanced upon the food truck on my last visit to the city. I learnt that the family was going through a time due to the pandemic and also that Shilpa was largely confined to her home due to a serious back problem. She cooks what she can at home aided by her brother who then sells the food out of the truck with her father. Whilst their economic situation may be dire, the food that they dish out is still as delicious as before, I relished a toothsome green chicken curry, a spicy leg piece with soft akki rotti.

I hope you find it in your heart to support enterprises like Halli Mane Rottis. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Chicken green curry
8/10

Leg Piece
9/10

I paid under Rs. 200 for my meal here.

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,

Title: Must Stop Here For Menthe Dosae, Bassaru, Shavige‚Ä¶ HOTEL LATHA VEG Kota | 60 Years,Honestly Priced!
Description:
#lathaveg #kota #breakfast

hotel latha kota, popular vegetarian restaurant, kota, kundapur, south canara, mangalore kundapur highway, menthe dosae, dosa, shavige, ragi mudde, bassaru, moode, kote kadubu, goli baje, kesari bath, sana polo, coffee, 60 year old restaurant, latha veg, latha veg kota,mangalore food trail, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Mr Balakrishna Prabhu and his wife, Sarojini began a tiny eatery in Kota, 60 years ago, then a little village enroute to Kundapur. Slowly but surely, the reputation of their tasty South Canara vegetarian fare cooked to family recipes grew not just with the support of locals, but travellers too for whom a visit to Hotel Latha was de rigueur after darshan at the famous Shri Amrutheshwari temple, located nearby. And served at prices that most would say are downright cheap in current context. Today the second and third generation father and son duo of Venkatesh and Rajesh Prabu tend to this eatery‚Äôs affairs, overlooked by the matriarch of the house, Mrs. Prabhu. I stop by for a delicious breakfast spread of menthe dosae, ragi mudde, basaaru, shavige, moode and more. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Title: Iconic 70-Year KALLADKA TEA Hotel Was Demolished But Rebuilt In 2 Months! KT Hotel Lakshmi Nivas
Description:
#kthotel #kalladka #mangalore

lakshmi nivas, kt hotel, popular tea and coffee shop, highway stop, 70 year old tea shop in kalladka, bantwal district, mangalore, kt, k tea, kalladka tea, rim jhim coffee, rimjhim coffee, best tea in mangalore, mangalore tea, mangalore food trail, karnataka, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

When their 70-year-old eatery, Hotel Lakshmi Nivas, popularly known as KT Hotel, in Kalladka was demolished to make way for a flyover construction, Shivaram Holla and his wife, Mamatha resolved to bounce back as quickly as they could. Determined to hold on to the legacy left behind by their forefathers, during this difficult time, they gathered every bit of the rubble of the old structure and poured it into the foundation of their new building that has emerged just a few steps behind the original location. And they managed to do this in just under two months! I was amazed at their incredible determination to fiercely protect the Kalladka Tea and Rimjhim Coffee  tradition that has quite literally put this town, 30 kilometers outside Mangalore on the food lovers map. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: She Serves 1500 Idlis Everyday! Must-Try MAMU IDLI HOTEL Hassan | Soft Idlis & Most Spicy Chutney!
Description:
#mamuidlihassan #breakfast #idlichutney

mamu idli hotel hassan, mamu idli hotel, 36 year old idli shop in hassan, mamu idli hassan, karnataka, spicy chutney, idlis, hyderabad dosa, dosae, breakfast stop in hassan, idli chutney, hassan food trail, karnataka, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

Mrs Prema continues in the legacy of her father, Mr Venkateshwara, who began a tiny idli hut in a bylane of Hassan adjoining the main market area. Over time the eatery moved to a tiny shop down the road, but its main offering, the idli continues to be a crowd pleaser, even 36 years on! Over 1500 of these are steamed each morning, to a unique batter that incorporates kusubalakki, urad dal and sabakki, sago pearls, in equal proportion; the Idlis are soft and sponge-like in texture to drink up the ghee that is drizzled over. It is served with a unique onion palya that is only tempered with salt and turmeric, and a fiery red chilli chutney made of peanuts, red chillies, cumin and garlic. The decor here is nothing to speak of, just some benches strewn around a tiny shed, but it doesn't seem to deter its patrons from lining up in queues to savour piping hot idlis for only the four or five hours they are open for business every morning.

Idli
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) for 4 idlis with chutney, palya and ghee 
9/10

Hyderabad Dosa
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
7/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/xSH7gqxd1ywLjpiB7

Note: It is a tiny shop with benches strewn around for communal seating and can get crowded on most days.

Title: This Famous VASU HOTEL Masala Dosa Has A 80-Year History! Most Reasonably Priced Tiffin Stop
Description:
#vasuhotel #masaladosa #kanakapura

popular masala dosae restaurant in kanakapura, karnataka, highway stop, vasu hotel kanakapura, dosae, makhmal puri, boondi ladoo, gulab jamun, filter coffee, road trip, motorcycling, 50 kilometres from bangalore, bengaluru, breakfast, tiffin, traditional, kanakapura, karnataka, karnataka food tour, support local

In 1969, P. Ramachandra Upadhyay, then barely in his teens, migrated from Saligrama, Udupi district, to Kanakapura to work in Vasu Hotel, an eatery famous even then for its masala dosae. This form of the dosae though was a foreign concept to Ramachandra, who coincidentally came from a small village called Parampalli, where the khali dosa was prepared as an offering to Lord Maha Vishnu. Notwithstanding his lack of knowledge, the young lad worked hard in the kitchen and in a span of 14 years was handed ownership of the Vasu Hotel by the then owners who wished to retire. Nearly 50 years on, this no-frills eatery located 50 kilometers from Bengaluru still reigns supreme, not just for its sumptuous masala dosae and other old-fashioned tiffin and sweet treats, but also for its honest approach to pricing. I caught up with Mr Upadhyay and his son, Janardhan on a trip back from Mysuru.

Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

This family run eatery in Baburayanakoppal, just outside Srirangapatna on the Bengaluru - Mysuru highway, goes back sixty years, when current owner, Mr. Vidya Ganapathi Kadam‚Äôs grandmother began serving travellers on the route. Title: Best Traditional Karnataka Breakfast At KAMAT LOKARUCHI, Popular Mysuru Highway Eatery For 27 Years!
Description:
#kamatlokaruchi #ramanagara #breakfast

27 year old vegetarian eatery in ramanagara, popular mysore highway eatery, kamat lokaruchi, best traditional karnataka food, moode, neer dosae, chow chow bath, khara bath, kesari bath, breakfast, lunch, dinner, ramanagara, traditional meal, kamat lokaruchi ramanagara, kamat lokaruchi bangalore-mysore road karnataka, karnataka, karnataka food tour, support local

An eatery that began the Kamat Yatriniwas group‚Äôs foray into highway restaurants twenty seven years ago, Kamat Lokaruchi in Ramanagara serves the nourishing fare of rural Karnataka in an earthy atmosphere that seeks to connect diners to the land. Traditional staples are cooked over old fashioned stoves fuelled by wood to recreate authentic flavours of yore, the culinary philosophy employed here also shuns the use of artificial color and additives. Since they first opened doors, numerous eateries have mushroomed on the Mysuru highway, but even today, over quarter of a century later, Kamat Lokaruchi reigns supreme as one of the most popular eateries on the route. I caught up with Narayan Kamat, son of the late A. S. Kamat who established the Kamat Yatriniwas group, and also explored the kitchens and some wholesome dishes here. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Softest Thatte Idli In Temple Town At 100-Yr-Old SUBBANNA MESS, Melukote | Must-Try Breakfast
Description:
#subbannamess #breakfast #melkote

100 year old vegetarian eatery in melukote, subbanna mess melkote, temple town, mandya district, pandavapura taluk, iyengar food, iyengar cuisine, brahmin cuisine, thatte idli, gojju, puliyogare, sakkarai pongal, bela pongal, sambar, rasam, banana leaf lunch, traditional meal, subbanna mess melkote karnataka, karnataka, karnataka food tour, support local, support small business

During my lunch visit a few months ago to Subbanna Mess, a 100-year-old eatery in the temple town of Melukote in Karnataka, I happened to steal a glance at the preparation of the thatte idli batter, for breakfast the next morning. I was intrigued by the high proportion of urad dal as compared to typical idlis, and so made a mental note to return. And when we did, we were rewarded with tasting one of the softest idlis that I have ever eaten, in combination with a delicious, warming  cucumber gojju made. I also savoured their scrumptious no-onion masala dosae, again with an interesting twist, and their world-famous creations - puliyogare, bella pongal and sakkare pongal. This is a breakfast that I will gladly return to, and I hope this video makes your day too. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!


Thatte Idli 
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3) per idli 
10/10

8.5/10 (9/10 In combination with the gojju)

Title: Must-Try USMAN DRY GOBI | Mysuru‚Äôs Most Popular Street Food, 27-Years In The Making!
Description:
#usmandrygobi #mysore #streetfood

popular street food in mysuru, mysore, usman dry gobi, cauliflower fry, usman dry gobi mysore, usman dry gobi mysore recipe, vegetarian, street food, mysuru food tour, popular street food, mysore food tour, tamil nadu, gourmet on the road food tour, kripal amanna, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support local, support small business

When offered a free stall at the Mysuru Dussehra exhibition 27 years ago, Zainul Ahbideen felt he should in turn offer the city a taste of something different. And for his main ingredient, he chose the humble gobi, cauliflower, given the popularity of gobi manchurian, but in an avatar that had not been seen before. Experimenting with a spice mix he first made at home, Usman Dry Gobi emerged. It wasn't long before he moved to a street cart, and eventually a streetside stall a few years ago. Great care is taken by him and his son, Usman, to procure the right quality and size of cauliflowers, that are cleaned thoroughly and spiced with a secret masala, before being fried meticulously in a bath of hot oil. The result is the crunchiest, most flavourful dry gobi one can eat in Mysuru, and the sheer number of customers who queue up at this stall every evening stand testament to the fact that Usman‚Äôs Dry Gobi has emerged as one of this palace city‚Äôs most popular street food creations over the years. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Dry gobi
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8) per plate
10/10

Title: Meeting Famous Actor ASHISH VIDYARTHI Over Delicious Gowda Cuisine At GOWDARA MUDDE MANE, Bengaluru!

ashish vidyarthi, ashish vidyarthi latest, vlog, kripal amanna, kripal amanna vlogs, collaboration, collab, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, lunch, conversation, gowda cuisine, gowdara mudde mane, on veg paradise, meat lovers, kaal soup, mutton korma, spare parts, offal, chakna, kheema gojju, chicken fry, mutton chops, karela, leg fry, mutton lollipop, mutton palav, pulao, popular restaurants, bengaluru food tour, tamil nadu, bangalore, gourmet on the road food tour, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support local, support small business

And like they say, the universe sometimes conspires to bring people together, and that's exactly what happened. I hope you enjoy this very special collaborative episode, where I introduce Ashish Vidyarthi, a wonderful person to the rustic, meaty joys of Gowda cuisine, fittingly at an eatery named Gowdara Mudde Mane here in Namma Bengaluru.

Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Title: Must-Try Hubli Savaji Cuisine In Bengaluru At HOTEL SAVAJI‚ÄôS | Jowar Roti, Kaima Unde, Mutton Chops
Description:
#hotelsavajis #bengaluru #rajajinagar

hotel savaji‚Äôs non veg, rajajinagar, non vegetarian, khaima unde, mutton chops dry, egg curry, chicken masala, chicken chilli, mutton liver fry, savaji cuisine, hubli savaji cuisine in bengaluru, savaji food, bengaluru food tour, karnataka food tour, popular restaurants, bangalore food reviews, bangalore diaries, bangalore food trail, karnataka, gourmet on the road food tour, kripal amanna, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support local, support small business

The Savaji community, settled for centuries in Karnataka, traces its ancestry to a race of warriors, originally from Maharashtra, and therefore it only seems natural that meat, especially mutton, forms an important part of their diet. 

Hotel Savaji‚Äôs Bengaluru pays allegiance to its owner, Narasingsa Kathare‚Äôs Savaji culinary roots, when he got into this business 25 years ago owing to circumstances, unable to find a job despite possessing an engineering degree and mba. He began his eatery cooking all dishes himself, wIth recipes gleaned subconsciously having watched his grandmother cook in his ancestral home in Hubli. Therefore, not surprisingly,  the flavours are the sort that one would find in a Savaji household in North Karnataka, the food cooked in a set up that quite resembles a home kitchen, not by professional chefs, but a small team of people who moved from Hubli to join Narasingsa. I step in here for a delicious meal of a sumptuous, mutton thali with the softest kaima unde, tasty chicken masala, mutton dry fry and other dishes. If you like your meaty preparations, albeit spicy, this is certainly a place to check out Savaji cuisine in Bengaluru.

This tiny eatery isnt easy to locate, hidden on the first floor of a nondescript building in a bylane of Rajajinagar. But once you ve eaten here, the flavors are the sort that will be permanently ‚Äòlandmarked‚Äô on your palate. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

A name that stuck because of his preferred work attire, a black trouser, Mr. Rajendran‚Äôs ‚ÄòTrouser Kadai‚Äô (Kamatchi Mess) is the sort of nondescript eatery that may not beget a second look when you walk past it in Mandaveli, Chennai. However, that doesn't seem to deter its diehard fans in the least who have been flocking here for the last 45 years to savour the meaty fare that he cooks over a wood-fired stove. I visited him just before lunch hour on a Saturday to watch the making of some of the dishes, before sitting down for an enjoyable meal comprising mutton chukka, vanjaram fry, kola urundai and a scrumptious kola urundai. Hope you enjoy this episode as well; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

In this episode, I meet the affable father-daughter duo of Mr. P. Suresh and Sanjana Suresh at their flagship Sangeetha Veg restaurant in Adyar, and discover an interesting legacy and industrious work ethic that has over the years sought to embrace various Indian culinary influences and traditions to create an unique identity for the food that is served here, that I savour in a delicious breakfast of elai adai, chikkoo kesari, ven pongal, kasi halwa, rava dosai and some more. Title: This Legendary MAKKAN PEDA Sweet Goes Back 190 Years! ARCOT CHETTIYAR SWEET STALL, Near Vellore
Description:
#makkanpeda #chettiyarsweetstall #arcot

arcot chettiyar sweet shop, arcot chettiyar mittai kada, arcot, vellore, must-try sweet, makkan peda, mitai, sweetmeat, traditional mithai, chennai highway, tamil nadu food tour, popular restaurants, highway eateries, chennai food tour, tamil nadu, gourmet on the road food tour, kripal amanna, gourmet on the road, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food, support small business, support local

When in Arcot, Northeastern Tamil Nadu, those in the know make a beeline for Chettiyar Mittai Kadai, home of the legendary makkan peda that was first made here nearly two centuries ago by Govindasamy Chettiyar, inspired by a mithai that he tasted in the palace of the Nawab of Arcot. I caught up with his fifth generation, Mr. Sundaram, to find out what goes into the making of this flour and khoa dumpling stuffed with a mixture of 11 dry fruits and nuts, before being fried gently in oil over a wood fire until golden brown and then left to soak in sugar syrup. Hope you enjoy this delectable sweet episode; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Makkan Peda
Rs. 35 (usd 0.5) per piece
10/10

When on the road to Chennai, this ten-year-old vegetarian eatery, Hotel Alankar, located just outside Vellore, is a must-stop for travellers on the route, not just for its aesthetically appointed interiors, but more importantly for the variety of pleasing Tamil Nadu preparations like poriyal, vatha kuzhambu, koothu, avial, sambar, sakkarai pongal, and suchlike that emerge from the kitchens here. Manned entirely by local homemakers and cooks who combine traditional recipes with cooking methods that help preserve nutrition and natural flavours of ingredients, the unlimited thali served here is the most popular lunch draw for its sheer variety and economical pricing as I discovered in this highway outing. Title: Tasting The Popular JOWAR BHAKRI Meal At KAMAT BUGLE ROCK, Bengaluru! Jolada Rotti, Ennegai, Holige
Description:
#joladarottimeals #kamatbuglerock #basavanagudi

kamat bugle rock, popular jolada rotti meal in south bengaluru, vegetarian, jowar bhakri meal, jolada rotti, yennegai, gurellu, shenga chutney, kempu chutney, kamat yatri niwas group, badanekayi ennegayi, eggplant, jhunka, obbattu, hollige gourmet on the road, bangalore food tour, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

What I find most appealing about a good North Karnataka meal is its balanced approach when it comes to nutrition, the meal components, both raw and cooked, dishes that complement and contrast, not just in taste and textures, but also in the warming and cooling impact that they have on the body. A good representation of this culinary ethos is the jowar bhakri meal served at Kamat Bugle Rock in Basavanagudi. Part of the Kamat Yatri Niwas group that first brought North Karnataka cuisine to Bengaluru in a restaurant format, this 17-year-old eatery serves a satisfying jolada rotti oota, albeit with flavours slightly tweaked to better suit the palate of this South Bengaluru suburb. Hope you enjoy this watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Couple Brings Authentic Kolkata Kathi Rolls To Bengaluru! CHAKUM CHUKUM
Description:
neighbourhood eatery, popular roll shop, calcutta kathi rolls, rolls, chicken tikka roll, veg rolls, vegetable chop roll, paneer roll, mutton roll, egg roll, indira nagar, street food, bengaluru, bangalore, local, small business, local business, inspiring story, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

When work brought Arpita and Sujoy Das to Bengaluru 13 years ago, they yearned for the flavours of Kolkata's street fare, more specifically the Calcutta kathi roll. Since they could find none, Arpita decided to open a tiny 150 square feet shop cooking and serving up this quintessential Kolkata eat-as-you-go treat. It was only a matter of time before Sujoy quit his advertising job to support this small enterprise that has since built for itself a loyal following not only for its rolls that are made completely in house, including the spice mix with a few ingredients shipped from Kolkata, but also their Kolkata style kebabs and biryani in recent times. I visit them for a late lunch and make a meal of three tasty kathi rolls.

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong; please do support businesses in your neighbourhood. Happy eating!

Title: Making Of SREENIVASA BRAHMINS BAKERY Iconic CONGRESS KADLEKAI | Tasting KBC, Capsicum Puff, PalyaBun
Description:
#sreenivasabrahminsbakery #vegetarian #bangalore

popular bakery, traditional bakery, pure vegetarian bakery, bengaluru, basavanagudi, sreenivasa brahmins bakery, sreenivasa brahmins bakery bangalore, congress kadlekai, bread, kbc, khara bun butter congress, khara bun, palya bun, capsicum puff, nippat, bun butter jam, aloo bun, honey cake, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

HR Ramaswamy Iyengar came to Bengaluru from Holenarsipur in 1956 and set up a bakery in Basavanagudi, an old market area surrounded by villages where groundnuts were cultivated. Selling a limited variety of pure vegetarian breads, buns and biscuits, the bakery fell upon hard times due to the rationing of flour and other essentials in the seventies. Faced with dire prospects, Ramaswamy Iyengar looked at the plentiful groundnut for survival and in doing so hit upon a unique recipe combining peanuts with a blend of spices that he named the Congress kadlekai, owing to the legend that during British times, secret notes were sent by Indian National Congress party workers hidden in sacks of groundnuts. I spent an afternoon with the second and third generation of the Sreenivasa Brahmins Bakery family to watch the making of the iconic Congress kadlekai and also taste some of the traditional items that make this 66-year-old institution a hit not just with locals, but also with Bengaluru diaspora across the globe who throng here for the kadlekai, nippat, khara buns, palya buns, puffs and other traditional Iyengar bakery treats.

Title: He Quit His Job For His Love Of Momos! Freshest Momos At MOMO SHOP, Bengaluru!
Description:
#momoshop #momos #bangalore 

neighbourhood momo shop, vegetable momo, mushroom momo, paneer momo, chicken momo, wholewheat momo, fresh momo, street food, bengaluru, bangalore, local, small business, local business, inspiring story, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

In our continuing initiative to support small businesses, we visit Momo Shop, a passion enterprise of Ronald George who fell in love with momos whilst pursuing an advanced mountaineering course in Darjeeling, with plans to eventually join the army like his father and brother, both war heroes. Unfortunately, that wasn‚Äôt to be owing to an accident, necessitating him to switch tracks to a corporate career. However, after 11 years, he decided to return to his love for momos in 2010 and set up a tiny 100 sq. ft. shop in RT Nagar, North Bengaluru to serve the freshest momos. How fresh? Unlike typical momo shops which pre-cook and reheat momos to serve customers instantly, out here these steamed dumplings are prepared from scratch, from rolling out the dough to preparing the filling, only when an order is placed. This approach has won for Ronald a steady stream of customers over the years, facilitating his shop‚Äôs move to a slightly larger space. Hope you enjoy this episode enough to support neighbourhood eateries like the Momo Shop. Take care; stay safe and strong.

Title: Malleswaram‚Äôs Popular VEENA STORES Now 4 Times Larger! Top Idli Chutney & More Space For Customers!
Description:
#veenastores #malleswaram #bangalore

popular tiffin, veena stores, malleshwaram, best idli, idli chutney, khara bath, kesari bath, coffee, bangalore food tour, bengaluru, veena food stores idli, vegetarian, breakfast, evening tiffin, south indian breakfast, south indian tiffin, iconic eateries of bengaluru, street food, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Whilst many eateries are forced to cut back owing to the current situation, Bengaluru‚Äôs much-loved idli-chutney destination, Veena Stores, that began as a small condiment shop 44 years ago, has done just the opposite! It has scaled up four times in size! just so it can afford its customers more space and some relative peace of mind, valued aspects in present times, when tucking into their favourite tiffin treats here. Gone are the days when one had to struggle to order and then huddle and eat on the footpath. Instead, the store is now transformed with a dedicated ordering counter, a larger food dispensing area, indoor space, and even a traditional katte (alfresco bench) where one can sip on some coffee and take in the Malleswaram vibe. I caught up with second generation owner, Pradeep Suryanarayan, and also savoured a plate of idli vade and a couple of their other popular items. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care and stay safe. Happy eating!

Title: This Mother-Son Duo Make The Best Samosa & Kachori Chaat At SUDHA CHATS | Bhajji, Masala Vada
Description:
#sudhachats #streetfood #bangalore 

popular samosa and kachori shop, sudha chats, berlie street, langford town, bengaluru, samosa, kachori, bajji angadi, samosa chaat, kachori chaat, bajji, vegetable, pakora, capsicum bajji, potato bonda, gulab jamun, street food, north indian, local, bangalore street food, small business, local business, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Originally from Satna in Madhya Pradesh and raised in Bengaluru, Jawahar Lal always dreamt of being an entrepreneur when he worked as a North Indian cook in eateries in Bengaluru. A friend pointed him to a tiny shop on Berlie Street in Langford Town, and thus began Sudha Chaats, named after his wife, 39 years ago, to introduce Bengaluru to the joys of khasta (crisp) samosas and kachoris. The couple would cook and serve their fare piping hot; alongside the North Indian treats, their masala vada, bhajji and bonda, made interestingly with samosa stuffing, too found much favour, making their shop a popular cornerstone of the neighbourhood over time. Jawahar Lal passed on two years ago, but the tradition continues with his wife, now joined by their son, Satya Narayan. Hope you enjoy this chatpata episode. Do support neighbourhood eateries like Sudha Chats. Take care; stay safe and strong.

Title: OG VARIAR & SONS | This Iconic 70-Year Bengaluru Bakery Is Bridging Tasty Traditions With Health!
Description:
#ogvariarandsons #bakery #bangalore

popular bakery, traditional bakery, bengaluru, og variar and sons bakery, variar bakery, bread, wholewheat bread, wheat jaggery bread, khara bun, palya bun, nippat, coconut biscuit, jaggery wholewheat biscuit,  veg toast, vegetable puff, aloo bun, plum cake, eggless dry fruit cake, bangalore food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

OG Variar & Sons Bakery, popularly known as Variar Bakery, traces its roots to 1954 when O Govinda Variar, a native of Kannur, Kerala, set up a small bakery in Guttahalli, Northwest Bengaluru, selling breads and buns. Eventually he moved to Rajajinagar in 1970 before opening a second bakery on Chord Road, West Bengaluru. What makes Variar bakery immensely popular with locals is its philosophy that ‚Äúexcludes artificial additives, preservatives and chemically bleached flour in its vast range of baked products.‚Äù As a result, ‚Äúthere is no shining in our items,‚Äù says second generation owner, Vijaya Shankar, who is currently on a quest to substitute, to the extent possible, detrimental fats with healthier options of unrefined oil, ghee, butter across most of their range, and in certain products, maida with wholewheat flour and grains. I spent the better part of a day exploring the bakery and tasting many of the must-haves at this institution that has spawned many imitators. Hope you enjoy this slightly extended, but toothsome watch. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Description:
#hotelwoodlands #mangalore #breakfast

popular mangalore eatery, popular vegetarian eatery in mangalore, breakfast, tiffin, bunts hostel road, local favourite, woodlands hotel, mangalore, sajjige, sheera, batata vada, batata bonda, mangalore food tour, evening tiffin, snacks, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

An institution that dates back to the 60s, stepping into Woodlands Hotel transports one back to yesteryear, with its old fashioned dining rooms that carry an air of nostalgia and the aroma of comforting Mangalorean vegetarian fare served by uniformed waiters, some perhaps as old as the establishment itself. However, it is the large parking lot that seems to be the preferred dining spot, weather permitting, with Mangaloreans looking for a breakfast or evening snack in the convenience of their cars. Which is what we did on our way out of Mangalore the last time around. Hope you enjoy this snacky watch. WIsh you a fantastic 2022; take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: Our Favourite Bengaluru Idlis - Pt 1 | Popular Idlis Of Bengaluru!
Description:
#topidlis #bangalore #breakfast

favourite idlis of bengaluru, best bangalore idlis, top bengaluru idlis, must-try idlis in bengaluru, popular bangalore idlis, rice idli, rawa idli, sabakki idli, acrey idli, ramasseri idli, baale yelle idli, karnataka idli, tamil nadu idli, karnataka, support local, small business

People often say we are partial to idlis, and rightfully so :-) We love our idlis and rather unabashedly at that. Tell us about a great idli stop and we won't waste much time getting there. As the year draws to a close, we thought it would be fitting to draw up a list of some of the most memorable idlis we have tasted in namma Bengaluru. Title: Delicious Neer Dosa And Homemade Curries In Kottigehara Village, Charmadi At 48-Year-Old ANIL HOTEL
Description:
#anilhotel #kottigehara #neerdosa

charmadi highway eatery, anil hotel, charmadi ghat, kottigehara, kottigehara neer dosa, kottigehara neer dosa hotel, anil hotel kottigehara, mudigere, mangalore highway, chikamagalur, highway eatery, neer dosa, chicken curry, fish curry, fish fry, veg pulav, chicken kebab, mangalore highway, dakshina kannada cuisine, karnataka, support local, small business

A tiny village located atop the Charmadi ghat in Mudigere taluk of Karnataka, Kottigehara was a mere bus stop on this old route to Dakshina Kannada. Travellers would stop here for a few minutes and if hungry, would saunter off to one of the few home eateries on this remote, narrow strip of highway. And perhaps because its quick batter, water-like in its consistency, required almost no prep when an unexpected guest walked in, the neer dosae (neer meaning ‚Äòwater‚Äô in kannada) quickly became the staple offering of this village centered around a bus stand. Whist many neer dosa stalls have mushroomed since, the oldest home eatery here is Anil Hotel, begun by Mrs. Mary 48 years ago and now managed by her son, Baby and his wife, Theresia. Famous for its honestly-priced homestyle curries, tasty preparations and warming hospitality that I first experienced a year ago, I learnt that the eatery was recently rebuilt after being demolished in highway expansion causing untold challenges to the family. In this episode, we revisit this tiny enterprise to not just savour their fare for the day but to also support them as they make a new beginning despite having a legacy of nearly half a century. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Title: This Family Serves Delicious Malenadu Homestyle Biryani, Kurma, Khaima‚Ä¶ DURGASHREE MESS Sakleshpur
Description:
#durgashreemess #sakleshpur #malenaducuisine

sakleshpur highway eatery, durgashree donne biryani mess, durgashree mess sakleshpur, mutton donne biryani, mutton chops, mutton kurma, khaima unde, chilli chicken, chicken leg masala, non vegetarian, mangalore highway, malenadu cuisine, karnataka, support local, small business

In her tiny eatery, just off the highway in Sakleshpur, Mrs. Vishalakshi Lokesh cooks homestyle non vegetarian fare - biryani, khaima unde, mutton chops, chilli chicken, etc. - to recipes she learnt decades ago from her mother in Bengaluru, but accommodating ingredients more suited to native Malenadu tastes. The result is comforting, tasty food that not only has its share of customers amongst the local populace, but also draws in travellers on the route. This enterprise that she began with her late husband, Mr. Lokesh, 21 years ago, supported by son Sujith today, may seem a bit rustic in its aesthetics, but more than makes up for it in the honest, homely appeal of a meal here. Hope you enjoy this episode enough to support small enterprises like Durgashree Mess. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Mrs. Komal Prabhu presides over the kitchens at her 20-year-old Maharaja restaurant in Mangalore, where in addition to dishing out popular fare like the ghee roast etc., she also presents preparations from her GSB (Goud Saraswat Brahmin) culinary heritage. During my last trip to Mangalore, I caught up with this affable restaurateur while she introduced me to the making of her style of the chicken ghee roast, and a rather unique dish, the boothai (sardine) nippat. Title: AKKAMAKKA‚ÄôS MEALS HOTEL 130 Year-Old Family Eatery | Affordable, Wood Fire Cooked Fish Curry, Fry
Description:
#mangalore #akkamakkahotel #fishmeal

affordable seafood restaurant, akkamakka hotel mangalore, oldest fish curry and fish fry eatery, fish meal, akka makka hotel, hampankatta, mangalore, south canara, mangalorean food, fish thali, banana leaf meal, fish curry, fish fry, south canara seafood, murumeen rava fry, anjal fry, mackerel fry, iraba saudi fry, mackerel curry, karnataka, support local, small business

Tucked in a quiet, narrow alley in bustling Hampankatta, Mangalore sits Akkamakka‚Äôs Meals Hotel, an eatery that goes back 130 years! Located in a home that‚Äôs tended to by the third, fourth and fifth generation of a family that has a long tradition of serving the local community, a meal at Akkamakka isn‚Äôt just about the food, but also offers diner a nostalgic peek into the old-fashioned hospitality and way of life of a bygone era. I visit the family to get a glimpse into the history of the eatery, catch the cooking and a satisfying, very affordable, home cooked fish meal that is served on communal tables. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Title: ‚ÄòCheap & Best‚Äô South Canara Breakfast | Indra Bhavan Mangalore | Sajjige Avalakki, Moode, Ambode‚Ä¶
Description:
#indrabhavan #mangalore #vegetarian

popular mangalore eatery, popular vegetarian eatery in mangalore, breakfast, tiffin, balmatta, local favourite, hotel indra bhavan, mangalore, sajjige avalakki, moode, ambode, saatu, coffee, mangalore food tour, evening tiffin, snacks, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Mangalore flocks to Indra Bhavan for its delicious South Canara tiffin at prices that don't pinch one‚Äôs pocket in the least. And just because the fare is priced low, doesn‚Äôt mean the eatery cuts corners in any aspect; this near 70-year-old institution prides itself on sourcing the best ingredients and following hygiene protocols that were laid down by its founders decades ago. And as if to validate this, most items run out in a matter of a couple of hours, consumed by regulars who come here during the morning and evening sessions to savour their favourite Indra Bhavan treats which are made at specific times. This was my second visit here, this time to taste a combination of their delicious avalakki sajjige, a comforting ‚Äòleaf-steamed‚Äô moode and a couple of other equally interesting dishes. Hope you enjoy this Mangalorean tiffin episode. Take care, stay safe and strong; happy eating!

Title: Must-Try ‚ÄòTyson‚Äô CHICKEN SUKKA At HINDU MILITARY HOTEL, Mangalore | 64-Year Eatery | Chilli Chicken
Description:
#chickensukka #hindumilitaryhotel #mangalore

hindu military hotel, hindu military hotel chicken sukka, kodialbail, mangalore, manguluru, chicken sukka, chicken chilli, mangalore food tour, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

The humble chicken sukka, made popular by permit rooms in erstwhile Bombay, is a rather underrated Mangalore export,, when compared appeal-wise to its more seductive siblings like the ghee roast, etc. Which is perhaps also the reason why this unpretentious eatery in Kodialbail, Mangalore, although in existence for 64 years and popular with locals, isn't much known to those visiting. I stepped in one evening for a quick chat with the affable owner, Mr. Udayshankar, and also tasted their much-sought-after chicken sukka made to a 40-year-old recipe with an interestingly named ‚ÄòTyson‚Äô chicken!  Hope you enjoy this short and simple episode. Take care; stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

Rs. 90/ 180 (usd 1.2/ 2.4) for a half and full portion respectively, I ordered a half.

Title: Ice Cream Legend Pabba‚Äôs Latest i THALI! Tasting With 3 Generations At New PABBA‚ÄôS IDEAL CAF√â
Description:
#pabbasmangalore #icecream #mangalore
 
must-try pabba‚Äôs ice creams, pabbas ice cream mangalore, pabba‚Äôs ideal cafe, bharath mall most popular ice cream parlour in mangalore, mangalore, prabhakar  kamath, mukund kamath, mangalore food tour, must try in mangalore, ideal ice creams, pabbas ice creams, gourmet on the road, kripal amanna, food lovers tv, food lovers india, truth in food

Say the word, ‚ÄòPabba‚Äôs‚Äô to anyone in Mangalore, or someone who has had the opportunity to visit this port city, and one is most likely to be met with a smile or in the very least, warming thoughts of  wistfulness. For very few, if at all any, in Kudla may have escaped to the alluring charm of the gadbad, tiramisu, parfait, bella candy and scores of other delicious ice cream creations concocted by S. Prabhakar Kamath, affectionately known as Pabba to family and friends, over half a century at his now iconic Mangalorean institution, Pabba‚Äôs and Ideal Ice Creams. On my visit to kudla nearly a couple of months ago, I had the opportunity to sit with him (after nearly 20 years), his son, Mukund, and grandson, Mohith, to taste their latest creation, the I. Thali, a tantalising ice cream take on the South Indian thali, at their newest parlour, Pabba‚Äôs Ideal Caf√©, Bharath Mall, that seems to have taken Mangalore by storm going by the sheer numbers that queue outside this large restaurant. However little did I know then, that this would be my last meeting with him! This episode was conceived as a review of the I Thali, but is now in some ways a tribute to the man who put Mangalore and his legendary ice creams on the culinary map. 

Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating!

I Thaali
8.5/10
Rs. 279 (usd 3.7)

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

If this seventy three year-old eatery located in the temple complex in Udupi had its own currency, it would have to be the Goli Baje! Title: She Has Been Making The Fish Curry & Fry For 60 Years! HOTEL MAHALAXMI, Malpe | FISH THALI
Description:
#seafood #udupi #malpe

popular seafood restaurant, affordable seafood, fish meal, affordable seafood, malpe, south canara, mangalore, mangalorean food, fish thali, fish curry, fish fry, south canara seafood, kane rava fry, lady fish, pomfret, prawns, karnataka, support local, small business

South Canara has its share of seafood eateries, but then, there are some that have endeared themselves to diners over decades by virtue of being true to the traditions they follow. One such popular seafood stop is Hotel Mahalaxmi, in the fishing village of Malpe, about six kilometres from Udupi, where Mrs. Pushpavati Bangera, the matriarch of this family run restaurant that began as a tiny hut, has been cleaning the fish and preparing the masala for the fish curry and fry each day for the last 60 years. I catch up with her and her son, Vishwanath Bangera before I sit down to a satisfying fish thali meal. 

Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and strong. Happy eating.

Although only a couple of decades old, it seems like Mahesh Prasad has been a part of Mysore's culinary scene forever. Hugely popular with locals for its all day vegetarian offerings, and I suspect, also for its cosy, homely setting that conveys to diners the comforting, gold ole vibes of yesteryear, I stopped by to savour a wholesome vegetarian thali, that finds its culinary roots in South Canara albeit in a flavour tone that is suited to local preferences, a delicious bonda soup, a dish that doesn‚Äôt get nearly the recognition it deserves, and some more.
