Title: What I Do To ORDER TAKEAWAY FOOD SAFELY | Taste, Safety & Peace Of Mind! Rerun Episode
Description:
#safefoodtakeaway #supportlocalbusiness #supportrestaurants

Hi folks, I hope you are doing well. This is a video that I have put together based on requests I have received from many of our viewers to illustrate do‚Äôs and don‚Äôts when ordering takeaway food.

I want to share with you measures that I take when I am ordering food, from a taste, safety, and peace of mind perspective. Hope you find this useful, I have also placed some of my research reference links below. Stay safe and happy eating!

Note: This episode was first released in May 2020 and is being rerun to support the eatery and others like this establishment that need help in the current situation. Please do support local eateries.

Link to Gourmet On The Road Takeaway playlist: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLri_37vf6mmrBWUIaryRMdvcL8p1rmrY1 
Link to Gourmet On the Road Recipes playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLri_37vf6mmqmRCMkXZxRG--nGqQL3SPs

Links to references I have looked up to determine if eating outside food is safe:

Specifically, coronaviruses are thermolabile, which means that they are susceptible to normal cooking temperatures (70¬∞C). Therefore, as a general rule, the consumption of raw or undercooked animal products should be avoided. Raw meat, raw milk or raw animal organs should be handled with care to avoid cross-contamination with uncooked foods.
Source: WHO https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/situation-reports/20200221-sitrep-32-covid-19.pdf

Food containers and packaging. There's no evidence of anyone contracting the virus that causes COVID-19 after touching food containers and food packaging. Many restaurants are now offering no-contact takeout and delivery to lessen the risk of transmission.

Still, if you're concerned, it's reasonable to follow general food safety guidelines. Wash your hands for at least 20 seconds with soap and water after handling takeout containers, and then transfer food to a clean dish using clean utensils. Wash your hands again before eating. After disposing of containers, clean and disinfect any surfaces that had takeout containers on them.
Source: Mayo Clinic, https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/coronavirus/expert-answers/can-coronavirus-spread-food-water/faq-20485479
Food Standards Australia & New Zealand, https://www.foodstandards.gov.au/consumer/safety/Pages/Can-COVID-19-be-transmitted-by-food-or-food-packaging.aspx

COVID-19 is a respiratory disease spreading from person to person. It‚Äôs not a foodborne disease. There‚Äôs no evidence to suggest people will get infected by swallowing the virus in, or on, food or drink.
Source: Food Standards Australia & New Zealand, https://www.foodstandards.gov.au/consumer/safety/Pages/Can-COVID-19-be-transmitted-by-food-or-food-packaging.aspx

Title: This 80-Year-Old Has Seen Famines But Never This! Support NEW MODERN HOTEL Takeaway | Rerun Episode
Description:
#supportlocalbusiness #newmodernhotel #vegetarian 

support local eateries, takeaway meal, new modern hotel, lockdown, new modern hotel, basavangudi, south bangalore, traditional vegetarian food in bangalore, south canara food, traditional vegetarian food, thatte idli, set dosa, khara bath, kesari bath, rice rasam, rice sambar, anna saaru, lunch, old world restaurant, traditional eatery, bangalore, bengaluru

Mr Padmanabha Adiga, has seen famines, plagues, political unrest and other disruptions in the 60 years he has helmed this old Bengaluru institution, New Modern Hotel, but says the current situation is something else altogether! An optimist though, he and his sons prepare to do what it takes to tide this South Canara vegetarian eatery through. Inspiration aside, I also take away a simple but nourishing anna-saaru meal in addition to some of their popular tiffins and sweets. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care, stay safe and happy eating.
Note: This episode was first released in May 2020 and is being rerun to support the eatery and others like this establishment that need help in the current situation. Please do support local eateries.

Set Dose
There‚Äôs a hint of tart sweetness in these soft, fluffy dose that are perfectly suited for takeaway. With the nourishing sambar, vegetable saagu and chutney, it makes for a wholesome light meal. 
Rs. 48 (usd 0.6) 

Thatte Idli
Soft and porous, the thatte idli breaks under its own weight. The sambar, pleasing to the palate with its sweet acidity is perfectly suited to impregnate the idli with its mildly spicy fervour. 
Rs. 29 (usd 0.4) 

Khara Bath
As you place the khara bath in your mouth, the savoury aroma of the onion is what you taste first, followed by the moist crunch of the tomato and the grainy bite of fresh coconut. Spice things up with the chutney. 
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 

Kesari Bath
Redolent in the flavour of cloves, this isn't a kesari bath that‚Äôs dripping in ghee. Which makes for a tasty indulgence minus the guilt.
Rs. 27 (usd 0.4) 

Anna Sambar
A sambar rich in lentils and grated coconut, made well, the vegetable, ladies finger, still has its crunch intact. 
Rs. 43 (usd 0.6) 

Anna Saaru
The tomato plays a dual role in this pleasing South Canara tilli saaru, more popularly known as tomato rasama here in Bengaluru. The tomatoes are the foundation of this tart broth, and also offer a fruity crunch in the diced tomato that is perhaps added when the rasam is near cooked. 
Rs. 43 (usd 0.6) 

Mysore Pak
Rich in ghee, the fresh mysore pak crumbles under its own weight. When you place it in the mouth, it dissolves into a lush, buttery pool of deliciousness.
Rs. 18 (usd ) per piece 

Jehangir
Crisp, crunch and moist, this well-made old-fashioned mithai is a popular sweet at NMH.
Rs. 18 (usd ) per piece 

Note: Due to the current uncertain situation, please call the eatery to ascertain the timings and what is available. Prices may have changed since when this episode was originally published a year ago.
ADDRESS -  New Modern Hotel, 143, Dr.A.N. Krishna Rao Road, Vishweshwarapuram, near Minerva circle, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel +91 80 2661 2625/ +91 98458 27655
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/k2pQw9UHzsXtZZus7

Title: Support Mr. & Mrs. Iyer's 60-Yr-Old IYER MESS | Takeaway A Tasty Veg BANANA LEAF Meal! Rerun Episode
Description:
#vegetarian #takeaway #bangalore

support local eateries, iyer mess, takeaway meal, iyer meal, pure vegetarian meal, carrier meal, vegetarian lunch, banana leaf meal, sambar, rice, kootu, veg meals, bangalore, malleshwaram, bengaluru

Mr Venkatesh and Mrs Kamala Iyer serve up Tamil and Kerala Brahmin traditions in their tiny eatery, Iyer Mess, established by the former‚Äôs father in 1959. The food is simple, yet delicious, cooked by Mrs Iyer and honestly priced at Rs. 80 for a sumptuous vegetarian banana leaf meal. 
As I catch up with the Iyers when I get this takeaway meal, I can't help but feel sorry for this elderly couple who are trying hard to grasp the realities of business in the new normal. From 200 meals a day, they are now reduced to under 30, and despite the financial hardships that they endure, they have held onto their staff, lodging and boarding them at home to ensure they are safe. Spare a moment for establishments like Iyer Mess even as you watch this episode. Take care and stay safe.

Vegetarian Meal
A simple meal, the Iyer Mess banana leaf is laden with everything that one needs for tasty sustenance. With a menu that changes everyday, the spread - rice, sambar, rasam, kootu, poriyal, thayir, pickle and papad - is nourishing, and of the sort you would relish at a Tamil home blessed with a good cook. And offers great value.
Rs. 80 (usd 0.9) Rs. 100 takeaway

Note: This episode was first released in May 2020 and is being rerun to support the eatery and others like this that need help.

ADDRESS - Iyer Mess, No 4/3, West Park Road Between 7th and 8th Cross, Malleshwaram West, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003; tel: 098860 78290

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/JLGgTcL8MC5Pfs7L9

Title: She Is Doing Her Best To Make It Through This Difficult Time | The Lighthouse |üôèSupport Restaurants
Description:
#gourmetontheroad #supportlocalrestaurants #smallbusiness 

support eateries, small business, restaurants, takeaway, the lighthouse restaurant, coastal cuisine, mangalorean food, konkani food, alle piao, stuffed pomfret, unicorn special prawns, rmv layout, sadashivnagar, bangalore, bengaluru

It is a rather difficult time for eateries and restaurants everywhere. Barely had they somehow scraped through last year, the ones that managed to survive that is, the current scenario yet again threatens hundreds and thousands of livelihoods that depend on this sector. In this ‚Äòsupport restaurants‚Äô vlog, I return to The Lighthouse Restaurant to meet lady entrepreneur, Prathiksha Nayak and learn how they are coping, and to also taste some delicious dishes that I missed out on when I was here last. Whilst we must all stay safe and take adequate precautions for ourselves and our loved ones, if possible, please spare a thought for the many restaurants and eateries that have given us abundant culinary pleasures and now depend on our support to make it through these gloomy days, one small takeaway order at a time. Take good care of yourself and stay safe; this too shall pass. God bless.

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 1130am to 11pm; please check on the current timings owing to the restrictions that may be in place. 
Note: The restaurant also delivers through online delivery platforms.

Title: Tasting 8 Varieties Of Holige At MANE HOLIGE! Bele, Badam, Jackfruit, Gulkand, Dates, Pineapple..
Description:
#holige #maneholige #bangalore

popular holige shop with 23 varieties of holige, mane holige, traditional, bele, coconut, badam, gulkand, dates, pineapple, jackfruit, carrot, khoa, sweet store, kuruk thindi, savouries, snacks, bengaluru

In Karnataka, we love our holige or obbattu, traditionally a lentil and jaggery mix stuffed in a flour dough, rolled out, fried, and served hot, slathered with ghee. However, when it comes to variety, all roads seem to lead to Mane Holige which dishes out a mind-boggling 23 types of holige, hot and fresh every single day! I visit their Jayanagar store in the run-up to Ugadi and taste 8 of the holiges on offer - including the classic bele and kai to the rich khoa, badam, dates and an unusual jackfruit version too! No matter what your preference, you‚Äôre bound to find your holige fix here!  Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and happy eating!

9/10

Rs. 28 (usd 0.4)
7/10

10/10

8.5/10

8/10

Food Lovers TV

Note: The place does get crowded, especially on weekends and festivals. You should be able to locate one closest to you on google maps.

Title: Cooling Down With Bengaluru‚Äôs Latest TENDER COCONUT SHAKE Trend! ‚ÄòOriginal' YELNEER KATTE
Description:
#coconutshake #yelneerkatte #bangalore

trending coconut dessert, popular coconut shake, tender coconut shake, ice cream, summer cooler, dessert, milkshake, smoothies, healthy coolers, yelneer katte, basavangudi, bangalore, katte special, ice cream, small business

With the mercury rising, Bengaluru‚Äôs denizens seem to be turning to the yelneer or tender coconut water shake, a dessert trend that seems to be the flavour of the season. I ventured out to Yelneer Katte, supposedly the store that began this rage in the city to decipher for myself what the fuss was all about. Hope you enjoy this short and icy-cool episode. Take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Katte Special
Coconut flesh crushed with coconut milk, cream and nuts, this is the one to have if like me you prefer tasting the ‚Äòcoconutty‚Äô character. The nuts and raisins also add to the nutty flavor and thick texture of this shake, the pomegranate seeds provide a fruity pop and the swirl of condensed milk a rich, creamy finishing touch. The sweetness is just right.
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
8/10

Yelneer Mango Shake With Vanilla Ice Cream
A loaded shake, coconut flesh ground with coconut water and fresh mango, topped with vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, nuts, fresh mango and some condensed milk. A tasty milkshake, but one cannot taste much of the coconut as it is overpowered by the ice cream, chocolate sauce and a copious amount of sugar. 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
6.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 11am to 9pm
Note: The place does get crowded especially on weekends. Do plan your visit accordingly. Yelneer Katte also has branches in BTM 2nd Stage, Jayanagar and Malleshwaram, you will find it on google maps.  
ADDRESS -  Yelneer Katte, 57, E Anjaneya St, Gandhi Bazaar, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: +91 83173 14636 
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/JRKuwfs3QxA6rKUGA

Title: TARAYI COASTAL CUISINE | This Family Eatery Is A Labour Of Love! Fish Thali, Ghee Roast, Crab Masala
Description:
#seafood #mangalorean #bengaluru

family eatery, st thomas town, east bangalore, new restaurant, coastal cuisine, fish thali, fish fry, pomfret, mackerel, fish fry, prawn ghee roast, crab masala, chicken curry, small business

Tarayi, a tiny three-table eatery in St. Thomas Town, East Bengaluru, was born of homemaker Freeda Ananth‚Äôs desire to share the culinary legacy of her late mother and to set up a small business of her own. So, with the support of her husband, Vijay Ananth, this soft-spoken lady ventured out as a restaurateur just a couple of months ago, and in a relatively short span of time has managed to make an impression on the neighbourhood with her rendition of Mangalorean-Kundapur fare laced with a touch of Kerala influence. I visited Tarayi to taste their limited but tasty homestyle offerings, and to also help share the word on this family enterprise that‚Äôs a true labour of love. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Prawn Ghee Roast
This ghee roast masala exudes a slight sour twang followed by the warmth of the chilli and spices. The prawns are cooked just right, delicately ‚Äòspringy‚Äô on the bite, swaddled in the grainy textured masala with the lushness of ghee.  
Rs. 270 (usd 3.6)
9/10

Black Pomfret Fry 
The masala is napped rather lightly on the fish, allowing for the pomfret to shine in its fresh flavours. The skin is cooked to a perfect crisp.
Rs. 250 (usd 3.3)
8.5/10

Seer Fry
Rs. 280 (usd 3.7)
8/10

Crab Masala
Loved the aromatic masala, onions, tomatoes and spices, soaked up by the plump, meaty sea crab. The sweet crab meat contrasts beautifully with the savoury notes of the masala. If you love crab, this is certainly a must-order when here.
Rs. 240 (usd 3.2)
10/10

Fish Thali
A satisfying thali, complete with modest portions of mackerel curry and fry, in addition to sambar, rasam, vegetables, boiled rice‚Ä¶ perfect if you‚Äôre looking to savour Mangalorean fare on a budget.
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
8/10

Kheema Ball Curry
A pleasing curry, I found the meat ball a tad pasty and giving up the texture of the flour used to bind the mince together.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) for half portion
7/10

Chicken Curry
A homestyle curry, thin in its consistency but rich in the flavour of the masala. Goes well with the neer dosae. 
7.5/10


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: breakfast and lunch - 8am to 430pm; dinner - 630pm to 10pm; closed on Mondays.
Note: This is a tiny eatery with barely three tables; if dining here, be prepared for a bit of a wait. Best perhaps to order in, they are registered on Dunzo for now.
ADDRESS -  Tarayi Coastal Cuisine, #7, 3rd Main Road, karavalli Road, KK Halli, St Thomas Town, Post, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560084; tel: +91 97319 95671/ 96111 02133/ 080 4972 2888
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/juaSDpVbdQvjvp4w9

Title: Rajamma‚Äôs MADHAVAN PARK BAJJI SHOP | This 30-Year-Old Cart Is Serving Up Delicious Nostalgia!
Description:
#streetfood #jayanagar #bengaluru

popular bajji shop in jayanagar, south bangalore, vegetable, pakora, bonda, capsicum masala bajji, baby corn fry, potato, bread pakora, mirchi bajji, balekai bajji, raw banana, small business

Rajamma and her husband, Basavaraj, set up a pushcart in a street corner of Jayanagar to fry and sell hot bajjis. Thirty years have passed since, the neighbourhood has evolved beyond recognition but Rajamma‚Äôs Madhavan Park Bajji Angadi, or shop, has stood constant at the same spot. Her husband has since retired, and today, she is helped by her sons, as they continue to serve delicious vegetable bajjis at honest prices to customers who visit not only for the scrumptious fare but also for the comforting nostalgia of yesteryear. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and happy eating! 


The bajjis here are served fresh and are rather enjoyable, my favourites were the capsicum, baby corn and also the masala vade. But it is the sort of place that you can't go wrong no matter what you order.

Title: This Biryani Is Steamed In Bamboo For Two Hours! NRK BAMBOO BIRIYANI Food Truck, Mysuru
Description:
#biryani #streetfood #mysore

biryani food truck, nrk bamboo biryani, mysuru, bamboo biryani, mutton biryani, chicken biryani, chicken tawa fry, small business

On my last trip to Mysuru, I visited this food truck that cooks an unusual biryani, layered and steamed in bamboo. Helmed by a relatively new food entrepreneur, Ramamurthy, who was left with no option but to move to Mysuru and begin this mobile eatery to support his family after losing his life‚Äôs savings, the bamboo biryani is a result of his culinary passion and kitchen experiments. This version of the biryani that is steamed in bamboo for a couple of hours, isn‚Äôt what one may traditionally expect, but certainly makes for an interesting dish to taste! Check it out if you find yourself in Mysuru. Hope you enjoy this short and sweet episode, take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Mutton Biryani 
The sort of biryani that tumbles onto the plate when semi-cooked meat masala is placed in the bottom of a bamboo cylinder, topped with aromatic rice and egg,  and steamed for a couple of hours. The thick masala clinging to the meat serves to moisten the rice and the meat, some pieces soft and yet others that warrant a bit of a chew. The bamboo lends its aroma to the preparation.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
7.5/10


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 6pm to 1030pm; Monday holiday
Note: They also serve a chicken biryani at Rs. 150; the vibe is that of a food truck in an open area.  
ADDRESS -  NRK Bamboo Biryani, Water Tank, Vijayanagar Chat Street, High Tension Double Road, Vijayanagar, Mysuru, Karnataka 570016; tel: +91 63625 36290

Title: JOLADA ROTTI OOTA With Power Star PUNEETH RAJKUMAR | Karnataka YUVARATHNAA | Basaveshwar Khanavali
Description:
banana leaf lunch with mega star puneeth rajkumar, puneeth rajkumar, yuvarathnaa, sandalwood, karnataka, baale yelle oota, jolada rotti, vegetarian, basaveshwar khanavali, gandhinagar, bengaluru, bangalore

Hi folks, this is a very special episode. Karnataka youth icon and Sandalwood superstar, Puneeth Rajkumar, joins me in a traditional jolada rotti oota at the legendary North Karnataka eatery, Basaveshwar Khanavali in Gandhinagar, Bengaluru. Over a delicious meal of butter-laden jolada rotties, tantalisingly spicy condiments and comforting traditional preparations, we talk about food, but of course, his upcoming film, Yuvarathnaa with Director, Santhosh Ananddram, his penchant for cooking, and a lot more. Hope you enjoy this exclusive gourmet on the road presentation, take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

Title: GANGA‚ÄôS MUDDE MANE | Homely Gowda Cuisine| This Brave Couple Makes A Fresh Start Despite Challenges!
Description:
#traditional #gowdafood #bangalore

new gowda cuisine eatery, vegetarian thali, non veg meal, nalli fry, ragi mudde, kheema unde curry, mutton peas pulav, kaal soup, boti gojju, chicken tava roast, small business

A sudden loss of occupation forced Hemanth Kumar to deploy his life savings and rustle up an eatery to support his family. Seeing her husband struggle, Nalini gave up her teaching job to support him in this enterprise that aspires to serve homestyle Gowda food. I visited Ganga‚Äôs Mudde Mane one afternoon to meet and motivate the brave couple, and along the way tasted an elaborate spread. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Kaal Soup 
An aromatic soup that serves well to whet your palate. The tomato conveys a pulpy texture laden with the meaty broth.
Rs. 40 (usd 0.6)
8/10

Brain Fry
Flavoured with the lightest touch of spice, pepper and curry leaves, the ‚Äòbheja‚Äô is cooked to perfection and melts in its rich buttery lushness when placed in the mouth. If you love the brain, a must-order here!
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
10/10

Chicken Tava Roast
Marinated in a green chilli, ginger garlic paste, it is the freshness of the mint that shines through the masala. I found the chicken a tad chewy. 
Rs. 190 (usd 2.6)
7.5/10

Boti Kal Goju 
A thick preparation enlivened with the starchiness of raw banana and nourishment of lentils, the boti is cooked through well. 
Rs. 170 (usd 2.3)
8/10

Mutton Kheema Ball Curry
The kheema unde is rich in its meatiness and is complemented by the green chilli and coriander. Eat this hot to prevent the gram flour, used to bind the meat, from making its presence felt on the palate.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.5)
7.5/10

Chicken Kheema Goju 
Tiny cubes of chicken tossed in a tasty masala. What makes this dish interesting are flecks of yam that bring its earthy flavours. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
7/10

Nalli Fry 
A weighty lamb shank, some of the meat has a bit of a bite, but as you work your way to the core of the nalli, the meat is tender. There is depth of flavour from the spices and the pepper. 
Rs. 380 (usd 5.2) for two large pieces, the price for this varies by weight. 
9/10

Veg Meals 
A vegetarian will enjoy this simple but homely assemblage with as much gusto as a non vegetarian. From the scrumptious dill fritters to the comforting sprouts saaru and rasam, each dish bears the mark of a talented home cook, in this case, Nalini Hemant Kumar. I would happily order this with a non-vegetarian side.
Rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
8/10

Mutton Peas Pulav 
Made three days a week, this is a pulao that is moist, gentle and aromatic. The aroma of the whole spices is what one tastes on the palate alongside the faint warmth of green chillies whose heat has been toned down by some coconut milk that goes into the pulao just before it is placed on dum. The meat in the pulao is soft and has a bit of fat ribboned through it, the peas are endearing in their soft bite.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
8.5/10


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Breakfast and lunch - 8am to 4pm; dinner - 6pm to 930pm; Monday holiday
Note: Ganga‚Äôs Mudde Mane is a new eatery run by a family with a spartan team at present. Do support them as they try to find their feet. 
ADDRESS -  Ganga‚Äôs Mudde Mane, 3rd cross, Manjunath Nagar, Kanakapura Rd, Raghuvanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560062; tel: +91 98806 54833/ 97415 49363/ 99161 63217
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/ganga-s-mudde-mane?share

Title: Tasty, Rustic Breakfast At NANI HOTEL, Vijayapura | Popular Ghee MASALA DOSA, Bele Bhath And More...
Description:
#traditional #villagebreakfast #ruralbangalore

popular breakfast spot 50 kilometres from bangalore, village eatery, bengaluru, rural bengaluru, nani hotel, masala dosa, dose, idli, vada, bisi bele bhath, chitranna, tomato rice, masala vade, kesari bath, coffee

Given its modest beginnings as a village eatery in a hut six or seven decades ago in Vijayapura, S. Narayan Rao, the late founder of Nani Hotel may have found it hard to fathom its current immense following that draws Bangaloreans to drive 50 kilometres for breakfast here. Having discovered its tiffin delights on a motorcycle ride a couple of months ago, I returned to savour breakfast, catch up with the owning family and patrons to find out what‚Äôs special here, including their much-loved Nani Hotel Masala Dosa. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Tuppa Masala Dosa
The ghee masala dosa is the top draw with patrons here. Smeared with a spicy chutney as it roasts, the dosa is ladled with a dollop of potato palya and a top-up lashing of ghee to ensure the tuppa is what customers taste in plenty. The result is a golden-brown dosae that is slightly thick and biscuity in its crunch and lush with ghee, cradling within its fold a creamy, flavourful palya. The chutney makes for a spicy accompaniment.
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8) 
9/10

Idli 
Rs. 5 (usd 0.1) 
8/10

Uddina Vade 
Rs. 10 (usd 0.15) 
7/10

Bele Bhath/ Tomato Bhath/ Puliyogare/ Chitranna/ Kesari Bhath
Rs. 25/ 40 (usd 0.3/ 0.5) for half/ full portion 
8/10 (my favourites were the tomato bhath and bele bhath 

Masala Vade 
Rs. 5 (usd 0.1) 
7/10

Coffee 
Rs. 6 (usd 0.1) 
7/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 730am to 1030am, 230pm to 430pm
Note: The eatery is located in a tiny alley, if you‚Äôre in a four-wheeler, it is best to park in the main Gandhi chowk or nearby and find your way on foot here. It‚Äôs a short walk and will help build your appetite! :-)
ADDRESS -  Nani Hotel, Vijayapura Town, Karnataka 562135; tel: +91 99451 02286/ 95913 24248
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/Kk9bs5mQuoRwDAJw6

Title: Tasting A Delicious, Traditional Kerala Meal | KAPPA CHAKKA KANDHARI | Ramassery Idli, Appam & Stew
Description:
#traditional #keralacuisine #bangalore

best kerala restaurant, bangalore, bengaluru, koramangala, traditional, malayali food, kappa chakka kandhari, appam and stew, karimeen, pearlspot fry, kappa fish curry, pazham kanji, pidi kozhi curry, duck roast, kappa vada, tapioca, ramassery idli, appam and stew, puttu, mutton coconut fry, meen pollichathu, tender coconut pudding, kandhari ice cream, payasam, chef regi mathew

The folks behind Kappa Chakka Kandhari restaurant take their food rather seriously, after all their menu is a showcase of Malayali fare based on their collective memories of growing up in Kerala. And spearheading this unique ‚Äònostalgic‚Äô culinary initiative is Chef Regi Mathew, who has spent more than a decade extensively touring his home state, exploring recipes and connecting with cooks across homes, community kitchens, and even toddy shops. The resulting food is a labour of love, with ingredients sourced from micro-regions in Kerala to match the provenance of the dish, for instance the rice for the fabled Ramassery Idli comes from Palakkad, the home of the idli, the karimeen (pearl spot fish) from Vaikom, Kottayam, and so on‚Ä¶ This fastidious approach to sourcing also seems to extend to the kitchen hands at KCK too, who hail from traditional kitchens and homes in ‚ÄòGod‚Äôs own country‚Äô. In this episode, I partake of a lavish lunch that spans across a dozen preparations, made possible by their innovative menu approach that allows for diners to savour a string of delicacies in the course of a meal. Hope you enjoy this one, take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Note:
The set menus at Kappa Chakka Kandhari are priced upwards of Rs. 475 (usd 6.5) and in addition to a tasting of seven preparations, include a beverage and dessert too. Additional add-ons (limited servings), kappa vada, koorka fry, ramassery idli with chicken curry, are priced at Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) per dish.  

Rajayogi Meal
A set menu that‚Äôs fit for a king, this smorgasbord of a dozen dishes is sheer indulgence! Begin with juicy prawns in a coconut-kokum masala that is steamed in a petite banana leaf pouch, spicy ‚Äòtouchings‚Äô of needle fish, the plumpest soft shell crabs, and a delicately flavoured pearl spot fish draped in a robust, toddy shop masala, amongst other delicacies that include a peppery chicken peralan and a slow-cooked mutton coconut fry. After an interlude of a sweet, sour and spicy, pineapple-nendram relish, the main courses troop out - pidi, tiny rice dumplings steeped in coconut milk and served with a flavourful simple chicken curry, a velvety mutton stew and appam combo, and a prawn puttu biryani that hits the spot. For dessert, there‚Äôs much to choose from, we tried the chilli-pricking kandhari ice cream and the luscious tender-coconut cloud pudding.
Rs. 1475 (usd 20.3)       
9/10 (overall) The pearl spot fry, mutton fry, soft shell crab, pineapple nendram relish, mutton fry, appam and stew  - 10/10

Kappa Vada
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) add-on serving
8/10

Koorka Fry 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) add-on serving
8/10

Ramassery Idli With Varutharacha Chicken Curry & Sambar
The idli is aromatic and soft, slightly pasty, and has a bit of a weight that lends to combining with the sambar or spicy chicken curry.  
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) add-on serving
9/10

Ayakora Nellikai Masala Fry
A fish fry inspired by frugal tribal traditions, the fish is spiced with a paste of sun-dried gooseberries, green peppercorn and kandhari, bird‚Äôs eye chilli. Rs. 375 (usd 5.2)
8.5/10

Cloud Pudding
10/10

Kandhari Ice Cream
9/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Lunch - 12pm to 330pm, Dinner - 7pm to 11pm
Note: If in a group, order more than one set menu, it‚Äôs a great way to gourmet graze through the diverse flavours of Kerala. 
ADDRESS -  Kappa Chakka Kandhari, 438, 18th Main Rd, 6th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095; tel: +91 63646 71010/ +91 80 2552 1010
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/kappa-chakka-kandhari?share

Title: Tasting North Bengaluru‚Äôs Best Pizza At SIDDY‚ÄôS PIZZA | Veg Margherita, Chicken, Sicilian Pepperoni
Description:
#pizza #yelahanka #bangalore

best pizzas, north bangalore, bengaluru, siddys pizza, pizza recipe, pizza, pizzeria, margherita, smoked chicken, garlic bread, pepperoni, handmade pizzas, italian, authentic sicilian style pizzas, siddy, siddhanth sawkar, yelahanka, bangalore

When Siddhanth Sawkar was forced to close his caf√© and home catering-turned-food truck brand, Spitfire Barbeque, owing to the pandemic, he spent a couple of months mulling his next move, making pizzas. Not just a generic version as dished out by fast food chains! Instead, he dug deep into his experience as a culinary student in Southern Italy, to open a pizzeria serving Sicilian style pizzas in his erstwhile North Bengaluru caf√© in Yelahanka New Town. Siddy‚Äôs Pizza, as I discovered during a leisurely visit, is a one-man passion enterprise, where Siddy, as Siddhanth is known, does everything from taking the order to putting together the pizzas to serving customers who quite often chat with him as the cheese-laden flavourful pies bake in the oven. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Garlic Butter Bread
Pillowy soft and gushing with garlic-infused buttery flavour; the butter is molten as the bread comes out of the oven! Changes your perspective of what simple garlic bread can be! The cheddar cheese dip makes for an indulgent accompaniment.
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
9/10

Classic Margherita & Cheese - Large
Its dough fermented for a few hours, the pizza is firm and toasty, drooping at the edge, burdened under the weight of a generous topping of cheese. The sharp, spicy notes of the homemade tomato sauce, salsa semplice, is softened by the mozzarella. 
Rs. 350 (usd 4.8)
8/10

Smoked Chicken & Cheese - Large
The juicy personality of the chunky, smoked chicken franks take over the palate the moment you bite into this cracker of a pizza, followed then by the slightly, sweet crunch of the onions. The cheese and tomato sauce play second fiddle to the meat and onions. If you love smoked chicken, this pie is a must-have!
Rs. 420 (usd 5.8)
10/10

Classic Pepperoni & Cheese - Large
Lush in virgin olive oil, this is a classic Sicilian style pizza, its ‚Äòbready‚Äô texture quite similar to a focaccia. There‚Äôs plenty of mozzarella that sits atop the pizza, followed by the spicy sauce and onions. But it is the fat-laden savoury fervour of the pepperoni that is the hero of this pizza! This pizza is also the sort that would make for a great midnight snack when left over in the refrigerator.
Rs. 650 (usd 9)
9/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 12pm to 1030pm
Note: Closed on Mondays. The pizzas are loaded and large, so do plan your order accordingly. ADDRESS -  Siddy‚Äôs Pizza, 810, HIG, 1st & 2nd Stage, B-Sector Yelahanka, New Town Main Rd, Yelahanka New Town, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560064; tel: +91 96118 09810
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/siddys?share

Title: This Couple Serves The Authentic Taste Of Nellore | CHEPALA PULUSU | VIJAY KITCHEN | Andhra Bhojanam
Description:
#nellore #andhrafood #bangalore

nellore andhra restaurant, vijay kitchen, brookefield, whitefield, bengaluru, andhra meals, fish curry, chepala pulusu, fish fry, vegetarian bhojanam, rr chilli chicken, mutton pepper ghee roast, biryani, chicken fry biryani, nellore, small business

With a culinary lineage that goes back to Hotel Manju, supposedly the first table-service restaurant in Nellore, Andhra Pradesh in the sixties, Sashidhar Reddy and his wife, Vijayalakshmi, moved to Bengaluru from Nellore little over a year ago to open Vijay Kitchen, to serve dishes made to traditional family recipes. I visited this modest eatery set in the ground floor of their home in the suburb of Brookefield, where I not only savoured a delicious Andhra Bhojanam but also caught the making of an iconic Nellore Chepala Pulusu, a sour and spicy fish curry. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and happy eating. 

Plate Rice Meals
Served on a banana leaf tray, the rice meals is a simple but satisfying affair that consists of two vegetables, one dry and the other moist, a sambar, rasam and a nourishingly tasty pappu to keep company with the anam (steamed rice) and flavoured rice. There is also a sweet to round off the meal.
Rs. 99 (usd 1.4)
8/10 

Chepala Pulusu (Sour and Spicy Fish Curry)
Made by his wife, Vijayalakshmi, to a recipe that goes back to Sasidhar Reddy‚Äôs grandmother, the Chepala Pulusu is a must-try here. A sour and spicy affair, the fish curry is made the evening before, thereby allowing for the fish to soak up the vivacious character of the tamarind, raw mangoes, chilli powder and the secret fenugreek spice blend. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.5)
10/10

Mamdikaya Royyalu (Mango Prawns)
A tangy preparation that juxtaposes fresh flavours of shrimp to the tart fervour of raw mangoes. Taste it with the annam (rice) to tone down some of its tangy flavours.
Rs. 250 (usd 3.4)
9/10

Chepala Fry (Fish Fry)
Chinese pomfret or lake pomfret naped in a pleasant masala; the skin is fried to a crisp.
Rs. 150 (usd 1.4)
7/10
 
Royyalu Avakkai
A spicy, homemade prawn pickle that makes for a great combination with steaming hot rice.
8/10
 
Mutton Pepper Ghee Roast 
The meat is moist and juicy, coated with coarsely ground pepper and tossed in the buttery lushness of ghee. The meat is cooked twice, first a roasted fry with masala, and then tossed around in hot ghee. 
Rs. 250 (usd 3.4)
9/10

RR Chilli Chicken
This dish should come with a ‚Äòchilli hotness‚Äô warning! Not for the faint-hearted, there is little else in this dish other than the chicken and tonnes of green chilli. The result is a unique taste that‚Äôs fiery at first but also the sort that endears itself once you get past the ‚Äòsuffering‚Äô! If you like it toned down, tell them so and they will toss it in some ghee.
Rs. 150 (usd 1.4)
8/10

Chicken Fry Biryani
A dish that was introduced as a means to consume leftover biryani rice, topped with chicken fry, the chicken fry biryani today is more popular than the Nellore biryani here. One can taste the warming flavours of the biryani spices in the kushka, the rice, that makes for a great combination with the robust tomato-onion rich masala of the chicken fry. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.5)
8.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Lunch - 12pm to 4pm; Dinner - 7pm to 11pm 
Note: This is a family run enterprise that is doing its best to cope with the realities of the new normal. The food is great, and the family does its best in its service assisted by a few staff members. 
ADDRESS -  Vijay Kitchen, 533, B Block, AECS Layout, Marathahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560037; tel: +91 82970 90789/ 70759 01966

Title: SRI CHIKKAVEERANNA SWEETS | This 72-Year-Old Village Shop Serves PURE GHEE MITHAI & KHAARA Items!
Description:
#mysorepak #badamhalwa #vijayapura

popular sweet shop in rural bangalore, vijayapura, bengaluru, sri chikkaveeranna sweets, mysore pak, badam halwa, ghee jilebi, pure ghee sweets, traditional mithai, family run, tuppa, ghee red rice avalakki

In 1948, Chikkaveeranna opened a sweetmeat stall in Vijayapura, then a sleep hamlet located fifty kilometres from Bengaluru. The stall would travel from village fair to village fair selling mithai and khaara made of pure country ghee. 72 years on, village ghee may no longer be easily available, but Suresh Chikkananjundappa, his grandson, tends to the traditions of his ancestors in the ghee sweets and savouries that he personally prepares with his family and dedicated workers. Their mysore pak is hugely popular, made to a special technique where the gram flour is lightly roasted with some ghee, before finding its way into the paaka or sugar mixture. However, the tuppa jilebi, with the batter fermented overnight in clay pots, the rich badam halwa made with homemade khoa, and a seriously addictive red rice avalakki mixture, all made with pure ghee, are also must-haves when at this tiny sweet shop. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Tuppa Jilebi
Made of a batter that is fermented overnight in a clay pot, and fried in pure ghee, the result is a white jilebi that crackles with a sticky bite and unburdens its ghee-laden sweetness with just a tinge of sourness. 
Rs. 440 (usd 6) per kilo 
9/10 

Tuppa Avalakki
Red rice puffed to a crisp in a bath of boiling ghee, comes together with ghee-roasted cashewnuts, curry leaves, Bengal gram and generous sprinkling of spices to make a seriously addictive khaara or mixture.  
Rs. 560 (usd 7.7) per kilo 
9/10 

Mysore Pak
Soft and crumbly, lush with ghee, this is the sort of Mysore Pak that dissolves on the palate with the light lilt of cardamom, when fresh. You can taste the weight of the gram flour, especially in the tiny clumps that have held on to the ghee as the gram flour is lightly roasted before it finds its way into the sugar syrup or paaka. The hero ingredient in this mithai though is the ghee that makes it Sri Chikkaveerana‚Äôs most popular mithai for over seven decades.
Rs. 560 (usd 7.7) per kilo 
10/10 

Bene Murukku
One of the few items here that is made in oil, the murukku though crunchy and flavourful with cumin and carom seeds and the nuttiness of sesame, feels a bit spartan when tasted in the company of the other heavyweights here.
Rs. 280 (usd 3.8) per kilo 
8/10 

Badam Halwa
Garnished with chironji seeds and slivers of pistachio and almonds, the halwa is rich with the reduced milk solid, ghee and the grainy bite of coarsely ground almonds. Although, the Mysore Pak is traditionally more popular here, the badam halwa comes a close second. 
Rs. 640 (usd 8.7) per kilo 
9.5/10 


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 1030am to 9pm 
Note: They have no branches, to taste what I tasted, visit the original shop located in Vijayapura town by following the google coordinates given below. To ensure their fare is always fresh and given the family-run nature of this sweetshop, Sri Chikkaveeranna Sweets prepares limited quantities each day. It is best to call ahead and ensure you get your quota of the mithai and khaara items here.
ADDRESS -  Sri Chikkaveeranna Sweets, Shidlaghatta Road, Vijayapura Town, Karnataka 562110; tel: +91 98458 88499
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/xqwjrMmLnYZCM9Ct8

Title: ROYAL MESS | This Couple Serves Memorable Hyderabadi Mughlai Food At Their Mysuru Home Eatery!
Description:
#restaurantathome #mysore #mughlai

home eatery in mysore, royal mess, mughlai, hyderabadi cuisine, mutton kheema, mutton masala, butter chicken, korma, biryani, kheer, sameena khanum, homestyle food in mysore

When Sameena Khanum‚Äôs husband retired from his job overseas, she decided to do something on her own to support the family. Her love for cooking led her to open a tiny eatery at home with two tables only, catering initially to college students yearning for home-cooked meals. Entirely self-taught, Mrs. Khanum serves up a repertoire of Hyderabadi-Mughlai dishes, assisted by her husband and children. A meal here is not just about delicious sustenance but also about the warming hospitality with which one is welcomed and served, as I discovered when I dropped into Royal Mess late one evening. Hope you enjoy this episode; take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Mutton Kheema
The mutton kheema is coarse and grainy, cooked with meat on the bone, that results in a deep-flavoured, warming dish. The sort that makes it a must-try here.
Rs. 350 (usd 4.8) for a large portion.
9/10

Mutton Masala
Flavoured with the gentle sweet flavours of fresh tomato and the savouriness of onions, the masala is tasty. The meat is soft, there‚Äôs a bit of fat that one needs to work through. One could request for slightly less fat, makes for an enjoyable dish. 
Rs. 400 (usd 5.5) for a large portion.
8.5/10

Chilli Chicken
A homestyle chilli chicken that is spiced with green chillies and red chilli powder and plenty of garlic. There are onions and capsicum too. A chilli chicken that isn‚Äôt as spicy as one would expect it to be. 
Rs. 220 (usd 3) for a large portion.
7.5/10

Butter Chicken
A rich cashew nut gravy that had a tad too much dried fenugreek garnish for my liking, the meat, a bit of a bite. 
Rs. 220 (usd 3) for a large portion.
7/10

Chicken Biryani
Made with long-grained basmati rice, the flavourful masala is an amalgam of fried onions, tomatoes, yoghurt and Mrs. Khanum‚Äôs home-blended spice mix. The biryani had cooled down a bit, rendering the rice slightly dry and the meat a fibrous bite. Ensure that you arrive at Royal Mess when the biryani is freshly made to savour this preparation.  
Rs. 175 (usd 2.4) 
7.5/10 

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 1230pm to 1030pm 
Note: Portions are large and easily shared between two people. Given the nature of the eatery, located in a home, it is best to call ahead and go to ensure you get what you are looking for. They also accept orders in advance for special dishes.
ADDRESS -  Royal Mess, 4th Cross Rd, S S Nagar, Siddique Nagar, Bannimantap, Mysuru, Karnataka 570015; tel: +91 99024 19612
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/nbAk8UeeQcvzUvo2A

Title: Exploring SAPA Sourdough & Pastry | Mysuru‚Äôs Charming New Dessert Caf√© | Must-Try Chocolate Tart!
Description:
#mysore #coffee #desserts

new coffee house in mysore, caf√©, sapa sourdough and pastry, bakery, gokulam, chocolate tart, cheesecake, tea cake, flat white coffee, wheelchair accessible

On a recent trip to Mysuru, I ventured into this cafe that in a short span of time seems to have charmed denizens of this city of palaces with its refreshing vibe, scrumptious bakes and delectable pastries. Hope you enjoy this short video of my tryst with SAPA Sourdough & Pastry, where I gave my heart to a decadent salted caramel chocolate tart! Take care, stay safe and happy eating! 

Chocolate Chip Tea Cake
Buttery and gooey with the chocolate chip, this is the sort of cake that could potentially make for  a great accompaniment to the coffee. I found it a bit crumbly though.
Rs. 110 (usd 1.5)
7/10

Oat Crumble & Vanilla Sour Cream Cheesecake
A rich cheesecake with a slightly sour twang that is balanced by an oat crumble crust. With its delicate whiff of vanilla, this makes for an enjoyable cheesecake. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
8/10

Chocolate Tart
A must-try dessert here, layers of dark chocolate and salted caramel ensconced in a ‚Äòbiscuity‚Äô chocolate tart shell, topped with pistachio crumb. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
10/10

Coffee
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
7/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

Hope you enjoy the first part of this amazing Coorg holiday experience at The Tamara, stay tuned for part two. 
Take care, stay safe and happy eating!

Title: Traditional Breakfast At New SHIVALLI | Kotte Kadubu, Rajamudi Dosa, Kuchalakki Ganji, Ragi Ambli
Description:
#mysorehighway #vegetarian #breakfast

popular restaurant on mysore highway, shivalli restaurant, mtr shivalli, mudagere, channapatna, bangalore mysore road, kotte kadubu, rajamudi rice, neer dosa, dose, kuchalakki, boiled rice, finger millet, ragi ambli, healthy food, healthy breakfast, highway breakfast, wheelchair accessible

One of the earliest eateries on the Bengaluru - Mysuru route, Shivalli has recently emerged after an extensive renovation that imparts this 20-year-old popular highway destination a breezy, contemporary vibe that comes as a breath of fresh air in current times. It is heartening to note though that the food remains as traditional as ever, in fact, with some ‚Äònew‚Äô additions seeking to convey to diners the wholesome flavours of the good old days. On a recent drive to Mysuru, I stopped by for a delicious breakfast of nourishing porridge, kuchalakki (boiled rice) ganji, tenginkai haalu (coconut milk) ganji, ragi (finger millet) ambli, and also tasted a scrumptious neer dosa made of the very special Rajamudi rice, and their much-favoured kotte kadubu. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and happy eating! 

Kotte Kadubu
Soft and slightly grainy, the kadubu is a much-sought-after breakfast delicacy here; savour it with their flavourful south canara sambar and spicy ‚Äòkai‚Äô chutney
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
8/10

Thenginkai Ganji
Rice soaked in coconut milk and topped with a lashing of ghee. Pleasant in its aroma, flavour and texture, this is a porridge to savour if you‚Äôd like something light post a heavy meal the evening before. The cucumber served alongside provides an element of crunch. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
7/10

Kuchalakki Ganji
Boiled rice, sourced from Kundapur, cooked simply with salt and served with a drizzle of hot ghee. Comforting in its nourishing flavours, the rice retains its form and is soft to the bite, having lent some of its starchy heft to the broth. The hand pounded chutney of green chillies, fresh coconut and rock salt provides a spicy edge to the ganji. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
8/10

Ragi Ambli
The cumin is dominant in its flavour in this earthy but sumptuous broth of finger millets. There is also a delicate tinge of green chilli heat and pepper. 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
7/10

Neer Dosa
The Rajamudi rice lends a brownish tinge to the dose, and also a crusty crunch. The dose is roasted with generous lashings of ghee, ensure you ask for your dose to be kadak. The flavours are quite unlike a traditional neer dose; although enjoyable on its own when hot, the bela kai, jaggery with fresh grated coconut makes for a delicious companion. If you like a touch of spice, there is the chutney too.
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
9/10

Filter coffee
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
8/10


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 7am through 930pm, open all days. 
Note: On google maps, the eatery comes up as MTR SHivalli restaurant, it has no connection to MTR restaurants. Google maps will take you to the eatery on the left hand side of the highway enroute to Mysuru; however the eatery that we visited is on the opposite side a few metres down the road.
ADDRESS -  Mudagere, Channapatna, Bangalore, Mysore Rd, Channapatna, Karnataka 562160; tel: +91 99805 12450
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/UVjUhU6qW44ZycHAA

Title: Lunch At LAKSHMAN MESS | Mysore‚Äôs Famous Naati (Local) Non Veg Eatery |Mutton Pulav, Curries & Fries
Description:
#mysuru #lakshmanmess #muttonpulav

popular eatery in mysuru, must-try, non vegetarian, naati style cuisine, local, affordable, mutton pulav, mutton curry, mutton fry, chicken kebab, khaima unde, inspiring story, mysore 

Armed with recipes gleaned from his mother, Lakshman quit his job at a spice shop, to begin a small pushcart operation to serve the non-vegetarian delicacies of his home. Bit by bit, the reputation of his food grew, and after 20 years of eking out a living on the streets, Lakshman was finally able to move into a tiny shop where customers could finally dine away from the bustle of the street. A few years later, the landlord wanted his space back, and faced with no option, he tore down his home to build a permanent space for Lakshman Mess. A eatery that has all of Mysuru thronging here for their honestly-priced limited menu that includes a delicately flavoured pulav, homestyle meaty preparations cooked by Lakshman and his son, Satya, with masalas ground at home. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care, stay safe and happy eating! 

Chicken Kebab
Mild in its flavours, the batter has a flavourful crunch that could have enlivened the taste of the kebab had it seeped all the way into the meat.
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2)
7/10

Mutton Chops
Chunks of meat that have a bit of bite, cooked in a delicious masala that is dominant in the flavour notes of coriander and mint, and the aroma of the special spice blend. The pepper coconut milk adds a layer of creamy warmth. This is the sort of dish that makes for an appropriate side dish to taste with the demure pulav. 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4)
9/10

Mutton Pulav
Delicately flavoured and moist, the Lakshman Mess pulav employs a combination of the long-grained basmati and short-grained rice varieties. You taste the faint edge of the green chili alongside the mint and coriander, the whole spices too aren‚Äôt the sort that dominate the palate. The meat is tender and juicy. I loved the pulav as is for its demure character, but if you like yours spicy, savour it with the meaty curries.
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
9/10

Kaima
Minced mutton balls simmered in a spicy gravy, spicy when compared to the mutton curry and pulav. 
Rs. 50/ 100 (usd 0.7/ 1.4) for half/ full portion
8/10

Mutton Fry
Curry leaves meet soy sauce in this mutton stir-fry, a dish created for the benefit of locals who wanted something different, I found this a slightly discordant fit on the Lakshman mess menu.
Rs. 105 (usd 1.5) 
7.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 7am through 11pm, closed on Mondays.
Note: The mutton pulav and boti is quite popular and runs out soon, get there early to taste it.. 
ADDRESS -  No.87, 1,k 46/1, Santhepete Rd, Behind Mysuru City Corporation, KR Mohalla, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570024; tel: +91 821 243 0269/ +91 99868 45777

Title: Must-Try Mysore‚Äôs Very Popular KUKKARAHALLI LAKE Breakfast Tradition | DEEPU GAADI & MYSURU KAAPI
Description:
#mysuru #breakfast #coffee

popular breakfast spot in mysuru, food in mysore, mysore food trail, traditional, south indian tiffin, dosa, dose, set dosa, thatte idli, filter coffee, kukkarahalli lake, mysore 

Every city has its popular morning traditions, Mysuru too has its share of them. A delicious one though seems to be that of going for a long walk around Kukkarahalli lake followed by a steaming, hot breakfast at a food rickshaw, Upahara Darshini, popularly known as Deepu Gaadi. The popular draw here is the set masala, smaller than your usual dosa, perhaps to let its fans indulge in more than one of these scrumptious beauties. On a recent dash into Mysuru, I took time out to experience half of this popular tradition, no points for guessing which half, followed by a delicious cup of filter kaapi. Hope you enjoy this breezy watch. Take care, stay safe and happy eating!
 
Breakfast At Upahara Darshini (Deepu Gaadi)
I paid Rs. 70 (usd 1) for a single thatte idli with a vade, and a plate of set masala dose. The thatte idli is soft, a bit pasty, but goes well with the chutney. The set masala dosa though is the dish to try here. The dose is well roasted, crisp and translucent in the centre, revealing flecks of a spicy red chutney smeared within. 
8/10 overall 

Filter Coffee At Mysuru Kaapi
The coffee is thick, strong and just the sort of beverage to wash down an indulgent ghee-laden breakfast.
Rs. 12 (usd 0.2)
8/10


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Breakfast commences from 7am through 11am.
Note: Get to Kukkarahalli lake and ask for Deepu Gaadi, located in a lane opp the lake. 
ADDRESS -  
tel: +91 99729 22227 (Deepu Gaadi), +91 81057 47679 (Mysuru Kaapi)
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/SrNc6V99rbrMPZXv5

Title: Tasting Karnataka‚Äôs Famous BANNUR MUTTON In Bannur | Bandur Sheep | Lunch At BANNUR MILITARY HOTEL
Description:
#bannurmutton #biryani #karnataka

bannur mutton explained, bandur sheep, bandur village, malavalli, mandya, bannur, mysore, mutton biryani, mutton fry, mutton kheema, bannur military hotel, ramaswamy hotel, mutton meal

The Bannur mutton, Karnataka‚Äôs most prized mutton, isn‚Äôt actually from Bannur. It is the meat of an indigenous variety of sheep that hails from Bandur, a village located between Malavalli and Bannur near Mysuru. Prized for its juicy tender meat, the sheep was traditionally sold in village shanties in Bannur, ergo the acquired moniker, Bannur. I drove to Bannur to learn more about this sheep and also catch a mutton meal at a family eatery, Bannur Ramaswami Military Hotel, that showcases this very special meat in its homestyle preparations. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating! 

Nati Koli Kurma
The chicken has a bit of a chew, a character of the free range chicken, there‚Äôs a bit of skin too that adds to the flavourful character of the homestyle curry, which is the sort that goes well with the ragi mudde.
Rs. 110 (usd 1.5) 
8/10

Kaima Sambar
Dumplings of rough-ground mutton simmered in a curry, the meat has a springy bite to it. There is also some dil that lends its aroma to the meat balls. 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) 
8.5/10

Mutton Fry
The fat of the Bannur mutton is ribonned through the meat that is deep in its slightly salty, savoury flavours. The curry isn't too spicy, and is quite happy playing second fiddle to the flavour of the meat.
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1) 
8.5/10

Bannur Mutton Biryani
You can nose the kasoori methi (dried fenugreek) in the aroma of the biryani, there‚Äôs the warming heat of the red chillies and spices that you can taste on the palate, a touch of tang from the tomatoes‚Ä¶ the kolam rice is tasty all in itself, also having absorbed the character of the meat. The meat is soft and moist, deep pink in its colour and veined with fat. This is a biryani you should eat hot, do not allow it to cool down for the fat tends to congeal. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2) 
9/10 

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 9am to 11pm
Note: Like with most popular eateries, this one too has its share of imitators. Make sure you visit the right one to savour the original Bannur mutton. Do refer to the google maps coordinates below.
ADDRESS -  Bannur Military Hotel (Ramaswamy Hotel), MM road Bannur, near Bharath petrol bunk, Bannur, Karnataka 571101; tel: +91 94489 79333
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/bannurmilitaryhotel?share

Title: Serving Delicious Wood Fire Idlis For 50 Years | Original KOTE IDLI KANAKAPURA| 4 Idlis Rs. 10 Only!
Description:
#idlichutney #kanakapura #karnataka

must try idli shop, kote idli, popular village style wood fire idlis, kempu chutney, red chutney, kanakapura, kanakapura road, karnataka, near bengaluru, bangalore, idli chutney, popular breakfast, inspiring story, culinary tradition

After completing the 10th grade, a young lad decided to help his father in their village idli shop in Kanakapura, 60 kilometres from Bengaluru. Half a century on, Mr. Ramchandra has remained steadfast to his father‚Äôs culinary tradition, steaming fragrant idlis over a wood fire. A one-man army, he procures the ingredients, prepares the wood to fuel the decades-old stove, soaks the rice and lentils, grinds and carefully ferments the batter, before rising at 4am each morning to make a spicy chutney, and steam over 3000 idlis, 500 in a batch, that run out before noon! Working with the energy and enthusiasm that is hard to imagine in a modern-day sextagenarian, Ramchandra swears by the philosophy of ‚Äúcheap and best‚Äù, in his words, selling four piping-hot idlis for only Rs. 10, or Rs. 2.50 a piece! The quality and appeal of the soft, fluffy idlis are such that patrons don't mind a two-hour drive just to breakfast at this old-fashioned Kote Idli Mane. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating!

Idlis
The idlis are soft and porous, yielding with a slightly pasty texture in its weight. The size of the idlis are such that you can happily savour about four to six without feeling its burden. The spicy, roasted gram and red chilli chutney makes for a delicious accompaniment to the fragrant idlis. 
Rs. 10 (usd 0.1) for four idlis
9/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 630am to 12noon
Note: Do not be misled by another Kote Idli shop that has opened at the entrance of the street where the original Kote Idli is located. Venture into the lane to find the original Kote Idli, a nondescript village house, where you will find Mr. Ramchandra preparing the idlis.
ADDRESS -  Kote Idli, #147, Agrahara Rd, opp. Hamsavahini" School, Fort, Kanakapura, Karnataka 562117; tel: +91 99865 15860
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/7ERXcvWWdjiEN8DE7

Title: Making Of Famous Village Style HALLI JONNE BIRIYANI | From Pushcart To Popular Biryani Eatery!
Description:
#biryani #jonnebiryani #bangalore

popular jonne biryani shop, donne biryani, bengaluru biryani, jayanagar, mutton biryani, chicken biryani, mutton chops, chilli chicken, chicken curry, leg piece, mutton kheema, inspiring story, jayanagar, bangalore

As the oldest son in his family of modest means, Ningaraju was compelled to look for work as a student. His fondness for food and his ability to recall the flavour of dishes from local eateries led him to set up a pushcart on the outskirts of Bengaluru, serving a self-taught village-style biryani. In the beginning, ‚Äúthings were difficult, sometimes humiliating and marked by periods of self-doubt‚Äù, recalls Raju, as he is popularly known. Giving up though wasn‚Äôt an option, driven also by the necessity to provide for his family. Slowly, the popularity of his mild-flavoured biryani served in cups of dried banana leaves, jonne, grew, and so did the scale of his enterprise. Today, this resilient entrepreneur‚Äôs Halli Jonne Biryani occupies prime real estate in Jayanagar, South Bengaluru, and is frequented by over 500 customers on any given day. I catch up with Raju as he makes the biryani before sitting down to a tasting of most of the dishes on the limited menu here. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating!

Kaal Soup
The soup is peppery, infused with the freshness of coriander.
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
8/10

Khaima Goju
The mutton mince is coarse, there‚Äôs a rustic rawness to the masala that is smoothed by the fluffy texture of the idli.
Rs. 130 (usd 1.8)
8.5/10

Chicken Leg Piece
Cooked soft and tender to the bone, you can taste the pungency of ginger garlic that‚Äôs softened by the acidity of tomatoes.
Rs. 130 (usd 1.8)
8/10

Mutton Fry
Some of the meat is soft and tender, with a bit of fat, others have a bit of a bite. You can taste the coriander and the pointed heat of green chillies in the masala. The flavours are mild but satisfying.
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
9/10

Mutton Liver Fry
The peas make for a nice touch in this gentle gravy; some of the liver pieces though were a bit tough.
Rs. 130 (usd 1.8)
7.5/10

Chilli Chicken
An unusual chilli chicken, you can taste the fresh flavours of the green chilli as opposed to its heat. The mildest chilli chicken I have ever tasted.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6)
8.5/10

Chicken Kabab
The kabab is scrumptious and flavourful, the chicken is moist and seasoned well, but doesn‚Äôt hold on to the spicing of the batter.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6)
7/10

Chicken Biryani
The seeraga samba rice is stained pastel yellow with a tinge of green, reminding one that this biryani hasn‚Äôt borne the brunt of a masala overload. Not the sort of biryani that one will smell from a mile away, the flavours though are the sort that reveal to the palate the ingredients that have gone into its making. You can taste the tingling heat of the green chilli, the freshness of the coriander and mint, the veil of fragrance from the spices register. A biryani that also brings to the fore the flavour of the seeraga samba rice. If you like it spicy, you may need to taste it with the curries that are served alongside the biryani. 
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
8.5/10

Mutton Biryani
The mutton has rounded off the flavours of biryani, as opposed to the chicken version. The meat is tender and moist, its fat laden flavours the sort that compels one to draw a bit of the meat in every scoop of the rice. These biryanis are perhaps the lightest donne biryanis one has tasted.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.5)
9/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 730am to 4pm; 6pm to 10pm
Note: Closed on Mondays. This is a rather busy restaurant, prepare to share tables if you get one, there is a stand and eat option too for those in a hurry. If you‚Äôd like to savour the Halli Jonne fare in peace, best to takeaway or order in. 
ADDRESS -  Halli Jonne Biryani, #44, 4, 13th Main Rd, opp. BHS College, 4th T Block East, KV Layout, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560011; tel: +91 2663 3886/ 96637 11666
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/ofKkRxRW9uwhv4XY8

Title: Will You Do One Simple Thing To Help The Community Of WheelChair Users Access Great Food?
Description:
#wheelchairaccessible #gourmetontheroad #kripalamanna  

wheelchair accessible, hashtag, facebook, instagram, twitter, youtube, wheelchair accessible restaurants, eateries, food lovers tv 

Great food should be physically accessible to all food lovers, shouldn‚Äôt it? But the sad truth is, it isn‚Äôt! I recently received a message from one of our viewers speaking from experience of the challenges that those in wheelchairs face, trying to manoeuvre from their vehicle on the street onto the sidewalk, the premises, and then to the eatery. To help the community of wheelchair users, can you try and do one simple thing. 

When you put up a restaurant post on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or any other social media, include the hashtag #wheelchairaccessible in your post in case the restaurant is.

Let‚Äôs try and help build a resource of #wheelchairaccessible eateries for those who rely on wheelchairs for mobility. Do share, repost and help spread the word. üôèüôè

#gourmetontheroad #kripalamanna #foodloverstv #foodloversindia #truthinfood 


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

Title: CALICUT‚ÄôS TOP FOOD TRAIL Pt 1| Paragon, Amma Hotel, Rahmath, Bombay Hotel, MS Sarbath, Kumaran Chips
Description:
#kozhikode #gourmetontheroad #kerala

most popular, must-try restaurants in calicut, must-eat-at eateries, popular food destinations, paragon restaurant, amma hotel, rahmath hotel, bombay hotel, bhaskarettan ms sarbath, kumaran‚Äôs banana chips, kozhikode chicken biryani, mutton biryani, fish fry, evening snacks, biryani tea, kozhikode, kerala

When it comes to vying for the best food destination honours in ‚ÄòGod‚Äôs own country‚Äô, Kerala, Calicut, or Kozhikode, seems to trump the popularity charts. And for all the right seasons, we found out during our visit to this coastal destination last year. Here‚Äôs part one of our top Kozhikode picks: from the iconic Paragon, Kerala‚Äôs most popular restaurant, to the fabled fish fry and curry destination, Amma Hotel, to Rahmath‚Äôs traditional biryanis, the evening snacks at Bombay Hotel, Bhaskarettan‚Äôs Sarbath and scrumptious banana chips at Kumari‚Äôs, this compilation covers it all. Save it for your next visit to Kozhikode, and stay tuned for part 2 as well. Hope you enjoy this one, stay safe and happy eating!

Click on links below to check the full videos of featured eateries, and for details, address and google maps coordinates too.

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

Title: Karnataka Food Legend, SIHI KAHI CHANDRU Invited Me To His Hit TV Show, Bombat Bhojana!
Description:
#gourmetontheroad #kripalamanna #sihikahichandru 

sihi kahi chandru, karnataka‚Äôs most popular food television personality, actor, director, producer, bombat bhojana, food show, television, star suvarna, interview, cooking, recipe, dosa, dose, dilruba dose, recipe, behind the scenes, bangalore

When it comes to food personalities in Karnataka, Sihi Kahi Chandru is perhaps one name that everyone knows. An acclaimed actor, director and producer, he has endeared himself in the hearts of every Kannadiga for his prolific food shows on television. Over the last couple of years that I have been producing Gourmet On The Road, I have received numerous comments requesting for a collab with him, so it was a pleasant surprise and an honour to receive a call from him inviting me as a guest to Bombat Bhojana, his show on Star Suvarna. In this vlog, I share a behind the scenes peek on my participation in the show and a quick conversation with the legend himself.

Hope you enjoy the vlog, and do tune in to the episode of Bombat Bhojana on Star Suvarna on 30th January at 12pm IST.

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,

Title: Exploring Bengaluru‚Äôs Love For The GOBI MANCHURIAN AT RAVI GOBI | Vegetarian Street Food
Description:
#gobimanchurian #ravigobi #banashankari

vegetarian, popular gobi manchurian, street food, auto, manchurian sauce, gobi, gobi dry, fried rice, cauliflower manchurian, cabbage manchurian, potato manchurian, baby corn manchurian, mushroom manchurian, banashankari, bangalore

Armed with the recipe for a crowd-pleasing manchurian sauce that he learnt from a chinese cook, 16 year-old Ravi set out with an auto 21 years ago to serve gobi manchurian in the South Bengaluru neighbourhood of Banashankari. Two decades on, Ravi Gobi seems to rule the heart of gobi manchurian lovers in the city, as evidenced by the number of customers who throng his vegetarian sidewalk eatery each evening. I caught up with Ravi and some of his happy patrons over an extended manchurian tasting session recently, where I savoured not only his popular cauliflower and cabbage versions, but also an equally appetising, babycorn, mushroom and potato variation too. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating!

Each dish on the Ravi Gobi menu is prepared fresh to order, every plate served piping hot and therefore necessitating a wait of 10 to 15 minutes. The gobi or potato/ mushroom/ baby corn, fried fresh, dressed in a chilli-salt spice mix to make the dry version, or tossed in a savoury manchurian sauce that has the fresh zing of coriander, green chillies, ginger, garlic and onions.
Babycorn Fry & Manchurian - 9/10
Cauliflower Manchurian - 8.5/10
Overall food rating - 8/10
Full plate - Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
Half plate - Rs. 35 (usd 0.5)

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 630pm to 1030pm
Note: Ravi makes the dishes fresh to order, so do factor in a bit of a wait.
ADDRESS -  Ravi Gobi Bindu Chinese Center, 1162, 22nd Main Rd, Siddanna Layout, Banashankari Stage II, Banashankari, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560070; tel: +91 97431 20661
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/BmbYQZKAQuyuvo3Z8

Title: This Man ‚ÄòInvented‚Äô The WHITE PAANI PURI! Tasting BANGARPET CHAAT At Ramesh Chit Chat In Bangarapet
Description:
#chaat #bangarapet #karnataka

bangarpet chaat, chaat innovation, white paani, vegetarian, white paani puri, pani puri, masala puri, sev puri, bangarpet tikki, pot gulkand salad, pizza paani puri, street food, pani puri, bangarapet, kolar district, kolar gold fields, kgf, karnataka

Son of R. Panduranga Setty, who is said to have begun the Bangarpet Chaat tradition in 1974 in Bangarapet, named so (Bangar = gold, pete = town) for its importance as a town that connected the erstwhile Kolar gold fields to Bengaluru, 80 kilometres away, young Ramesh, wasn‚Äôt happy just continuing with the family legacy. A desire to create something new led to the invention of the ‚Äòwhite paani‚Äô, a clear liquid that though as innocuous-looking as water, packs a potent, spicy punch. And thus began the tradition of the Bangarpet Paani Puri, that has spawned a few hundred namesakes in Karnataka. Ramesh however continues to operate out of his tiny shop in a bylane in Bangarapet, serving customers personally and experimenting constantly to add to his spicy, tangy repertoire. I spend an evening with him, tasting his wares, and return impressed with his childlike enthusiasm that doesn‚Äôt seem to have waned in the least despite being in the business for nearly four decades, his latest creation, a pizza inspired paani puri! Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

White Paani Puri
A simple assemblage of green peas, onions, carrots and coriander, stuffed in a semolina and flour puri, topped with the potent ‚Äòwhite paani‚Äô. The spiciness of paani though is toned down by the creaminess of the peas and the crunch of the onions. A simple, clean flavoured paani puri that allows one to appreciate every component singularly, as well as in its completeness. 
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
8.5/10

Special Dahi Puri
Embellished with rose petals, this chaat is a riot of flavours and textures. The crispiness of the chaat components and the spice of the masala play second fiddle to the creamy, sweet richness of the yoghurt that is fortified with Horlicks, milk powder and sugar. 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
10/10

Floating Paani Puri
The floating paani puri is a spicy affair, the spicy white paani goes into the puri and also floats the puri. The moist crispness of the puri is endearing as is the crunch of the spiced peanuts and the sev, despite the fresh crunch of the onion, cucumber and tomato, there is no getting away from the chilli heat of the sea of white paani. 
Rs. 40 (usd 0.6)
9.5/10

Tikki Masala Bangarpet
A take on the Bengaluru masala puri, this is puri topped with spicy chutney, sweet chutney, peas, garam masala, squeeze of lime, onions, carrots, coriander, sev and puffed rice. It has all the components that you would expect to find in a chaat without being overdressed! 
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
8.5/10

Special Sev Puri
The flat papdi base for this chaat is fried in ghee which gives it a rich, ‚Äòbiscuity‚Äô bite embellished with the nuttiness of sesame seeds. You can taste the edge of garlic in the chutney that the fresh ingredients are tossed in. 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
9/10

Bhelpuri
A typical bhel but with the addition of the peas gravy that goes into every plat of chaat here, I found this rendered the puffed rice soggy and that didn‚Äôt quite work for me.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
7/10

Pizza Paani Puri
I doff my hat to Ramesh on his latest attempt to innovate and bring a foreign flavour to the bylanes of Bangarapet. However, with regards to its taste and appeal, some may fancy it, yet others question its existence. 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4)
7/10

Spiced Amla
Rs. 30
7/10

Pot Gulkand Salad
Rs. 30
8/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 4pm to 10pm
Note:
ADDRESS -  Ramesh Chit Chat, Vijayanagar Road, near nandhi medical, Vivekanand Nagar, Bangarapet, Karnataka 563114; tel: +91 94481 85272
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/s93eS1YseBT6Sdoy7

Title: Blockbuster KGF - KAVERI GODAVARI FOODS | Tasty Curries, Dosa, Parotta Cooked In Wood Pressed Oil!
Description:
#foodtruck #tamilnadufood #bangalore

traditional tamil nadu, salem style, non-vegetarian, street fare, food truck, kalakki, mutton kari dosa, nati chicken, mutton chops, brain fry, pepper fry, podi dosa, east bengaluru, bengaluru 

When Prabhu, an automobile engineer with a major car company chose to pursue his entrepreneurial calling in food, a food truck didn't come across as a surprise to his father who encouraged him to pursue his dreams. After getting his hands on a Tempo Traveller, he drove it to Pune to fabricate a food truck that would serve up the meaty cuisine of his Tamil heritage with a smattering of influences from Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka as well. Back in Bengaluru, this culinary enterprise on wheels, Kaveri Godavari Foods, is slowly but surely gaining popularity in the neighbourhood it is parked in. Adding to its appeal is the fact that all dishes here are prepared at Prabhu‚Äôs home and cooked in wood-pressed oils extracted in the family‚Äôs oil mill. I drive 20 kilometres to East Bengaluru to catch up with this passionate engineer and experience the streetfood vibe here whilst savouring a bunch of tasty preparations - egg kothu parotta, kalakki podi dosa, mutton parotta, chops, nati chicken, brain fry and more. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating!
 
Mutton Brain Fry
Tava-fried with eggs in an aromatic, homemade masala, this is the dish to taste if you love brain meat; it quite simply melts in the mouth. The eggs also help make more of the dish that is perfect, mopped up with some parotta.
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
9/10

Kuzhambu Kalakki
A Salem egg staple, egg cooked skilfully such that it encloses within its folds a gooey, spicy egg mixture. Traditionally, this is eaten at the end of a non-vegetarian meal in Salem.
Rs. 15 (usd 0.2)
7.5/10

Mutton Kari Dosa
A fluffy dosa topped with coarse mutton mince, eggs and served with a spicy curry, this is the sort that makes for a satisfying one-dish meal or a big late-night snack.
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
7.5/10

Mutton Chops
Goat chops cooked in a gravy rich in the flavour of dark-roasted spices, this is a dish that will bring me back to KGF. The meat is the sort that peels away from the bone in a juicy, peppery bite. Order a plain dosa to soak up the curry.
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
10/10

Podi Dosa
One can smell the nutty aroma of the peanut oil that this dose has been roasted in. The dosa is smeared with an Andhra podi whilst being fried to a near crisp. A dose that goes ‚Äòcrunch‚Äô from the first bite to the last, with a slightly tangy edge.
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
9/10

Nati Chicken Pepper Fry
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
7.5/10

Chicken Stuffed Parotta
Rs. 100 (usd 1.9)
7.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

Title: SWAD - N - SWAD | This RAJASTHANI Couple Is Serving Delicious, HOME-COOKED Traditions Of Their Land!
Description:
#homecooked #rajasthanifood #bangalore

rajasthani food, vegetarian, non vegetarian, besan gatta, sev tamatar, lahsuni bhindi, tangdi kebab, rathodi chicken, junglee maas, laal maas, makki ki roti, roti, kheer,  inspiring story

Hailing originally from Surajpura Lotiyana village in Ajmer district of Rajasthan, Jithender and his wife, Renuka Tak, moved to Bengaluru with their young children having lost their automotive shop in the Ahmedabad earthquake of 2001. Facing financial difficulty, a chance encounter with a visiting relative at an exhibition who was looking for food to be catered led to the couple setting up a home-cooked meal enterprise. A family-run operation, they would shop, cook and deliver the food themselves, with their children lending a hand with the chores too.  However, work from home and the current situation bought their livelihood to a standstill yet again! Not one to give up though, this family has set-up a small one-table eatery in the east Bengaluru neighbourhood of Kaggadasapura, primarily to serve as a takeaway point for their delicious home-cooked Rajasthani fare, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. I drive here to chat with the couple, watch them cook a laal maas, sev tamatar and other dishes, before tucking into a delicious meal coupled with the warm hospitality of this Rajput family that has an inspiring, never-give-up attitude. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating!       

Tandoori Chicken Tangdi
Not cooked in a tandoor, but deep-fried and then fire-cooked with some ghee and spices, the chicken legs, marinated for hours in a spice mix, make for a juicy, char-smoked appetiser.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) for 2 pieces.
8/10

Lahsuni Bhindi Fry
Cooked with plenty of browned garlic, green chillies, this is a flavourful, though slightly spicy bhindi fry. 
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2)
7.5/10

Sev Tamatar
Spicy sev (chickpea fritters) are cooked in a tangy, thick tomato gravy that tones down the heat of the sev. The sev garnish also adds an element of crunch and spiciness to this simple but tasty preparation.
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2)
8/10

Besan Gatta
Spiced chickpea dumplings boiled and then cooked in a creamy, mild and slightly tangy, yoghurt based gravy, this is a traditional Rajasthani vegetable delicacy. Rs. 100 (usd 1.4)
8.5/10

Malai Chicken
Chicken, slow cooked with spices in milk that eventually thickens to cream (malai) and hence its name. The thick gravy is fortified with cashew nut paste, and smoked just before serving, adding to the richness and depth of flavour of this delicious chicken gravy
Rs. 170 (usd 2.3)
9/10

Rathodi Chicken Curry
A simple everyday sort of chicken curry. You can taste the coriander and the sweet aroma of the whole spices that have flavoured the curry. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
8/10

Junglee Maas
A derivative of the Laal Maas cooking process, the meat is removed before the stock is added to make the gravy. The meat is rich in the near caramelised sweetness of the onions, the warming heat of the mathania chillies and the aromatic spices that linger on the palate. 
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
10/10

Laal Maas
Similar in flavours to the junglee maas but fortified with meat stock, this curry may get its colour from the Mathania chilli, but it is quite gentle in the manner in which it greets your palate. 
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
9.5/10

Kheer
Rs. 70 (usd 0.9)
8.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 1pm to 1030pm
Note: Most of the dishes here are prepared fresh to order, so it is advisable to call at least half an hour to an hour ahead and order to minimise wait time. The family is running the show themselves without any assistance at this point; please be patient. Thank you.
ADDRESS -  Swad - n - Swad, No 1/108, RKR Complex Kaggadasapura main road, opposite 16th Cross, Kaggadasapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560093; tel: +91 95352 79210/ 74116 97935
