Title: GOPALJEE CAF√â | She Quit Her Job To Bring Authentic DELHI Style CHOLE BHATURE To BENGALURU!
Description:
#vegetarian #northindianfood #bangalore

gopaljee cafe, delhi chole bhature, delhi style food, north indian, vegetarian, paneer bhaturey, chole, suvigya bansal, passion enterprise, inspiring story

Corporate executive Suvigya Bansal and her entrepreneur husband would scour Bengaluru in search of an authentic Delhi-style chole bhature. When they found none, she decided to quit her job and set up a small eatery that would endeavour to dish out the flavours of their favourite chola bhatura from Delhi. And so seasoned cooks were hired from Delhi, a complex 58-spice masala developed to ensure authenticity of taste, the right size of chickpea sourced to convey the flavour of the spices, et al. Barely had this enterprise found its feet early last year when covid struck! I made a surprise visit to Gopaljee Caf√© one afternoon in response to a plea from the eatery. Suffice to say my conversation with this passionate lady entrepreneur and tasting of the puffy bhature and ‚Äòmazedaar‚Äô chole compelled us to return to film an episode of Gourmet On The Road. Hope you enjoy this one, enough to pay them a visit if possible. Stay safe and happy eating!  

Chole Bhature
The bhatura is light and puffy yet with a bit of strength, to match the tenacity of the 56-spice blend masala that is delicately warming yet has enough depth to linger on the palate. The chickpeas, cocooned in the flavour of the masala, a seasoning of oil, chilli and spices, are stained deep brown by some amla and cooked such that they retain their shape yet yield in a creamy texture to the bite. The mandatory topping of dry, spiced aloo (potatoes) adds a slightly tangy flavour to the dish. If you like it spicy, go for generous bites of the green chilli pickle in between mouthfuls of the chole bhature. If you like paneer, opt for the paneer chole bhature, which arrives with a paneer and coriander mince, stuffed into the bhaturas, and also atop the chole.
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) per plate, plain 
Rs. 125 (usd 1.7) per plate, with paneer
9/10

Lassi
The lassi is thick and creamy, garnished with nuts, and also provides cooling respite if you have ingested more of the green chilli than you can handle.
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7) 
8/10

Gulab Jamun
The way to end your meal if you have a sweet tooth is with their perfectly browned gulab jamuns.
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8) for two pieces
8/10 

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 9am to 9pm
Note: The chole bhature are served between 9am and 830pm; the bhaturas are fried fresh upon order, so it may involve a bit of a wait especially if crowded.
ADDRESS -  Gopaljee Caf√©, 17/1,chandra mansion, Marathahalli - Sarjapur Rd, Bellandur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102; tel: +91 90350 03283/ 91081 71715
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/9DLhEGH91svQpPWc6

Title: Move Over ‚ÄòKFC‚Äô, Krishnappa Gowda‚Äôs Fried Chicken (GFC) Is Here! NEW GOWDA‚ÄôS FRIED CHICKEN Bangalore
Description:
#friedchicken #biryani #bangalore

gowda fried chicken, fried chicken, gowda fried chicken, gfc chicken, chicken kebab, mandya recipe, mutton biryani, biryani, chicken 65, mysore road, bengaluru, bangalore

Fed up with labour problems in his vegetarian eatery of 35 years, Krishnappa Gowda closed doors 10 years ago to open a shop selling fried chicken, cooked by him to a secret recipe influenced by his Mandya roots. Such is the tantalising taste of this chicken kebab, that its fans drive across the city to stand and eat at this eatery located in a nook of Mysore road! An astute entrepreneur, and mindful of the popularity of his spice mix, Gowda has also developed packaged versions of the masala for those who would like to satisfy their fried chicken cravings at home. I make the trek to GFC and return convinced that this is perhaps the best local fried chicken I have tasted to date. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

Gowda‚Äôs Fried Chicken
Tender chicken, marinated for six hours in an aromatic, secret spice mix, Gowda‚Äôs Fried Chicken is the sort that is tantalisingly tasty. The masala serves to coat the kebab with a delicately spiced crust and seal its juicy bite; the chicken is cooked perfectly down to the bone. This is the sort of kebab that needs no accompaniment in the form of a chutney or onions.
Rs. 480 per kilo (usd 6.5)
10/10

Chicken 65
A tasty kebab in itself, slightly spicier when compared to the GFC. The masala has formed a bit of a thick crust in parts as the chicken is fried, which lends a spicy kick. And then there are those parts where it is the juiciness of the bird that gushes through the palate. 
Rs. 480 per kilo (usd 6.5)
8.5/10

Mutton Biryani
The biryani here, made of basmati and kollam rice is served in a sumptuous portion, and is rich in the flavour of the masala when hot. Some pieces of the meat are soft and slide off the bone, and ribboned in rich fat, yet others with a bit of bite. As the biryani cools down, the savoury fat-laden flavour of the meat takes over.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
8.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 7am to 10pm
Note: Most customers here take away the food, however, we recommend that the Gowda Fried Chicken is best consumed at the eatery, hot off the oil.
ADDRESS -  New Gowda‚Äôs Fried Chicken, No.52, 2nd Main, Mysore Rd, New Timberyard Layout, Narsimayya Colony, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560026; tel: +91 90669 98880
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/sSEHEN17cjxtbBZg6

Title: JAGLI TINDI | This Couple Is Reviving Traditional DAKSHINA KANNADA TIFFIN After Giving Up MNC Jobs!
Description:
#vegetarian #tiffin #bangalore

traditional vegetarian snacks from south canara, mangalore, kundapura in bengaluru, jagli tindi, jagli masala dosa, kotte kadubu, kolkatte, banana kesari bath, mandakki upakari, inspiring stories, couple goals, banashankari, south bengaluru 

An engineer and mba by education respectively, Raksha Prasad and Suhas Karanth began making plans to open an eatery that would serve traditional vegetarian tiffin of their native South Canara, during their courting days. Shortly after getting married, they gave up their MNC jobs and their eatery, Jagli Tindi was born, in a tiny nook in Kengeri, on the outskirts of Bengaluru, with a menu comprising mostly dishes gleaned from their grandma‚Äôs recipes, with ingredients sourced from Kundapura to lend authenticity to the taste. Two years on, this passion enterprise has moved to a slightly larger space in Banashankari, South Bengaluru, but the couple still remain hands-on, Suhas, in the kitchen, and Raksha managing the front of the house. I visit them to learn of their inspiring story, catch some of the action in the kitchen, before sitting down to a slightly indulgent tiffin session. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating!
 
Mandakki Upakari
Made with a red puffed rice that‚Äôs tossed with their ‚Äòsecret‚Äô podi mix and onions, topped with grated coconut and plenty of peanuts. This is the sort of fun snack that one should share with friends whilst you wait for some of the other substantial tiffin items.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
8/10

Kotte Kadubu 
The kotte kadubu here is made the traditional way, steamed in cups fashioned of jackfruit leaves that lends the kadubu a distinct aroma. There‚Äôs a hint of tartness from the fermentation, the red tomato chutney makes for a sprightly partner to the gentle flavoured kadubu, with its tangy, slightly spice, sour and nutty character. The vegetable sagu adds to the nutritional quotient of this tasty tiffin.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
9/10

Jagli Masala Dosa
This creation of Suhas Karanth seems to be inspired by the 99-variety dosa ilk. The dosa is smeared with a paste of potatoes, spicy podi and ghee, as it is roasted to a crisp on the tava. Folded, flattened and cut into two, this dosa creation makes for an interesting snack if you are the sort who is acquiesce to pushing the envelope for what a masala dosa can be.   
Rs. 58 (usd 0.8)
8.5/10

Kolkatte
Steamed in a banana leaf, this steamed dumpling of urad dal batter, is stained lightly with the colour of the leaf. Slightly pasty and dense in its texture, and studded with whole peppercorns that lend their tingling touch. Whilst the red chutney adds zing, next time, I would also ask for some of the nutritious vegetable saagu to complement the austerity of this steamed dumpling.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
8.5/10

Banana Kesari Bath
The ripe banana heroes this velvety-textured dish from the start to finish, definitely order a plate of this to close your tindi experience here.
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
9/10

Coffee
Rs. 10 (usd 0.1)
8/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 7am to 9pm
Note: This is a relatively young enterprise, please support them with your patience in case of a delay because of the response from this video. Thank you.
ADDRESS -  Jagli Tindi, 6th Block, 17, Outer Ring Rd, 3rd Phase, Banashankari 3rd Stage, Banashankari, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560085; tel: +91 97432 24899/ 81972 97719
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/jagli-tindi?share

Title: Best HOMESTYLE GOWDA Lunch at Hassan‚Äôs Popular MAMATHA HOTEL | Ragi Mudde, Mutton Korma, Katla Fry
Description:
#gowdacuisine #lunch #hassan

popular hassan restaurant, hotel mamatha, gowda food, katla fish fry, mutton biryani, mutton korma, ragi mudde, chicken fry, leg piece, gowda cuisine, naati cuisine, hassan food, mangalore hassan bangalore highway

I often find that the most memorable meals are usually those that happen rather unexpectedly. Like this delicious lunch that we savoured at  this popular eatery in Hassan, 210 kms from Bengaluru, a couple of months ago. Guided by suggestions from our viewers, I didn't quite know what to expect when I walked into a bustling lunch session here late one afternoon on our way back from Mangalore. But the memory of the rustic, homestyle Gowda dishes that I tasted here, lingers to this day. Suffice to say I would happily make the 210 km drive to Mamatha Hotel in a heartbeat just to savour the food all over again. Hope you enjoy the episode. I take this opportunity to wish you and your family a fabulous 2021. Take care and stay safe.

Katla Fry
Coated in a delicious spiced batter that complements the earth flavours of the freshwater fish, the katla fry is a popular dish here for all the right reasons. The crispened skin and the masala work well to cradle the fleshy fish.
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2) for 2 pieces
9/10

Mutton Korma
Notwithstanding bits of fat ribboned through it, the juicy chunks of meat have a bit of a bite. And as you chew on it, you are rewarded with the robust flavours of the curry. This is the sort of delicious mutton curry you would taste in a Gowda home in the area. Makes for a great accompaniment to the ragi mudde and steamed rice.
Rs. 170 (usd 2.3) 
9/10

Mutton Biryani
Flecks of fat abound in this biryani, that is redolent with the aroma of mint and coriander, and do well to coat the zesty, hard-spice laced rice with its unctuousness. The meat is mild in its flavour and benefits from being combined with the rice.
Rs. 210 (usd 2.9)
7.5/10

Chicken Leg Piece
The chicken is tender and juicy, the masala has penetrated deep into the meat that is cooked through to the bone. The spicy batter that crumbs the chicken has depth of flavour that is quite endearing.
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9) for 2 pieces 
9/10

Chicken Fry
The chicken pieces, in a slightly thick gravy, have bits of skin clinging to it.  
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
7/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 1230pm to 10pm
Note: Sundays, 1230pm to 5pm; opt to sit upstairs, it is less crowded.
ADDRESS -  Mamatha Hotel, Bangalore - Mangalore Rd, Beside Bhanu Theater, Karigowda Colony, Rangoli Halla, Hassan, Karnataka 573201; tel: +91 72599 23131
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/CR8dUgVM52ETGYgA8

Title: 90-Year SHIVAJI MILITARY HOTEL, Bangalore‚Äôs Most Popular DONNE BIRYANI Opens Dine-In After 8 Months!
Description:
#donnebiryani #lunch #bengaluru

popular biryani restaurant, donne biryani, shivaji military hotel, popular biryani, mutton biryani, chicken biryani, mutton dry, chilli chicken, kaal soup, mutton liver, jayanagar, banashankari, bangalore, bengaluru

When Bengaluru emerged from lockdown months ago, Lokesh and Rajiv, the brothers behind Shivaji Military Hotel took a conscious decision to not reopen dine-in until the situation got better. This meant foregoing a substantial chunk of revenues and relying on takeaway business only, but this was something they were prepared to live with, for the safety of their customers and staff. So when they reopened the eatery to customers a couple of weeks ago, we lost no time in getting there to savour their hugely popular donne biryani and also report on the current experience at this 90-year old culinary institution that has a reputation for being jam packed with customers. We arrived to find certain measures in place, even though in precarious danger of being overrun by its patrons. Thankfully though, the taste of the donne biryani hasn't wavered a bit from the time we tasted it last nearly a year ago. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating!

Kaal Soup
A warming, gently-spiced mutton bone broth, the trotters are cleaned well and cooked to melt-in-the-mouth texture.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
8.5/10

Chicken Donne Biryani
The biryani is served steaming hot and is impressionable in its persistent aroma and spicy, flavourful fervour laced with green chilli heat. We tasted the donne biryani in takeaway mode where it is packed in foil, but it's not quite the same as when it is ladled onto a donne, a container fashioned of leaves. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
9/10

Mutton Donne Biryani
The biryani has a slightly smokey tone, and the spices imbued with the weight of the fat and the character of the meat, is rounded in its flavour as opposed to the chicken biryani. The meat is juicy and has absorbed the flavour of the masala rather well. This is the textbook donne biryani, served by this revered culinary institution for the last nine decades. 
Rs. 260 (usd 3.5)
10/10

Chilli Chicken
The chicken is moist, bathed in a green chilli gravy, this is certainly not a dish for the faint-hearted. 
Rs. 180 (2.4)
8.5/10

Mutton Pepper Dry
Tender meat braised in a deep roasted masala with plenty of pepper. 
Rs. 230 (usd 3.1)
9/10

Mutton Liver Fry
The liver has a bit of a bite, its deep flavours juxtapose delightfully against the contrasting freshness of coriander and mint in the green masala.
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
8.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 10am to 4pm
Note: please call ahead to verify timings and dish availability on account of the current situation; closed on Mondays.  
ADDRESS -  Shivaji Military Hotel, No. 718, 1st C Main, 45th Cross, 8th Block, Jayanagar, Bangalore 560 082; tel: +91 98451 49217
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/mZqgz8ZNB4C8e5s38

Title: Flavours of East Godavari At KAKINADA SUBBAIAH GARI HOTEL Bangalore | 30-Dish Vegetarian Andhra Meal
Description:
#vegetarian #lunch #subbayyagarihotel

popular andhra restaurant, new restaurant, andhra food, subbayya gari hotel, subbaiah gari hotel kakinada, east godavari, kakinada cuisine, andhra sweets, subbaiah hotel hyderabad, subbaiah hotel, banana leaf meal, special lunch, andhra bhojanam, brookefield, whitefield, bangalore, bengaluru

In the year 1950, Subbayya Gaaru opened a small 10-seater mess in Kakinada in the East Godavari region of Andhra Pradesh to serve honestly-priced food of the land. Legend has it that he would treat each customer as a guest visiting his home and leave no stone unturned in feeding them. Tales of his legendary hospitality and traditional fare soon spread far and wide and this tiny eatery evolved into the legendary Subbaiah Gari chain of restaurants. I visit their newly opened Bengaluru outpost where I explore the kitchen and the making of some special dishes before savouring a lavish 30-item banana leaf meal that is served with dollops of neyi (ghee) and old-fashioned hospitality that can leave you bursting at the seams! I also brush up on some Telugu along the way. ;-)  Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe. Happy eating! 

Special Vegetarian Meal
If you‚Äôre looking to savour the traditional flavours of the North Godavari region in Andhra Pradesh, look no further than this special 30-dish Andhra Bhojanam. You begin with tantalising sweets like annavaram prasadam, poornam boorelu, junnu, savoury fries like the tamalapaku (betel leaf) bajji, garelu, before moving on to the procession of curries, lentils, tantalising rice preparations like the pullihora (tamarind rice), panasa (raw jackfruit) mukkala biryani and chutneys. The list of dishes served is far too long to be contained within this description, but suffice to say the food prepared by the master cooks who have trained in the original Kakinada Subbayya Gaari Hotel will hold your attention. But then, this is also the sort of meal that you need to savour at leisure, in order to do full justice to the dishes that are served with generous dollops of neyi (ghee) and old-fashioned hospitality. 
Rs. 250 (usd 3.4)
9/10


Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Lunch - 11am to 4pm; Dinner - 7pm to 10pm 
Note: Note: Subbaiah Gari also serves their famous Butta Bhojanam, a takeaway meal bundle that will feed 4 to 6 diners for Rs. 400. Those with a smaller appetite can consider the ‚Äòsingle meals‚Äô that are priced at Rs. 150 with a limited selection of dishes. Curries are also available at Rs. 50 per portion. 
ADDRESS -  Subbaiah Gari Hotel, 1, ITPL Main Rd, MLayout, Brookefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560037; tel: +91 82774 00123
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/nGsLxrfuW4QgLe5W6

Title: This New NORTHWEST KEBAB & CURRYHOUSE Serves Tasty Kebabs And Curries Beyond The Usual North Indian!
Description:
#bangalore #kebabs #curries

new restaurant, restaurant with a cause, inspiring stories, north west frontier cuisine, kebabs, curries, tandoor, sigri, barbeque, vegetarian, non vegetarian, north indian food, koramangala, bengaluru

In the current climate of gloom and doom, Chefs Sanjay Tyagi and Shyam Sundar Bhaskaran, both seasoned culinary professionals with stints in some top Indian kitchens in the country and overseas, have launched a culinary enterprise to not just serve delicious fare but also, more importantly in our opinion, provide livelihoods to chefs and f&b professionals who have lost their jobs at some of the city‚Äôs top hotels. The result is Northwest Kebab & Curryhouse, a breezy casual dining restaurant in Koramangala, that is showcasing an interesting repertoire of dishes from the North West Frontier region. Barely a couple of weeks old, and with not too many customers at present, this is certainly an eatery to pencil into your eating-out plans if you are looking to taste ‚ÄúNorth Indian-style‚Äù of food that goes beyond the ubiquitous palak paneer and butter chicken! Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

Mewe Aur Subz Ki Seekh
A delicately spiced kebab that offers the richness of reduced milk solids, dry fruits and the freshness of vegetables that intermingles with the gentle spice of chillies.
Rs. 289 (usd 3.9)
8/10 

Paneer Parathdar
Marinated paneer, that is soft and creamy to the bite, stuffed with a slightly spicy, tangy paste of sun dried tomatoes. 
Rs. 289 (usd 3.9)
8.5/10 

Teekhi Machli
A dish that is a confluence of the North, in the mustard oil, and the South, toasted curry leaves and tamarind, that go to flavour the masala that the tilapia is tava-fried in. 
Rs. 429 (usd 5.8)
9/10 

Tabak Maaz
Tender lamb that is braised in saffron, spices and milk, and then finished with ghee. At Northwest Kebab & Curry House, the braised meat is then coated in a light batter and fried. The juicy succulence of the fat and the ghee is what one tastes on the palate as the meat peels away from the bone. 
Rs. 439 (usd 6)
9/10

Chicken Behari/ Mutton Behari
A moist and gently flavoured grilled morsel of meat with none of the heavy handed spicing that one would associate with a North Indian Kebab. My vote though goes to the mutton version of this kebab where the tenderiser has imparted a creamy texture to the smokey flavours of the meat.
Rs. 389 (usd 5.3)/ Rs. 439 (usd 6)
8.5/10 / 9.5/10

Bhindi Musallam
Slit and spiced tender ladyfingers that are fried and topped with a rich musallam gravy of almonds and heavy cream, and garnished with beaten silver, rose petals and saffron oil. 
Rs. 289 (usd 3.9)
8/10

Methi Malai Kofta
Paneer and potato dumplings stuffed with prunes and nuts, cooked in a tomato and cream based gravy laced with the slightly bitter edge of fresh fenugreek.  
Rs. 339 (usd 4.6)
8.5/10

Murg Shinwari Karahi
A rustic preparation that one would perhaps encounter on a highway stop in the NorthWest, one tastes the untamed flavours of ginger, green chillies, coriander seeds in this chicken dish that is prepared and served in cast iron karahi
Rs. 429 (usd 5.8)
8.5/10

Nalli Rogan E Nishat
If you are a mutton lover, this is a must-order dish here. The curry bears the lip-smacking goodness of tender meat and bone marrow, the meat the sort that not just slides off the bone but almost melts away when placed in the mouth.
Rs. 499 (usd 6.8)
10/10

Dal Makhni 
Rs. 289 (usd 3.9)
7.5/10

Zaffrani Pulao
Rs. 249 (usd 3.34)
8/10

Husn E Ara
Rs. 129 (1.7)
7.5/10

Samak Ke Chawal Ki Phirni
Rs. 129 (1.7)
9/10

Sheer Kurma
Rs. 129 (1.7)
8.5/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Lunch - 12 to 3pm; Dinner - 630 to 1130pm 
Note: Although the team is one with a fair bit of experience, this is a new restaurant trying to find its feet. Please be patient and do call ahead to reserve.

Title: Exploring SATTVIC Cuisine At THE HIGHER TASTE, ISKCON TEMPLE | Food That Satisfies The Soul!
Description:
#vegetarian #sattvic #krishnatemple

temple cuisine, sattvic cuisine,  indian food, vegetarian food, krishna temple, iskcon, rajajinagar,  bangalore, bengaluru

Temple food to many isn't about mere nourishment but a blessing from the divine. And when temple fare is presented in a culinary experience that is not only rich in its depth of traditions, but also celebrates diversity to appeal to all humanity, it is elevated to food that truly satisfies the soul. In a first on Gourmet On The Road, I experience the philosophy and flavours of Sattvic cuisine at The Higher Taste, a fine dining restaurant located in the serene environment of ISKCON Temple, Bengaluru. This isn‚Äôt a typical episode, but then the experience too isn't! Hope you enjoy this very special presentation, take care and stay safe.

Please note:
As a mark of respect to this meal that is served in a temple complex, I have chosen to not rate the dishes in this episode. Thank you.

Nuggekai Rasam
The rasam is flavourful and aromatic, you can taste the sweet lilt of fennel, the warmth of pepper and the weight of the lentils and drumstick drumstick pulp. The floating drumstick kernels add to the appeal of this nourishing broth.
Rs. 165 (usd 2.2)

Multani Paneer Tikka
The paneer is stuffed with the richness of cream and nuts, marinated in yoghurt, saffron and cooked in the tandoor. The peppers provide for a pleasing crunch, and the chaat masala cuts through the dairy richness and refreshes the palate. 
Rs. 325 (usd 4.4)

Potato Milagu Fry
Baby potatoes that are tossed in a sprightly spice mix, loaded with pepper, chilli flakes, cumin, crunchy, fried curry leaves and the fresh tang of lime juice. 
Rs. 230 (usd 3.1)

Mango Rasgulla Chaat
Visualise a chatpata paapdi chaat where the paapdi is replaced with soft rasgullas immersed in the sweetness of mango pulp. If you want to begin your meal on a sweet and spicy note, this is the dish to try. 
Rs. 250 (usd 3.4)    

Raja Bhojanam
Paneer, peas and nuts cooked in a rich cashew, cream and ghee laden curry, topped with a touch of saffron, this curry is a touch of indulgence befitting a king! The spicing is mellow, barring the tingling prick of heat when one bites into a peppercorn. The soft, layered warki paratha makes for a comforting companion to the Raja Bhojanam. If you‚Äôd like to add a touch of spice, savour this gravy with the chilli cheese naan, stuffed with mozzarella that bridges to the creamy flavour of the curry, and topped with finely chopped green chillies.
Rs. 285 (usd 3.9)
Warki Paratha - Rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
Chilli Cheese Naan - Rs. 120 (usd 1.6)

Vazhaipoo Murungakai Kozhambu
A ‚Äòcoconutty‚Äô curry with fried banana blossoms and drumstick segments. The drumstick segments are a tad fibrous, the banana blossom, deep-fried, lends a bit of a bite to this dish. The curry is thick, rich in its coconut flavours and does well to smother every grain of the rice.
Rs. 285 (usd 3.9)

Vetrilai Thakkali Satham
An unusual rice preparation that brings together the sharp flavours of betel leaves with tomatoes. Although the paan flavours are quite pronounced on the palate, the pulpy freshness of the fresh tomatoes helps cut the astringency of the former. Rs. 280 (usd 3.8)

Elaneer Payasam
A payasam of tender coconut, coconut milk, thickened milk for sweetening, this payasam makes for a pleasing end to the meal at The Higher Taste.
Rs. 210 (usd 2.9)

Paan Ice Cream
A sweet paan that‚Äôs blended into a homemade ice cream, this is a ‚Äòbeeda‚Äô the customary sweet paan that concludes a festive meal, in a dessert!
Rs.  165 (usd 2.2)

Please note:
As a mark of respect to this meal that is served in a temple complex, I have chosen to not rate the dishes in this episode. Thank you.

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Lunch - 1130am to 3pm; Dinner - 7pm to 1030pm on all days 
Note: Some of the dishes may be subject to seasonal availability.
ADDRESS -  The Higher Taste, Inside ISKCON, Hare Krishna Hill, Chord Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560010; tel: +91 94494 95440/ +91 802357 5333

Title: MANI DUM BIRYANI HOSKOTE | The Village-Style Biryani That Began The Early-Morning Biryani Tradition!
Description:
#hoskote #earlymorning #muttonbiryani 

popular hoskote biryani shop, mani dum biryani, no branches, mani biryani, hosakote, hoskote, hoskote biryani, bangalore, mutton biryani, biryani trail, inspiring stories, karnataka

After trying his hand at a number of professions, Mani decided to pay heed to his parent‚Äôs advice and set up a tiny vegetarian eatery in a hut in his hometown on the outskirts of Bengaluru. The year was 1992 and his hometown was Hoskote, then a mere highway halt enroute to Madras. Soon Mani began preparing and serving a rustic-style mutton ‚Äòbiryani‚Äô inspired by his amma‚Äôs recipe. His early patrons, workers from nearby factories, truckers and drivers, for whom the biryani was a satisfying early morning meal to help sustain them through the day, having relished Mani‚Äôs biryani not only carried its taste but also news on this biryani shop. Year after year, the throng of customers to Mani‚Äôs eatery grew, and this also spawned the tradition of the early morning Hoskote biryani ritual with other biryani shops opening in its wake. Today Mani Dum Biryani Hoskote caters to hundreds of customers every Tuesday, Friday, and a few thousand on Sundays, but the rustic soul of the biryani remains, be it in the setting or the flavour of the dish, prepared only by Mani‚Äôs sons with a secret spice blend made by his wife. I drove out at dawn one Tuesday to watch the sons, Manjunath, Kiran Kumar and Chandrashekar prepare the biryani that first put Hoskote on the food lovers‚Äô map. 

Mutton Biryani
The only dish made at Mani Dum Biryani, is unique in its aroma that is redolent of an amalgam of spices combined with meat. Each grain of the rice has absorbed the procession of spices that go into the pot and the fat that is rendered from the meat, this is the sort of biryani that leaves behind a spicy impression on the palate. You can taste the heat of green chillies, and the flavour of the secret spice mix that‚Äôs made in Mani‚Äôs home. Some of the meat is laced with fat that melts in the warmth of one‚Äôs mouth, some pieces though can have a bit of a bite. This is a spicy biryani, and the mosaru bhajji, onion and cucumber raitha helps cool things down.
Rs. 230 (usd 3.1)
9/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 6am to 930am on Tuesday, Friday and Sundays only. The biryani can run out early at times.
Note: It can get crowded, especially on Sundays. Get early to beat a long queue. Mani Dum Biryani Hoskote has no branches.
ADDRESS -  Mani Dum Biryani, Hoskote Malur Rd, beside Sri Satya Convention Hall, Dandupalya, Hoskote, Karnataka 562114; tel: +91 96112 96212
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/kqUtDU14PkpJV4gT6

Title: Tasting The Must-Try World Famous Hotel Diana Gadbad & Veg Cutlet In Udupi | A Legacy Of 60 Years!
Description:
#gadbad #dianarestaurant #udupi 

most popular vegetarian restaurant in udupi, hotel diana, vegetable cutlet, gadbad, ice cream, udupi ice cream, udupi hotel diana, gadbad ice cream, udupi, karnataka

When this enterprise conjured up the name Diana in the sixties, it was meant to sell cool drinks and ice cream in Udupi, then a sleepy town in South Canara. But because cool drinks and ice creams weren‚Äôt popular in this sleepy South Canara town those days, the Pai family decided to diversify into snacks. Their first creation, a vegetable cutlet, then a foreign item to the Udupi populace, took nearly five years to curry favour with the locals. Along the way, they also accidentally conjured up an ice cream concoction, the Diana Gadbad. Whilst the early days may have been tough, these 60-year old timeless classics are the most popular items on the menu today. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

Vegetable Cutlet
A potato and beetroot patty that is flavoured with a seasoning of curry leaves, lentils and spices, this cutlet is a delicious medley of flavours and textures. The accompanying homemade chutney and sauce make for worthy companions to this Diana classic.
Rs. 75 (usd 1)
9/10

Diana Gadbad
An accidental invention of this eatery nearly 60 years ago when the restaurant‚Äôs founder, Mohandas Pai, put together a concoction of three ice creams, because he had very little quantity of each, topped with cashew nuts to feed a large group of customers who dropped in unexpectedly for ice cream. And because it was prepared in a ‚Äògadibidi‚Äô (kannada word for ‚Äòhurry‚Äô) it came to be known as the Gadbad. A layered creation with strawberry ice cream, eight types of dry fruits, fresh fruits, a special ‚ÄòHorlicks‚Äô cake, vanilla cake, no two spoonfuls of this delicious dessert are the same. 
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6)
10/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS:  8am to 1pm, 330pm to 930pm, closed on Tuesdays
Note: It can get crowded, especially on weekends, but the service is quick.
ADDRESS -  Hotel Diana, Opp Big Bazar Ajjarkad, Udupi, Karnataka 576101; tel: +91 820 252050/ 2522586/ 2524558
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/oWc6tRDjuCtFz8Ek7

Title: Exploring SLV COFFEE BAR, South Bengaluru‚Äôs Most Popular IDLI, VADA Chain | 125 Years Of Experience!
Description:
#idlvada #tiffin #vegetarian 

sri lakshmi venkateshwara coffee bar, slv, slv coffee bar, slv idli vada, south bangalore‚Äôs popular breakfast and tiffin destination, most popular idli and vada, vegetarian, khara bath, kesari bath, tiffin, banashankari bangalore, bengaluru

When it comes to savouring soft idlis and crunchy vadas, all roads in South Bengaluru lead to Sri Lakshmi Venkateshwara Coffee Bar, or SLV as this string of eateries is popularly known. And it is no surprise given the fact that the brothers behind this tiffin house enterprise have over 125 years of combined experience in the making of the idli, vada and khara bath, beginning with extended stints at the iconic Brahmins‚Äô Coffee Bar where they learnt the trade. I met the brothers behind SLV, Srinivas Bhat, Krishna Bhat and Anantha Bhat at their flagship eatery as it completed 35 years last month to find out what makes their offerings so special.

Idli 
The idli is porous and the sort that dissolves in the mouth when steaming hot. The chutney makes for a flavourful accompaniment to permeate through the idli with its ‚Äòflowing‚Äô consistency and spicy fervour. One of the best idlis one can taste in Bengaluru. The butter, to be honest, is an unnecessary but decadently tasty indulgence!
Rs. 28 (usd 0.4) for two idlis; Rs. 10 (usd 0.1) for butter per idli 
10/10

Vada 
The vade here is double fried ensuring a crisp crunchy bite from the first bite to the last, on the inside it is soft and porous, speckled with black pepper, green chillies and curry leaves. 
Rs. 22 (usd 0.3) per vada
9/10

Chowchow Bath 
The khara bath is ‚Äòrunny‚Äô in its texture and quite loaded in its flavour, one can taste the aroma of the spice mix that goes into the preparation here. The kesari bath is lush with ghee, and studded with pineapple flecks and cashew.
Rs. 46 (usd 0.6)
8.5/10

Coffee
Rs. 10 (usd 0.1)
8/10
Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 6am to 830pm on all days except 6am to 12pm on Sunday
Note: It can get crowded, especially on weekends, but the service is quick.
ADDRESS -  Sri Lakshmi Venkateshwara (SLV) Coffee Bar, 186, 24th Cross Rd, Siddanna Layout, Opposite BDA Park, Banashankari Stage II, Banashankari, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560070; tel: +91 89716 91805

Title: POLAMMA‚ÄôS MESS | This Eatery Serves Tasty, Affordable ANDHRA FOOD & Memories Of A Grandmother‚Äôs Love
Description:
#andhrafood #bangalore #bananaleafmeal 

polamma‚Äôs mess, popular andhra eatery for working professionals, students, families, vegetarian andhra meal, banana leaf meal, bhojanam, pappu, sambar, rasam, hyderabadi chicken biryani, chicken roast, mutton pepper fry boneless, chicken polamma, fish fry, bangalore, bengaluru

Every city has its celebrated restaurants, these are the ones that everybody knows. And then there are hundreds of tiny eateries that are almost unknown except to those they quietly provide daily sustenance to - office goers, working professionals, students yearning for a taste of home.... However, in the current scenario of work from home, offices and educational institutions being shut, these establishments that once were the lifeline of the communities they served are now finding it difficult to sustain themselves. 

In this episode, I visit one such Bengaluru eatery, Polamma‚Äôs Mess, named so by its owner, Jagadeesh Reddy in memory of his late grandmother who raised him as an orphan in a village near Kalahasti, Andhra Pradesh. I hear his poignant account of how this once bustling eatery is barely getting by, which is rather unfortunate given the simple but delicious Andhra vegetarian bhojanam that Polamma‚Äôs serves in addition to other meaty sides. I hope you will find within your heart the desire to support eateries like Polamma‚Äôs Mess. These need your support today to help keep them on their feet to continue serving the workforce, students, community at large‚Ä¶ when things get back to normal in the future. Take care and stay safe.


Veg Meals
My favourite part of the meal here. Simple but satisfying affair of rice served with a nutritious and creamy ‚Äòthottakoora‚Äô pappu, vegetable for the day, sambar, rasam, yoghurt and the staple condiments of pappula podi, ghee and ghongura chutney. The simplicity of the meal is reminiscent of what you will be served in an Andhra home.
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
8/10

Chicken Roast 
The chicken is double cooked, first in a deep-flavoured masala and then roasted in ghee with plenty of curry leaves and spices. Moist inside and with a slight roasted crunch, this is a must-order if you like chicken and prefer it sprightly and spicy.. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
9/10

Chicken Polamma
This chicken fry is fortified with the richness of cashew paste and red chilli powder, the sort of preparation that will make you sweat if you aren‚Äôt accustomed to chilli heat.
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
8/10

Vanjaram Fry
The fish is fried in a tasty masala, albeit thin sliced, the sort that you would expect to find in a mess.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
7.5/10

Mutton Pepper Fry Boneless
The meat is soft, but the flavours of the masala had settled a tad; I also found the cornstarch a bit overwhelming, especially since we didn‚Äôt get to it as soon as it arrived on the table.
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
7/10

Chicken Hyderabadi Biryani
The Friday special at Polamma‚Äôs Mess is portioned enough to feed one, or two if you precede it with the Andhra veg bhojanam. There is plenty of masala and the chicken is moist and juicy, made in the kacchi akhni style. A recipe picked up by Jagadeesh during his stint in Hyderabad.
Rs. 150 (usd 2)
8/10

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: lunch - 12pm to 330pm; dinner - 7pm to 1030pm
Note: Only lunch service on Sundays; as you may have seen in the video this is a modest eatery sans any frills. For those looking for takeaways, they are available on Swiggy and Zomato too. Located close to Christ College.
ADDRESS -  Polamma‚Äôs Mess, 67/1, 2nd Cross Rd, Chikku Lakshmaiah Layout, Adugodi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560029; tel: +91 99641 49888

Title: Lunch At Mangalore‚Äôs Most Popular SEAFOOD Restaurant, MACHALI | Crab Ghee Roast Prawn Fry Fish Curry
Description:
#seafood #popularrestaurant #mangalore

popular seafood restaurant in mangalore, machali restaurant mangalore, manguluru, fish curry, fish fry, ghee roast, fish thaali, crab ghee roast, pomfret masala fry, anjal tava fry, squid ghee roast, alle piao, sardine fry, prawn fry, koliwada, kingfish, top seafood in mangalore

Given its incredible popularity with hundreds of seafood lovers who visit here for the meals, fries and curries everyday, it‚Äôs hard to believe that this restaurant is only six years old. I visit this eatery that has the vibe of a busy dining hall to indulge in a humongous meal, and along the way also catch up with its unassuming owner, Vicky Pai, who says his trying experiences as a young executive looking for affordable, homestyle food in a new city, spurred him to open Machali - to serve tasty, homestyle food at affordable prices. And going by my meals at this eatery, I have visited thrice already, and watching fastidious Mangalorans relish the seafood here, Machali certainly delivers, whether one wants to enjoy a sumptuous fish meal and fry for Rs. 150 or splurge Rs. 300. Truly, a democratic seafood restaurant that caters to all.

Fish Thaali
A standard Mangalore fish meal experience, on the plate there is a fish curry with a small piece of fish, some dry vegetables on the side, boiled rice, shrimp chutney, fried sandige and pickle. Servers walk along ladling more fish curry, a simple Konkani style lentil preparation, daali thove, and rasam out of buckets. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
8/10

Taru Buthai
Tiny sardines, fried to delicious scrumptiousness, the sort that you eat whole. Quite tasty!
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
8.5/10

Prawn Fry
A robustly-flavoured fresh prawn preparation crusted in a Konkan koliwada masala. Once you get past the spices, you can taste the sweet lilt of the prawns.
Rs. 230
8.5/10

Boneless Crab Ghee Roast
Perfect for those who love crab but don‚Äôt want to go through the hassle of de-shelling one. The lush ghee roast masala packs a punch more so against the mild flavours of the crab, the buttery fervour of the ghee brings the spices and the crabmeat together. 
Rs. 280 (usd 3.8)
10/10

Squid Ghee Roast
The squid was cooked to the texture that yielded quite gently to the bite, the masala though, seemed a tad salty to my taste. Perhaps a bit lacking in the ghee. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4) 
7.5/10

Alle Piyao
A flavourful Konkani curry made of ginger, onions and fresh coconut. The onions, starring both in the masala and the seasoning, are quite pronounced on the palate, as is a tinge of turmeric and the warmth of the ginger.   
Rs. 130 (usd 1.8)
10/10

Anjal Tava Fry
A plump piece of fish, flakey and pristine in its freshness, crusted with a punchy masala. You can taste the red chilli spice the moment you place the fish in your mouth, but the meaty character of the anjal balances against the spicy hit.  
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
9/10

Pomfret Tava Masala
The pomfret is burdened under the weight of a flavourful masala that has notes of savouriness, heat and sourness, owing to the onions, curry leaves, chillies and tamarind. The fish is moist, poached in a turmeric curry first, before being slathered with the masala in a pan. 
Rs. 300 (usd 4)
9/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV
Gourmet On The Road Mangalore Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLri_37vf6mmqELg4kChPIYLp4EzfLS0lq

TIMINGS: lunch - 1130am to 330pm, dinner - 7pm to 10pm 
Note: Closed for dinner on Mondays. Get here early, there is usually a bit of a wait, especially on weekends, but service is quick. 
ADDRESS -  Machali Restaurant, Behind Ocean Pearl, Sharada Vidyalaya Rd, Kodailbail, Mangalore, Karnataka 575003; tel: +91 77959 57575
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/kqfWPyHB7dycvZbi6

Title: Tasting The Original KALLADKA TEA & RIM JHIM COFFEE At KT Hotel Lakshmi Nivas, 70-Year Old Caf√©
Description:
#teacoffee #kalladka #mangalorehighway

hotel lakshmi nivas, kt hotel, popular tea and coffee shop, highway stop, kalladka, bantwal district, mangalore, kt, k tea, kalladka tea, rim jhim coffee, rimjhim coffee, best tea in mangalore, mangalore tea

Long before the advent of the modern day caf√©, a tiny tea shop in Kalladka town, Bantwal taluk, just outside Mangalore was creating ripples, quite literally, with its ‚Äòdancing‚Äô frothy tea and coffee creations. I caught up with third generation owner of Hotel Laxmi Nivas, Shivaram Holla, to find out what has earned the Kalladka Tea, known in local parlance as KT, and the Rim Jhim coffee, concocted by his grandfather, Mr Lakshminarayan Holla nearly 70 years ago, a massive following through the decades. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

Kaladaka Tea (KT)
A melange of thick tea decoction layered gently over frothy milk that‚Äôs fortified with sugar. The tea is ‚Äòkadak‚Äô and you can taste the tannins therein, but smooths on the palate when stirred into the milk. The sugar in the concoction is just right. 
Rs 15
10/10

Rim Jhim
An aromatic, strong coffee balanced with rich, creamy milk that is undiluted with water and fortified with just the right amount of sugar. The coffee used here is a 80:20 blend of coffee and chicory, which helps deepen its roasted flavours on the palate..
Rs 15
9/10

Balekaayi Bhajji
Rs 20
7.5/10

Mensanikaayi Bhajji
Rs 20
7.5/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 6am to 8pm
Note: Closed on Wednesdays; they also provide car service and there is an additional fee for the same. We prefer sitting in the eatery to soak up its old world charm. 
ADDRESS -  Hotel Lakshmi Nivas (KT Hotel), G1201, Bengaluru - Mangaluru Hwy, Kalladka, Karnataka 574222
; tel: +91 94485 45203
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/5x4j7w29Yn5erihaA

Title: NOON‚ÄôS BIRYANI | This Family Serves ‚ÄòAsli‚Äô Home-Cooked HYDERABADI Biryani | Biryani Making At Home
Description:
#hyderabadibiryani #bangalore #authenticbiryanirecipe 

noon‚Äôs biryani, hsr layout, bengaluru, hyderabadi biryani, dum biryani, hyderabadi mutton dum biryani, hyderabadi chicken dum biryani, mutton, chicken, hyderabadi biryani at home, eid special biryani, hyderabadi biryani recipe, cook hyderabadi biryani at home, hyderabadi biryani banane ka tarika, kebab, rasmalai, inspiring stories

When Mr Mohammed suffered business losses in Bengaluru 18 years ago, he was on the verge of retreating to his hometown, but his wife, Mrs Asiya Khan prevailed upon him to stay back and begin a home-cooked biryani enterprise, based on a recipe she had learnt from her mother-in-law in Hyderabad. She would cook the biryani at home and her husband was entrusted with the task of selling these in supermarkets. Little by little, they grew their biryani business, moving to a tiny shop with space only for a counter and three tables eight years ago. Over time, the reputation of Noon‚Äôs Biryani grew and built for itself a loyal clientele, many of whom would order takeaways. However, the current situation has seen their business dwindle down to less than half, and it was in this context that they reached out to us, seeking assistance to help spread the word. I paid a surprise visit and liked what I tasted, compelling us to return later to film this episode. We visit the elderly couple at their home, watch the making of a chicken and mutton biryani, before making a delicious meal of these at their shop. I hope you enjoy this one, do support enterprises like these. Stay safe and happy eating!

Chicken Kebab 
Moist and juicy, homestyle chicken kebabs that make for a tasty side to the biryani. Seasoned well and encased in a batter with a savoury, light crunch.
Rs. 120/ 220 (usd 1.6/ 2.9) for half/ full portion
8/10

Chicken Biryani
Each grain of rice is separate and every piece of meat is cocooned in the biryani masala, much like how Hyderabadis like their biryanis. The heart of the masala is the brishta, fried onions, and the spices that make their presence felt in the aromatic warmth that wafts through the palate. The meat has a bit of richness thanks to the khoa that goes into the making of the chicken biryani here, and makes for a worthy partner to the rice.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7) per portion; also available by the kilo
8.5/10

Mutton Biryani
Mrs. Mohammed‚Äôs mutton biryani benefits from a generous measure, as compared to the chicken biryani, of the fried onions and spices to complement the richness of the mutton on the bone, its meaty flavours fortified by some fat clinging on to the pieces. The rice glistens in its moistness and greets you with a gentle embrace, the edge of the spices tamed by the character of the meat, that also lends the rice depth of flavour. The meat is tender in parts and with a bit of a bite in others, its flavour delicate and warming, shining through the spices. If you are the sort who doesn‚Äôt like your biryani to assault your tastebuds with a spicy jhatka, this is certainly a biryani that will please your palate.
Rs. 290 (usd 3.9) per portion; also available by the kilo
9/10

Rasmalai
Rs. 30
8/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: lunch - 1pm to 4pm; dinner - 630pm to 10pm
Note: Closed on Mondays; they make the mutton biryani only on weekends. Whilst you will get a biryani for lunch, dinners are usually takeaways only. Do call them before you visit to ensure you get our biryani. Although you can have a quick biryani meal here, it is best to take away. Order ahead to ensure you get what you want. 
ADDRESS -  Noon‚Äôs Biryani, 664, Sector 7, HSR Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560102; tel: +91 80501 60888/ 88926 02786
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/V7zLk2TzZvyUYAeM7

Title: Breakfast Stop At The Very Popular SWATHI DELICACY On The Bangalore Mangalore Highway, NH 75 Kunigal
Description:
#popularhighwayrestaurant #mangalorehighway #koppa 

popular restaurant for vegetarian breakfast, lunch, snacks and dinner on the bangalore mangalore highway, kunigal, koppa, south indian, breakfast, tiffin, thaali, north indian, sandwich, idli, vada, dosa, dose, coffee, vegetarian

When on the highway, you want to stop for a meal at a place where you will not only get your food piping hot, consistently tasty and sumptuous enough to keep you fortified for the journey, but also in an environment that is clean and hygienic. Swathi Delicacy, located 100 kilometres from Bengaluru on the Mangalore Highway seems to have built a massive following doing precisely that. In a short span of 8 years, this eatery has come to be the preferred dining spot on the route. On a recent trip to Mangalore, I stopped for breakfast here and also caught up with co-owner, Ram Prasad Bhat to find out that his family has a legacy of being in the food service space for nearly half a century. Hope you enjoy the episode, take care and stay safe.


Idli Vada
Idlis served steaming hot, the sort of welcome that would please a traveller. The texture of the idli is grainy, and comes alive when drowned in the deliciously flavourful sambar. The vada is crisp and crunchy, soft and airy inside. The chutney is green-chilli-hot and balances against the slightly sweet notes of the sambar. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
9/10

Kesari Baath
Not decadently burdened with ghee, the kesari baath served here is relatively austere. On the palate, one can taste the comforting, toasty notes of the semolina, mingled with pineapple flecks, fried cashew and raisins.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
8/10

Butter Masala Dose
The masala dose is crisp and kadak, smeared with a spicy red chutney inside and served, topped with a generous dollop of butter. The dose is thick and filling, the sort that would keep one sated for a few hours. The coriander freshness of the potato palya takes centerstage in this masala dose. 
Rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
9/10

Open Butter Masala Dose
A fluffy open dose, thick and ‚Äòspongy‚Äô in its texture, with a generous sprinkling of a sweet and spicy, powdery-crunchy podi that assumes a caramelised note when the dosa is flipped over on the tava. Contrasts playfully with the creamy potato topping. The butter seems like an over the top indulgence. 
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3)
8.5/10

Grilled Vegetable Cheese Sandwich
The crunch of fresh veggies smothered with plenty of cheese in between toasted slices of bread. 
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2)
7.5/10

Coffee 
An exceptional filter coffee, the sort that lures travellers to drive on kilometres more, just to stop at Swathi Delicacy for a steaming hot cup of Joe!
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
10/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 630am to 1030pm on all days.
Note: Weekends may be a bit crowded, but the service here is the sort that is quite efficient and quick.
ADDRESS -  Swathi Delicacy, NH 75, Kunigal, Tumkur, Koppa, Karnataka 577126; tel: +91 96117 72977/ 94481 29493
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/ufXbWexTE2wEo1Ct7

Title: Tasting Popular South Bengaluru Special Banana Leaf Meal At UDUPI SRI KRISHNA BHAVAN | 20 VEG Dishes
Description:
popular vegetarian lunch, baale ele oota, vegetarian lunch, thaali, udupi sri krishna bhavan, gandhi bazar, basavangudi, south bangalore, poori saagu, kadubu, palya, vegetable, sambar, tilli saaru, rasam, hollige, south canara meal, udupi meal, south indian,, vegetarian, traditional south indian lunch

When it comes to festive vegetarian indulgence here in Namma Bengaluru, one looks forward to a good baale ele oota,  a meal that is served on a banana leaf. And a popular one at that is the 20-dish special lunch served at the Gandhi Bazaar, Basavanagudi outpost of Udupi Sri Krishna Bhavan, a vegetarian eatery that first opened doors in 1926. In this episode, I not only savour this special lunch but also step into their kitchen to catch the making of a steamed ‚Äòkadubu‚Äô and the South Canara style rasam, known as the Tilli Saaru, by Ganesh, their ‚Äòadige bhatru‚Äô, or chief cook, who has been cooking here for over 40 years. There is something truly auspicious about eating off a banana leaf. I hope you enjoy this episode. 

Special Banana Leaf Lunch
This is an indulgent lunch affair representative of the flavours of the Udupi-Kundapura region in most of the 20-dishes that make for a typical baale ele oota offering here. The food is served hot and fresh, and conveys a wholesomeness that is pleasing and satisfying. One begins with a traditional grape juice and mosaru vade, menasinkai bhajji, kosambari, kadubu-chutney, couple of coconut-rich vegetables before proceeding to the substantial mains of poori-saagu, anna (rice) served with tilli saaru and sambar. Servings are unlimited, and the servers are quick and efficient in dispensing refills. Make sure you save space for the desserts, a payasa and hollige, before you close with curd rice, banana and beeda, in true South Canara style.
Rs. 220 (usd 2.9) 
9/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 12pm to 330pm on all days.
Note: They also offer a limited lunch option should one not be feeling indulgent enough to try the special banana leaf lunch. 
ADDRESS -  Udupi Sri Krishna Bhavan, No.115, 116, Gandhi Bazaar Main Rd, Gandhi Bazaar, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: +91 80 2287 0456/ 2228 4777/ 2228 4999
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/D75HLQzFVW6VBtgz9

Title: World Famous MYSORE PAK At SHRI JANARDHAN HOTEL, Ramnagar | Made To A 100-Year-Old Recipe Tradition!
Description:
#mysorepak #ramnagar #indiansweet 

popular mysore pak, shri janardhan hotel ramnagar, mysore pak hotel, bangalore mysore highway, badam halwa, south indian,, vegetarian, traditional indian sweets, popular traveller breakfast spot, highway breakfasts, mysore highway 

Established in 1926, Sri Janardhan Hotel has a history that spans nearly a century, and of its many delicious offerings, one rules supreme, the Mysore Pak. Such is its popularity, that this eatery in Ramnagar, a 60-kilometre drive from Bengaluru enroute to Mysuru, is called the Mysore Pak hotel. Made to a recipe tradition that hasn't wavered for decades, each batch of the famed sweet is made by third generation owners, Prashant and his wife, Gayathry. I catch up with them to find out what makes the Mysore Pak sold here supremely addictive and with a following that stretches far beyond the borders of Karnataka. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

Mysore Pak
Drenched in ghee, the mysore pak is meltingly soft, and dissolved when placed in the mouth. The sweetness of the sugar is balanced by the weight of the gram flour and the buttery fervour of the tuppa in this dessert! A mysore pak worth its weight in gold!
Rs. 40 (usd 0.5) per plate (50 gm); Rs. 800 (usd 10.8) per kg
10/10

Badam Halwa
Lush and gooey, one tastes the richness of khoa and the grainy bite of almond.
Rs. 40 (usd 0.5) per plate (50 gm); Rs. 800 (usd 10.8) per kg
8/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 8am to 10pm, closed on Thursdays.
Note: The south indian tiffin items served here are also quite popular. 
ADDRESS -  Shri Janrdhan Mysore Pak Hotel, Mandipet, Agrahar, Ramanagara, Karnataka 562159; tel: +91 87623 14027
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/oVeJJeUVoR7YRA4i7

MYSORE PAK TRAIL IN MYSURU | Guru Sweet Mart | Shree Mahalakshmi Sweets | 5 Varieties Of Mysore Pak https://youtu.be/fXab_9AhhhU

Title: ORIGINAL MULBAGAL DOSA | PRASAD HOTEL | The Famous, Roasted & Steamed Dosa Of This Temple Town!
Description:
#mulbagal #dosa #vegetarian 

popular mulbagal dosa, prasad hotel, mulbagal, karnataka, masala dosa, dose, plain dosa, chutney, masala vada, onion dosa, popular traveller breakfast spot, highway breakfasts, madras highway, old madras road, tirupati highway, breakfast, snack

When friends encouraged Rajendra Prasad to begin a home-eatery in 1979 in Mulbagal, then a sleepy village 100 kms away from Bangalore on the Tirupati - Madras highway, he set out to make a dose that hadn‚Äôt been seen in commercial kitchens before. Borrowing a homestyle tradition of cooking dosas on individual tawas, ‚Äúhe pioneered‚Äù the technique of making a dose that was both roasted and steamed. And thus began the tradition of a scrumptiously delicious, crisp and fluffy breakfast treat, now known as the Mulbagal Dosa, that has put this temple town on the map for every dose aficionado. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe. 

Special Masala Dosa
Roasted first and then steamed, the form of the Mulbagal Dosa with its upturned edges mirrors the shape of the individual cast iron pans it is cooked in. Crusty and crisp on the outset, soft and spongy within, this dose comes across as a cross between a traditional version and an appam. Oozing ghee, the dose breaks in a crisp crackle that belies its thick and fluffy body. The chilli-warming, slightly sour notes of the red onion chutney smeared within complements the palya. For a spicier bite, taste the dose with the lentil chutney.  
Rs. 45 (usd 0.6)
10/10

Masala Vada
Crisp and flavourful, makes for a tasty sidekick to the dosa.
Rs. 6 (usd 0.1)
8/10  

Special Plain Dosa
The unique texture of the dose is heightened because there is none of the potato stuffing (palya) to moisten the dose; taste it before the masala dose to savour completely the texture of this unique creation.
Rs. 40 (usd 0.5)
9/10

Onion Dosa
More like a thick, fluffy uthappam. The hero here is the texture and flavour of the onion; you can taste the near caramelised, sweet notes of the fried onions, and also the moist bite of the translucent onions that haven‚Äôt been roasted to a crisp. A dose that can get heavy, the chutneys provide respite. 
Rs. 40 (usd 0.5)
8.5/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Breakfast 730am to 12noon, Evening tiffin 6pm to 8pm
Note: Get there early, they run out quick, much before closing time, especially on weekends. If arriving by four wheeler, park near the bus stand in Mulbagal, it‚Äôs a few minutes walk from there. 
ADDRESS -  Mulbagal Dosa Prasad Hotel, #87, Indra Nilaya, Tathipalya, Mulbagal, Karnataka 563 131; tel: +91 94483 04066/ 94489 63176
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/cPJQWVaGVcHF2DYp7

Title: Tasting INDIAN CHINESE Traditions At HAO HAO, Mangalore‚Äôs Oldest & Most Popular Chinese Restaurant
Description:
popular chinese restaurant, oldest chinese restaurant, hao hao, manguluru, chinese family restaurant, mangalore, hongkong soup, crunchy fried chicken, chicken, mushrooms and bamboo shoots stir fry, honey spiced chicken wings, roasted and fried chilli chicken, shin min rice, dragon noodles, karnataka

When I moved to Bengaluru nearly 25 years ago, Chinese family-run restaurants formed a significant part of the dining landscape. Run by second and third generation immigrants who were shipped to India by the British over a century ago, the cuisine in these restaurants had evolved to integrate Indian influences, much like how the entrepreneurs of Chinese descent, now Indian citizens, had adapted to the tastes and traditions of the land. Since then, most of these restaurants have closed doors. However during my recent visit to Mangalore, I came upon one such establishment that has stood the test of time for nearly half a century. I caught up with Louis and Rosy Wong to find out more about the Indian Chinese culinary phenomenon, and to also savour some of the dishes on offer at their restaurant, Hao Hao, Manguluru‚Äôs most popular Chinese dining spot.

Crunchy Fried Chicken
A tasty duet of spicy chicken supremes encased in crisp, crunchy threads. Alongside a tangy, piquant dipping sauce, this makes for an interesting play of flavours and textures on the palate, not surprising then that this is ‚Äúthe most ordered dish‚Äù here.
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
8/10

HongKong Soup
A nourishing, delicately flavoured chicken broth that is topped with ‚Äòclouds‚Äô of eggs whipped into a soft meringue. There‚Äôs tiny diced of vegetables to give the chicken company with some soft noodles.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
9/10

Chicken, Mushrooms & Bamboo Shoots Stir Fry
A wholesome assemblage of veggies - chinese cabbage, peppers, beans, onions, bamboo shoots - tossed with chicken in a light soya sauce. The garlic is quite pronounced, in the flavour of the dish, and also on the bite with whole cloves that are stir-fried into the noodles. 
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
8/10

Honey Spiced Chicken WIngs
Fried chicken wings, tossed with a potent dark honey-soy-chilli-garlic sauce and sprinkled over with toasted sesame and spring onions. The chicken is crunchy and moist, only wish the sauce had seeped all the way into the wings.
Rs. 230 (usd 3.1)
8/10

Roasted & Fried Chilli Chicken
The chicken is cooked twice, first roasted, allowed to rest before being tossed in a hot wok with soy, chillies, ginger, garlic, spring onions‚Ä¶ rendering the meat the sort that pulls away from the bone effortlessly. Although spicy, the chilli heat is balanced against the umami flavours of the dish. There are also bits of chicken skin in the dish that provides a lovely flavour burst. 
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
10/10

Shin Min Rice
A one-dish meal of soy prawns, sweet garlic chicken, fried rice topped with an egg sauce that coats every grain of rice in its moist custardy texture. The chicken is slightly sweetesh with a prick of pungency from the garlic, the shrimps are a tad overwhelmed by the soy and batter.
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
7.5/10

Dragon Noodles
My favourite of the two main courses, this has chicken in a savoury sauce tossed with plenty of veggies, served with noodles - fried and soft, topped with an egg sauce.
Rs. 210 (usd 2.8)
8.5/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS:  Lunch from 11am to 3pm; Dinner from 630pm to 1030pm
Note: Open all days.
ADDRESS -  Hao Hao, Basement floor Essel Wilcon, Below Radha Medical, Father Muller's Rd, Kankanady, Mangalore, Karnataka 575002; tel: +91 87928 00319/ +91 824 411 3308
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/iteU7UmSF12AR7kF6

Title: HOTEL THIMMAPPA, Udupi‚Äôs Most Popular FISH FRY & Meals | A 50-Year Tradition That Began In A Home
Description:
#seafood #fishfry #udupi

popular seafood restaurant, affordable seafood, fish meals served on banana leaf, affordable seafood, udupi, malpe road, south canara, mangalore, mangalorean food, fish thali, fish curry, fish fry, kane rava fry, lady fish, pomfret, prawns, crabs, disco fish, karnataka

50 years ago, Thimmappa and his wife set up three tables in a rented outhouse in Udupi that they called home, to earn a livelihood by serving a simple meal of fish fry, curry and rice. Over the years, the fish fry, slathered in a secret masala made by the couple, and their sons thereafter, gained favour with locals who would flock to this home that carried no name. Five years ago, his son, Sathish Kotian finally put up a nameboard as a tribute to his late father‚Äôs culinary legacy that has endured decades since the eatery‚Äôs modest beginnings. In this episode, I visit Hotel Thimmappa Fish Meals to chat with Kotian and also taste some of the seafood delicacies here. Hope you enjoy this one. Take care and stay safe.

Fish Meal
The fish meal is a simple affair here, there‚Äôs rice, a tasty curry made with small-sized, inexpensive fish, a vegetable for the day and some pickle. And to complete this, one picks from the selection of fish fry (charged extra) proffered by attendants who scurry between the tables and the kitchen. Whether one has a budget of under Rs. 100 or 300, one is assured of a satisfying fish meal at Thimmappa.
Rs 40 (usd 0.5)
8/10

Kane Rava Fry
This was a plump lady fish, the semolina forming the perfect crunchy crumb over a veil of perfectly spiced masala encasing the flakey delicate flesh of the fish. One of the best kane rava fry preparations that I have tasted.
Rs. 100 - 250 (usd 1.3 to 2.7) depending on size
10/10

Disco Fish
The perfect fish fry for those on a budget. The fish is meaty, it is mild in its flavours and readily embraces the vivacious strength of the masala. 
Rs. 40 - 50 (usd 0.5 to 0.7) depending on size
8.5/10

Prawn Ghee Roast
The prawns are swathed in a robust masala, the flavour of the ghee complements the slight hint of sweetness in the prawns. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7) 
8.5/10

Fish Kebab
Kingfish deep fried in a spicy Koliwada batter, a touch of the Konkan coast in Udupi.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7) 
8/10

Pomfret Fry
The pomfret exemplifies the fish fry preparation at Hotel Thimmappa. Aided by the sizzling hot tawa and lashings of coconut oil, the fish has the perfect masala crust encasing its moist and meaty flesh. If you are lucky to find it on the fish fry tray, go for the biggest pomfret. 
Rs. 200 - 300 (usd 2.7 to 4) depending on size
10/10

Prawn Pepper Fry
The pepper intensifies the sweetness of the prawns, and the toasted flavour of curry leaf lends a savoury note to the delightful crunch of this deep-fry.
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2) for a full portion, I tasted a sample portion of this dish.
9/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS:  Lunch from 12pm to 4pm; Dinner from 7pm to 10pm
Note: Get here early, the eatery tends to get quite busy, especially on weekends.
ADDRESS -  Hotel Thimmappa Fish Meals, Near Karavali Junction, Malpe Road, Adi-Udupi, Udupi, Karnataka 576102; tel: +91 98457 63799 
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/Thimmappa-fish-hotel?share

Title: Tasty VILLAGE MEALS Cooked Over A Wood Fire At This FARMER‚ÄôS AKKI ROTI HOTEL | Needs No Sign Board!
Description:
#villagefood #vegetarian #sakleshpur 

simple village style akki rotti and vegetarian lunch outside sakleshpur, village food, vegetarian, highway eatery, bangalore mangalore highway, akki rotti, vegetarian meal, thaali, raagi mudde, sambar, highway dining, highway meal, karnataka

Sixteen years ago, Balwant and his wife, Girija decided to open a tea shop on the fringe of their small farm abutting the highway at the foothills of the Western ghats just outside Sakleshpur, to augment their income. The tea shop soon began offering Malenadu style akki rotti to hungry travellers. And then meals followed, fuelled by Girija‚Äôs recipes and a wood fire, a simple affair, rice, rotti or raagi mudde, served with homely preparations of sambar, rasam, vegetable, pickle, papad, buttermilk and curd. Their following may have grown over the years, but the eatery remains as basic as it was when they first opened; I asked Balwant why he didn‚Äôt have a name board, and he modestly replied, ‚ÄúI thought I would put up a board when I improved the hotel,‚Äù meaning the interiors.

His son, Prashant interrupts to say ‚Äúwe are on google maps and customers find us so we don‚Äôt need a signpost anymore.‚Äù And that‚Äôs true, it‚Äôs the simple yet tasty village style food served in a rustic setting here that‚Äôs a big draw for locals and travellers alike and earned for the establishment the moniker, Akki Roti Hotel Anemahal.

Akki Rotti
The Malenadu style akki rotties are served hot and puffy with homemade butter that makes for a simple yet delicious accompaniment to the toasty crackle of the rotti. A tasty vegetable saagu, curry made of raw banana and bengal gram, helps one make a sumptuous meal of these rotties. There‚Äôs a spicy green chilli chutney completes the plate.
Rs. 50 (usd ) 
9/10

Meals 
Choose from rice or raagi mudde served with a delicious homestyle sambar and a fingerlicking rasam that‚Äôs a flavourful play of spicy, sour and sweet on the palate. A dry vegetable for the day adds to the tasty nutrition of this meal, and there‚Äôs some homemade curd, buttermilk, happala and pickle to round off the meal.
Rs. 60
8/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS:  Breakfast from 7am to 11am; Lunch from 12pm to 4pm.
Note: Open all days of the week; they only close on Sundays during heavy monsoons. The eatery has no signboard and is at a slightly lower position than the road. If driving from Bengaluru, look to your left when you arrive at the location and you should find it. Opp Canara Bank ATM.
ADDRESS -  Akki Roti Hotel Anemahal,, NH-48, Bengaluru-Mangaluru Highway, Anemahal, Sakleshpur, Rural, Mangalore, Karnataka 573134; tel: +91 73376 43313 
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/cWa1KURs9zBMn9mt7

Title: MALGUDI MYLARI MANE Combines An Iconic Mysore Dosa Style With Local Curries & Palav | Highway Dining
Description:
#nelamangala #bangalore #mangalorehighway

highway eatery in nelamangala, bangalore mangalore highway, mylari dose, akki rotti, mutton fry, mutton chops, chicken palav, mutton palav,  akki rotti, highway dining, karnataka

This highway eatery in Nelamangala, 40 kilometres from Bengaluru, is a passion enterprise of young entrepreneurs seeking to combine an iconic dosa style with local curries, palavs and more. Their conviction in the dosa, and a dosa cook with credentials apparently in the kitchen of the legendary Vinayaka Mylari, Mysuru, is even stamped in the name of this culinary venture, Malgudi Mylari Mane. I venture out for breakfast one early morning to taste the dose and other meaty offerings here, and return convinced that MMM certainly offers a refreshing change-from-the-usual offering for travellers on this stretch of the road. Hope you enjoy this episode, stay safe and happy eating!

Mylari Dosa
Topped with some village butter, the Mylari Dose here served with a herb-enriched green saagu and coconut chutney. Its fluffy, porous texture also makes it a willing accomplice to be dunked in the curries. However, in comparison to the iconic Mysuru Vinayaka Mylari Dose that it seeks to emulate, it doesn‚Äôt quite manage the melt-in-the-mouth fragility of the original offering. But it is a tasty dose on its own.
Rs. 40 (usd 0.5)
8/10

Paaya
This broth typically consumed in the morning is the sort that jolts your senses awake with its spicing. Would make for a perfect medium to dunk some hot thatte idlis in here.
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7) soup only; Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) with one trotter
8/10

Koli Kara
A Sino-Indian inspired creation of MMM, the chicken is juicy down to the bone. You can taste the heat of the fresh green chillies, the slight sweetness of some tomato sauce and the lingering warmth of red chillies combined with the umami punch of some soy. 
Rs. 70 (usd 0.9) per leg piece
8.5/10

Chicken Pepper Fry 
You can taste the grainy bite of the pepper alongside some garam masala and coriander in this preparation. 
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
7.5/10

Naati Koli Fry
Loved the coriander freshness of this preparation made of free range chicken that is deep in its flavours, fortified also by bits of skin clinging on to the meat. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
9/10

Mutton Fry
A rustic-style dish, the meat is soft in parts and a tad chewy otherwise. The masala seemed a bit heavy on the salt though, thankfully one could dunk the fluffy dose in to tone it down. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
7/10

Mutton Chops
The meat is juicy and pink with a bit of fat, and the sort that peels away from the bone. The curry is thick and flavourful, redolent of coriander and fenugreek. Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
9/10

Akki Rotti
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3) 
8/10

Chicken Palav
The rice is a bit starchy to the touch, the punch of the spices quite pronounced in the rice. The meat is moist and juicy, savour it with the rice to taste the complete flavours of this tasty palav.
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
7.5/10

Mutton Palav 
Although the composition of the spicing is similar to the chicken palav, one can taste the flavour and aroma of the meat in the rice as opposed to the accent of spices in the former. The spice in this version is subservient to the flavours of the goat meat, thereby making this a palav that is gentle and rounded on the palate.
Rs. 220 (usd 3)
8/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 730am to 1030pm.
Note: Closed on Mondays

Title: The Most Popular BIDADI THATTE IDLI At Sri Shiva Darshana Shashi Hotel | Bangalore Mysore Highway
Description:
#breakfast #idli #vegetarian 

popular highway eatery in bidadi, bangalore mysore highway, bengaluru mysuru, idli, thatte idli, masala vada, chutney, vegetarian, breakfast, snack, karnataka

The origin of this iconic Bidadi thatte idli shop dates back to the 1950s when it came into existence as a tiny village eatery in the middle of nowhere (then), steaming and serving large plates of the acrey idli, an early precursor to the modern day thatte idli.  What makes Sri Shiva Darshana Shashi Thatte Idli Hotel the most popular stop on the Bengaluru-Mysuru highway today though is the owning family‚Äôs commitment to its culinary legacy over five generations. I stop by for a chat and to taste the idli that in a manner of speaking has put Bidadi on the food lovers‚Äô map.

Thatte Idli
The thatte idli is pillowy, it is as ‚Äúsoft as air‚Äù and breaks under the effect of gravity! Definitely order the butter with the idli, it‚Äôs a premium worth paying. The butter seeps through the porous structure of the fragile idli and makes for a bite that melts the moment you place it in your mouth. The chutney delivers a potent chilli punch, the potato saagu is creamy and provides for respite from the spicy yet addictive red chutney. The masala vada makes for a savoury interlude whilst tasting the idli. On the whole, this is an idli that is worth driving 50 kilometres for! 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7) for two idlis, two masala vada. Extra butter Rs. 25 (usd 0.3)
10/10 

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 630am to 4pm.
Note: 
ADDRESS -  Sri Shiva Darshana Bidade Thatte Idly Hotel,, Kenchanakuppe, Karnataka 562109; tel: +91 99643 34448 
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/R8ooXuPdR6N4czWz9

Title: Exploring 25 Years And 3 Generations Of RURAL Culinary Traditions At SVS MESS, Kolar
Description:
SVS MESS, Kolar | 25 Years And 3 Generations Of RURAL NON VEG Traditions! Biryani, Chops, Kheema Fry

#ruralfood #kolar #karnataka 

popular rustic eatery in kolar for non vegetarian food served by a family, svs mess, mutton dishes, sheep, mutton biryani, chicken biryani, mutton chops, boti fry, fish kebab, paya soup, mutton fry, kheema, kolar food, non vegetarian food, biryani, non veg in kolar, kolar hotels, karnataka

This rustic eatery, located in Kolar, the milk and silk center of Karnataka, and within a two-hour driving distance from Bengaluru, is a labour of love spanning three generations of a family who come together every morning to serve up a meaty repast of traditional dishes that over the years has found much favour with the locals. I catch up with the family in their kitchen where the food is cooked as it was 25 years ago, on an ingeniously designed wood-fired stove. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe.

Paya Soup
The paya is gentle and nourishing with the warming touch of pepper, an appetising start to the meal here.
Rs. 10 (usd 0.1) for a cup of soup; Rs. 180 (usd 2.5) with two trotters
8/10

Fish Kebab
A fish fry that‚Äôs best savoured hot, the flesh is moist with the skin crispened. The masala is flavourful and thankfully does not overpower the earthy flavours of the fish, I suspect this is a kaatla or a variant thereof, although locally it is referred to as silver pomfret. 
Rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
7.5/10

Mutton Biryani
A biryani that is mellow in flavours, subtle nuances of the aromatic spices are all that one detects in the rice, a combination of seeraga samba and the bullet variety. The meat is tender and moist, effusive in its flavour with a slightly salty edge of sheep meat. The meat combined with the rice makes for a flavourful mouthful, combine with the sherva to add a bit of a punch, the biryani is definitely a must order here if you come on one of the days they make it.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.7)
9/10

Mutton Kheema Unde
Handground by the ladies of the house, one can discern the grainy texture of the coarse kheema on the bite and the warming notes of inger. The kheema unde is soft and flavourful, there is some egg that‚Äôs used to bring the roundels together with a bit of gram flour, but is barely discernible. Loaded with fresh pepper spice, 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
8.5/10

Boti Fry
The boti is cleaned well and cooked with tender hithikabele (peeled hyacinth beans) which helps in toning down some of the ‚Äòfunky‚Äô flavours of the boti. If you love your boti, you will enjoy it.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6)
7/10

Mutton Chops
A loaded chop, plenty of meat and some fat, that stands testament to the fact that SVS knows how to cook its meat. Absolutely delicious, the meat peels away from the bone, yet has a bit of a bite. There‚Äôs bits of fat floating in the gravy, that also adds to the rich, unctuous flavours of the curry. Savour this with some plain steamed rice.
Rs. 160 (usd 1.6)
9/10


Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: Full menu is available for lunch from 12pm to 4pm only; they are open in the evenings but only serve kebabs. Saturdays closed.
Note: Biryani is available on Tuesday, Friday and Sunday only. Raagi Mudde available on other days.
ADDRESS -  S V S Mess, Ambedkar Nagar, Kanakanapalya, Kolar, Karnataka 563101; tel: +91 98444 37774 
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/ue6vNnDDgiRnnZhx5

Title: GALLI KITCHEN By SHINE SHETTY | Inspiring Story Of How A Streetside FOOD TRUCK Saved A Kannada Actor
Description:
#shineshetty #actor #foodtruck 

popular food truck run by kannada actor shine shetty, big boss kannada winner, inspirational story, vegetarian, mangalorean food, sabakki idli, mysore masala dosa, dose, bela kai neer dose, galli kitchen, banashankari, south bengaluru, bangalore

During a particularly difficult period in his career, popular Kannada actor, Shine Shetty took up cooking to stretch his meagre resources and feed himself. Cooking in those difficult times led him to mull the idea of setting up a food truck venture for his livelihood. Rustling up a loan from well wishers, he found a second auto that he could afford. Thus began Galli Kitchen, a streetside food enterprise, a far cry from the world of glitz and glamour that Shetty was once used to. Two years on though, Galli Kitchen seems to have changed the fortunes of its owner, and has now upgraded to a full-sized food truck. I catch up with this affable actor over an inspiring chat, and also taste some of the popular fare here.

Sabakki Idli
An idli that isn't too thick to hold, but weighty nonetheless owing to the sabudana or tapioca pearls. The aroma of the dill takes over the palate when placed in the mouth, the texture is a bit gummy. The idli is the sort that comes alive when combined with the chutneys, especially the spicy and sour notes of the kempu chutney. 
Rs. 40 (usd 0.6)
8.5/10
9/10 for the kempu chutney

Mysore Masala Dose
Shine Shetty‚Äôs ode to the 99-variety style of dose that would sustain him during his acting school days in Mumbai. The dose is crisp when it leaves the tava, but weighed down to a soft texture by the loaded stuffing of masala, fresh onions and tomatoes, when gathered into a tight roll. The spicy-sweet flavour of the podi is discernible above the fresh crunch of the veggies. Not a dose for the purist, but a tasty and filling one nonetheless.
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
8/10

Neer Dosa Bela Kai
This is how Mangaloreans love to eat their neer dose for breakfast with a lip smacking accompaniment of fresh coconut, jaggery and ghee combined together with a touch of cardamom. Simple yet delicious, and a must order to finish your thindi experience on a sweet note at Galli Kitchen.
Rs. 40 (0.6)
9/10

Happy Eating!

Kripal Amanna,
Gourmet On The Road,
Food Lovers TV

TIMINGS: 530pm  to 11pm
ADDRESS -  Galli Kitchen, 951, 21st Main Rd, Siddanna Layout, Banashankari Stage II, Banashankari, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560070; tel: +91 63639 41310 
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/eyJ7E26hKvmKhqji6
