Title: LAST LUNCH At EBONY, Bengaluru‚Äôs Most Popular Multi-Cuisine Restaurant | Arcot Chops, Butter Chicken
Description:
#ebony #bangalore #multicuisine

popular bangalore restaurant, bengaluru, ebony, 13th floor, asean on the edge, popular multicuisine restaurant, popular lunch, pan indian, asian, arcot lamb chop, kakori kebab, thai crisp vegetables, nonya prawns, dal makhni, butter chicken, diwani handi

My first meal in Bengaluru when I moved here 25 years ago was at Ebony, a restaurant perched on the 13th floor of one of the city‚Äôs earliest highrises. Dining under the stars, I distinctly remember the food, a smattering of Parsi, Pan Indian and Continental, dished up, simply minus any pretence yet solid in its flavours, much like the character of the city I now call home. I learnt later that the restaurant came into being quite by accident, born out of a crisis after its owner, Rajesh Rajaram, having bought the property as an investment was unable to flip it owing to the adverse fall out of the first Gulf war. Over the years, Ebony has successfully weathered many crises, evolving multiple avatars, the city‚Äôs most ‚Äòdemocratic‚Äô bar and more recently, an Asian restaurant. But sadly, the economic brunt of the current situation seems to have gotten the better of this Bengaluru bellwether. I visit Ebony for their last lunch service as they close shop to emerge stronger in a couple of months. Take care and stay safe. Happy eating!

Do catch our wine tasting table at Ebony here:
A Tasting Of Indian Wines From SULA & KRSMA|TASTING TABLE|Pairing Food & Wine|White Wines For Summer  https://youtu.be/p7TDogoQWok

Nonya Crunchy Butter Prawns
Despite being crumbed in a flavoursome buttery crunch that resonates the toasty herbaceousness of crispened curry leaves and the tingling heat of red chillies, the faint sweetness of the prawns shines through. 
Rs. 495 (usd 6.6) 
8.5/10

Thai Crispy Vegetables
Vegetables served up in a crispy batter with a honey-chilli combination, this was a vegetarian favourite at 13th Floor. The peppery notes of basil accents this appetiser.
Rs. 355 (usd 4.7) 
8/10

Salonee Broccoli
Moistened in a saffron-mustard marinade, the grilled broccoli florets unburden the punchy mustard flavours on the palate. The processed cheese rounds off flavours of this tasty appetiser. 
Rs. 320 (usd 4.3) 
8/10

Arcot Mutton Chops
A ghee laden lamb chop that is slow-cooked to juicy doneness, and then charred on a grill to form a delicious masala crust. A traditional Mudaliar dish, the ghee in this heroes the juicy bite of the meat. A must-have when at Ebony. 
Rs. 545 (usd 7.3) 
10/10

Kakori Kebab
Tender, rich in fat, lamb mince that is massaged with gentle spices and grilled on a skewer, these fragile kebabs leave a warming smokey, decadent impression as they melt away when placed in the mouth.
Rs. 525 (usd 6.7) 
9/10

Ebony‚Äôs Ultimate Butter Chicken
Rich in the tart sweetness of the tomatoes that cradles the tandoori spiced, grilled chicken, this is a dish that is supposedly a popular order here. I would have enjoyed a bit more kasoori methi punch in this makhan-laden dish. Having said that, it‚Äôs a dish that is comforting with a hot roti.
Rs. 495 (usd 6.7) 
8/10

Hyderabadi Deewan E Handi
Vegetables cooked in a rich cashew and onion gravy, the softened shallots add a punch of demure sweetness. 
Rs. 385 (usd 6.7) 
8/10

Malaidar Dal Makhni
Loved the smokey, buttery flavours of the dal makhni that has been cooked slowly allowing for the flavours to develop. This is a dal that I would happily return for. 
Rs. 325 (usd 6.7) 
9/10

ADDRESS - Barton Centre, 13th Floor, 84, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel: +91 80 4178 3344
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/ebony-restaurant?share
Note: The restaurant is temporarily closed as this video was uploaded. They are expected to reopen in September 2020, do call before visiting.

Title: TKS IYENGAR‚ÄôS | No Staff But This Family Isn‚Äôt Giving Up Serving DELICIOUS HOMESTYLE IYENGAR FARE!
Description:
#IyengarFood #Vegetarian #Bangalore

tks iyengar, bengaluru, bangalore, iyengar cuisine, lunch, vegetarian lunch, soppina saaru, akki rotti, payasa, popular lunch, south indian lunch, basaveshwar nagar

TKS Iyengar‚Äôs, a passion enterprise spanning three generations of a family came as a breath of fresh air to Bengaluru's tiffin culture with time honoured recipes that were hitherto confined to homes. Not surprisingly, this charming refreshment house became an instant hit when they opened doors a year ago. However, the current covid situation has brought all that to nought, and left the family with no staff and barely any business to make ends meet. However, rather than buckle down, the ladies of the house aided by their menfolk are doing all that it takes to keep their traditions alive, from manning the stoves to serving customers to keeping house. I savour a delicious homestyle Iyengar meal on a recent visit, and while doing so said a silent prayer, hoping that eateries like TKS Iyengar‚Äôs survive these turbulent times. For if not, we would be much poorer in losing the rich, ancient culinary traditions of our land. Take care and stay safe.

Previous TKS Iyengar‚Äôs Video link:
IYENGAR HOMESTYLE Breakfast At TKS IYENGAR‚Äôs |UNIQUE DISHES! Nuchinna Unde, BaleEle Idli, Hayagreeva https://youtu.be/CyRtTySx9zs

Meals
A sumptuous homestyle meal, choose from the savoury, onion-laced akki roti or poori-saagu combination to begin your lunch. There is plenty more on the plate, a crunchy kosambari laced with asafoetida, a palya or vegetable, a hearty lentil and spinach fortified soppina saaru that is to be savoured with the fiber-rich Rajamudi rice, palav and mosaru anna. And to end your meal, a payasam for the day. All this for Rs. 100 only!
Rs. 100 (usd 1.3) 
8/10

ADDRESS -  TKS Iyengar‚Äôs, Address: 274, 8th Main Rd, West Of Chord Road, West of Chord Road 1st Stage, Basaveshwar Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560079; tel +91 96069 04008
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/n6zmWZre9cHaMB9a9

Title: Karnataka Style Maratha Cuisine At MARATHA DARSHAN | Mutton Korma, Raagi Mudde, Kheema Unde, Chicken
Description:
#MarataDarshan #NonVegetarian #MarathaCuisine

popular non vegetarian lunch, maratha cuisine, marata darshan, military hotels, bengaluru, bangalore popular lunch spot, mutton korma, chilli chicken, ragi, raagi mudde, kheema unde, mince ball, curry, mutton liver fry, chicken biryani

Maratha warriors entered Karnataka over a couple of centuries ago, drawn to battle, but were eventually disarmed by the people, customs and traditions of the land. And so they stayed back integrating into the local community, adopting culinary practices along the way. And thus was born Karnataka style Maratha fare, distinctly different from that found in the neighbouring state. I revisit Marata Darshan, a family-run eatery that though immensely popular today had rather humble beginnings on a pushcart nearly 30 years ago. Hope you enjoy this episode, take care and stay safe. Happy eating.

Do catch our previous Marata Darshan episode for an in-depth look at the kitchen, meet the family, and savour many other dishes:
MARATHA STYLE NON-VEGETARIAN Food | MARATA DARSHAN | Naati Koli Saaru, Mutton Chops & More! https://youtu.be/WF5Yb2q-0VA

Kheema Unde
These mutton mince roundels, floating in a spicy broth are soft to the touch and on the palate exude only the flavour of meat punctuated with spices. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
9/10

Chilli Chicken
The Maratha version, rich in tomatoes, green chilli and pepper; the chicken is moist and juicy, cooked perfectly down to the bone.
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
9/10

Mutton Liver Fry
The liver has bite but is still creamy, any gaminess is offset by the flavours of the pepper that the liver is roasted in. It makes for a delicious meal with the thin chapatis served here. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
8.5/10

Mutton Korma
Meat that is swathed in a generous amount of fat, the meat is cooked long until soft and tender. Barring the initial bite, it breaks down in the mouth instantly. The rice and korma are the perfect match, the rice doing well to absorb the deep unctuous flavours of the curry.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
10/10

Chicken Biryani
A local Karnataka style biryani, the rice is moist and redolent with the flavour of mint and coriander, the meat peels away from the bone and exudes a smokey aroma. It‚Äôs the sort of biryani that works well when you taste the rice and meat together, add some if you need a spicier punch.
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4) 
8/10

Address -  Marata Darshan, Kaverappa Layout, Vasanth Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560051; tel: 9902021970
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/LzMQgsjySnPaw3Cg9

Title: AIRLINES HOTEL | Bengaluru‚Äôs Most Popular Outdoor Eatery | Butter Masala Dosa, Mangalore Buns & More
Description:
#AirlinesHotel #ButterMasalaDosa #DriveInRestaurant

bengaluru, bangalore popular breakfast, drive-in restaurant, garden restaurant, pure vegetarian, south indian, mangalore buns, sambar vada, medu vada, butter masala dosa, dose, akki rotti, channa bhatura, south indian snack, sambar, chutney, kesari bath, basundi, lavelle road, state bank of india road, coffee 

Named simply for the reason that an airline office was located down the road when it first opened its doors as Bengaluru‚Äôs first drive-in restaurant in 1968, Airlines Hotel harks back to a time when life was uncomplicated. As evident in its non-pretentious South Canara fare headlined by the wafer-crisp butter masala dose, that has won it legions of fans over the years, served under the magnificent verdant canopy of ancient banyan trees. Some may say the restaurant is a relic of the past, but then life has a way of coming full circle, the restaurant‚Äôs garden eating providing a much-needed social-distanced setting with the bonus of Bengaluru‚Äôs glorious outdoorsy weather. Enjoy this video. Stay safe and happy eating!

Mangalore Buns
A puffed deep-fried pastry made of maida dough that‚Äôs fortified with ripe banana, yoghurt, cumin seeds, and left to ferment. The bun is a tad chewy, the banana making its presence felt on the palate and also aiding in its subtle sweetness.
Rs. 65 (usd 0.9) 
8/10

Sambar Vada
The sort of vada that one should perhaps be tasting with steaming hot idlis if one is looking for a substantial snack. The vada isn‚Äôt crisp, but then that makes it of the perfect sponge to soak up the delicious Airlines Hotel sambar!
Rs. 65 (usd 0.9) 
7/10

Butter Masala Dosa
Loaded with butter and the resulting calories, the dose is crackling crisp and ironically a hit with Bangaloreans for whom savouring this is a ritual after an early morning walk or jog in nearby Cubbon Park! But then, to be fair this certainly a dose that can make anyone weak. Lined with a red chutney and bearing a potato stuffing that also employs the crunch of carrots and beans, this is a dose you will love if you like it crisp. 
Rs. 130 (usd 1.7) 
9/10

Akki Rotti
The akki rotti is crisp around the edges and a tad dry on the bite. However, this filling snack is redeemed by the moistness of the gentle coconut-urugadle chutney, to take the spice quotient a few notches higher, taste it with the pungent byadgi chilli-garlic chutney. 
Rs. 115 (usd 1.5) 
7/10

Channa Bhatura
A popular lunch order, this isn't your typical NorthIndian style dark-coloured and deep-flavoured chole. Get over that and you will be rewarded by a tasty combination of the chickpea with a steaming hot bhatura.
Rs. 155 (usd 2.05) 
7.5/10

Kesari Bath
Not a lush ghee-laden version of a popular Bengaluru tiffin, the version here is rich in pineapple flavours. 
Rs. 90 (usd 1.2) 
7/10

Basundi
If you enjoy dairy-richness, you will dig the lushness of this dessert, milk thickened in a pan slowly and then fortified with nuts, cardamom powder and served chilled. 
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) 
8/10

Coffee
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7) 
8/10

ADDRESS -  No 4, State Bank of India Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel +91 80 2227 3786
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/e4voDdkbLHrnzpaW7

Title: Full-On ANDHRA NON-VEG Meal At BHEEMA‚ÄôS | Biryani, Mutton Pepper Fry, Guntur Chicken, Chilli Chicken
Description:
#Bheemas #AndhraFood #Bangalore

andhra cuisine, bheema‚Äôs, bengaluru, non vegetarian meal, lunch, fish fry, chilli chicken, mutton pepper fry, guntur chicken, mutton seeraga samba biryani, chicken biryani, nellore biryani, popular bengaluru lunch spot

After many a vegetarian reviews over the last few weeks, I was craving the comfort of some hearty non vegetarian fare. And so we landed at Bheema‚Äôs to savour a spicy Andhra bhojanam of fish fry, chilli chicken, mutton pepper fry, Guntur chicken, and a couple of biryanis, their staple Nellore version in addition to their ode to Bengaluru‚Äôs dhonne style biryani! And needless to say, we also took a quick look behind the scenes to see how this popular restaurant is gearing up to serve customers in these challenging times. Enjoy and stay safe. 

Fish Fry 
A tasty fry, though not the sort that will blow your socks off! It‚Äôs a thin slice of fish, napped in a sprightly masala and fried crisp around the edges.
Rs. 370 (usd 4.9) 
7/10

Chilli Chicken
No Andhra non-vegetarian meal can be complete without a chilli chicken, rich in copious amounts of green chilli and pepper. The spice hit is tongue-numbing, but one that‚Äôs vicariously addictive. The chicken is nice and juicy all the way down to the bone. 
Rs. 270 (usd 3.6) 
8/10

Mutton Pepper Fry 
The mutton is soft and yields to a gentle bite, draped in a pepper-onion masala. The meat is sheathed in some fat, which lends it its fulsome flavour. At Bheema‚Äôs they pick their meat cuts well and certainly know how to cook it well too.
Rs. 350 (usd 4.6) 
9/10

Guntur Chicken
A chicken preparation that heroes the Guntur chilli.The creaminess of the coconut though and the acidity of tomatoes in this dish balances against the heat of this otherwise spicy Andhra chilli.
Rs. 305 (usd 4) 
8/10

Mutton Jeera Rice Biryani
Bheema‚Äôs ode to the local Bengaluru biryani, this one is made with the short-grained seeraga samba rice. You can taste the fervour of coriander, mint and green chillies alongside other ingredients like the marat moggu, cloves that are typically used in this one-pot rice and meat preparation. The meat slides off the bone, it is cooked as well as that! 
Rs. 295 (usd 3.9) 
8/10

Chicken Biryani 
Bheema‚Äôs most popular dish, this traditional Nellore-style biryani is made with basmati rice. There‚Äôs flecks of pineapple that go into this biryani and you taste its acidity juxtaposed against the aromatic flavours of cloves, cinnamon and other warming spices that the chicken and rice are cooked in. The meat is soft and juicy, however it is the delicate spicing of the biryani that makes an impression on the palate and lingers long after one has finished eating.
Rs. 260 (usd 3.4) 
9/10

ADDRESS - Bheema's, 31, Asha Building, Ground Floor, Church Street, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tell: 080 2558 7389

Title: Tasting SOUTH BENGALURU‚ÄôS Popular Vegetarian Thali & Coffee At MAIYAS | Traditions Meet Food Science
Description:
#Maiyas #VegetarianLunch #Bangalore

bengaluru, bangalore popular lunch, south indian lunch, vegetarian lunch, karnataka lunch, vegetarian thali, poori saagu, kosambri, beetroot palya, vegetable, pulav, rice, sambar, rasam, anna saaru, payasam, jayanagar, south bengaluru, sadananda maiya, maiyas, coffee 

South Bengaluru‚Äôs popular vegetarian restaurant, Maiyas prides itself on serving the ‚Äúpurest, cleanest and tastiest food‚Äù, says 72 year-old Sadananda Maiya whose family has a legacy in food for nearly a century beginning with Mavalli Tiffin Rooms in 1924. And given his erstwhile venture, MTR Foods, it‚Äôs not entirely surprising to even find a food lab on the premises of his restaurant which merges the culinary traditions of South India with food science and technology. In this episode, I take in a quick tour of Maiyas, and also its crowd pleasing special vegetarian thali. Hope you enjoy this episode. Stay safe and happy eating! 

Special Meals
This thali has everything you need for a satisfying, nourishing meal. First on the plate are hot, puffy puris, sans any residual oil, that goes well with a creamy potato saagu, a crunchy kosambari and palya (dry vegetable preparation). Next troops in a flavourful pulao, followed by anna (rice), sambar and rasam with a sweet payasam thrown in. Best to linger over this meal, nice and slow.
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
9/10

Coffee
Rs. 25 (usd 0.3) 
9/10

ADDRESS -  Maiyas, 459, 30, 30th Cross Rd, 4th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel +91 80 4341 4400
Location Tag - Maiyas Beverages And Foods Private Limited
459, 30, 30th Cross Rd, 4th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004

Title: Savouring Our FIRST CRISP MASALA DOSA In The New Normal | VIDYARTHI BHAVAN, BANGALORE | Rava Vada...
Description:
#VidyarthiBhavan #MasalaDosa #Bengaluru

bengaluru breakfast, bangalore popular breakfast, south indian breakfast, evening tiffin, vidyarthi bhavan, basavangudi, south bengaluru, popular bangalore dosa, masala dosa, masala dose, uppitu, rava vada, kesari bath, coffee 

There‚Äôs nothing that comes close to savouring the crisp crackle of a dosa a few moments after it has left the pan. An experience that we missed much in lockdown. And so when Bengaluru‚Äôs most popular dose spot, Vidyarthi Bhavan re-opened dine-in, we lost no time in getting there to savour their iconic masala dose, scrumptious rave vade and a couple of other evening treats. In doing so, I also took a look at the measures that this eatery has employed to ensure a safe dining experience. Enjoy and stay safe. 

Rave Vade
A deep-fried semolina vade studded with chilli, cashewnuts, ginger and curry leaves and served only in the evening, I am told this is quite popular. It‚Äôs bite is as crunchy as a cookie, crisp around the edges and soft towards the centre. 
Rs. 27 (usd 0.35) 
8/10

Kesari Bath
A textbook kesari bath that dissolves on the palate in a buttery gush of ghee, the raisins convey a pop of sweetness and the cashew lends a toastiness to the clove-induced flavour of this semolina pudding. 
Rs. 27 (usd 0.35) 
8/10

Uppitu
The flavour of onions headlines this soft semolina preparation that‚Äôs studded with fried lentils, green chillies and curry leaves. A flavoursome dish on its own, savour it with the spicy chutney if you prefer to perk things up. 
Rs. 27 (usd 0.35) 
8/10

Masala Dose
If you need one reason to visit Vidyarthji Bhavan, this would be it. A dose that‚Äôs crisp and lacey in parts, soft and fluffy in others, and hides within its single fold a creamy potato palya. The chutney is spicy and vivacious, a bold complement to the gentle flavours of the dose and palya.
Rs. 53 (usd 0.7) 
10/10

Coffee
Rs. 17 (usd 0.2) 
8/10

ADDRESS -  Vidyarthi Bhavan, 32, Gandhi Bazaar Main Road, Basavanagudi, Bangalore 560 004; tel +91 080 2667 7588
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/nFsBwv9yM6DoRwL69

Title: Easy Recipe to Make PRAWN GHEE ROAST At Home | Authentic KUNDAPUR Recipe For Guaranteed Tasty Dish!
Description:
#Prawn #GheeRoast #Recipe

kundapur, prawn, ghee roast, recipe, ghee roast, prawn ghee roast, shetty lunch home, mangalore, kundapur, authentic recipe, karnataka, ghee, chilli, chicken, kundapur masala, kundapur ghee roast, kundapur prawn ghee roast

The prawn ghee roast is a South Canara delicacy that can take any meal to the next level. Savour it with simple dal-rice or serve it as part of a more elaborate party spread, it‚Äôs a dish that stands out with its rich ghee-laden Kundapur masala. Here‚Äôs an impromptu video of me whipping up this recipe at home over the weekend. And even though I say so myself, this foolproof recipe is bound to impress even the toughest critic. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking!   

Link to Chicken Ghee Roast recipe: https://youtu.be/IdHyaXqs6Og
Link to Shetty Lunch Home episode: https://youtu.be/6OMwyXj8AH0

Ingredients:
¬Ω  kg prawns, medium sized, small to medium is better because of the flavours, although a bit of a pain to clean and devein. 
Now, for the marinade, I am using:
2 tbsp yoghurt
1 tsp turmeric powder
1 tbsp chilli powder 
1 tsp salt 
1 tsp vinegar, I like a bit of sour zing. One could use lime juice too.

For the masala 
5 nos guntur Chillies
5 nos byadgi Chillies
1 tsp peppercorns
¬Ω  tsp cumin seeds
¬º  tsp mustard seeds
¬º tsp fenugreek seeds
1 tbsp coriander seeds
1 tbsp thick tamarind pulp 
10-12 garlic cloves
Water as required

To cook:
4 to 5 tbsp ghee 
15 to 20 curry leaves
¬Ω  tsp jaggery
1 tsp vinegar
A pinch of coriander powder 
Salt to taste

Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: Hyderabadi, Karnataka, Italian & Dessert | FIVE STAR DINING In The New Normal | THE OBEROI BENGALURU
Description:
#TheOberoi #Bangalore #Coffeeshop 

five star dining, fine dining, bangalore, bengaluru, the oberoi bengaluru, goat cheese bruleÃÅe, roomali roti, hyderabad lamb tikki, deep dish pizza, organic kale and millet soup, pan seared kolkata bekti, sea bass, panchkuta saag, apple jelly, cinnamon mousse, vegan dessert, lapis, coffee shop, all day dining

I step into The Oberoi, Bengaluru, for my first dine-in meal post lockdown, where I not only savour some of the signature specialities at Lapis, the all-day dining restaurant here, but more importantly, take a close look at the measures being employed by the hotel to ensure safety of guests and staff in these precarious times. From sanitisation of guests, their vehicles and belongings, to meticulous back of the house and kitchen processes aimed at fostering heightened levels of hygiene, to restaurant modifications that appear to not just take care of social distancing, but also airflow management, the team here seems to have made good use of the lockdown to ready services for the new normal. Hope you enjoy this episode, folks. Stay safe and happy eating!

BruleÃÅe Of Goat Cheese And Herbs
This dainty bruleÃÅe of goat cheese, crested with a passion fruit vinaigrette and basil seeds, is lusciously creamy with a smokey edge and contrasts sharply with the pickled beetroots served on the plate. The pistachio granola chip provides sweet relief to complement the fat and acidity of the dish.
Rs. 775 (usd 10.2) 
8.5/10
         
Inside-out Karari Roomali Roti
A conversation starter of a dish, the humble roomali roti is roasted on a ulta tawa until crisp and slathered with a heavy hand of spiced butter. The trio of yoghurts, a puckeringly tart kairi (raw mango), beetroot and a savoury masala dip, served alongside elevates the status of the roti from being a mere nibble to that of a palate-teaser. 
Rs. 625 (usd 8.2) 
7/10
    
    
   
 
Hyderabadi Lamb Keema Tikki
A kacche kheeme (raw mince) ki tikki, the charred crust of which yields to the juiciness of the meat and the fresh crunch of onions on the bite. The flavours hark to a Hyderabadi pathar ka gosht, a possible inspiration behind the spices in this delicious lamb appetiser. 
Rs. 1025 (usd 13.5) 
9/10
 
Peri Peri Cauliflower Deep Dish Pizza
A perfectly executed Chicago style deep dish pizza, the pie is crunchy at the base and that helps hold within itself its weighty stuffing of peri peri spiced cauliflower, jalapeno and cheese. 
Rs. 1395 (usd 18.3) 
10/10

Organic Kale And Ragi Millet Soup
There‚Äôs a nutty bitterness to this soup, the sort that tastes healthy. Not a soup that‚Äôs designed to pander to your taste buds, the rajira (amaranth) and millet help in adding a touch of texture.  
Rs. 495 (usd 6.5) 
7/10

Pan Seared Kolkata Bekti
The sea bass is cooked to the perfect, crisp sear yet moist inside. The wilted spinach works well as a foil to the sweetness of the mild Creole sauce with its slightly bitter, savoury notes.
Rs. 495 (usd 6.5) 
9/10

Karnataka Lasooni Panchkuta Saag
Five varieties of greens go into the making of this saag that‚Äôs topped with roasted garlic and a generous dollop of white butter. 
Rs. 995 (usd 13.1) 
9/10

The Unbelievable Apple
This striking dessert layers apple jelly, cinnamon mousse and spiced, stewed apple core into a clever take on the apple crumble. 
Rs. 575 (usd 7.6) 
10/10

Pot Of Gold
A vegan assemblage of pink guava jelly, almond milk cream and berry compote.
Rs. 575 (usd 7.6) 
8/10

ADDRESS - Lapis, The Oberoi Bengaluru, 37-39, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel +91 80 2558 5858
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/TheOberoiBengaluru?share

Title: Savouring A Traditional Meal In A Fisherman's Home, Tamil Nadu | Seafood Thokku, Kozhambu, Karuvadu
Description:
#gourmetontheroad #seafoodmeal #tamilnadu

#traditionalfood #seafoodlunch #kovalam #tamilnadu #chennai #fishkozhambu #fishcurry #driedfish #fishfry #seafood #seafoodfry #gourmetbiker 

In this throwback video, I share with you a meal that I savoured in the home of Mrs Jayanti in the tiny fishing hamlet of Kovalam, Tamil Nadu. I tasted a Prawns Thokku, Para Kozhambu, and even a dried fish, Karuvadu, that tides the community through times when fish is not easily available. Hope you enjoy this short and sweet episode.

Title: LOCAL Military Style OOTA Takeaway| ROYANNA MILITARY CANTEEN| Khaali Palav, Chicken Kebab Mutton Fry
Description:
#RoyannaMilitaryCanteen #Bangalore #NonVegetarianLunch 

Takeaway Meal, Lockdown, Royanna Military Canteen, Karnataka Meal, Military Style Food, Chicken Kebab, Chicken Liver Fry, Mutton Fry, Curry Leaf Chicken, Chicken Pepper Fry, Chicken Pulav, Mutton Pulav, Pulav, Pulao, Non Veg Meals, Bangalore, Bengaluru

Just over a year old, Royanna Military Canteen seeks inspiration from the decades-old traditions of military hotels in the South, in its meaty menu that serves up naati (local) dishes. But in a format that the restaurant says is ‚Äúsanitised and one that makes military-style fare convenient to families eating out.‚Äù The important question, though, does the food deliver the tasty punch that one has come to expect of military hotels that have stood the test of time? Well, I visit the restaurant and grab a takeaway of most of their dishes to find my answer. Hope you enjoy this episode. Take care and stay safe.

Chicken Kebab
Not as crispy as a kebab would be when tasted at the restaurant, but the chicken is moist, juicy and flavourful. The chicken is cooked perfectly and peels off the bone. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
8/10

Curry Leaf Chicken
The rich masala exudes the toasty herbaceousness of curry leaf, however its flavours have not penetrated the meat as one would have desired. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.6) 
6.5/10

Chicken Pepper Fry
The chicken is moist and napped in a flavourful masala rich in onions, tomatoes, coriander and curry leaf. The onions have been roasted to a deep brown. Definitely a dish to savour at Royanna.
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
8.5/10

Mutton Fry
The meat has a bit of a bite, after all one is eating local, military-style dishes. The buttery, unctuous flavour of the fat that straddles the meat makes for a lush mouthfeel. The spicing is gentle and warming as opposed to the fiery chilli hit one sometimes encounters when dining local style. 
Rs. 280 (usd 3.7) 
8.5/10

Chicken Liver Fry
The chicken is perfectly cooked to a creamy texture, its deep flavours complemented by the pepper laced green masala. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2) 
9/10

Palav
Cooked with chicken, but served minus the meat, the khaali palav is a spicy, military hotel tradition. The palav here though is mild on the palate, if you like to pick up the flavours, combine it with the sherva, the spicy broth that‚Äôs served with the palav.
Rs. 120 (usd 1.6) 
7/10

Chicken Palav
If you are looking for a bold, military-style pulav, this is not it. But if you‚Äôre looking for something mellow in flavour, this would be a good pulav to taste. The chicken benefits when tasted with the rice, the latter lending its spice notes. The pulav comes alive when combined with the spicy sherva.
Rs. 160 (usd 2.1)
8/10

Mutton Palav
The palav is deeper in its flavours helped by the character of the red meat and also the fat that‚Äôs clinging on to it. One needs to work though, to pry some meat from the bone, and also to chew on it. One of those rare occasions when I preferred the chicken palav to mutton. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.4)
7/10

ADDRESS -  St Patricks Complex, unit 9, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Bengaluru, 560025; tel +91 74836 15161
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/gS4RePt1HqfJF7uTA

Title: A Taste of Dindigul in Bangalore | DINDIGUL THALAPPAKATTI BIRYANI Making | Mutton, Chicken & More...
Description:
#DindigulThalappakatti #Biryani #Bengaluru 

Takeaway Meal, Lockdown, Dindigul Thalappakatti Restaurant, Dindigul Thalappakatti Biryani, Mutton, Chicken, Vegetable, Biryani, Mutton Chukka, Mutton Kuchi, Chicken Kodaikanal, Chicken Peri Peri, Kola Urundai,  Kuzhambu, Biryani, Bangalore, Bengaluru

In the year 1957, Nagasamy Naidu set out to sell a biryani made to his wife‚Äôs unique recipe in the then sleepy town of Dindigul in Tamil Nadu. Seated at the counter, always with a turban tied on his head, led to the eatery being popularly referred to as the Thalappakatti (thalappa - turban; katti - tied) biryani shop as opposed to its original name, Anandha Vilas, and thus was born an establishment that today owns (yes owns, not franchises) nearly 70 outposts of Dindigul Thalappakatti across the world. I visit the kitchen here to watch the cooking of their famed biryani made with small-grained seeraga samba rice, and also visit one of their eight restaurants in Bengaluru to get a takeaway bundle of their signature dishes. Hope you enjoy this episode. Happy eating and stay safe! 

Kola Urundai
Spiced roundels of mutton mince, it‚Äôs unassuming form doesn't reveal the flavourful rush of spices it delivers on the palate. 
Rs. 137 (usd 1.8) 
7.5/10

Mutton Chukka
Tiny morsels of meat, soft and yielding, with a springy bite. You can taste the grainy crunch of the coconut and the pepper hit, the perfect snack to accompany an evening tipple.
Rs. 253 (usd 3.1) 
9/10

Peri Peri Chicken Chops
The smokey, spiciness of the peri peri masala certainly perks things up on the palate alongside a zing of acidity, perhaps from some vinegar. The mayo helps assuage the spicy assault of the peri peri chicken. 
Rs. 300 (usd 4) 
8/10

Kuchi Mutton
Tender goat ribs, braised in a deep-roasted masala. The meat is soft and tender, encased in a thin veil of fat which adds to the flavour. The parotta makes for a handy bread to mop up the masala, this is a dish that epitomises the way in which DT cooks its mutton! A must-have!
Rs. 288 (usd 3.8) 
9/10

Kodaikanal Chicken Kozhambu
The chicken is moist and calming in its flavours, the spicing is mellow and cradled in creamy coconut milk. You bite into flecks of coconut as you savour this kozhambu.
Rs. 265 (usd 3.5) 
8/10

Vegetable Biryani
The seeraga samba rice heroes the Dindigul biryani powder that makes for the masala, the vegetables, beans, carrots and cauliflower, have been roasted in the masala thus imbuing in them the flavour of the biryani.
Rs. 210 (usd 2.8) 
7.5/10

Chicken Biryani
The rice is flavoursome and the chicken definitely benefits when savoured in its company. Taste it with the biryani gravy and its endearing tomato-acidity if you like to moisten things up on the palate. The boiled egg helps stretch the protein component on the plate.
Rs. 240 (usd 3.2) 
8/10

Thalappakatti Boneless Mutton Biryani
This is the biryani that‚Äôs synonymous with Dindigul Thalappakatti, and therefore it is no surprise that they do it extremely well. The seeraga samba has not just trapped the flavour of the spices, but also the smoky aromas of the meat. The meat is soft, tender and moist. This is the sort of deep-flavoured, satisfying biryani that needs no accompaniment, either the gravy or the raitha. A must-order if you‚Äôre a biryani buff.
Rs. 299 (usd 4) 
10/10

Title: Make This AUTHENTIC MANGALOREAN FISH CURRY | Spicy Surmai, Pomfret, Rawas, Kane, Prawns Curry RECIPE
Description:
#Mangalorean #FishCurry #Recipe

Easy Fish Curry, Mangalorean Fish Curry, Fish Curry Rice, Indian Fish Curry, Seer Fish Curry, Pomfret Curry, Prawn Curry, Mangalore, Seafood, Kudla, Easy Recipe

The Mangalorean fish curry is the perfect balance of spice, heat and sour. In this recipe episode, we cook up a seer fish curry from scratch, including a vivacious masala that lends itself well to any mild-flavoured fish like pomfret, kingfish, ladyfish, or even prawns. Its beautiful bright reddish-orange hue comes from the combination of Kashmiri & Guntur chillies I prefer to use in this traditional preparation from namma Kudla. Traditionally, the curry is prepared atleast a couple of hours ahead of meal time, thereby allowing the fish to soak up the flavoursome masala. Served with steaming hot rice, this is a curry that pleases the soul! Enjoy!

Link to Rooster Masala episode https://youtu.be/3RXHj32sToQ

Ingredients to make Mangalorean Fish Curry
Serves 3 to 4

500 gm fish, marinated in ¬Ω tsp each of turmeric and salt.

15 red chillies (I use a combination of Kashmiri & Guntur in the ratio 9:6)
1 tbsp coriander seeds
1 tsp cumin seeds
10 to 12 peppercorns 
¬º tsp mustard seeds
12 to 15 fenugreek seeds I USED 15
A pinch of carom seeds (ajwain)
¬Ω tsp turmeric powder
1 large onion, roughly chopped 
10 cloves of garlic
¬Ω inch ginger, roughl chopped
Tamarind, lime sized ball 
5 tbsp grated coconut
400 ml water 
Salt to taste

For the seasoning
¬Ω medium sized onion
20 to 25 curry leaves
Coconut oil

#coffee #coffeeestate #sakleshpur #karnataka #malenadu #malenaducuisine #coffeetasting #gourmetbiker #harleyestate #foodtravel #culinaryjourney #coffeeestate #coffeeplantation #classiccoffee

There‚Äôs much that goes into bringing you that cup of coffee. Here‚Äôs one of our earliest documentaries that was shot over an entire year to capture the journey that coffee makes, from blossom to bean to cup. Title: Delicious & Nutritious HAYAGREEVA MADDI Sweet Recipe | Traditional Udupi Prasadam | Chana Dal Halwa
Description:
#IndianSweet #HayagreevaMaddi #ChannaDalHalwa

Hayagreeva Maddi, Hayagreeva Maddi Recipe, Traditional Udupi Prasadam, Quick Recipe For Indian Sweet, Recipe, Temple Prasadam, Hayagreeva Sweet, Hayagreeva Sweet Recipe, Hayagreeva Food, Chana Dal Sweet, Chana Dal Halwa, Nutritious Sweet, Bengal Gram Halwa, Bengal Gram Halwa Recipe, Quick Indian Dessert

The Hayagreeva Maddi is said to have been first made in the temple town of Udupi in South Canara as an offering to Lord Hayagreeva, the horse-faced avatar of Lord Vishnu. Since then, this wholesome Madhwa Brahmin dessert, made of Bengal Gram, jaggery and nuts mostly, continues to be offered as prasadam and is relished especially during festivals. Hope you enjoy my recipe adaptation of the Udupi Hayagreeva; I find in this a divinely delicious, nutritious and guilt-free fix to a sudden dessert craving, given that it can be whipped up quite easily at very short notice. Enjoy!

Ingredients to make Hayagreeva Maddi
Serves 4 to 6

1 cup chana dal (split Bengal gram)
2 cups water
1 cup + 1 tbsp  grated jaggery. 
¬Ω cup grated dried coconut 
1 tsp green cardamom powder (about 4 to 5 cardamoms seeds)
3 to 4 cloves
11 halved cashew nuts + 4 for garnish
12 broken almonds + 4 for garnish
2 tbsp raisins + ¬Ω tbsp for garnish
1 tbsp poppy seeds
4 tbsp ghee ghee
Pinch of salt

Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: MANGALOREAN PRAWN PULAO | Make This FLAVOURSOME Shrimp Pulao | Coriander Mint Masala | MOM'S RECIPE
Description:
#Mangalorean #PrawnPulao #Biryani  

Prawn Pulao, Prawn Pulav, Prawn Biryani, Mangalorean Prawn Pulao, Coriander & Mint Masala, Mangalore, Prawn Pulao Recipe, Recipe, Seafood, Prawn Recipe, One Dish Meal, Spicy Prawn Pulao, Prawn Pulav

The Mangalorean Prawn Pulao is unlike any seafood pulao. At its heart is an aromatic coriander-mint masala that complements the sweetness of fresh shrimps, and lends this rice dish an appealing greenish hue and a unique fulsome flavour. One of my favourite food memories growing up, this was a pulao cooked by my Mom on special occasions like birthdays,  with plenty of medium-sized prawns, thereby ensuring a taste of the crustacean in every mouthful. And she would also find in this pulao the perfect medium to include finely chopped carrots and beans to feed veggies to her fussy kids. ;-) This pulao recipe is truly special to me, I hope you find it special enough to cook too. Take care and stay safe. Enjoy! 

Mangalorean Prawn Pulao
Serves 4

Ingredients:

500 gm medium-sized prawns (roughly around 40 to 50 prawns) 
2 large onions, finely chopped
2 carrots, finely chopped
10 beans, finely chopped
1 cup peas
8 cloves
5 to 6 green cardamoms
1 inch cinnamon
Oil/ ghee to cook
Salt to taste

For the masala
1 big bunch of coriander and stalk,
1 cup of mint leaves 
Ensure coriander and mint are in a 60:40 ratio.
8 to 9 green chillies
1 inch of ginger, peeled and sliced
10 to 12 pods of garlic
1 tsp of turmeric powder
1 tsp salt

Title: A FISHERMAN‚ÄôS LIFE What It Takes to Bring You Great Catch! Fishing, Beachside SEAFOOD FRY Tamil Nadu
Description:
#gourmetontheroad #fishing #tamilnadu

#fisherman #fishing #lifeofafisherman #kovalam #tamilnadu #chennai #fishfry #seafood #seafoodfry #gourmetbiker 

There is much hardship and uncertainty a fisherman endures each day to bring us our favourite harvest of the sea. In this video from our earliest culinary explorations, we travelled to the tiny fishing village of Kovalam in Tamil Nadu to spend a day with Selvam. We took a boat ride into the ocean where this sunburnt fisherman shared with us a moving account of what it takes to carry on with the traditions of his community. On our return, we stopped at his favourite stall to taste some seafood fries. Hope you find this episode an interesting watch, and take a moment to remember not just the fishing community but the many growers and producers who must face enormous difficulties to bring to us the food that nourishes and sustains us, especially in these unforeseen times. Stay safe.

Title: Make The Parsi Delicacy, AKURI | Best ANDA SUBZI | Spiced SCRAMBLED EGGS | ORIGINAL Mumbai Recipe
Description:
#Eggs #ScrambledEggs #EasyRecipe  

Akuri, Parsi Scrambled Eggs, Spicy Scrambled Eggs, Desi Eggs, Parsi Dish, Parsi Cuisine, Irani Restaurant Breakfast, Breakfast. Eggs, Eggs Recipe, Easy Recipe, Parsi Sambar Masala, Authentic Recipe, Mumbai, Parsi Dish, Bombay

In this lockdown recipe episode, we celebrate the humble ‚Äòanda‚Äô in the making of an Akuri, the spicy Parsi version of scrambled eggs. Some confuse this dish with the Mumbai street food staple, ‚Äòanda bhurji‚Äô, but the Parsi Akuri is a different dish altogether, from its nuanced spice notes, its depth of flavour, and its texture, comparable to a savoury custard. Growing up in Mumbai, this was a dish I would savour in Irani restaurants with some kadak brun pav, or in Parsi homes. I dig deep into my food memories to cook this comforting ‚Äòeggy‚Äô dish, perfect for breakfast or a lazy lunch. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking.

Ingredients

Serves 2

3 eggs
1 tbsp ghee, you could use refined oil as well.
Knob of cold butter butter for finishing
2 medium sized onions, chopped finely (roughly ¬Ω onion per egg) 
2 medium sized tomatoes, chopped finely (roughly ¬Ω tomato per egg)
4 to 6 garlic cloves, finely chopped
2 to 3 green chillies, finely chopped
¬æ 1 tsp red chilli powder
¬Ω tsp turmeric powder
1 tsp Parsi sambar masala (optional) The Parsi sambar masala is that special touch that adds depth of flavour to the dish. It is a concoction of chilli powder, turmeric, asafoetida, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, peppercorn, star anise, cloves and cinnamon, ground together, and then combined with heated sesame oil). If you don‚Äôt have this, you can use any garam masala to add flavour depth.
2 to 3 tbsp coriander, chopped
Salt to taste

Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: Here‚Äôs Why You Should COOK FOR LOVE Today! A Short Story On LOVE AND FOOD
Description:
#Love #CookForLove #CookAtHome

Cooking for love means various things to various people, but love always remains the motive behind the effort that goes into cooking a dish for that cherished someone.

To chronicle the wonders that cooking for love can do to any relationship and how love and food ties into every connection,  we bring to you heartwarming stories of food and love.

From sisters who bond over butter chicken to a couple married for 30 years sharing how food has remained a constant through all the ups and downs, here's why you should Cook For Love Today!

Title: Make Super Delicious KUNDAPUR GHEE ROAST At Home | Authentic CHICKEN/ PRAWN/ VEG Ghee Roast Recipe
Description:
#Kundapur #Chicken #GheeRoast  

Ghee Roast, Chicken Ghee Roast, Prawn Ghee Roast, Veg Ghee Roast, Recipe, Shetty Lunch Home, Mangalore, Kundapur, Authentic Recipe, Karnataka, Ghee, Chilli, Chicken, Kundapur Masala, Kundapur Ghee Roast, Kundapur Chicken Ghee Roast, Ghee Roast Mangalorean Style, Ghee Roast Kundapur Style

One of my all-time favourite comfort foods is the Kundapur Ghee Roast. A dish born decades ago in a tiny eatery called Shetty Lunch Home in the then sleepy hamlet of Kundapur along the South Canara coastline. Over the years, this spicy preparation has conquered palates across the country and beyond. What gives this dish its soul is the roasted Kundapur Masala, that manifests itself in the spicy, tangy, robust flavours of this preparation. Over the years, I have tasted many ghee roasts and watched its making in illustrious kitchens, including Shetty Lunch Home. This recipe, my ode to the dish and its creators, is versatile enough to be made not only with chicken, the original chicken ghee roast, but also with prawns, paneer or any veggie of your choice. Enjoy, stay safe and happy cooking.

1 kg chicken or prawn or vegetable of your choice

For the marinade:
4 to 5 tbsp yoghurt
1 to 1 ¬Ω tsp turmeric powder
2 tbsp chilli powder
1 to 2 tsp salt (to taste)
1 tsp lemon juice/ vinegar

For the Kundapur Masala
8 dried Guntur chillies
10 dried Byadgi chillies
2 Tsp peppercorns
1 tsp cumin seeds
1/2 tsp mustard seeds
1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds
2 tbsp coriander seeds
2 tbsp thick tamarind pulp 
16 - 20 garlic cloves
Water as required

To cook:
6 to 8 tbsp ghee 
20-30 nos curry leaves
Salt as required
1 tsp jaggery
1 tsp vinegar
A pinch of coriander powder 

Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: Exploring MALENADU CUISINE, COFFEE ESTATE In Sakleshpur, KARNATAKA | Plantation Walk, Coffee Tasting
Description:
#gourmetontheroad #malenaducuisine #karnataka

#coffee #coffeeestate #sakleshpur #karnataka #malenadu #malenaducuisine #coffeetasting #gourmetbiker #harleyestate #foodtravel #culinaryjourney #coffeeestate #coffeeplantation #classiccoffee #plantationwalk

In this throwback video, we travel to the picturesque Harley Estate in the coffee region of Sakleshpur in Karnataka. We savour delicious Malenadu cuisine, explore the way of life in a coffee estate over a couple of days, and also taste some of the finest coffee produced in the region. Incidentally, this video is also the earliest precursor to the Gourmet On The Road  series that you have now come to love. Enjoy!

Title: Move Over IDLIS, Tasty NUCCHINA UNDE Are Here! Steamed LENTIL DUMPLINGS | TRADITIONAL Healthy FOOD
Description:
#Vegetarian  #LentilDumplings #TraditionalRecipe

Nuchinna Unde, Nuchinunde, Nucchina Unde, Nuchinunde Recipe, Steamed Lentil Dumplings, Low Carb Recipe, Majjige Huli, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra, Healthy Snack, Recipe, Wholesome, Protein Rich, Summer Recipe, Vegetarian, South Indian, Bangalore, Bengaluru

Delicious in its flavour and rich in lentil protein, the Nucchina Unde or Nuchinunde makes for a nourishing light meal if you are craving something steamed and delicious. In this recipe episode, Sreedevi makes light work of this traditional Karnataka dish and serves it alongside a comforting majjige huli, a simple yet punchy asofeotida oil, and a snacky upma version as well. These are perfect to rustle up in your kitchen, either for a satisfying lunch or an evening bite. Stay safe and happy cooking.

Ingredients to make Nucchina Unde 
Makes 20 to 25 dumplings

1 cup toor dal
1 cup Bengal gram
1 cup split green gram
1 tsp cumin seeds
1 tsp peppercorns
1 tsp turmeric powder
¬Ω tsp asafoetida
1 cup grated fresh coconut
7 to 8 green chillies
25 to 30 curry leaves
A bunch of coriander leaves
Water, as required
Salt, to taste

Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: How To Make An Authentic KARNATAKA MAJJIGE HULI | Wholesome VEGETABLE & YOGHURT CURRY |  Summer Dish
Description:
#Vegetarian  #VegetableCurry #HomeRecipe

Majjige Huli, Recipe, Yoghurt, Vegetable, Curry, Ladyfinger, Authentic, Karnataka, Brahmin, Recipe, Wholesome Vegetable Curry, Summer Recipe, Vegetarian, Spicy Curry, Wholesome, Nourishing Curry, Anna Saaru, Rice And Curry, South Indian, Bangalore, Bengaluru

Summer is here, and so it‚Äôs time for a refreshing yet nourishing curry. This authentic Karnataka style Majjige Huli, a staple of Brahmin homes fits the bill. Sour, spicy and enriched with the creamy goodness of yoghurt, this easy recipe, though traditionally made with ash gourd is versatile enough to be made with a host of vegetables. Catch Sreedevi as she makes her favourite version with ladies finger before we sit down to a humble yet soul satisfying meal at our home. This is the perfect recipe to make for your loved ones, stay safe and happy cooking. 

Ingredients to make Majjige Huli
Serves 3 or 4

 250 gms ladies finger/ okra, washed and dried
1 cup fresh, grated coconut
1 ¬Ω cup yoghurt, nicely whisked to prevent any lumps
5 to 6 green chillies
Handful of curry leaves
1 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera)
2 tbsp Bengal gram , soaked for an hour in ¬Ω cup water
1 tbsp ginger
1 cup water
Salt to taste

For the seasoning
1 tbsp oil
1 tsp mustard seeds
10 to 12 fenugreek (methi) seeds
1 tsp turmeric powder
A pinch of asafoetida


Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: TOP 10 CHICKEN BIRYANIS AND PULAVS | Tasted On Gourmet On The Road
Description:
#Chicken #Biryani #GourmetOnTheRoad

Top Chicken Biryanis, India, Favourite Chicken Biryani & Pulav, Biryani, Paragon Kozhikode, Rajaganapathy Salem, Bawarchi Hyderabad, Jothie Vellore, RRR Mysuru, Ulavacharu Hyderabad, Zain‚Äôs Calicut, Shivaji Military Hotel Bengaluru, Food Pyramid Kotakotha, Kurnool Kunda Biryani, Meghana‚Äôs Bangalore, Dhonne Biryani, Hyderabadi Biryani, Thalassery Biriyani

Title: Making A Warming PEPPER RASAM Of TAMIL And ANDHRA Origin | Hot, Spicy and Tangy | My Wife‚Äôs Recipe
Description:
#Vegetarian  #Rasam #HomeRecipe

Rasam, Rasam Recipe, South Indian Rasam Recipe, Pepper Rasam, Tomato Rasam, Rasam Without Rasam Powder, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil, Andhra, Recipe, Vegetarian, Spicy Soup, Soup, Pepper, Tamarind, Tomato, Wellness Drink, Anna Saaru, Tilli Saaru, Rice And Curry

Hi folks, here‚Äôs the recipe to a comforting rasam that you can very easily make at home. Hot, spicy and tangy this warming broth features Tamil and Andhra influences, mirroring the ancestry of my wife, Sreedevi. This is perfect, drunk as a soup after a heavy meal, or delightfully satisfying with some steaming hot rice, a simple vegetable and a touch of pickle. We also drink it in copious amounts especially when fighting the cold, the pepper and spices in this concoction providing warming relief. Hope you enjoy this one. Stay safe and happy cooking. 

Ingredients to make Rasam

 2 medium-sized ripe tomatoes
1 bunch fresh coriander
 Curry leaves, a fistfull
2 tsp peppercorns
2 tsp cumin seed (jeera)
7 to 8 dry red chillies
9 to 10 cloves of garlic
2 tsp organic jaggery powder (optional)
1 roundel tamarind, soaked in water/ 1 tbsp tamarind pulp
1 ltr water
2 tsp salt

For seasoning
1 tbsp ghee
1 tsp mustard seeds
A pinch of asafoetida

Please refer to the video for the method.

Title: I Tasted The Much Advertised BEHROUZ BIRYANI And‚Ä¶ | Does It Live Up To Its Mythical 2000-YEAR STORY?
Description:
#Biryani #StayHome #Bangalore 

Biryani Delivered Home, Lockdown Biryani, Stay Home Biryani, Behrouz Biryani, Vegetable Biryani, Subz-E-Biryani, Dum Gosht Biryani, Bhuna Chicken Biryani, Bangalore

I had heard much of Behrouz Biryani, or rather had consumed many of its slick ads touting a mythical kingdom and the story of a 2000-year-old recipe! So when the craving to indulge in some biryani in this lockdown hit me real hard, I decided to order in and put this ‚Äòstoried‚Äô biryani to the test. Did the biryani live up to the tale, or was its advertised appeal as mythical as its story? Well, you will have to watch the video to find out. Enjoy and stay safe, folks!

#gourmetontheroad #gotrraw #athome #foodloverstv 

Subz-e-Biryani
The vegetables consisted of peas, carrots, potatoes and cauliflowers, mushy for the most part, and slathered in a rich masala. The rice though was cooked perfectly, each grain blossomed to its fullest. Rs. 286 (usd 3.7) 
6/10

Lazeez Bhuna Murg Biryani
With tonnes of masala, this isn't a biryani that will endear itself if you‚Äôre looking for something delicate. The rice is cooked well, garnished with slivers of almonds, but suspiciously tastes just like the rice in the vegetable biryani. The chicken is firm, not juicy and succulent.
Rs. 314 (usd 4.1)
5/10

Dum Gosht Biryani
With three or five juicy pieces of meat slathered in masala, this is a biryani that could feed two. The meat is soft and moist, cooked perfectly. Taste with plenty of mint raita to wash down the warmth of the spices in the masala. 
Rs. 448 (usd 5.9)
7/10


We ordered for these biryanis on a delivery app. Our total bill came up to Rs. 1098 including taxes.

Title: Trying POTHICHORU, Most Popular KERALA PACKED LUNCH | Pothi Choru = Rice Bundle| Banana Leaf Lunch
Description:
#Kerala #PackedLunch #Lunch  

Pothichoru, Pothi Choru, Kerala‚Äôs Most Popular Packed Lunch, Kerala Lunch, Malayali Lunch, Lunch On The Go, Banana Leaf Lunch, Vegetarian Pothichoru, Rice, Sambar, Aviyal, Fish Fry, Chicken Roast

Hi folks, a few days ago, I ordered a Pothichoru, a Kerala packed lunch, for those not in the know, Pothi = Bundle and Choru = Rice. This rice bundle  tradition, I am told, is the lunch lifeline in Kerala, where every morning the ladies of the house pack rice with the day‚Äôs curries, vegetables, fries, sides and pickles into warmed banana leaf parcels for family members to carry to homes, schools and offices. Here‚Äôs my experience of tasting a Pothichoru in Bengaluru. 
Enjoy!

Title: How To Make AYURVEDIC FRESH TURMERIC IMMUNITY BOOSTER At Home | MANJAL KASHAYAM
Description:
#ImmunityBooster #Ayurveda #HomeRemedy

Homemade Immunity Booster, Fresh Turmeric, Ginger, Ayurvedic Recipe, Manjal Kashayam, Wellness Drink, Homemade Potion, Ayurveda, Immunity Booster, Kashayam, Fresh Ginger, Pepper, Cinnamon, Cloves, Wellness Drink

Hi folks, hope you are doing well and keeping safe. Our latest episode from my home kitchen features the recipe to a potent immunity booster that is very relevant to current times. An ayurvedic potion of fresh turmeric, ginger, and a host of other spices and ingredients that you can easily brew at home. The recipe comes from my wife's grandfather who was an Ayurvedic practitioner in Thanjavur. A potent immunity booster, rich in antioxidants and known to ward off a host of ailments, including respiratory such as common cold, sore throat, alleviate morning allergies, etc., this brew is a part of my daily diet now. Hope you find it useful too. 

Ingredients to make Manjal Kashayam

75 gm fresh turmeric (if using dry turmeric instead, you could use around 50 gm)
75 gm fresh ginger
2 tsp peppercorns
2 tsp cumin seeds
1 tsp cloves
12 to 15 cardamom pods
5 to 7 cinnamon sticks
3 to 4 tsp jaggery (optional)
2 tsp carom seeds (optional)
7 to 8 leaves of mint leaves (optional) 
1 1/2 ltr water
Please refer to the video for the method.

Note: Whilst this is an Ayurvedic based immunity booster that is widely used, please refer to a medical practitioner for specific medical queries.

Title: Best TANDOORI CRAB, BOMBIL (BOMBAY DUCK) FRY, FISH CURRY & More At GAJALEE Seafood Restaurant MUMBAI
Description:
#BestSeafood #Mumbai #GourmetOnTheRoad

Gajalee, Mumbai‚Äôs Favourite, Most Popular Seafood Restaurant, Best Bombay Duck Mumbai, Best Seafood Mumbai, Most Popular Seafood Mumbai, Best Tandoori Crab Mumbai, Best Seafood Restaurant In Mumbai Stuffed Bombil Fry, Bombil Fry, Bombay Duck Fry, Randoori Crab, Indian Salmon Rawas Curry, Fresh Seafood, Bombay, Seafood, Lunch, Dinner

Gajalee is perhaps Mumbai‚Äôs most popular seafood destination. When here, its fresh seafood offerings, from the signature stuffed bombil fry, prawns koliwada, plain bombil fry, rawas curry to the splurge worthy tandoori crab are a ritual for many of its regulars. I make the most of a quick visit to Mumbai to catch an indulgent seafood feast here and film this GOTR Raw episode. Enjoy!

PRAWNS KOLIWADA
These sea prawns are fresh, well seasoned and encrusted in a crunch rice flour batter. Smother it with the ginger garlic chutney if you like it spicy.
Rs. 425 (USD 5.6)
8.5/10

STUFFED BOMBIL FRY
If you were to try only one dish at Gajalee, this would be it. The delicate, watery bombay duck is rolled around a spicy shrimp mixture, dipped in a batter and fried. The fish retains its moistness despite being fried and the shrimp adds flavour.
Rs. 400 (USD 5.3)
10/10

Bombil Fry
The Bombay Duck is simply seasoned, dredged through a rice batter and fried. Yet another dish to try here. You can quite literally taste the ocean in this preparation.
Rs. 325 (USD 4.3)
9/10

TANDOORI CRAB
It‚Äôs a bit of a splurge, but you definitely get the ‚Äòmeatiest‚Äô bang for your buck! The crab was fresh and plump in its meat. I was worried that the tandoori masala would overpower the flavour of the crab, but that wasn‚Äôt the case. You could taste the sweetness in the flesh, and the gentle edge of the tandoori marinade.  
Rs. 2957 (USD 39)for a one kilo crab
10/10

Rawas Curry
A creamy Malwan style curry, flavoured with the sour twang of kokum. The rawas or Indian salmon was soft and had absorbed the flavour of the curry. Best eaten with the ghavne, lacy pancakes made with a runny rice batter. 
Rs. 425 (USD 5.7)
8/10


ADDRESS -  Gajalee, Kadamgiri Complex Hanuman Road, next to Icici Bank, Vile Parle East, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400057; tel +91 91678 91678
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/bWzNT69HmjpWp85y8

Title: Cilantro Veggies, Mexican Rice, Citrus Salsa, Cilantro Fish | Tasty & Easy Recipe To Cook At Home
Description:
Easy Vegetarian Recipe, Easy Fish Recipe, Cook restaurant Style Food At Home, Mexican Recipe, Cilantro Vegetables, Cilantro Fish, Salsa, Mexican Rice

Cilantro Fish/ Cilantro Vegetables 
With Citrus Salsa and Corn On The Cob
Serves 2
Recipe by Chef Vikas Seth, Sanchez, Bengaluru

For the Cilantro Marinade
Ingredients:       
Cilantro, chopped   100g
Green Chilli, chopped   3 pcs
Garlic, cloves   1tbsp
Onion     quarter of an onion
Jalapeno     1 tsp 
Oil      1 tbsp
Lemon juice    1 tbsp
Salt      to taste
Water     1 tbsp or as required
Method:
1. Prepare the marination by blending all the ingredients together in a food processor or a mixer.

For the Cilantro Fish
Ingredients:       
Boneless Fish, cut into cubes   300g
Cilantro marinade    4 tbsp
Mustard                     1 tbsp
Salt                      to taste
Black Pepper crushed    a pinch
Lemon juice             1 tbsp
Oil                      1 tbsp
Orange zest              ¬Ω tsp
Method:
1. Marinate the fish with the above ingredients and leave aside for 20minutes.
2. Grill it on both sides to cook it perfectly, and it will take 5 to 7 minutes, depending upon the thickness of the fish filet.
3. Serve it on the plate as done.

For the Cilantro Vegetables
Ingredients:       
Broccoli, thick slices     50g
Cauliflower, thick slices    50g 
Green Beans, batons, blanched   20g
Carrot, thick slices, blanched   20g
Red/Yellow/Green Peppers, 
thick batons                                                 60g
Cilantro marinade     4 tbsp
Mustard                      1 tbsp
Salt                       to taste
Black Pepper crushed     a pinch
Lemon juice              1 tbsp
Oil                       1 tbsp
Orange zest              ¬Ω tsp
Method:
1. Marinate the vegetable with all the above ingredients and leave aside for 20minutes.
2. Grill on a medium high heat, flip it once or twice to cook it perfectly on both sides.
3. Serve it on the plate as done

For the Fresh Tomato Garlic Paste
Ingredients:     
Tomato Red                                                             1 Whole
Garlic Cloves                                                            5 cloves
Onion                                                                         Half onion
Method:
1. Cut tomato into quarters, add garlic cloves & onion in a Mixer. Blend into a smooth paste.

For the Mexican Rice
Ingredients:  
Long Grain Rice/basmati rice   100g
Refined oil                      20g
Carrot, small cube            20g
Green peas                      20g
Tomato puree            1 tbsp
Fresh Tomato garlic paste**    2 tbsp
Vegetable stock                   180ml
Coriander Stem                    15g
Salt                              to taste
Lemon Juice                    1 tbsp
Method:
1. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat; add in rice and saut√© till all the grains are lightly golden brown in color.
2. Add in the carrot cubes, tomato puree, fresh tomato garlic paste stirring constantly, now add in the vegetable stock, salt, green peas and bring to a boil. Add in the coriander stems at this time. 
3. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes until done. 
4. Remove the cover and the coriander stems out from the cooked rice. 
5. Squeeze lemon juice on top and fluff the rice with a fork.

 
Mexican Corn on the Cob
Ingredients:
Fresh Corn ears    1pcs
Lemon Juice     1 tbsp
Butter      10g
Salt              to taste
Black Pepper, crushed  a pinch
Method:
1. Remove the husk and strings from the corn. Cut into three or four pics.
Boil it in salted water for half an hour.
2. Grill it with a little butter, salt, crushed black pepper and lemon juice.

Citrus Salsa
Ingredients:
Grapefruit, cubes    4 tbsp
Orange , cubes    4 tbsp
Onion Chopped    1 tbsp
Green Chili, chopped    1 tsp
Cilantro             1 tsp
Salt               to taste 
Lemon juice     1 tbsp
Olive oil              1 tbsp
Green Pumpkin seeds   1 tsp
White Pumpkin seeds   1 tsp
Method:
1. Cut grapefruit and orange segments into medium sized cubes.
2. Add chopped onion, cilantro, green chilli, salt, lemon juice and olive oil and mix lightly
4. Serve chilled with a sprinkle of green and white pumpkin seeds.

Title: HYGIENIC, TASTY & AFFORDABLE! Tiffin At TAAZA THINDI | Most Popular SOUTH INDIAN SNACK Destination
Description:
#VegetarianBreakfast #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Taaza Thindi, must-visit for its tasty south indian tiffin, hygienically prepared and affordable! Vegetarian, Masala Dosa, Plain Dose, Masala Dose, Plain Dose, Idli, Vada, Khara Baath, Kesari Baath, Chowchow Baath, Coffee, Filter Coffee, Bengaluru, Bangalore, Jayanagar, Breakfast in Bngalore

Tasty food made using quality ingredients in a kitchen that rivals the best in terms of its hygiene standards and at prices that make it affordable for everyone, these are three tenets religiously adhered to by Taaza Thindi, that have made it one of Bengaluru‚Äôs most popular South Indian tiffin destinations in a short span of only six years in a culinary landscape that‚Äôs dominated by institutions that have been around for decades. 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna savours a delicious tiffin comprising of all five dishes on the menu here, but not before a detailed walk-through of this eatery that has no door separating the restaurant from the kitchen in its belief that customers should be able to see how their food is prepared. Enjoy!

Idli Vada
The idli is grainy and porous in texture allowing for the ‚Äòrunny‚Äô chutney to seep through and imbue it with its spicy fervour. The vada exudes a near ‚Äòbiscuity‚Äô crunch and is simple and clean in its flavours. 
Rs. 10 (usd) per idli/ vada
8.5/10

Chowchow baath
Made with bansi wheat rava, the khara baath is porridge-like in its consistency. On the palate, it exudes savoury, spicy flavours tinged with the tartness of tomato. The kesari bath is rich, in ghee, toasted cashew, raisins, and also incorporates the fruit of the season, and the spicy tinge of cloves.
Rs. 25 (usd)
8.5/10

 
Plain Dose
The dose here is not kadak (extremely crisp) but exudes a whisper of a crunch and is soft inside. Although the ghee and oil is quite evident on the fingers, its compact size renders it manageable. The dose seeks the company of the coconut chutney.
Rs. 20 (usd) 
8/10

Masala Dose 
Its golden brown crust glistens with the ghee that‚Äôs ladled over, the kempu chutney reveals itself from within. Crunch (well, almost) into this dose to taste the savoury onion flavour in the creamy potato palya, the warm tinge of of the kempu chutney. 
Rs. 25
9/10

Coffee
The perfect close to a tiffin here!
Rs. 10
8/10


ADDRESS -  Taaza Thindi, 1004, 26th Main Rd, 4th T Block East, 9th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560041; tel +91 80 4091 2277
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/tKhbVWrmJ1eGmfXS8

Link to Bengaluru Dosa Trail - https://youtu.be/GN1g70_pbUk

Title: Juicy LAHM (Mutton) MANDI, 14-Dish PRAWN CURRY MEAL, KERALA | WHITE HOUSE RESTAURANT Wayanad
Description:
#PopularHighwayRestaurants #Wayanad #GourmetOnTheRoad

Restaurants On Wayanad - Calicut Road. Popular Restaurants In Wayanad. White House Restaurant. Making Of Mutton Mandi. Pidi Kozhi Porichatu. White House Restaurant Wayanad Road, Puduppadi, Kozhikode Road

Although a relatively recent eatery, White House Restaurant located in Puduppadi has turned into a dining hotspot for travellers on the Wayanad-Kozhikode route. Lured by its enticing offerings that include traditional Keralan dishes cooked on wood-fired stoves and much loved Arabian dishes like the Mandi, prepared in deep rubber wood-fired brick pits, we had to stop here for a meal enroute to Kozhikode. 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna relishes a 14-dish Prawn Curry Meal, a juicy Pidi Kozhi Porichathu, the Mutton Mandi of course, and a Ayakora or King Fish Fry.

TAWA FISH 
The kingfish has been cocooned in a masala with coconut milk as its base and hence the spicicing is quite gentle in its warmth. I like the crunch of the coconut flakes in the masala. 
Rs. 300 (usd 4.2)
8/10

PRAWN CURRY MEALS 
I was expecting a bowl of prawn curry and rice, but instead it came in a procession of 14 dishes packed into tiny bowls. The prawns were fresh and cooked with the head, which is where the flavour pop is! A nice touch were the drumsticks in the curry. Also enjoyed the crunch of the beans poriyal, the bitter gourd, the fish pickle and the red chilli chutney with a touch of sweetness. The paruppu payasam is the perfect end to the meal here.
Rs. 140 (usd 2)
10/10

PIDHI KOZHI PORICHATHU
A juicy bird despite its scrawny size, and served with a mutta (egg). The fried curry leaves makes for a toasty relish. One of the signature dishes here, loved the crunch of the masala that this chicken is covered in before being deep fried. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
9/10

MUTTON MANDI 
cooked the traditional way in a brick-lined pit oven. The meat peels away effortlessly from the bone with a thin flavourful veil of fat. The rice is scented with the meat juices and hit of saffron. The mandi is served with a smattering of chutneys, but I preferred savouring the delicate flavours of the dish sans any condiment. 
Rs. 550 (usd 7.7) 
9/10

ADDRESS - White House Restaurant, Wayanad Road, Near Odungakadu Makham, Engapuzha, Puduppadi, Kerala 673586; tel: 0495 223 4889
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/9sxtTmoz5dBg47oP7

Title: WHAT‚ÄôS COOKING For Lunch At One Of INDIA‚Äôs Top Chefs, ABHIJIT SAHA‚Äôs Home? Indian Or European?
Description:
#IndiaTopChef #HomeCooking #GourmetOnTheRoad

India‚Äôs Top Chef Abhijit Saha, Chef, Cooking, Cooking at Home, Indian Food, Bangalore, Mackerel Fry, Begun Pora, Prawn Curry, Homestyle Cooking, Best Indian Recipe, Subzi, European Food, Gazpacho and Burrata, Churros Modern, Cookbook, The Caperberry Cookbook, Caperberry, Progressive Cooking, Top Indian Chef Cookbook, Indian Top Chef, Best Indian Chefs


Widely regarded as one of the country‚Äôs top chefs, Abhijit Saha recently published a rare tell-all cookbook that not only illustrates down to the tiniest fascinating detail of each captivating plate that comes out of his Caperberry kitchen, but also documents his restaurant‚Äôs journey.

In this rare ‚ÄòGourmet On The Road - Invited‚Äô episode, I visit his home for a delicious home cooked meal by his wife, Shruti Saha, with a couple of mesmerising creations conjured by the chef himself. We talk about the book, food at the home of one of India‚Äôs top chefs, and more. Needless to say, I thoroughly enjoyed this experience, hope you enjoy this episode too. 

The Caperberry Cookbook is the essential companion to every chef, restaurateur, gourmet or food lover. Get it on:
Amazon https://www.amazon.in/Caperberry-Cookbook-Abhijit-Saha/dp/9389611180
Flipkart https://www.flipkart.com

Title: Unusual SALEM IDLI, ONION DOSE | DOSE MANJANNA, A Son‚Äôs Tribute, Father‚Äôs 48-Year Street Cart Legacy
Description:
#Bangalore #IdliDosa #GourmetOnTheRoad

Dose Manjanna, Must Try Salem Idli, Butter Idli, Onion Open Dosa, Mysore Masala Dosa, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Vegetarian, Street Food


Manjanna ran a popular street cart for 48 years in the South Bengaluru suburb of Jayanagar selling only three or four dishes, dose, idli and vada, earning him the moniker, Dose Manjanna. His son, Ganesh, seeks to keep alive his late father‚Äôs legacy in a tiny shop, aptly named Dose Manjanna, serving a smattering of traditional and some accidentally inspired creations, like the buttery, spicy Salem Idli. Concocted on a cold, rainy night, when his store had run out of hot idlis, in a bid to acquiesce to a customer‚Äôs demand for hot food just prior to the latter‚Äôs boarding a bus for Salem. 

In this #gourmetontheroad episode, Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna tastes the Salem Idli, a scrumptious ghee onion dose and a couple of other tiffin treats that has Jayanagar‚Äôs denizens crowding this eatery at all times. Hope you enjoy this episode.

SALEM IDLI
This Idli roasted in butter, sings the flavour of the butter with the spicy, grainy crunch of the podi. Eat it piping hot, just off the tawa. When it cools down, pair it with the spicy hurigadale (fried gram) chutney.
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3)
8.5/10

Butter Idli 
Thatte idli roasted on a hot tawa over melted butter, with lashings of butter and served with a dollop of butter, this is sheer decadence. The idli loses some its fervour as it begins to cool, and that‚Äôs when you taste its slight tartness.
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3)
8/10

Open Onion Dose
Served folded, this crisp, kadak dose was the highlight for me. Dripping with ghee and butter, smeared with chutney podi, a generous sprinkling of moist, crunchy onions, this dose is flavourful enough to be eaten on its own. The chutneys served alongside play a distant second fiddle to this open onion dose. 
Rs. 40 (usd 0.6)
9/10

Mysore Masale Dose
The masale is smeared into a paste with chutney podi, butter and onions as the dose is roasted on the tava. I expected it to be robust in its flavours, however the potatoes seem to tone down the aggression of the chutney podi, making this a gently-spiced bite. Mix together the gram chutney, chutney podi and butter that‚Äôs served alongside, and combine with the dose to savour a spicy mouthful. 
Rs. 40 (usd 0.6)
8/10

Shavige Baath 
The shavige baath here is light, fluffy and springy, tossed in a chitranna or lemon rice masala. Studded liberally with peanuts, fried lentils, flecks of green chilli and roasted curry leaves, it makes a gentle yet persuasive impression on the palate. If you like it spicy, enjoy it with the smokey tomato-red chilli-roasted gram chutney.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
8.5


ADDRESS -  Dose Manjanna, No 20, 12th Main, Near Old Sub Registrar Office, Behind Reliance Jewellery, near Cool Joint Junction, 4th T Block East, KV Layout, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560011; tel +91 86604 72706
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/qR9ALXXmRBrGSbYe6

Title: TASTY VEGETARIAN TWIST | Parmesan KHICHDI, Avocado PAPDI, HALWA Mousse, Coffee MALAI| STREET STORYSS
Description:
#Vegetarian #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Street Storyss, Vegetarian Street Food With A Twist, Vegetarian Restaurant in Bengaluru, Bangalore, Indiranagar, World Cuisine, Indian Cuisine, Burmese Cuisine, Asian Cuisine, Tibetan Cuisine, Italian Cuisine,  Chef Nishant Choubey
 
Street Storyss caters to the discerning vegetarian palate with its playful adaptations of ‚Äòstreet flavours‚Äô from the world. Chef Nishant Choubey, curator of the cuisine here says they seek to take popular fare and add a unique dimension that elevates the original dish.

Intrigued, Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna, takes up the chef‚Äôs invitation to visit this popular eatery in Indiranagar, Bengaluru, and taste a smorgasbord of creations - Rajma Ghee Khichdi, Tibetan Laping Roll, Soba Khow Suey, Mushroom Salad, Thai Corn Cake, Coconut Pancakes... some a delightful confluence of flavours and textures, some rather unexpected, but all vegetarian! Enjoy!

Avocado Mousse
A papdi with Western aspirations, the desi yoghurt makes way for the creamy avocado mousse. The chutneys are replaced by piquant raw mango salsa and a refreshing tomato salsa.
Rs. 295 (usd 4.1)
8/10

Curried Cauliflower & Beetroot Soup
A vegan offering at Street Storyss, the warming spiced cauliflower broth combines with the sweet and sour beetroot puree in a lively jig on the palate. 
Price na
8.5/10

Pomegranate Kombucha 
A refreshing mocktail of fermented kombucha and fresh pomegranate.
Rs. 250 (usd 3.5)
7/10

Tibetan Laping Roll
These translucent noodle rolls deliver batons of pickled cucumber and watermelon in a chilled sweet and sour crunch, swathed with the nuttiness of sesame soy and the warming heat of ginger. 
Rs. 325 (usd 4.5)
9/10

Thai Corn Cake
Corn pureed and coaxed into a cake before being cubed and fried. The result is a lush, creamy appetiser, topped with toasted garlic and chilli. 
Rs. 325 (usd 4.5)
8.5/10

Bangkok Stir Fry 
This is a dish that seems atypical for an eggplant preparation. Bite into its deep-fried crunchy texture to savour its soft and mushy insides. Tossed in a chilli garlic sauce, this is certainly a dish that‚Äôs made for the spice-loving palate.
Rs. 325 (usd 4.5)
9/10

Warm Mushroom Salad
A dish with banging umami flavours, the shiitake has been poached with aromats rendering it soft and gentle on the bite. The cooked watermelon provides a fruity contrast to the star anise scented notes of the mushrooms.
Rs. 395 (usd 5.5)
9/10

Burmese Khow Suey
Soba noodles, placed atop a creamy yellow curry that‚Äôs rich in coconut flavour and the fragrant notes of fresh turmeric.  
Rs. 425 (usd 5.9)
8.5/10

Nasi Goreng
The black bean lends its fermented salty punch to the Nasi Goreng, but I found the preparation a tad dry and unappealing.
Rs. 325 (usd 4.5)
6/10

Rajma Ghee Khichdi
Far removed from the humble khichdi, this version is topped with crunchy khakra and slivers of parmesan. 
Rs. 425 (usd 5.9)
8/10

Coconut Pancake with Besan Halwa Mousse
Inspired by the Bengali patishapta, the pancakes are topped with a near-cloyingly sweet besan halwa mousse. The pancakes help rein in some of the sweetness, the banana chips help in this effort too.
Rs. 325 (usd 4.5)
8/10


Frozen Coffee Malai
This is the dessert to try if you like a milky dessert and coffee. Smooth in its consistency, its flavour harks back to a cardamom-scented kulfi or rabri, condensed milk.
Rs. 295 (usd 4.1)
9/10

ADDRESS -  Street Storyss, 3155, Srinivasan Towers, Indiranagar Double Rd, opp. Thomsun music, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038; tel +91 98109 46339
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/StreetStoryss

Title: CTR - SHRI SAGAR | Bangalore‚Äôs Most Popular BENNE MASALA DOSA, GOLI BAJJI, IDLI & More | Malleswaram
Description:
#Vegetarian #CTR #GourmetOnTheRoad

Central Tiffin Room, CTR Malleswaram, Shri Sagar, Bangalore‚Äôs Most Famous Benne Masala Dose, Goli Bajji, Mangalore Bajji, Kesari Bath, Masala Dosa, Maddur Vade, Rava Idli, Ordinary Masala Dosa, Filter Coffee

When it comes to the Benne Masala Dosa, all roads lead to CTR - Shri Sagar or Central Tiffin Room in Bengaluru. The city‚Äôs love for this butter drenched dose goes back a few decades when the present owners took charge of this 70-year old establishment that served as the only eatery in the historic Malleswaram area.

Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna catches up with Sandesh Pujari, third generation owner of this landmark eatery and explores what makes the benne dose special, before indulging in a tiffin treat that includes not just their most loved offering, but other equally popular snacks like the Mangalore bajji, Maddur Vade and more. Enjoy!

Rava Idli
The soft rava idli makes for a wholesome, comforting tiffin, bathe it in the kai (coconut) chutney or savour it with the vegetable sagu that is packed with nutrition and flavour.
Rs. 29 (usd 0.4)
8.5/10

Goli Bajji
Scrumptious with a bit of a stretchy pull on the bite, and served steaming hot, the goli bajji is a must-have when you are at CTR for an evening snack. Relish it just by itself, with its slight hint of sweetness, or dunk it into the chutney to make for a spirited mouthful.
Rs. 35 (usd 0.5)
9/10

Maddur Vade
This vade has the texture of a scrumptiously flakey cookie. On the palate, one tastes the deep savoury notes of the fried onion. Relish it while at CTR, or also carry some home, it makes for a great snack on the go
Rs. 29 (usd 0.4)
8/10

Ordinary Masala Dosa 
The dose is roasted kadak (crisp), and smeared with a generous amount of kempu (red) coconut chutney inside that lends a tinge of heat. The creamy masale, potato palya, barely whispers its flavours, but lends a great supporting act to the dose that takes centerstage with every bite.
Rs. 52 (usd 0.7)
8.5/10

Benne Masala Dosa
This butter-drenched gold-hued dose is blessed with the perfect gentle crackle. On the palate, one tastes the lushness of the homemade butter that envelopes every bite of the dose, the palya and the chutney with its delicious veil. If you need one reason to visit CTR, this would be it.
Rs. 57 (usd 0.8)
10/10

Kesari Bath 
Dripping in ghee and topped with toasted cashews and raisins, the grainy kesari bath almost melts away when placed in the mouth. The cashew provides an element of nuttiness and the raisin, pops of sweetness to this semolina preparation.
Rs. 29 (usd 0.4)
9/10

Coffee 
A fitting end to a meal here.
Rs. 15 (usd 0.2)
8/10



ADDRESS -  CTR - Shri Sagar, 7th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003; tel +91 80 2331 7531
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/SduK1UJF8oNF9a2h7

Title: Tasting HOT & SPICY DARJEELING STYLE MOMOS | Chicken, Paneer, Vegetarian | STEAMED, FRIED & SZECHUAN
Description:
#Momos #StreetFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

Hot Momos, Unique Momos, Darjeeling Style, Indian Street Food, Bengaluru, Bangalore, Steamed Dumplings, Steamed Vegetable Momo, Steamed Paneer Mom, Steamed Chicken Momo, Fried Chicken Momos, Fried Chicken Momos in Szechuan Sauce, Street Food, Momos, Bengaluru Street Food, Veg Momos, Veg Momos Indian Style, Veg Momo Recipe, Chicken Momo, Fried 

This tiny dim sum shop serves momos with a difference, says its owner, Dawa Lepcha, a migrant from Darjeeling into Bengaluru, ‚Äúthey are steamed fresh with the filling raw, which makes them juicier than other momos.‚Äù I put his claim to the test as I taste an assortment of momos - steamed, fried and sauced, spicy, in this snacky Gourmet On The Road outing. Enjoy! 

Steamed Vegetable Momo
Stuffed with a cabbage, carrot, bean and capsicum filling that‚Äôs enlivened with a ginger-garlic and green chilli paste, this is a savoury momo, quite flavourful for a veggie option.  If you like it spicy, go for the chilli sauce. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8) for 8 pieces
7.5/10

Steamed Paneer Momo
I was quite cynical of this momo before I tasted it. But one bite and I changed my mind! If I were a vegetarian, I would be quite happy with this momo stuffed with soft paneer and slivers of green chilli. Flavourful enough to be eaten on its own minus the chutney.
Rs. 70 (usd 1) for 8 pieces
7.5/10

Steamed Chicken Momo
The chicken momo had spent a bit longer in the steamer than necessary, and therefore weak in the strength of the dumpling wrap. The chicken stuffing is the consistency of a soft paste, and though flavourful, a bit shy in asserting itself on the palate. I wish this momo was served hot though.
Rs. 70 (usd 1) for 8 pieces
7/10

Fried Chicken Momos
These deep-fried momos are crispy and crunchy outside and doughy inside. An interesting contrast of textures that makes for an interesting bite. Though I wasn‚Äôt a fan of its chatpata taste with the chaat masala that‚Äôs sprinkled quite liberally on the momo..
Rs. 80 (usd 1.1) for 8 pieces
7/10

Fried Chicken Momos in Szechuan Sauce
The Szechuan style spicy momo tops the ‚Äòfiery‚Äô chart here and is certainly not for the faint-hearted. All that you taste here is tonnes of chilli spice, the momo ends up being just a dumpling that has surrendered to the assault of the spicy sauce.
Rs. 100 (usd 1.4) for 8 pieces
6/10



ADDRESS -  Hot Momos Darjeeling Style, 46, 4th B Cross Rd, KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095; tel +91 99025 59471
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/kKHGdJW1qRiBrBiT6
Note: It‚Äôs located in a tiny lane with absolutely no parking for 4-wheelers, best to ride here or resort to cabs/ autos/ public transport to get here.
