Title: Spicy KONGUNADU VILLAGE STYLE Tamil Food | KOTHANUR KITCHEN Bangalore |MUTTON URUNDAI, NETHLI KURUMA
Description:
#TamilCuisine #NonVegetarian #GourmetOnTheRoad

Kothanur Kitchen, Authentic Kongunadu Cuisine, Tamil Cuisine, Village Style Salem Food, Kothanur, Bengaluru, Bangalore, Kothu Parotta, Mutton Kola Urundai, Egg Boti Fry, Naatu Kozhi Fry, Nethili Kuzhambu, Naati Kozhi Kuruma, Chicken Biryani, Mutton Biryani, Non Vegetarian 

This village style eatery in the North Bengaluru suburbs of Kothanur draws inspiration from Kongunadu cuisine and the streets of Salem in its hearty non vegetarian Tamil fare. Kothanur Kitchen favours cooking over wood fire and a strict no-refrigeration policy, ensuring that everything that is served is cooked with fresh ingredients for the day. 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor visits the restaurant to savour some of the most popular dishes served here, from a Mutton Kola Urundai to Egg Boti Fry, a vivacious Netholi Curry and more. Enjoy! 

Kothu Parotta
Robust in its spicing, this parotta that has soaked up the egg masala and chicken sherva will transport you to the street stalls of Salem. 
Rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
8/10

Mutton Kola Urundai
Love the texture of these spiced mutton mince balls, it's got a bit of a crunch as you bite into it but is yielding inside. The meat hasn‚Äôt been ground to a paste, and the spicing is gentle, leaves behind a happy warmth on the palate. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
9/10

Egg Boti Fry 
The boti is prepped and cooked rather well too. There is none of the raw ‚Äòanimal‚Äô scent that one smells if offal meat isn't cleaned well. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
8/10

Naatu Kozhi Fry 
At first bite, I felt the meat was a bit too tough, although I enjoyed the flavours of the fry - the tartness of the tomato, the mild sweetness of the onions and the savouriness of the Salem masala. However, as you chew on the chicken, it releases the flavours of the masala it has been cooked in. 
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
8.5/10

Nethli Kozhambu
This Sunday special fish curry  at Kothanur Kitchen combines the humble nethili fish with the puckeringly sour raw mango in a curry pot that‚Äôs cooked slowly over a wood fire. 
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
9/10


Naati Kozhi Kuruma 
The chicken is cooked with the skin, which lends a fulsome flavour to the kuruma. The kuruma in itself is rather delicately flavoured, allowing one to savour the flavour of the meat and the lingering warmth of the spices.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
8.5/10

Mutton Kuruma 
The fat flavour in this kuruma is quite pronounced, I also found the meat a tad chewy. On a positive note, the gravy benefits from the richness of the fat on the meat. 
Rs. 180 (usd 2.5)
7/10

Chicken Biryani 
The rice is quite flavourful once you get past its slight stickiness. On the palate you taste the freshness of the mint and coriander, the acidity of the tomatoes amidst the spices.  
Rs. 130 (usd 1.8)
8/10

Mutton Biryani 
The mutton biryani is restrained in its spice notes and spotlights the flavour of the meat. The rice is cooked perfectly in this naati, country style biryani, with the fat lending its deep savoury unctuousness.
Rs. 200 (usd 2.8)
8.5/10

Kalaki 
In case you haven‚Äôt had enough of the meaty preparations here, the custardy goodness of the kalaki, an egg and chicken curry mix that's cooked to the point where the egg begins to coagulate, provides the perfect end to a Kongunadu meal.  
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
7.5/10


ADDRESS -  Kothanur Kitchen, Sy. No. 28/3 & 28/4, K Narayanapura Road, Kothanur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560077; tel +91 95358 11681
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/kothanur-kitchen

Title: Rare BENGALURU ACREY IDLI Served By A 30-year-old FAMILY-RUN Eating House, SSP REFRESHMENTS | Pulav
Description:
#VegetarianBreakfast #AuthenticBreakfast #GourmetOnTheRoad

SSP Refreshments, also known as Mudanna Hotel, Mixing Hotel, Jayanagar, Bangalore, serves rare Bangalore Idli, Acrey Idli, Acre idli, Ikrey Idli, Pulav, Vegetable Pulav, Palav, Chitranna, Vada, Uppitu, Mosaru Anna, Vegetarian Breakfast, Bangalore, Breakfast, Idli, Chutney, Mudanna Pulav

With recipes gleaned from his father-in-law, Devaraju and his wife began a small venture out of their home nearly 30 years ago, serving what is now a rare Bangalore breakfast delicacy, the Acrey Idli. Since then, SSP Refreshment House has amassed a formidable reputation for its limited menu, an aromatic vegetable pulav, chitranna and a couple of other dishes, that run out not too long from the time they open doors to their home at 7 am.

Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna savours some of the dishes and also peeps into the kitchen to chat with the family and catch the making of the now-largely-lost Bengaluru Acrey Idli. Enjoy! 

Acrey Idli 
The idli is soft and unbelievably pliable, melts in the mouth when hot. You can smell the gentle sweet aroma of the batter which is perfectly fermented rendering a springy fluffiness to the idli. The thick, spicy lentil chutney with flecks of dry coconut makes for a great accompaniment.
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3)
9/10

Chitranna 30/ 20
You can taste the gentle tartness of the lemon, the flavour of cumin and pointed notes of green chilli on the palate, the lentils in the seasoning make for a nice bite.
Rs. 20/30 (usd 0.3/ 0.4) for half/ full portion
7/10

Pulav 
A flavourful pulav with the lingering warmth that comes from spices such as cinnamon and cloves, this is what draws customers to SSP. There‚Äôs the spicy kick of green chilli, but juxtaposed against the other ingredients, its hit is not the sort that obliterates your tastebuds. The seasoned chutney served alongside adds a layer of pleasing nuttiness. 
Rs. 20/30 (usd 0.3/0.4) for half/ full portion
8.5/10

Mosaru Anna  
Gentle on the palate, this provides cooling respite if one has overindulged in the spicy pulav and chutney.
Rs. 20/30 (usd 0.3/ 0.4) for half/ full portion
7.5/10

ADDRESS -  SSP refreshments, 10th Cross Rd, Jaya Nagar 1st Block, Someshwara Nagar, Mavalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560011; tel +91 86604 72706
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/jP638xbjdGBY55EUA
Note: It‚Äôs located in a tiny lane with absolutely no parking for 4-wheelers, best to ride here or resort to cabs/ autos/ public transport to get here.

Title: Most Popular Food at Jaipur Litfest | ALOO TIKKI, KACHORI & KULHAD CHAI From DIGGI PALACE Kitchen
Description:
#Jaipur #JaipurLitFest #GourmetOnTheRoad

Jaipur Literature Festival, Diggipur Ki Chai Aur Chaat Ki Dukaan, Diggi Palace Kitchen, Diggi Palace Food, JLF, Jaipur Rajasthan, Jaipur Lit Fest Food, Aloo Tikki Chaat, Onion Kachori, Dal Kachori, Gond Ke Ladoo, Kulhad Chai

A culinary highlight of the Jaipur Litfest, is the pop-up chaat and chai shop put up by the kitchens of Diggy Palace. Serving a limited menu, but replete with authentic local dishes like the aloo tikki, pyaaz and dal kachori, gond ke ladoo, steaming hot kulhad chai and other snackables, this is where the literati congregate for sustenance. 

Prices vary from Rs. 45 to 75 per item.

ADDRESS -  Diggi House, Shivaji Marg, Sawai Ram Singh Rd, C Scheme, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302004; tel: +91 0141 237 3091
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/DiggiPalace

I stayed at Hotel Devi Niketan, it's a comfortable place without any frills, but rich in character and history. And the best part is its location in the heart of the city. We paid for our stay.
Devi Niketan Website - https://www.deviniketan.com/

Title: Breakfast at SHIVAJI MILITARY HOTEL | Most Popular CHICKEN DONNE BIRYANI Making Revealed! BANGALORE
Description:
#ShivajiMilitaryHotel #DonneBiryani #GourmetOnTheRoad

Bengaluru's most popular Shivaji Military Hotel, Chicken Donne Biryani, Mutton Donne Biryani, Breakfast, Bengaluru's Top Restaurants, Biryani

What begins as a visit by Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna, to check out this iconic restaurant‚Äôs breakfast soon turns into a never-seen-before-on-video demonstration on the making of Bengaluru‚Äôs most famous chicken biryani, the Donne Biryani at Shivaji Military Hotel, a restaurant that has stood tall for over eight decades for its local-influenced Maratha fare.

Needless to say, he also catches a full military-style breakfast that includes a nourishing paaya soup, chicken leg masala, chops, mutton liver, khaali dose and steaming hot donne biryani. 

Lunch at Shivaji Military Hotel video - https://youtu.be/XxatALJz0Ro

Leg Soup
The gelatine has rendered well into the broth and glistens on the surface, you taste the flavour of the fat in the broth and the spicing too, especially the green chilli. The trotter is the sort that melts in your mouth. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2) for 2 legs.
8.5/10

Chicken Chops 
A rich, spicy green masala of coriander, mint and onions, studded with green peas. The juicy chicken pieces tame the salty savoury punch of the gravy. The khali dose makes for the perfect companion to taste the chicken chops masala. 
Rs. 190 (usd 2.6)
9/10

Chicken Leg Piece
Plump chicken legs cooked nice and juicy down to the bone. Definitely not a dish for the faint-hearted, you can taste the searing heat of the red chilli powder in this gravy. The onions,  tomatoes and lime provide a mildly sweet-tart counterpoint to the chilli heat though. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2) for 2 pieces.
8.5/10

Mutton Liver 
The mutton liver is cooked to perfection in a green masala, has a springy bite and is soft and creamy inside. Absolutely delicious, the intense earthiness of the liver goes well with the salty savouriness of the gravy.
Rs. 150 (usd 2.1)
10/10

Mutton Dry
The fat bits in the meat pieces add flavour. I tasted this piping hot off the stove, but I wish the meat had rested in the masala for a bit post cooking for me to better savour this peppery preparation. 
Rs. 190 (usd 2.6)
8/10

Chicken Donne Biryani 
You can taste the ingredients that have gone into Shivaji Military Hotel‚Äôs iconic donne biryani the moment you place the intensely flavourful rice in your mouth. The sweetness of the spices, the star anise, the mild astringency of the cloves, the fresh bite of the herbs, the pointed pungency from the green chillies, the tartness of tomato and the lime. The ghee coats the rice with a film of lushness, you can smell the smokiness from the dum. The chicken is delicate in its flavour, and not as effusive. Savour it with the rice to enjoy the complete range of flavours in this dish. 
Rs. 190 (usd 2.6)
9/10

ADDRESS -  Shivaji Military Hotel, No. 718, 1st C Main, 45th Cross, 8th Block, Jayanagar, Bangalore 560 082; tel: +91 98451 49217
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/mZqgz8ZNB4C8e5s38

Title: Bangalore‚Äôs ‚ÄòOldest‚Äô SEAFOOD Spot, HOTEL FISHLAND | KONKANI, MANGALOREAN Fish, Prawn FRY, Crab CURRY
Description:
#Seafood #Bengaluru #GourmetOnTheRoad

Hotel Fishland, 38-year-old seafood restaurant in Bengaluru, specialising in Konkani and South Canara coastal cuisine. Opened in 1982. hotel fishland, gandhinagar, bengaluru, fishland bangalore, fishland gandhinagar bangalore, seafood thaali, seafood thali, special seafood thaali, banged fry, mackerel fry, kana curry, ladyfish curry, prawns fry, crab curry, denji curry, clams, marvai sukka, mangalorean cuisine, konkani cuisine, saraswat cuisine

Established in 1982, Hotel Fishland in Gandhinagar, Bengaluru is one of the city‚Äôs oldest dining spots to cater to a seafood craving. Specialising in Konkani and coastal Mangalorean cuisine, the most popular item here is the seafood thaali.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits revisits this establishment and savours not just the special ‚Äòlimited‚Äô seafood thaali, but a host of other delicacies like the crab curry, bangude (mackerel) fry and prawns masala amongst others. Enjoy!

Special Limited Fish Thaali 
This thaali, complete with a fish curry, fish fry, vegetable of the day, rice, buttermilk and yoghurt had the potential to be a rather satisfying fish meal, especially given the fulsome flavours of the kaane curry. However, it was let down by the kingfish fry that although swathed in a spirited masala and crumb-fried, wasn't the epitome of freshness. Next time, I would order either a fish curry or the limited thaali that arrives minus the fry, but offers terrific value at at Rs. 180, and a fish fry separately.
Rs. 320 (usd 5.3)
7/10

Bangude Fry 
This is what a fish fry should be all about. The mackerel was fresh, plump and juicy. Fried such that the masala formed a thick crust. You can taste the heat of the chilli and the tang of the tamarind in the masala, this combination of spicy and sour made for the perfect complement to the oily flavours of the mackerel. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
10/10

Prawns Fry
You can taste the sweetness of the sea prawns notwithstanding the robust masala. The prawns are fresh, springy to the bite and the masala coating this crustacean is fried to a delightful crust. Order these for sure.
Rs. 295 (usd 4.1)
9/10

Marvai Sukka 
The clams are wanting in their flavour. All that you taste is the masala, the clams barely make their presence felt. 
Rs. 160 (usd 2.2)
6/10

Crab Masala 
The crab is delicious, plump with briny-sweet flavoured flesh. Chew on the crab shell unabashedly to lap up every ounce of its goodness that also carries the flavour of the curry. The curry too has tones of the crab ‚Äòsweetness‚Äô. Another winner here at Fishland.
Rs. 275 (usd 3.8)
9.5/10

ADDRESS -  Hotel Fishland, 1st Cross Rd, Gandhi Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560 009; tel +91 +91 80 2291 2173
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/RXnr2PMSoCrebrJG9

Title: JAIPUR‚ÄôS Most Popular LASSI & KULFI | 75-Year-Old ORIGINAL LASSIWALA Shop | Hawa Mahal PANDIT KULFI
Description:
#Lassiwala #Jaipur #GourmetOnTheRoad

Jaipur‚Äôs Original and Most Popular Lassiwala Shop, No 312, Mirza Ismail Road, Lassiwala Jaipur, World Famous Malai Lassi, Lassi, Sweet Lassi, Hawa Mahal, Pandit Kulfi Jaipur, Pandit Kulfi, Malai Kulfi, Jaipur, Rajasthan, Street Food, Curd, Yoghurt, Dahi

People say if you haven't tasted the Lassi at the original Lassiwala shop in Jaipur, it‚Äôs like you haven‚Äôt visited Jaipur at all. I taste this city‚Äôs favourite thirst quencher, in fact it is sumptuous enough to qualify as a light meal replacement, with my friend, Jaydeep Patil. And also swing by the iconic Hawa Maha for a bite of another local favourite, the Pandit Malai Kulfi! Here‚Äôs a short and sweet GOTR Raw segment on this delicious escapade.

Sweet Lassi - The lassi is thick and delicious, sweetened just right, the thick curd malai floating on top adds a touch of decadence! An absolute must-try!
GOTR Rating - 10/10
Small glass - Rs. 30
Full glass - Rs. 60
ADDRESS -  Lassiwala (Original), 312, MI Road, Jayanti Market, New Colony, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302 001
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/necAJ9CJNCVi1VHs7


Pandit Malai Kulfi - A wholesome dairy treat especially after a tour of the adjacent Hawa Mahal. One tastes the delicate light-caramel flavour of reduced milk and wisps of cardamom on the palate. Another must-have when in Jaipur!
GOTR Rating - 9/10
Rs. 20 per stick
ADDRESS -  Pandit Kulfi, 110, Hawa Mahal Rd, Chandi Ki Taksal, J.D.A. Market, Sirahdeori Bazar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002; tel +91 94140 71922
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/EkAwzWS3WuRrrJgg9

Title: Exploring BANGALORE‚ÄôS  Tasty AVAREBELE FESTIVAL| VV PURAM FOOD STREET |Avarebele Vada, Dosa, Jilebi!
Description:
#AvarebeleMela #Bengaluru #GourmetOnTheRoad

Bengaluru‚Äôs Annual Avarebele Mela at Sri Vasavi Vaisistha THindi, VV Puram Food Street, Farm to Food, Hyacinth Beans, Hithkabele Masala Vade, Hithkabele Bonda, Avarebele Dose - Hithkabele Saru, Hithkabele Akki Rotti, Avarebele Mosaru Kodubale, Hithkabele Holige, Hithkabele Honey Jalebi, Payasa, Ellavare, Street Food

Now in its 20th year, Bengaluru‚Äôs annual Avarebele Mela that celebrates the Bengaluru bean in an array of ‚Äòsnacky‚Äô preparations, goes back to a time when farmers from in and around Bengaluru would congregate in VV Puram to sell their harvest of Avarekai. Given the bean‚Äôs short shelf life, any unsold produce would be thrown away. Which prompted Mrs Geetha Shivakumar, owner of Sri Vasavi Vasisitha Mane Thindi to put together a food festival that would make use of the Avarebele. And thus began a unique collaboration between farmers and a food entrepreneur that now has Bangalore‚Äôs food lovers congregating here for their share of deliciousness.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor visits the mela and tasted a delicious smorgasbord of preparations, from vade to bonda to dose to hollige to rotti to jalebi to payasa to pootharekulu, with one ingredient in common, the avarebele. Enjoy!

Hithkabele Masala Vade
A top draw at the mela, and also all year around, one can taste the freshness of coriander and dill in this spicy hithabele masala vade. 
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3) for 2 nos.
9/10

Hithkabele Bonda
A tad mellow in flavour, the bonda benefits from the weight of the avarekalu. It‚Äôs a pleasing snack, but fails to make as impactful an impression on the palate as the masala vade. 
Rs. 20 (usd  0.3) for 2 nos.
7/10

Avarebele Dose - Hithkabele Saru
The most popular item at the mela, this dosa is topped with a spirited mix of avarebele, coriander, dil and onions. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
9.5/10

Hithkabele Akki Rotti
The akki roti is toasted nice and thin, and crispened around the edges making for a delightful crunch. 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
8.5/10

Avarebele Mosaru Kodubale
Crisp and crunchy on the bite, but chewy as you linger on this bangle-shaped jeera and ajwain flavoured treat made of steamed rice flour, yoghurt and avarebele.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) for 4 nos.
8/10

Hithkabele Holige
Dripping with ghee and stuffed with tuvar dal, jaggery and hithkabele, one can taste the lingering aroma of cardamom on the palate. 
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
8.5/10

Hithkabele Honey Jalebi
The jalebi are a light pista green in colour from the avarebele which lends its strength to the fermented batter and renders the jalebis cripier and also lends it a tart edge.  
Rs. 20 (usd 0.3) for 4 nos.
8.5/10

Payasa
The avarebele payasa is smokey in its flavour. Although made with gas gase, poppy seeds, one does not taste the nuttiness of the ingredient. 
Rs. 30 (usd 0.3)
6.5/10

Ellavare
Sesame seeds, coconut milk, avarebele and jaggery come together in this thick dessert. I quite enjoyed the crunch of the fresh coconut and the earthy sweetness of the jaggery.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.3)
7/10

Putharekulu
The avarebele makes its way into the putharekulu as well. However, I‚Äôm tasting more of the wrap in this version as compared to the filling and that takes away from the enjoyment of what is otherwise an interesting sweet.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.3)
6/10

ADDRESS -  Sri Vasavi Vaisista Thindi, #78 3rd Block 5th Main Road, Thyagarajnagar Bull Temple Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560028; tel +91 97432 69356
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/Lt6hyr2okH8U9HJr5

Title: IYENGAR HOMESTYLE Breakfast At TKS IYENGAR‚Äôs |UNIQUE DISHES! Nuchinna Unde, BaleEle Idli, Hayagreeva
Description:
#VegetarianBreakfast #AuthenticBreakfast #GourmetOnTheRoad

TKS Iyengar‚Äôs must-visit for authentic Iyengar dishes. Three Generations Family Recipes, Vegetarian, No Garlic, Unique Homestyle Dishes, bale elle idli, thatte idli, classic idli, nuchinna unde, puliyogare, ottu shavige, god halubai, hayagreeva, sweet pongal, bangalore, breakfast

This recent entrant to Bengaluru‚Äôs vegetarian dining landscape located in the suburb of Basaveshwaranagar serves up Iyengar homestyle fare. Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this eatery for a late breakfast where he tastes an array of dishes, some hitherto unseen in restaurants, such as the Nuchinna Unde, Halubai, Hayagreeva (originally prepared as a temple offering), Ottu Shavige and more. He also meets the three generations of the TKS Iyengar family that is seeking to share its interesting culinary traditions with the people of Bengaluru though this endearing enterprise. Enjoy!

Bale Elle Idli 
The Bale Elle Idli carries with it the subtle aroma of the banana leaf in which it is steamed. The leaf also imbues the idli with a light colouring. You bite into the crunch of coconut and the lentils as you taste the idli, savour it with the sambar that‚Äôs perfect in its sour-sweet balance and the spirited chutney. Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) for 2 pcs
9/10

Thatte Idli
A deliciously delicate thatte idli, springy like it should be. Acts as the perfect canvas of sorts to soak up the flavours of the chutney and sambar.
Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) for 2 pcs
8.5/10

Classic Idli
Grainy in texture and porous, but pales in comparison to the bale elle and thatte idli served here.
Rs. 12 (usd 0.2)
7/10

Nuchinna Unde
If you need only one reason to visit TKS Iyengar, these steamed dumplings made of four lentil varieties would be it. A traditional Iyengar recipe wouldn‚Äôt use onions, but these are added here due to the wants of running a commercial establishment, which lends it a delightful crunch alongside the lentils. Rs. 30 (usd 0.4) for 2 pcs
10/10

Puliyogare
Cooked and cooled rice, flavoured with spicy tamarind paste and fortified with the crunch of lentils and ground lentils, this is a Iyengar classic with the perfect balance of flavours - touch of sweet that gives into sour and the warmth of  the spices. The puliyogare here is made with red rajamudi rice from Hassan. 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
9/10

Ottu Shavige
This sweet and ‚Äòkhaara‚Äô combo is served with ella pudi (a powder made of sesame seeds, peanuts and jaggery) gasgase (poppy seed) payasa and a nutty, spicy chutney, enlivened with mustard oil and red chillies.  
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
9/10

Godhi Halubai
Made with puree of wheat, coconut milk and jaggery, this wobbly pudding like dessert magically disappears into sweet ‚Äònothingness‚Äô when you place a piece in your mouth.
Rs. 10 (usd 0.15)
8/10

Hayagreeva 
Taste the creaminess of lentils and the bite of dried coconut and cashew nuts in this decadently sweet dessert that was originally made as an offering to Lord Hayagreeva. 
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
8.5/10

Sweet Pongal
The whiff of edible camphor that greets you on the palate disappears quickly into the background, leaving you to relish the milky richness of this rice and lentil dessert.
Rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
8/10

Coffee 
Nice way to end things after an indulgent meal here.
Rs. 10 (usd 0.15)
7/10

ADDRESS -  TKS Iyengar‚Äôs, Address: 274, 8th Main Rd, West Of Chord Road, West of Chord Road 1st Stage, Basaveshwar Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560079; tel +91 96069 04008
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/n6zmWZre9cHaMB9a9

Title: RAJASTHANI ROYAL THALI At Laxmi Mishthan Bhandar LMB JAIPUR| DAL BATI CHURMA, KAIR SANGRI | GOTR Raw
Description:
#RajasthaniFood #LaxmiMishthanBhandar #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Laxmi Mishthan Bhandar, is one of Japur‚Äôs oldest restaurants for a traditional Rajasthani meal, Vegetarian, Papad Mangori Soup, Dal Bati Churma, Kair Sangri, Danamethi Kishmish, Kadi Chokkanwali, Boondi Raita, Missi Roti, Mishri Mawa

Lakshmi Misthan Bhandar, or LMB as it is popularly known in Jaipur, is  much recommended to tourists for its traditional Rajasthani fare. In this GOTR Raw episode, I hook up with my friend Jaydeep Patil and taste this establishment‚Äôs Rajasthani Royal Thaali. Here‚Äôs what I thought of the meal. Enjoy!

The Rajasthan Royal Thaali is priced at Rs. 585 plus taxes per person.

ADDRESS: Laxmi Mishthan Bhandar, No. 98, 99, Johari Bazar Rd, Bapu Bazar, Biseswarji, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302 003; tel: +91 90246 09609

Title: FULL BENGALI LUNCH | Esplanade | Shukto, BHAJA, Bhetki PATURI, Katla JHOL, Kosha Mangsho, Mishti DOI
Description:
#BengaliFood #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Esplanade, Authentic Bengali Restaurant, Indiranagar, Bengaluru. Recipes from Chef Subhankar Dhar‚Äôs Mother. Best Bengali Restaurant in Bangalore, shuktoni, begun bhaja, bhetki paturi, daab chingri, katla jhol, kasha mangsho, mishit doi, rosogolla

Esplanade has been catering to Bengali palates in Bengaluru for the last 12 years. Helmed by Chef Subhankar Dhar, a native of Kolkata, it is the destination to savour an authentic Bengali meal experience in an elegant setting.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor catches up with Chef Dhar before settling down to a sumptuous meal that covers the entire spectrum of a Bengali lunch - from shukto to dal to bhaja to paturi, jhol, mangsho and chutney before ending with mishti, desserts. Enjoy! 

SHUKTONI 
The traditional way to start a Bengali lunch, the Shuktoni, made with cow‚Äôs milk, sun dried lentil dumplings and flavoured with wild celery seeds, radhuni, is rich in vegetables. 
Rs. 195 (usd 2.7)
9/10

BHAJA MUNGER DAL
This is a comforting lentil dish, mellow in its flavours, embellished with fresh peas and hint of cumin in its ghee seasoning. 
Rs. 185 (usd 2.6)
8/10

BEGUN BHAJA 
Thick, fleshy slices of eggplant, roasted on a tawa. The pulpy ‚Äòbegun‚Äô has a sweetish edge contrasted by the slightly bitter tones of its skin. A
Rs. 175 (usd 2.5) for 4 pcs
9/10

JHUE JHUREE ALOO BHAJA 
Rs. 155 (usd 2.2)
7/10

DHOKAR DALNA 
Lentil, gram flour cakes simmered in a spicy tomato onion gravy. The stodgy texture of the dhokar is lifted by the spirited flavours of the spicy gravy, dalna. 
Rs. 235 (usd 3.3)
8/10

BHETKI PATURI
This dish is an ode to the Bengali palate‚Äôs fascination with mustard. The Kolkata bhetki is swathed in a paste of mustard, coconut and green chillies, wrapped in a banana leaf and roasted, rendering the fish firm to the touch but moist inside. Rs. 475 (usd 6.7)

9/10

DAAB CHINGRI 
The sweetness of the coconut milk and tender coconut, the punch of mustard, the grainy texture of poppy seeds and the heat from green chillies come together to make this flavourful curry.  
Rs. 595 (usd 8.3)
8.5/10

KATLA JHOL
The plump piece of katla, a pond fish, is fried first before being introduced to the curry which has a lilt of fennel in its flavours. The fish is earthy in its aroma, has a bit of a bite around the edges and its soft and fleshy texture is the perfect medium to soak up the flavours of the jhol. 
Rs. 395 (usd 5.5)
10/10

KASHA MANGSHO 
A slow cooked dish of onions and meat in equal measure, braised over four hours, the kasha mangsho epitomises ‚Äòmeaty indulgence‚Äô! The fat, gelatin and marrow of the meat lend to the savoury, unctuous character of the dark, braised onions. Rs. 495 (usd 7)
10/10

TOMATO KHEJUR CHUTNEY
Rs. 95 (usd 1.3)
8/10

MISHTI DOI 
Flavoured with seasonal, nolen or nutan, meaning ‚Äònew‚Äô, gur, jaggery tapped from the date palm, this is a lush, sweet end to the meal at Esplanade. 
Rs. 145 (usd 2)
9/10

BAKED ROSOGOLLA 
Rosogolla made with nolen gur, soaked in a sugar-nolen gur syrup, topped with a nolen gur enriched reduced milk before being baked, this mishti screams decadent indulgence. 
Rs. 195 (usd 2.7)
8/10

ADDRESS: Esplanade, 202, Indiranagar Double Rd, Indira Nagar II Stage, Hoysala Nagar, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038; tel: +91 80 4092 7878 
LOCATION TAG: hhttps://goo.gl/maps/NwHYhKqAysHCFd8o9

Mughal Darbar, 50-year-old Mughlai restaurant in Jaipur, Mutton specialities, Mutton Shammi Kabab, Kebab, Mutton Stew, Mutton Korma, Mutton Adla, Khameri Roti, Roomali Roti, Tandoor

Title: Steaming Hot BUTTON IDLIS & SAMBAR At BENGALURU Airport | Popular Breakfast | GOTR Raw
Description:
#Breakfast #BangaloreAirport #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Button Idli and Sambar, Most Popular Breakfast at Bengaluru International Airport, Bangalore, Kempegowda International Airport

Savouring a tub of steaming hot button idlis doused with sambar seems to be a popular breakfast choice for most travellers flying out of Bengaluru‚Äôs Kempegowda International Airport. For some reason, in all my years of flying out of this airport, I hadn‚Äôt savoured these yet. And so on a recent trip to Jaipur with family and friends, I decided to taste some. Here‚Äôs a GOTR Raw video on our Button Idli experience. Enjoy!

ADDRESS: Malgudi Tiffin Centre, Kempegowda International Airport, KIAL Rd, Devanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560300; tel: +91 88844 50003
LOCATION TAG: https://goo.gl/maps/zVEViX4E9qX8ETxRA

Title: Don't Leave JAIPUR Without TASTING Most Famous RAWAT ONION, MAWA KACHORI, Kadai Ka Garam Doodh
Description:
#JaipurStreetFood #RawatKachori #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Rawat Misthan Bhandar, Jaipur‚Äôs famous Onion Kachori, Mawa Kachori, Mirchi Bada, Chilli Vada, Kadai Ka Garam Doodh, Hot Milk, Breakfast, Street Snacks

In this episode of GOTR Raw, I visit Rawat Misthan Bhandar, seemingly Jaipur‚Äôs most favourite shop for scrumptious Pyaaz or Onion Kachori. I am joined by my friend Jay Bhow as we taste the best kachoris we‚Äôve eaten - onion and mawa, followed by the Mirchi Bada, sweet lassi and a warming Kadai Ka Garam Doodh. Enjoy! 
Note: all dishes priced between Rs. 25 to 35

Title: TOP 9 CHAATS At Bangalore‚Äôs Oldest Chaat Shop GANGOTREE | KING OF Tasty KOLKATA, North INDIAN CHAATS
Description:
#BangaloreStreetFood #Chaats #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Gangotree Chaats and Sweets, Bangalore‚Äôs oldest and favourite chaat shop for Kolkata and North Indian style chaats, since 1986. Paani Puri, Jhal Mudi, Aloo Tikki Chola, Masala Cola, Rasagoola Chaat, Masala Puri, Dahi Samosa, Sev Puri, Channa Moth Chaat, Malai Ladoo

One of Bengaluru‚Äôs earliest chaat destinations, Gangotree has been satisfying chaat cravings since 1986 with its Kolkata and North Indian chaat offerings. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers editor, Kripal catches up with second generation owner, Raj Sethia over an indulgent chaat outing where he tastes over 9 of the eatery‚Äôs palate-teasing combinations. If you‚Äôre a chaat lover, this is for you! Enjoy! 

PAANI PURI
Super crunchy puri that holds together the spiced potato and bengal gram mix topped with the sweet, tangy paani, just long enough to unburden the delicious snack in your mouth. A riot of flavours and textures, this Kolkata style paani puri is a must-eat here.
rs. 40 (usd 0.6)
9/10

JHAL MUDI
True to its Kolkata roots, mustard oil is the hero in this concoction of puffed rice, potatoes, onions and peanuts. Served in a paper bag, this is the perfect fast food on the go for chaat lovers.
rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
8/10

ALOO TIKKI CHOLA
The aloo tikki, stuffed with green peas and grated coconut, has a nice crust. Topped with the hot chickpea gravy, this makes for a comforting snack. 
rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
8.5/10

MASALA COLA
A concoction of Indian cola served up with spices, it's the perfect thirst quencher to refresh the palate in between ‚Äòchatpata‚Äô plates of chaat.
rs. 50 (usd 0.7)
7/10

RASAGOOLA CHAAT
A unique creation here, the ‚Äòdissolve-in-the-mouth‚Äô rasagoola chaat appears quite bewildering. But the mild sweetness of the rasagoola seems to work with the sweet and spicy hit of chutneys, yoghurt and the crispy texture of sev. If you want to try something different, this is it.
Rs. 70 (usd 1)
8.5/10

MASALA PURI
Karnataka‚Äôs favourite chaat, I found it to be a bit mellow as compared to the pointed flavours of the other concoctions here. 
rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
7/10

DAHI SAMOSA
The crisp texture and robust flavours of the samosa have been tamed by the yoghurt. There‚Äôs the gentle aroma and flavour of fennel seeds in the samosa. Personally, I like the samosa just by itself.
rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
7/10

SEV PURI
The sev puri here plays ode to Mumbai‚Äôs streetfood with its perfect play of textures and tastes. There‚Äôs the crisp crunch of the papdi, the juicy crunch of onions and the cold creaminess of potatoes. The spicing is just perfect making every bite super-satisfying!
rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
9/10

CHANNA MOTH CHAAT
Made sans any fried ingredients, you need to specify this when you order, the channa moth chaat is a chatpata indulgence for the health conscious. This is what happens when chaat and salad come together. 
rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
8.5

MALAI LADOO
Rasagoola topped with reduced milk and saffron, this is a rich and indulgent dessert. 
rs. 30 (usd 0.4)
8/10


ADDRESS: Gangotree Sweets and Chaats, Shop No. 4108, High Point 4, 45 Palace Road, Shivajinagar, Vasanth Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tel: +91 94483 56848
LOCATION TAG: https://goo.gl/maps/zFD7H4Wevau2TZwp7

Title: ULTIMATE Calicut FISH CURRY, PAROTTA & CHICKEN FRY At Local Favourite HOTEL SAGAR | KERALA PRAWN FRY
Description:
#KeralaFood #CalicutFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Hotel Sagar, Calicut‚Äôs famous restaurant for fish curry, spring chicken fry, parotta, irani kebab, prawn dry fry, meen molagathu curry, pidhi kozhi porichathu, chicken biryani

A spot in Calicut that does not require too much of an introduction. Located at Mavoor Road, near the KSRTC Bus Stand, 45-year old Hotel Sagar serves a variety of food items from 6 am till late night at 2 am on all days of the week. So, depending on what you wish to have you can come here at any convenient time of the day. Meals, Parotta and Meen Curry, Pidi kozhi fry, Meen Porichathu, Chicken Biryani available here are an all-time hit among its customers.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna tastes some of the must-haves at this popular Kozhikoden eatery.
 
IRANI KEBAB
this dish is Hotel Sagar‚Äôs ode to the Middle Eastern region. Not a dish I would return for, but a tasty dish nonetheless.
rs. 240 (usd 3.3 )
6.5/10

PRAWN DRY FRY
the prawns are medium-sized and pack flavour. A tad excessive on salt, but nothing that a squeeze of lime can‚Äôt fix. I love the spicy-sweet bite of the prawn and toasty notes of coconut oil in which it has been fried. the sort of dish that will make a prawn lover happy. 
rs. 268 (usd 3.7)
8.5/10

AVOLI FISH FRY
The white pomfret is almost crunchy to the bite, the skin is fried to the perfect crisp and soft inside. If you like the flavour of your fish fry to be robust, eat it with a generous measure of the spicy coconut mix that‚Äôs garnishing the fish. 
rs. 375 (usd 5.2)
8.5/10

PIDI KOZHI PORICHATHU
it's a spring chicken, so there's tiny bones to work around to get to the meat. But once you get to the meat, it‚Äôs moist and delicious, swathed in a zesty coconut mixture. A must have dish at Hotel Sagar.
rs. 190 (usd 2.6 )
9/10

MEEN MOLAGATHU CURRY 
a hugely popular dish here, the fish has soaked up the spicy-sour flavours of the curry to the point where it almost disintegrates in your mouth sans any effort. The curry has a chilli kick that‚Äôs balanced by the acidity that comes from tamarind and tomatoes. The light rice pathiri and the layered parotta, both make for an ideal companion to mop up this tantalisingly tasty fish curry.
rs. 140 (usd 1.9)
10/10

CHICKEN BIRYANI
Kozhikoden style dum biryani made with kaima rice. the flavours in the biryani are well rounded, I definitely taste the prominent notes of cinnamon. The leghorn chicken is cooked to perfection and straddles the flavourful masala. 
rs. 172 (usd 2.4)
8.5/10

ADDRESS: Hotel Sagar
Mavoor Road Near KSRTC Bus Stand, Mavoor Road Junction, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001; tel: +91 495 272 0152
LOCATION TAG: https://maps.app.goo.gl/PaPn5paqoZzNK8Sv5

Title: INDIAN With A Twist ! Muesli CHAAT! JERK Spiced PANEER TIKKA!  BHARWAN GHEE ROAST At THE PUMP HOUSE
Description:
#IndianFood #ThePumpHouse #GourmetOnTheRoad 

The Pump House, South Bangalore‚Äôs largest open concept microbrewery, JP Nagar, Bengaluru, Indian bar snacks with a twist, Muesli Chat, Jerk Spiced Paneer Tikka, Bharwan Mushroom Ghee Roast, Dahi Ke Kebab, Madras Curry Spiced Lamb, Kheema Ghotala

In the debut episode of GOTR Raw, a rough-around-the-edges vlog, I catch up with my friend and chef, Vishal Atreya over lunch. A top chef with leading hospitality chains, prior to taking the entrepreneurial plunge with a microbrewery venture, Vishal brings his experience across culinary repertoires to an eclectic Indian menu at The Pump House. I sit down for an interesting chat where we discuss everything from toddy shop menu inspirations to food phrases to the best paneer for paneer tikka, and a tasting of six delicious dishes.

ADDRESS: The Pump House, #607, 15th Cross, Outer Ring Rd, 1st Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078

Title: MOST POPULAR Bangalore BREAKFAST At MAVALLI TIFFIN ROOMS | Making BEST Rava Idli | TASTING 11 ITEMS
Description:
#VegetarianBreakfast #BestRestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Full Breakfast at MTR (Mavalli Tiffin Rooms) Restaurant, Lalbagh Road, Bengaluru, nearly 100-Years Old Eatery, Vegetarian Food, Bengaluru‚Äôs Most Popular Restaurant, Bengaluru's Most Popular Breakfast Spot, Rice Idli, Medu Vada, Rava Idli, Masala Dosa, Kesari Bath, Khara Bath, Chandrahara, Damroot, Dumrot, Badam Halwa,

This nearly-100-year-old establishment is chock full with customers every hour of the day when they are open. With a loyal fan following that values its adherence to age-old recipes and traditions to serve up consistent, wholesome South Indian fare, Mavalli Tiffin Rooms on Lalbagh Road is perhaps Bengaluru‚Äôs most popular breakfast destination.  

Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna drops in for a full breakfast and tastes 11 must-try dishes from this timeless eatery‚Äôs repertoire. He begins with a kitchen tour with VIkram Maiya, Managing Partner, MTR before sitting down to a sumptuous meal that includes amongst others, a dessert creation that‚Äôs the restaurant founder‚Äôs ode to French pastry. Enjoy!

RICE IDLI
The idlis are soft and a hot, buttery treat when had with the ghee. The coriander in the idli adds to its flavour. The idli dissolves in the mouth when immersed in the nourishingly thick sambar.
rs. 33 (usd 0.5)
8.5 

MEDU VADA
The vada exhibits a textbook crunch as it yields to the bite! Delicious with the sambar and comes alive with the spicy kick of the chutney. 
Rs. 44 (usd 0.6)
8

RAVA IDLI
Made of roasted semolina, yoghurt and speckled with fresh coriander, toasted cashews, and lentils, the rava idli makes for a hearty breakfast. The creamy potato sagu is a flavourful accompaniment to the rava idli.
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
10

KHARA BATH 
Fortified with carrots, slivers of green chilli and crested with a tomato slice, the khara bath is soft and crumbly, yet holds itself together. The pudina chutney helps tone down the tart notes of the lime and tomato. 
Rs. 62 (usd 0.9)
8

KESARI BATH
This breakfast treat glistens with the lushness of ghee. Embellished with toasted raisins and nuts, the kesari bath here is rich in its texture owing to the shavige (rice vermicelli) and semolina mix. 
Rs. 57 (usd 0.8)
9

MASALA DOSA
The dosa here is iconic and never disappoints. Made with a blend of three rice varieties, including two red rice varieties that lend a toasty colour tone, the dose is crisp outside and soft within. The palya is seasoned just right. Rs. 90 (usd 1.3)
10

PUDI DOSA
It‚Äôs soft, fluffy and big on flavours. You can taste the grainy crunch of lentils, the sharp, spicy notes of the chilli and the undertones of asafoetida. Tame its aggression with the palya and coconut chutney. 
Rs. 95 (usd 1.3)
8

DAMROOT 
Made of shredded pumpkin, semolina, raisins, nuts and tonnes of ghee, this MTR sweet is scented with cardamom. 
Rs. 47 (usd 0.6)
8.5

BADAM HALWA
You can ‚Äòalmost‚Äô drink this lush, buttery, silken almond halwa enriched with ghee and flecks of saffron. 
Rs. 60 (usd 0.8)
10

CHANDRAHARA 
MTR‚Äôs ode to French pastry, this ‚Äòsugary-sweet‚Äô pastry is fried in pure ghee, garnished with almond slivers and doused with a khova (milk solids) syrup. 
Rs. 67 (usd 0.9)
8

ADDRESS -  Mavalli Tiffin Rooms, #14, Lal Bagh Main Road, Doddamavalli, Sudhama Nagar, Bengaluru 560 027; tel +91 80 2222 0022
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/cyoTvBHVPGSJJ7he9

Title: LOCAL Chef Prepares His FAMILY'S FAVE Kerala FISH CURRY + GreenPepper Mackerel Fry| The Raviz Kadavu
Description:
#FishCurryRecipe #FishCurry #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Traditional Kerala Fish Curry Recipe, Black Pomfret Curry, Spicy Curry, Avoli VaruthaRacha Curry, Green Pepper Mackerel Fry, Ayala Valli Kurumulagu, Poricha Pathiri, The Raviz Kadavu, Kozhikode, Chef Arun Ramanunni Nair

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna goes fish shopping with Chef Arun Ramanunni Nair of The Raviz Kozhikode, after which he watches the chef cook up a delicious sour and spicy fish curry with black pomfret. This Avoli Varutharacha curry is then savoured with a scrumptious Poricha Pathiri and boiled rice.

Chef Nair also serves up a unique mackerel fry, Ayala Valli Kurumulagu, flavoured with strings of green pepper pearls at Garam restaurant in the lush settings of The Raviz Kadavu, a stunning resort nestled on the banks of the legendary Chaliyar River just outside Kozhikode.

AYALA VALLI KURUMULAGU
This delightful twice-cooked fish is moist and flavoursome.  I've never tasted mackerel prepared like this before. you taste the tartness of the lime, the whisper of the cheriya pepper, sweetness of the shallots and the flavour of the fish  that rounds off everything. Eat with the pumpkin leaves if you're looking to get some fiber into your system.

AVOLI VARUTHARACHA CURRY
The fish has soaked up the robust flavours of roasted, hand-ground masala, you can taste the toasty, creamy notes of the coconut, the earthy flavours of the coriander and the sharp edge of the tamarind. The poricha pathiri makes for a scrumptious accompaniment to this delicious fish curry, as would some local boiled rice.

RECIPE FOR AVOLI VARUTHARACHA CURRY
Serves 4
 
For the fish marinade:
Black pomfret 500 gms (after cleaning)
Rock salt 1 ¬Ω tsp 
Tamarind water 100 ml
 
For the ground masala:
Coconut oil 30 ml
Shallots 50 gms
Garlic 25 gms
Desiccated coconut 200 gms
Coriander seeds 40 gms
Whole dried red chilli 4 nos.
Curry leaves 10 gms
Turmeric powder 1 tsp
Coriander powder 2 tsp
Chilli powder 1 tsp
 
For the fish curry:
Coconut milk (50ml) at the finish to balance the dish.
Tomatoes, 2 nos.
Curry leaves 5 gms
 
For tempering:
Coconut oil 30 ml
Mustard seeds 10 gms
Fenugreek seeds 5 gms
Thin slices of shallots 30 gms
Bits of coconut 25 gms
Curry leaves 10 gms
Whole red chilli 2 nos.
 
Method of preparation:
Marinate the fish with rock salt and tamarind water. Keep aside for 30 minutes.
Saute the ingredients for ground masala till golden brown. Add turmeric, red chilli and coriander powder into the mix.
Remove masala mixture from fire and allow it to cool down. 
Make a fine paste, mix this masala into the marinated fish. Add two whole tomatoes, quartered into mix it well add curry leaves.
Put back on fire and allow it to simmer on a medium flame.
Occasionally, gently stir the curry until the fish is cooked.
Finish the preparation by adding coconut milk to balance the flavours. 
Make a tempering with the ingredients and ladle over the curry. Serve with hot rice or pathiri.


ADDRESS - The Raviz Kadavu, NH 17, Bypass, Road, Azhinjilam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673632; tel: +91 0495 241 1111
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/1JCnP9oEDZtvNbtbA

Title: This TEA SHOP Serves Up AMAZING Local Flavours With A DELICIOUS TWIST! ADAMINTE CHAYAKKADA Calicut
Description:
#KeralaFood #CalicutFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Adaminde Chayakkada, must visit destination for Malabari Food served with a twist, Kidilan Prawns Fry, Kozhi Porichathu, Kallumakaya Nirachathu, Kunzhi Kozhi Nirachathu, Elaneer Chicken, Mapranam Fish Curry, Chatti Choru, Parotta Kizhi, Avil Milk

A relatively new entrant to Kozhikode‚Äôs vibrant food scene, Adaminte Chayakkada or Adam‚Äôs tea shop is the brainchild of investment banker turned restaurateur, Aneez Adam. A self-confessed food lover, Aneez sought to showcase the culinary traditions of his Mappila community but in a format that seemed relevant to current times. And thus was born ACKD, as it is known in local parlance, a tea shop that celebrates quirk in its decor and innovation in some of the fare on the menu, a formula that seems to have helped position it firmly on Kozhikode‚Äôs dining map.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits Adaminte Chayakkada to chat with Aneez Adam and also taste some signatures on the menu, both traditional and dishes served up with the ACKD spin.

KIDILAN CHEMEEN FRY
Served quirkily in an old-fashioned iron box, these tiger prawns cooked in the skin are juicy and moist despite being charred. The prawns certainly hold their own against spicy assault of the red chilli aided by the toasty notes of coconut oil.
rs. 300 (usd 4.2)
9/10

KITABILEY KOZHI PORICHATHU
A chicken dish that will certainly hold your attention with its hot and spicy kick, If you‚Äôre faint-hearted, you may want to tame the chilli in this satay with a squeeze of lime.
rs. 235 (usd 3.3)
8.5/10

KALLUMAKAYA NIRACHATHU
A popular Kozhikoden snack, this dish of mussels stuffed with rice flour and then deep-fried with spices is a fixture on almost every restaurant menu. rs. 25 (usd 0.4) per piece
7.5/1

KUNZHI KOZHI NIRACHATHU
This roasted spring chicken, stuffed with mutta (egg) and masala made of loads of onions, thick coconut milk and cashew paste, makes for a rich bite, one that‚Äôs worthy of being served as a traditional first breakfast to a groom after the wedding. rs. 235 (usd 3.3)
10/10

ELANEER CHICKEN
Thickened with tender coconut and garnished with slivers of fresh coconut, this chicken stew is an ode to the versatility of the fruit of the cocos nucifera. There‚Äôs a gentle sweetness to this velvety stew and the gentle warmth of ginger and green chilli. 
rs. 294 (usd 4.1)
9/10

MAPRANAM FISH CURRY
A vivacious curry that reflects typical toddy shop fare. The sour notes of the kokum dominate this ayakora or kingfish curry, followed by the heat of red chillies and the pungency of garlic. Savour this with boiled rice.
rs. 500 (usd 6.9) price varies, depending on the size of fish.
9/10 

CHATTI CHORU
Basically, the equivalent of a sadhya served in a claypot (chatti). Work the choru (rice) with the smorgasbord of dishes in the chatti, be it the dry shrimp chutney, the fried fish, aviyal or the fish thiyal, or coriander fish curry. rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
8/10

PAROTTA KIZHI
A weighty dish of three parottas drenched in coconut milk and wrapped around chicken masala and steamed in a banana leaf bundle. A sumptuous one-dish meal. 
rs. 190 (usd 2.6)
8/10

AVIL MILK (CALICUT FALOODA)
AC‚Äôs spin on the Malabar staple, avil milk, is loaded with calories but sinfully delicious!
rs. 80 (usd 1.1)
9/10

CHILLI HORLICKS
Sweet Horlicks spiked with chilli flakes and pepper! Perfect for a cold night, if ever Kozhikode has one. 
rs. 55 (usd 0.8)
7/10
ADDRESS - Adaminte Chayakkada, Beach Rd, opp. Kozhikode Corporation Office, Mananchira, Kozhikode, Kerala 673032; tel: +91 495 2365800
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/PAi5DBWjWtuMZb1Q7

Title: HYDERABADI Chef Cooks MOST FAMOUS Hyderabad Vegetarian Dish | NIZAMI HANDI Recipe| Novotel Hyderabad
Description:
#HyderabadiCuisine #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

How to make Nizami Handi, Vegetarian Nizami Handi Recipe. Easy Vegetarian Recipes.

Although Hyderabadi cuisine is known for its richly flavoured meat dishes and kebabs, there are also delicious vegetarian recipes like this Nizami Handi, a mixed vegetable curry enriched with cashew paste, cream and gently flavoured with whole spices. The velvety gravy, and medley of veggies makes this dish a stiff competition to every non-vegetarian counterpart.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna joins Chef Iqbal at Novotel Hyderabad Convention Center as he makes this rich, aromatic, and gently spiced vegetarian dish made in the ‚ÄòHandi‚Äô, a traditional wide, heavy-bottomed pot used in Indian cooking. Hence the name of this royal dish!

Indicative recipe for Nizami Handi:
Serves Four
Ingredients: 
1 pinch of ajwain or caraway seeds
1 pinch of jeera or cumin seeds
3 onions, chopped
3 tomatoes, chopped 
1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste 
1 small bunch of spinach, chopped 
1 carrot, diced 
1 small cauliflower, cut into florets
6 pieces of baby corn, diced
50g of green peas 
200g of cashewnut paste 
200g of tomato puree
50ml cooking oil 
1 teaspoon chilli powder 
1 tsp jeera or cumin powder
1 tsp garam masala 
1 large pinch of kasuri methi powder (dry fenugreek leaves)
50ml cooking cream 
A small handful of chopped coriander to garnish. 

Method:
1. Heat the oil in a pan.
2. Add ajwain and whole jeera and stir till fragrant.
3. Add onions and cook until they are translucent.
4. Add the tomatoes.
5. Once the tomatoes are cooked through and the raw flavour is gone, add ginger garlic paste.
6. Once the paste has cooked through, add chilli powder and cumin powder and saute. 
7. Add the cashew nut gravy as well as the tomato puree. 
8. Add your vegetables along with enough water to submerge them. 
9. Let the mixture cook over medium flame until vegetables are tender (10-15 minutes) 
10. Finish with fresh cream, kasuri methi powder,and fresh coriander leaves 
11. Serve hot with roti or rice. 

ADDRESS - Near, Kondapur, Izzathnagar, HITEC City, Hyderabad, Telangana 500081
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/fbQADsEGDARxsg7y5

Title: Popular MALABAR Snacks At 70-Year-Old BOMBAY HOTEL Calicut | UNAKAYA, ELANCHI, ELADA, BIRYANI CHAI..
Description:
#MalabarSnacks #CalicutFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Best Malabar Snacks. Bombay Hotel Kozhikode. Calicut Bombay Hotel, Kozhikode Street Food, Moplah Snacks At Bombay Hotel Calicut. Elanchi. Unakaya. Mutton Cutlet. Biryani Chai. Chemmeen Cake.

A landmark on Silk Street, Kozhikode, Bombay Hotel has stood the test of time for 70 years and is still going strong, dishing out over 20 varieties of Moplah snacks come tea time every day! 

The spot to savour some Malabari snack classics and this is exactly what Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna does in this episode of Gourmet On The Road. He treats himself to the elanchi (thin crepes stuffed with a mix of bananas, coconut, sugar and raisins), a custardy savoury chemmeen or prawn cake, a biryani chai and much more! 

BIRYANI CHAI
A fancy name for this gimmicky tea poured skilfully into a glass such that the milk and tea liquor hold their own in a dancing swirl! Fancy name aside, and there are no biryani spices in this, the tea makes for a punchy companion to the loaded desserts and savouries here. 
rs. 22 (usd 0.3) 
8/10

CHICKEN PUFF
Not so pleasing to the eye, the chicken puff is flavourful. A deep-fried maida puff stuffed with chicken, onions green chillies and turmeric, this snack makes for a delicious accompaniment to some hot chai!
rs. 22 (usd 0.3) 
8/10

MUTTON CUTLET
A filling cutlet of meat and onions flavoured with ginger. I was expecting a more meaty flavour, but you taste mostly the onions and some flour that‚Äôs gone in as a binder in this snack. 
rs. 20 (usd 0.3) 
7/10

ERACHI PATHIRI
This stuffed pathiri is generous on the onions, but a trifle sparing on the meat, which in itself has a bit of a bite. Prepare to spend some time chewing on this.
rs. 35 (usd 0.5) 
7/10

CHEMEEN CAKE
a cake with a difference, this savoury steamed cake comprises of spiced shrimp sandwiched between layers of the soft cake. On the palate, I detect a hint of sweetness which contrasts with the mildly spicy shrimp. You can definitely taste the shrimp flavour in this! 
rs. 28 (usd 0.4) 
8.5/10

ELANCHI
A moist wobbly pancake that‚Äôs stuffed with ripe banana, fresh coconut, sugar and nuts. The tart sweetness of the banana combined with the juicy bite of the coconut is endearing, clearly a dessert that‚Äôs a must-try here.
rs. 17 (usd 0.2) 
10/10

MUTTAPOLA
They love eggs in desserts at Bombay Hotel, and this egg white and ripe banana steamed cake is a taste to be acquired. 
rs. 19 (usd 0.3) 
7/10

SP UNNAKAYA
A sticky maida fritter with a coconut, banana and egg filling. I was bracing to taste some ‚Äòegginess‚Äô, but thankfully you don‚Äôt. One tastes the sweet tartness of the banana and the flavour of the coconut. Certainly a snack that grows on you.
rs. 17 (usd 0.2) 
8.5/10

ELADA
A gooey steamed rice cake stuffed with coconut, banana, some lentils and jaggery, best eaten with a spoon. The rice casing is slightly mushy in texture, but the hero of this treat is certainly the banana. 
rs. 20 (usd 0.3) 
7/10

LEMON TEA
the lemon tea helps reset your palate and appetite if you want to dive back into some of the delicacies at bombay hotel. 
rs. 10 (usd 0.1) 
8/10

ADDRESS - Bombay Hotel, Silk St, Kuttichira, Kozhikode, Kerala 673032; tel: 0495 310 2412
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/rqs7viqM43fuDndeA

Title: MAKING of CHICKEN BIRYANI at KERALA‚Äôs Most Popular PARAGON RESTAURANT, Kozhikode | Tasting 11 DISHES
Description:
#MostPopularRestaurantInKerala #ParagonHotelKozhikode #GourmetOnTheRoad

Most Popular Restaurant In Kerala. Paragon Restaurant Kozhikode. Paragon Chicken Biryani recipe, Chicken Dum Biryani, Crab Bhumika, Meen Moilee, Mango Fish Curry, Mutton Varthiyathu.

A Keralan culinary institution that people are familiar with not just in the state but beyond its borders, Paragon Restaurant, is perhaps the oldest and by large the most popular restaurant in the city of Kozhikode. Established in way back in 1939, Paragon has built an empire across the world with restaurants in various parts of Kerala and the Middle East. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the iconic restaurant on Kannur Road, where Paragon was born to meet Sumesh, third-generation owner. He then visits the kitchen to watch their revered Paragon Chicken Biriyani being made from scratch. He then sits down to savour some of the most ordered dishes on the menu.

PRAWN DRY FRY
You taste the sweetness of the fresh prawns and the fragrance of the coconut oil in which this crustacean is fried. The prawn is perfectly seasoned and cooked textbook perfect to a yielding crunch and succulent inside.
rs. 315 (usd4.4) 
10/10

PAN FRIED MUSSELS
The mussels are cooked supple in a savoury mix of onions, curry leaves and green chillies. A play of flavours and textures, one tastes the toasty lilt of the curry leaves, the bite of the onions and gentle heat of the pepper.
rs. 331 (usd4.7) 
9/10

PAN FRIED SQUID
The squid, though cooked to a pleasing springy bite is quite neutral in its flavour and needs to be cocooned in the masala for it to make an impression on the palate.
rs. 273 (usd3.8) 
7.5/10

TAMARIND FISH
This Paragon creation teases the senses with its medley of flavours. You taste the sourness that comes from the vinegar, the sweetness of jaggery and the lingering warmth of ginger in the sauce in which the fried kingfish is tossed. 
rs. 336 (usd4.7) 
9/10

CRAB BHUMIKA
I love the size of these juicy sea crabs, they're soft and one can bite into them whole to relish the flavours of the dish. You taste the sweetness of the crab meat, the freshness of the ingredients, coriander, green chillies, ginger, garlic and the sour twang of lime.  
rs. 231 (usd3.2) 
9/10

AVOLI MOILEE
The delicate white pomfret is the perfect accomplice to the mellow, soothing flavours of this creamy coconut stew, punctuated with the notes of kokum, curry leaves and green chilli. Enjoy this with a lacey appam.
rs. 452 (usd6.3) 
9/10

MANGO FISH CURRY
Another popular dish here, the ayakora or kingfish has imbibed the sour notes of the raw mango. The shallots add a robust bite and the heat from slivers of ginger contrasts with the slightly sour notes of this curry.
rs. 273 (usd3.8) 
10/10

MUTTON VARTIYATHU
A mutton preparation that‚Äôs rich in flavour and texture. The meat, onions, tomatoes and spices have been slow-cooked for a few hours to come together in a lush gravy. 
rs. 254 (usd3.6) 
9.5/10

CHICKEN BIRIYANI
The biriyani here is plated in a layered mound, milky white grains of the mildly aromatic kaima rice or jeerakasala rice sit at the crest, followed by a layer of masala-stained rice, a savoury ribbon of masala and fried onions separating the two. 
rs. 168 (usd 2.4) 
10/10

ADDRESS - Paragon Restaurant, Kannur Rd, near CH Over bridge, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001; tel: 495 404 0000
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/mxYhKFGBmSeFYRYQ7

Title: Making & Tasting KOZHIKODE'S Famous RAHMATH HOTEL BIRYANI | Mutton, Chicken| ft@VolpeWhereAreYou
Description:
#Rahmath Hotel #Gourmet On The Road #Kozhikode

Kozhikode‚Äôs Famous Rahmath Hotel Biryani, Chicken, Mutton and Beef Biryani, Mutton Stew, Surprise Collab with Venezuelan-American blogger, Volpe Where Are You

A much-loved biryani destination in Kozhikode is Rahmath Hotel, famous for its meaty biryani, led by beef and mutton. Although they offer many varieties of biryani including chicken, fish, prawns, mussels and squid, it‚Äôs the meat biryanis that draw in serpentine queues of people especially on weekends.

Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna meets Mohammed Suhail, 2nd generation owner of Rahmath Hotel and explores the making of the biryani before sitting down to a sumptuous biryani meal and a surprise collab with Carlos Volpe, a visiting Venezuelan blogger from Miami who produces insightful destination stories that make for an interesting watch. Do follow his travel vlogs on his channel, Volpe Where Are You https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcPVzEbEIv1GUl_c4owKuhg


Mutton stew 
An aromatic stew, the meat has soaked up the lush creaminess of the coconut milk and the savouriness of the onions which also lend a gentle bite. the potatoes in the stew also add to the body of this dish. The meat pieces are tender and thoughtfully sized small, make this a dish that‚Äôs convenient to share. Enjoy this with soft, puffy, rice pathiris. 
rs. 140 (usd 1.8); pathri rs. 9 (usd 0.1 ) for each
8.5/10

Kallumakaya Fry
Cooked in a thick gravy made of onions, tomatoes, green chillies, the kallumakaya or mussels are cooked to the perfect texture that results in a juicy, yielding bite of this mollusc. This preparation displays a harmonious balance of savoury, sweet, sour, the warmth that comes from slivers of ginger, and is perfect to be mopped up with the rice pathiri.
rs. 155 (usd 2.0) 
10/10

Chicken Biryani
A steaming hot biryani, served with lemon and dates pickle, raita and salad, as typical to the region. The white leghorn chicken is cooked twice, first in the masala and next, as the biryani simmers on dum. The bird is juicy and moist. The flavour of the biryani is quite gentle, if you like it spicy, you can always perk things up with the lemon date and chilli pickle.
rs. 155 (usd 2.0 ) 
8.5/10

Mutton Biryani
This one-dish meal is a happy celebration of flavours. the meat, coated in a robust masala, is cooked to perfect doneness and is a juicy pink inside. the tomatoes lend a gentle acidity, thereby a unique to the biryani. you can never tire of a good biryani and this is definitely one of those.
rs. 230 (usd 2.9) 
10/10

Beef Biryani
A flavourful biryani that jolts your senses awake. you can savour the hearty presence of the meat in the rice. the meat is tender, has a salty savouriness that complements the spices in the masala. you definitely taste the fulsome meat broth in every grain of rice. 
rs. 110 (usd 1.4) 
10/10

ADDRESS - Aravind Ghosh Rd, Near Mathrubhumi Office, Mananchira, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001; Tel. +91 98950 63252
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/exShmuxjT6EZisK49

Title: Must-Try KALANTHAN'S Sharjah Milkshake, KUMARI Banana Chips, BHASKARETTAN Milk Sarbath | Kozhikode
Description:
#Kalanthans #BhaskarettanMilkShake #KumariBananaChips

Kozhikode Street Food & Treats, Kalanthan‚Äôs Milkshakes, Bhaskarettans Milk Sarbath, Kumari Banana 

Given Kozhikode‚Äôs hot and humid weather, it comes as no surprise that the people here love their cool, refreshing drinks. And what rules their craving for an icy cold thirst quencher are the thick, satisfying milkshakes at Kalanthan‚Äôs and Bhaskarettans satisfying milk sarbath. 

When it comes to a ‚Äòsnacky‚Äô bite, the banana chip is what‚Äôs on every Kozhikoden‚Äôs mind. And the best specimens of these are found at Kumari Banana Chips where these scrumptious treats are made fresh through the day. 

Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna spends a day savouring these, guided ably by Chef Arun Ramanunni Nair, Regional Executive Chef of Raviz Hotels & Resorts.   

SHARJAH SHAKE 
you don't drink this shake you eat it! it's as thick as that. you taste the flavour of the mildly sweet banana that is integrated into the frozen milk and the subtle undertones of cocoa. Disregard the sugar and this could be an incredibly nutritious milkshake.
rs 40. (usd 0.6) 
8.5/10

STRAWBERRY MILKSHAKE 
tart, sweet and lusciously thick, this strawberry shake is delicious. 
rs 60. (usd 0.8) 
8/10

CUSTARD APPLE MILKSHAKE 
My favourite shake here, you taste the ripe sweetness of the custard apple and its grainy bite. A glass of this would make for a refreshing meal substitute. 
rs 60. (usd 0.8) 
9/10

AVOCADO MILKSHAKE 
the sweet, buttery mouthfeel of the avocado, albeit with a slightly bitter edge, is a tasty way to get your superfood fix for the day. 
rs 60. (usd 0.8) 
8/10

BHASKARETTAN‚ÄôS MILK SARBATH (MS) 
This popular kozhikoden thirst quencher tastes quite similar to a melted vanilla ice cream laced the earthy tones of the sasparilla root extract. delicious! 
rs 20. (usd 0.3)
8/10

KUMARI BANANA CHIPS 
The banana chips are made fresh. you can watch these seriously addictive chips being made from the raw banana in a matter of minutes, seasoned just right with the perfect crispness and seasoning. 
rs 350. (usd 4.9) per kilo
10/10


ADDRESS - Kalanthan‚Äôs E.P.K. Fruit Centre, LIC Road, Mananchira, opposite Calicut District Sports Council, Kozhikode, Kerala 673 001; Tel. +91 98954 31401
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/QcP3M7jhPjZii7tZ7

ADDRESS - Kozhikode Milk Sarbath, Opp Paragon Hotel, CH Flyover, Vellayil, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001
LOCATION TAG - https://g.co/kgs/X6psw5 

ADDRESS: Kumari Banana Chips, 6/1044 Kannur Road Opp To Paragon Hotel, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001; Tel. +91 495 276 8890
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/BfjRFNd4EErtyeWJ7

Title: Most Popular FISH FRY in Kozhikode| Amma Hotel | Kingfish, Red Snapper,Fish Meals| Calicut Food Tour
Description:
#AmmaHotel #Kozhikode #GourmetOnTheRoad

Most Popular Fish Fry and Fish Meal Restaurant in Kozhikode, Amma Hotel, Ayakora (Kingfish) Fry, Chembali (Red Snapper) Fry, Fish Meal

Come lunchtime and locals in Kozhikode (Calicut) flock to this eatery set in a home in the tiny bylanes of Puthiyara. What draws the crowd here is their Ayakora or Kingfish fry and their satisfying fish meal served on a banana leaf.

Food Lovers‚Äô editor, Kripal Amanna visits this fish fry icon and after a tour of the kitchen where fish are slathered with a secret masala, lashings of coconut oil and fried over a rubber wood fire, sits down for a sumptuous meal.   

AYAKORA (KINGFISH) FRY
a much loved fish in the city, found in almost every eatery. Served here with a thick layer of a spirited masala slathered on a thick slice of kingfish, the bite of the masala has almost tamed the flavour of the fish. Slightly salty and redolent with the aroma of coconut oil, the fish fry masala is also a great accompaniment to be savoured with the rice and lentil curry. 
rs 160. (usd 2.2)
9.5/10

CHEMBALI (RED SNAPPER) FRY
a plump piece of red snapper naped with the Amma Hotel masala. Since this is a meatier fish than the ayakora, the masala doesn‚Äôt penetrate all the way in. if you like your fish fry robustly flavoured the ayakora is for you. but if you like it spicy and still want to enjoy the flavour of the fish the red snapper is what you should be trying. 
rs 150. (usd 2.1)
9/10


FISH MEALS
The swollen grains of kuruva rice are the perfect medium to carry the flavours of a tasty vegetable paruppu curry and also tame the aggression of the spices in the fish fry masala. For a mere 50 rupees, this unlimited meal that includes a simple choora (tuna) curry, valakaya (raw banana) upperi and rasam, is a meal that provides nourishment, satisfaction and taste!
rs 50. (usd 0.7)
8.5/10

ADDRESS - Amma Hotel, Puthiyara Rd, Puthiyara, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004; tel: +91 98461 53898

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/ghCnGDwNiQXjFFwT7

Title: Authentic, BEST Mappila Meal | ZAIN‚ÄôS HOTEL| Kozhikode |Cooking CHICKEN BIRYANI‚Ä¶ Mutton Stew|Calicut
Description:
#MappilaCuisine #Kozhikode #GourmetOnTheRoad

Authentic Moplah Cuisine in Kozhikode at Zain‚Äôs Hotel, Calicut, Mappila Cuisine, Chatti Pathiri, Kallumakaya, Mutton Stew, Chicken Biryani, Ghee Rice, Chicken Masala

Zain‚Äôs Hotel Kozhikode stands testament to Mrs Zainabi Noor‚Äôs firm resolve to showcase the Mappila cuisine of her family. Kozhikode‚Äôs first lady restaurateur, she began her culinary enterprise 29 years ago as a small tea stall dispensing evening snacks. Spurred by the love she received from her customers, Zain‚Äôs today stands tall in Calicut as the address for homestyle Malabar cuisine.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this cosy restaurant set in a home and meets the mother-daughter duo of Zainabi Noor and Shireen Mustafa who oversee every detail of the operation. He also looks at the making of their popular chicken biryani, ghee rice and chicken masala in their kitchen ‚Äòmanned‚Äô only by lady cooks, before sitting down to a generous lunch.

CHATTI PATHIRI 
A 12-layered baked pancake interspersed with eggs, poppy seeds and raisins, each bite is a delicious crunch followed by luscious overtones of the ghee, caramelised sugar and the textural play of nuts. This is one dessert that‚Äôs a must-have here.
rs 25. (usd 0.4)
8.5/10

KALLUMAKAYA NIRACHATHU
Twice cooked, first the mussels are steamed in a rice cake with spices and then fried, the kallumakaya niracathu is a speciality at Zain‚Äôs. Peel the shell away to reveal the mussel, the rice cake is a tad crunchy to the bite and yet moist within, the flavour of the masala has seeped into the rice dumpling. 
rs 29. (usd 0.4) per piece
10/10

FISH FRY
Lightly coated with a masala that plays second fiddle to the flavours of the plump ayakora or kingfish, this fry snares the moist flakey-ness of the fish in a light crunch. The turmeric lends it a delightful golden-orange hue. 
rs 200. (usd 2.8) per piece
8.5/10

MUTTON STEW
Rich in coconut milk, this creamy stew carries within itself juicy chunks of meat that is yielding and flavourful. The tingling sensation of green chillies on the palate is balanced by the ripe acidity of the tomatoes. Best savoured with the ghee rice.
rs 250. (usd 3.5) per piece
10/10

GHEE RICE AND CHICKEN MASALA
The rich chicken masala makes for the perfect companion to the aromatic ghee rice. Rounding up the rich tones of the onions, tomatoes and curry leaves is the coconut oil that floats to the top of this dish, absorbing the flavours of the vivacious masala along the way. 
Chicken masala rs 150. (usd 2.1), ghee rice rs 60 (usd 0.8) 
8.5/10

CHICKEN BIRYANI
This isn't a biryani that jostles your tastebuds, it embraces your palate gently with light flavours of the fried onions and spices. The chicken is moist, having absorbed the flavours of the marinade as it cooks slowly over dum for an hour. The biryani exudes a hint of smokiness, and is almost buttery on the palate thanks to the ghee, oil and vanaspati that goes into the cooking of this biryani.
rs 150. (usd 2.1)
9/10

ADDRESS - Zain's Hotel, Convent Cross Road Behind Fire Station, Kozhikode, Kerala 673032;
tel: +91 495 236 6311

LOCATION TAG - https://g.co/kgs/a8noLL

Title: Gourmet On The Road BEST 50 DISHES OF 2019 - Part 2 | Top Picks For The Year
Description:
#FoodGuide #TopDishesIndia # #GourmetOnTheRoad

Most Popular Dishes Of 2019. Tiffin Dishes, Vegetarian Meals, Best Biryanis, Best Vegetarian Restaurants. Best Non Vegetarian Restaurants. Food Guide 2019.

This episode of Gourmet On The Road is a true treat to every food lover! As the year draws to a close, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna has put together an exciting video series of the 50 most memorable dishes tasted in 2019 from the Gourmet On The Road Trail. 

In this concluding part, we have compiled 25 of these dishes, listing them out in alphabetical order of the restaurant. There‚Äôs a dish for everyone on this list, be it vegetarian meals, seafood, tiffin treats, biryanis, Indian sweets and much more. Make sure to use this video as your ultimate foodie guide for when you set out on your gourmet travels! Happy eating, folks!

Description:
#christmas2019 #newyear2020 #gourmetontheroad

Hi folks, it's been an exciting 2019 here at Food Lovers TV. We launched your favourite food travel show, Gourmet On The Road, about 8 months ago and are now racing towards our 100th episode across eight states.

2020 promises to be as exciting, with some new, tantalising culinary destinations on our travel plans. Do subscribe to Food Lovers TV to stay tuned and hit on the 'bell' icon to receive notifications each time we release an episode.

Title: Visiting JAI BHUVANESHWARI Miltry Hotel For A MEATY BREAKFAST | Srirangapatna | MUTTON CHOPS| KHEEMA
Description:
#PopularRestaurantsOnTheBangaloreMysoreHighway #BreakfastInKarnataka #GourmetOnTheRoad

Popular Military Hotels In Karnataka. Jai Bhuvaneshwari Military Hotel, Srirangapatna, Bangalore-Mysore Highway. Non-Vegetarian Breakfast. Mutton Chops. Kheema Unde. Thatte Idli. 
 
If you are setting out on a road trip en route to Mysore, Jai Bhuvaneshwari Miltry Hotel, a seemingly nondescript eatery with a legacy of 40 years int Srirangapatna is one place you should definitely make stop at for a robust, meaty, village-style breakfast meal. Set in an orange coloured home, look out for a signboard screaming the hotel‚Äôs name in Kannada and English. The eatery opens for breakfast as early as 7:30 am, dishing out carnivore favourites.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna stops over for a hearty ‚Äòmiltry‚Äô style breakfast tasting three crowd favourites here, the Kheema Unde, Mutton Chops in a masala-rich gravy and Paya Soup savouring these with some steaming hot Thatte Idli. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
THATTE IDLI
on the bangalore-mysore highway, the thatte idli rules and i had to order some to savour with my meaty sides! the idli served steaming hot is super soft. with the mutton chops gravy it just melts in the mouth. no chewing at all, it just disintegrates leaving behind the savouriness of the spices and meaty flavour. . 
rs 30 for two. (usd 0.4)
8/10

MUTTON CHOPS 
this mutton chops is a thick gravy preparation that comes with a generous piece of bannur mutton. the meat is pink encased in a thin sheath of fat and cooked to soft juicy perfection. you taste the robust meaty flavours in the gravy and the green chilli heat that slowly creeps up on you. don't forget to suck on the bone for a generous slurp of the marrow. 
rs 120. (usd 1.7)
9/10

KHEEMA UNDE
as you break into these, you notice only the tender pink of the meat. the mutton in this unde is coarsely ground giving it a delicious texture. this meatball is all about the meat and the warm spices in the gravy.
rs 120. (usd 1.7)
9/10


LEG SOUP
the gelatin in the trotter has rendered well into the nourishing soup, lending it a gamey savouriness that‚Äôs offset by the spices in this soup. this dish will definitely warm you up from within!
rs 120. (usd1.7)
8/10


ADDRESS - Jai Bhuvaneshwari Miltry Hotel, T Narasipura - Srirangapatna Rd, Baburayanakoppal, Karnataka 571807; tel: 98457 25792

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/tCrrwXrCWSXNhMb58

Title: Food Lovers TV Is Now a Part of YouTube's Exclusive Membership Programme!
Description:
#foodloverstv #youtubemembershipprogramme 

Hi folks, we have some great news for you. Food Lovers TV has just been selected by YouTube to join its unique and exciting membership programme. 

So what does this mean?

Basically, this allows us to create a membership community of food lovers like you who would like to support the work that we do by contributing a small amount each month.

In lieu of this, you will have access to special perks and privileges, such as exclusive posts and photo updates when I‚Äôm shooting an episode, to give you an insider‚Äôs perspective to what‚Äôs coming up. These will be waiting for you on the community tab on the home page. You can also enjoy access to exclusive ‚Äòmembers-only‚Äô live streams, and even have your name listed on Gourmet On The Road video descriptions as a patron.

And even if you aren‚Äôt able to join, we are just so happy to have you here. You will continue to have full access to all the videos we upload on the channel.

Title: Making & Tasting Of The Famous AMBUR BIRYANI in Ambur | RAHAMANIYA BRIYANI HOTEL | Mutton, Chicken
Description:
#Biryani #Ambur #TamilNadu #Mutton #GourmetOnTheRoad

Rahamaniya Briyani Hotel, Home of the legendary Ambur Briyani, Making of Ambur Mutton Biryani, serving the biryani since 1890 in Ambur, Tamil Nadu

With a culinary legacy that spans 130 years and four generations, Rahamaniya Briyani Hotel is considered to be the home of the Ambur Briyani. Spelt Briyani by the denizens of this bustling town, this dish has spawned many a biryani shop across the region.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna meets three generations of the Ahmed family and gets exclusive insider access to the kitchens of Rahamania Briyani Hotel to watch the making of an Ambur mutton briyani from scratch.

He also tastes the briyani and a moist Naatu Kozhi briyani in addtion to a couple of meaty sides.


GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

MUTTON BRIYANI
this biryani is seductively subtle in its aroma. you taste the luscious flavours of the aqhni in every grain of the flavourful jeera samba rice. The juicy meat pieces are small, allowing you to savour its meaty goodness in almost every mouthful of the briyani. If you like your briyani a little spirited and slightly spicy, taste it with the eggplant salan. I personally love this 'briyani' just by itself.
rs 200.
10/10

NAATU KOZHI BRIYANI
prepared in the same fashion as the mutton version, the flavour of the rice is very similar to the mutton briyani sans the flavour of the fat in the latter. The flavourful country chicken has a bit of a bite, typical of its character. If you love your naatu kozhi, you will love this briyani too. 
rs 210.
9/10

CHICKEN LEG PIECE
Marinated deep-fried leg of chicken, fried to the perfect crisp outside yet retains its juicy moistness within. relish it with the toasty, herbaceous flavours of the curry leaves that are fried alongside the chicken.
rs 40. 
8/10

VANJARAM FRY
Encased in a robust masala that‚Äôs rich in its fenugreek flavour notes, the seer fish fry is a tasty distraction from the legendary briyani here. The savouriness of the curry leaves and the acidity of the lime definitely perks up the flavours of the fish. 
The skin has been fried to a crisp 
rs 160. 
8/10

ADDRESS -Rahamaniya Briyani Hotel Since 1890, BAZAAR AMBUR, No.13, OV Rd, Krishnapuram, Ambur, Tamil Nadu 635802; tel: 98946 62373

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/zgpBRi6TMHAAKJ8r8

Title: Delicious NORTH KARNATAKA Jolada Rotti Meals & Snacks At HOTEL NALAPAKA In Bangalore
Description:
#NorthKaranatakaMeals #RestaurantsInBengaluru #GourmetOnTheRoad

North Karnataka Food, Bangalore. Vegetarian Meals. Hotel Nalapaka Rajajinagar. Jolada Rotti Meals. Davanagere Benne Dosa. Girmit. Mirchi Bajji. Biranji.

An eatery located in the western suburbs of Bengaluru, Hotel Nalapaka‚Äôs rustic Karnataka meals are an experience one must definitely devour! Ms Kavitha Lingayya who hails from North Karnataka, set up the restaurant 20 years ago with the motive of sharing her beloved cuisine with the city. She first begun serving food out of a car shed, moving to catering to office-goers and then finally moving to a bigger space, Hotel Nalapaka.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the eatery after it came much-recommended by viewers, to savours a North Karnataka-style meal for lunch. He meets with Ms Kavitha, visits her kitchen and also takes a look at how their famous jolada rottis are made the traditional way. He then sits down to a meal, and makes a beginning with tasting the popular snacks on offer, namely the Girmit, Mirchi Bajji and Davanagere Benne Dose. He then tastes the Thursday special Biranji meals, served with toasty jowar rotis topped with a big dollop of butter, he wolfs these down with a creamy brinjal curry, lentil preparations and chutneys!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

GIRMIT
often considered north karnataka‚Äôs take on a bhel puri, this snack is nothing like one! the addition of an onion tempering and gram flour to a mixture of turmeric stained puffed rice, raw onions and coriander is what makes the girmit different. make sure to chase a bite down with the fried chilli which perks up the flavours of this dish.
rs 36. (0.50 usd)
8/10

DAVANAGERE BUTTER DOSA
the perfect lacey and crisp texture of this dosa makes you want to dive straight into eating it! served with a lightly tempered potato palya and coconut chutney. the crunch in every bite followed by the lush butter that coats the palate is what makes this a superb dosa! rs 57. (0.80 usd)
8.5/10

MIRCHI BAJJI
love the way they make the chilli bajji here. the lightly spiced batter encases the chilli but not all the way through. you can see the spicy green chilli. you taste the spice of the chilli despite the thick casing. rs 21. (0.30 usd)
8/10

JOLADA ROTTI MEAL WITH BIRANJI 
this jolada rotti meal is wholesome in every sense! the rottis are light, fluffy and have a nutty flavour. when eaten with that lush butter and chutneys (the shenga or peanut chutney was my favourite) they are all the more delicious! the badnekayi is tangy and cream,  while the thick dal is fortified with fresh methi and the madike kalu is cooked to that perfect crunch. rs 192. (2.70 usd)
9/10

BIRANJI RICE
this aromatic rice quite similar in appearance to a pulav is a popular rice dish in the town of ranebennur, north karnataka. it is served only on thursdays as part of the jolada rotti meals at Nalapakka. the spices, cloves, cardamom, are reminiscent of a pulav but the addition of the lightly toasted garlic takes it in a new direction. every grain of rice is also speckled with that special biranji masala. the toasted cashew and butter makes this a rich preparation. 
8.5/10

ADDRESS - 28, 12th Main Rd, Near Navarang Theatre, 1st Block, Rajajinagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560010; tel: 080 2352 3108
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/kTotHgFfyWxBpd216
