Title: Tasting Famous Podi Idli At MURUGAN IDLI SHOP | Krishnagiri | GHEE MASALA DOSA | PONGAL |JIGARTHANDA
Description:
#TamilBreakfast #HighwayRestaurants #GourmetOnTheRoad

An iconic breakfast spot in Tamil Nadu, Murugan Idli Shop that first began in Madurai, today, has scores of branches in Chennai. The restaurant‚Äôs latest outlet in Krishnagiri, has turned into the place to stop at for patrons driving from Bengaluru either towards Salem, Madurai or Chennai.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna makes a quick stop at the eatery for a late breakfast, tasting some of the must-tries on the menu. This includes the restaurant‚Äôs signature Podi Idli, a paper-thin Masala Dosa, a ghee-laden Pongal, the Jigarthanda and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
PLAIN IDLI
not the softest idli you will come across, this one borders on being slightly firm. you taste the tart fermented edge of the batter. the idli is best enjoyed with the chutneys. the coriander chutney has a fresh flavour while the mint chutney makes for a zesty bite. my favourite accompaniment is the nourishing sambar fortified with lentils. the texture of the idli makes it perfect to be dunked in the sambar. 
rs 20. (0.30 usd)
7.5/10

GHEE PODI IDLI
this idli is a lot more softer and has a certain springiness to it. Slathered with ghee and doused in a spirited, spicy podi, its texture is a lot more pleasing to the palate. the heat of the podi is tamed when eaten with the creamy lentils in the sambar. this is a delicious idli!
rs 32. (0.45 usd)
9/10

SPECIAL SWEET PONGAL 
this dish is laden with ghee, so much so that it feels like you aren‚Äôt just eating the pongal but the ghee too! the dish isn‚Äôt cloying sweet, the amount of jaggery used is just right. the addition of toasted cashews gives it a nice bite and also helps cut through that dairy richness of the ghee. 
rs 58. (0.80 usd)
8/10

GHEE MASALA DOSA
the dosa is crisp and translucent. you can hear it go crunch as you break into it. the potato filling is creamy, almost pate-like. a bit excessive on the salt but flavourful nonetheless. the dosa batter in no way interferes with the flavours of this soft mash. the dosa surprisingly manages to retain its crunch despite being dunked into the sambar. it's almost like biting into a puff pastry, that's how delicately crunchy this dosa is!
rs 108. (1.50 usd)
9/10

ONION UTHAPPAM
love the way this uthappam is loaded with onions! the onion has been roasted to a deep brown. you taste the delicious caramelised notes of the almost burnt onion on the top layer followed by the sweet crunch of the lightly sauteed onions below it. the thick uthappam just cradles all these delicious textures and flavours! the chutney provides for a nice break, if it gets too onion-y.
rs 89. (1.25 usd)
8.5/10

JIGARTHANDA
literally translating to ‚Äòcool the heart‚Äô the jigarthanda is a very popular cooler on the menu here. the orange flavoured ice cream made in-house has a texture that‚Äôs somewhere in between a gelato and sorbet. the jelly has almond essence in it, you can also taste the dairy from the basundi. if you like something cooling and refreshing, settle for this drink.
rs 70. (1 usd)
7/10

FILTER COFFEE
my choice of drink after a south indian breakfast! the sweet bitterness of the filter coffee is the right way to end a slightly over indulgent breakfast here at murugan idli shop. 
rs 32. (0.45 usd)
8/10

ADDRESS - Murugan Idli Shop, S.NO.36/3, Binappalli Village, Near Arabic College Bangalore Selam Highway, NH 44, Krishnagiri, Tamil Nadu 635001; tel: 73977 74556

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/YEA7v5D3nxKAf9i5A

Title: Tasting BHEEMA'S Most Popular ANDHRA VEG MEALS | MUTTON BIRYANI | Chilli Chicken | KITCHEN TOUR!
Description:
#AndhraCuisine #RestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Best Restaurant For An Andhra Meal In Bangalore. Andhra Restaurants In Bangalore. Andhra Style Biryani. Andhra Meals.

A popular name when it comes to Andhra cuisine in Bengaluru is Bheema's, an iconic restaurant located in the heart of CBD, at Church Street. Although the street has witnessed a resurgence over the years, this over 20-year-old establishment has stood still, turning into a favourite spot for lunch, when in the area.

The simple yet satisfying vegetarian Andhra meal served on a plantain leaf and the Nellore-style Biryani is what patrons usually flock to the restaurant for, not forgetting their signature side, the Bheema's Chicken!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers' Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the restaurant after a decade to revive memories of a meal here. He meets with second generation owner, Vijaykumar and explores the kitchen. He discover the evolution in the method of cooking traditional Andhra fare Bheema's has adopted and also visits the restaurants' nursery!

He then sits down to indulge in the vegetarian meals with oodles of ghee and gongura chutney, moving on to taste the Mutton Biryani and some delicious meaty sides. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
VEG MEALS¬†
¬†a popular lunch choice at bheema‚Äôs, the veg meal comprises of a pappu, a vegetable of the day, sambar, rasam, perugu, buttermilk and dessert, usually a payasam. my top picks were the deliciously creamy spinach pappu, the flavourful sambar. the moolangi chutney was not as vibrant or vivacious as the gongura chutney. don‚Äôt forget to top your piping hot rice with ghee and the signature podi before you work your way through the dishes!
rs 205. (2.90 usd)¬†
8.5/10


CHILLI CHICKEN
although this chilli chicken has an incredible amount of chilli seeds, it doesn‚Äôt hit you right away when you first taste it. but as you devour the dish, the green chilli spice makes its presence felt on the palate. the chicken is moist and juicy. eat this dish with rice and oodles of ghee to help tame the chilli aggression.¬†
rs 260. (3.65 usd)
8.5/10


BHEEMA'S CHICKEN
this fried chicken preparation is a bheema‚Äôs signature. the chicken is coated and fried in a light batter and tossed in a masala which makes liberal use of green chilli and curry leaves. this fried chicken is cooked perfectly, crunchy and dry outside yet soft and juicy within. the curry leaves lends a toasty, herbaceous note to the dish.¬†¬†
rs 270. (3.80 usd)
9/10


MUTTON BIRYANI
this biryani is gentle in its aromas, not a biryani you can smell from a mile away. the rice is cooked in the flavourful mutton broth that has given up all its meaty flavour to the supremely flavoursome rice. you can also taste the whole spices like cloves, cinnamon and star anise. the meat is cooked to a juicy, tender pink.
rs 285. (4 usd)
8.5/10


MUTTON PEPPER FRY
the meat is the star in this mutton pepper fry. it is slow cooked and braised for hours resulting in that tender, melt-in-the-mouth texture. the flesh is pink all the way through and the fat too has rendered well. the pepper does not obliterate the flavour of the mutton.¬† the curry leaves provide a nice respite in between tasting. the flavour of the meat and spices have come together beautifully in this dish!¬†
rs 340. (4.75 usd)
9/10

ADDRESS - Bheema's, 31, Asha Building, Ground Floor, Church Street, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001; tell: 080 2558 7389

LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/gaDweeSNAwpedmtH6

Title: Tasting 14 COASTAL DELICACIES At KARAVALLI Bengaluru |LOBSTER, CRAB, PRAWN, OCTOPUS, POMFRET & More!
Description:
#GourmetOnTheRoad #RestaurantsInBangalore #Seafood 

Best Seafood Dishes In Bengaluru, Coastal Restaurant At The Gateway Hotel Bengaluru, Top Rated Seafood Dishes at Karavalli. Aquafest 
 
In nearly three decades of its existence, Karavalli at The Gateway Hotel Bengaluru has distinguished itself as an establishment that serves the country's finest South West Coastal cuisine. This has made the speciality fine dining restaurant an absolute must-visit in the city with patrons highly recommending a meal here.

What patrons also await is a much loved, annual seafood festival that the restaurant has been hosting since its existence. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits Karavalli to savour all the dishes on offer as part of this very special Aquafest menu. He meets with Executive Chef of The Gateway Hotel, Naren Thimmaiah to understand what makes this festival as popular. He then sits down to enjoy a whopping 14-dish meal.

BABY LOBSTER JIREM MIREM
chunky baby lobster meat marinated and cooked in a cumin (jirem) and fresh pepper (mirem) masala. you taste the byadgi chilli as opposed to the pepper in this warming masala. 
rs 1850. (25.80 usd)
9/10

GOAN OCTOPUS CHILLI FRY
i love the sweetness of the tomato in this preparation, the octopus however, has a bite that borders on being chewy. the flavours of this dish is one you would enjoy in a shack somewhere on the beaches of goa.
rs 1200. (16.75 usd)
7/10

KOONDAL PORICHATU
the batter-fried masala coated squid is cooked to springy perfection and the masala has penetrated all the way through. the fresh acidity of a squeeze of lime cradles that gentle spicing of the squid. this is the sort of dish that would make for a very happy bar snack.
rs 1200. (16.75 usd)
9/10

WHOLE SILVER POMFRET RECHEADO
this dish of whole fried silver pomfret is a taste of goa! liberally coated in the sweet, tart and hot goan recheado masala, both inside and out, you taste notes of the goan palm vinegar and the aggressive punch of chilli as you devour the dish. 
rs 1200. (16.75 usd)
8.5/10

TIGER PRAWN MALABAR STYLE
a signature dish at karavalli i keep returning for! these meaty tiger prawns are first fried to perfect scrumptiousness and then tossed in a vivacious masala of shallots, tomatoes and pepper.
rs 1800. (25.10 usd)
10/10
SEA CRAB GHEE ROAST
these meaty sea crabs, cooked in a ghee roast masala are divine! i love the mild sweetness of that crab meat (tastes just like the ocean!). the butteriness of that well rounded masala embraces the natural flavours of the crab.
rs 1450. (20.20 usd)
9/10
KOLI BARTHAD
a speciality here on the menu, this is a dish that hails from coorg. pieces of chicken are pan fried in a bunch of spices and kachampuli. the deeply roasted spices that have melded together as one.
rs 995. (13.88 usd)
8.5/10

MUTTON STEW
this is a textbook syrian christian stew with the mellow coconut base carrying just the subtlest hint of spicing. the meat is soft, you taste its nourishment in every strand. 
rs 1150. (16.05 usd)
10/10

PRAWN CALDEEN 
this goan-style curry is a pleasant melange of flavours. you taste the freshness of the coriander, the spice of the green chilli, raspy bite of the ginger and the creaminess of the coconut in the sauce. the prawns are juicy having absorbed all that goodness. 
rs 1450. (20.20 usd)
9/10
ALAPPUZHA MEEN CURRY
the deep, spice notes in this alleppey fish curry catches hold of your palate from the first bite. the seer, a meaty fish, is the right medium to convey and carry these bold flavours of coconut, ginger and raw mango. 
rs 1150. (16.05 usd)
9.5/10


DODOL
my favourite way to end a meal at karavalli is with the dodol, a goan dessert made with rice flour that has been well roasted with palm jaggery and loads of butter! it is rich and dark, each bite is lush, buttery yet dry. 
rs 475. (6.60 usd)
9/10
KASHI HALWA
the ghee glistens in this translucent kashi halwa. the ash gourd is flavoured with saffron, you also sense a hint of acidity in this dessert. 
rs 475. (6.60 usd)
7/10

ADDRESS- Ground Floor, The Gateway Hotel, Residency Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025
LOCATION TAG-  https://goo.gl/maps/2FMuVqHjJtJyUs4M6

The Best Restaurants In Mysore. Places To Eat At In Mysore. Kripal Amanna‚Äôs Top 5 Restaurants In Mysore. Iconic Eateries In Mysuru.

Mysuru is a city that‚Äôs rich in its culture and history, and its culinary landscape, of course is no exception. Dotted with iconic eateries that have been serving delicious fare for years, this city has a lot to offer to ardent food lovers.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna, rounds up 5 of his must-visit establishments when in the city or better still make a trip to the city for! From watching the making of the legendary Hanumanthu Pulav, to tasting the softest, melt-in-the-mouth Mylari Dose to savouring Mysore‚Äôs most popular Andhra-style biryani and more, use this episode as your Mysuru Food Guide!

Title: MARATHA STYLE NON VEGETARIAN Food | MARATA DARSHAN | Naati Koli Saaru, Mutton Chops & More!
Description:
#MilitaryHotelsInBangalore #NonVegetarianFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

Maratha Cuisine In Bengaluru. Military Style Food In Bangalore. Ragi Mudde and Mutton Chops Thali.

Gorge on mouthwatering military-style food, especially robust mutton dishes at Marata Darshan in Bengaluru. Established by Shantharaj Lad back in 1989, this humble eatery is known for its wholesome military style meals served for breakfast and lunch. Presently run by the father, mother and son trio, the reason behind the restaurant‚Äôs success are traditional recipes by the mother, Hemavathi Bai.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna meets the family in this episode of Gourmet On The Road. He unveils the secret behind the eatery‚Äôs success and explores the must eat dishes here through a short kitchen tour. He then sit downs for a meal tasting the Mutton Chops Thali served with either rice and the restaurant‚Äôs signature Ragi Mudde, Koli Saaru, Mutton Kheema Curry and a bowl of Soppina Saaru. He also tastes must-try sides, a peppery Mutton Liver Fry, a flavourful Chilli Chicken, a wet Chicken 65 made with a yoghurt gravy and Mutton Korma.

NAATI KOLI SAARU
the gravy of this naati koli saaru certainly has some chilli kick to it. one can also taste layers of spice and the garam masala. the soft, pasty ragi mudde is perfect to be dunked into this flavourful saaru.
rs 200. (2.80 usd)
9/10

MUTTON CHOPS
the meat in this hearty curry has a good distribution of fat and the mutton still has its bite intact. the masala has a mellow lingering heat perhaps from some warm spices like cloves and cinnamon. the mutton with the gravy makes for a juicy bite.
rs 170 (2.40 usd)
9/10

CHICKEN PEPPER
this chicken is liberally spiced with pepper that gives it a delicious, toasty flavour note. you taste the juiciness of the chicken that has been cooked to perfection and the freshness of coarse ground pepper and a slight savouriness perhaps from some onion.
rs 140 (2 usd)
9/10

CHILLI CHICKEN
easily one of the best ‚Äòlocal-style‚Äô chilli chicken I have tasted! the chicken just yields, and parts effortlessly from the bone. the masala made with plenty of tomatoes and green chilli is fingerlicking good! the chilli heat isn‚Äôt palate-numbing like other versions of its ilk.
rs 130. (1.80 usd)
9.5/10

CHICKEN 65
the chicken 65 here is a wet gravy of chicken kebab tossed in a thick gravy of yoghurt, curry leaves, dry red chillies and spices. the flavour of the dish is a little too tart, an interesting take on the 65, but plays a distant second fiddle to the other dishes.
rs 140 (2 usd)
7/10

KHEEMA UNDE GRAVY
love the rogan or thin veil of fat floating over this thick, lush gravy that is perfect to be ladelled over the unde or meatball. all you taste is the meat and the gentle spicing. the gravy merely straddles the unde without overpowering its nuanced flavour. the quality of meat in this dish is just brilliant!
rs 170 (2.40 usd)
9.5/10

MUTTON LIVER PEPPER FRY
mutton liver can usually be tough when cooked this way but in this dish, the meaty liver is quite yielding to the bite. there's none of the gamey meatiness. you taste the roasted pepper.  to hold itself up to the meatiness of the liver, the strength of the pepper is a lot more apparent in this preparation.
rs 170 (2.40 usd)
8.5/10

SOPPINA SAARU
love the earthy flavours of this soppina saaru that is made with a bunch of different greens. you can sense the nourishment you get from every scoop of rice that's soaked in the soppina saaru!
8.5/10

RASAM 
this almost clear rasam has an apparent tartness from some tamarind and you can definitely taste prominent notes of cumin or jeera. 
7/10

ADDRESS - Marata Darshan, Kaverappa Layout, Vasanth Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560051; tel: 9902021970

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/LzMQgsjySnPaw3Cg9

Title: Affordable, Fresh & Delicious SEAFOOD At MANGALORE PEARL | PRAWN GHEE ROAST | KANE FRY | CRAB & More
Description:
#Seafood #SeafoodRestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Best Seafood Restaurants In Bangalore. Mangalorean Food In Bangalore. Authentic Mangalorean Food In Bengaluru. 

A favourite for Mangalorean fare in Bengaluru, Mangalore Pearl is always bustling with patrons who visit this spot for their taste of coastal Karnataka, more specifically the Mangalorean Catholic-style of seafood food.

Set up by Steven Pinto who left behind a lucrative career in the IT sector to pursue his dream of sharing the food he grew up with, this 15-year old restaurant rose to fame thanks to its spiced filled seafood dishes and Mangalorean classics.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the Ulsoor outlet and meets with the brother duo that run the restaurant. He discusses the procurement of fresh seafood, the variety of curries on offer and also witnesses the making of two most popular fries, the Bangude and the Kane Fry.

He then sits down to a feast, tasting a bevy of coastal dishes, from a Pomfret Curry, Crab Masala, Khoobey Mootlien, Chicken Roce Curry and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

RAGI MANNI 
the manni has a lush, creamy texture that takes over your palate! you taste the caramel notes of the jaggery. this mangalorean dessert resembles the Italian panacotta minus the cream. definitely a delicious way to end your meal here.
rs 60 (0.90 usd)
8/10

KHUBEY MOOTLIEN
this dish deserves attention when being savoured, especially when picking on the tiny yet sweet and mildly briny clam flesh. the rice dumpling has a sticky, slightly slimy texture that goes very well with the thick, velvety coconut based gravy. the flavour of the clams in this dish is reminiscent of the ocean.
rs 170 (2.40 usd)
8.5/10

CRAB MASALA
tossed in a semi-dry onion and tomato masala that complements the mildly sweet, flesh of this dotted sea crab don‚Äôt forget to suck on the crab meat!
rs 310 (4.30 usd)
8.5/10

POMFRET STEW CURRY
the spicing in this masala is mellow and refreshing and just right, allowing the flavours of the pristine, fresh pomfret to shine. this stew curry goes deliciously well with mangalore rice.
rs 480 (6.70 usd)
9/10

KANE TAWA FRY
this fish is as fresh as it gets! so delicates that the meat just flakes apart effortlessly. the pullimunchi masala gives off a warming note o f the byadgi chilli and also a slight tartness from vinegar. the fish has absorbed the masala, yet retains its unique flavour. be mindful of the tiny pin bones though!
rs 280. (4 usd)
9/10

BANGUDE FRY
the butterflied mackerel allows for the masala to penetrate the deep flavours of this fish. notwithstanding this, the mackerel asserts its strong flavour from the word go despite being fried in a spicy masala.
rs 120 (1.70 usd)
9/10

CHICKEN ROCE CURRY
a popular choice of chicken curry at mangalore pearl made with coconut milk, fried onions and gentle spices. best savoured with the soft, spongy sannas that disintegrate as it absorbs this flavourful curry. the chicken though, tastes better when in the company of the creamy curry.
rs 220. (3 usd)
8.5/10

PRAWN GHEE ROAST
soaking in oodles of ghee this is one of the best prawn ghee roasts i‚Äôve tasted! the prawns are plump and fresh, being coated in all that roasted masala that does not overpower its sweet flavour. the neer dosa serves as the perfect combination to this dish. the beautiful balance of spice, toasty flavour notes of coconut oil, rich ghee and divine prawns will keep you coming back for this dish!
rs 295 (4.10 usd)
10/10

FRIED POTRADAY
this dish starts off as a rice cake steamed with spinach, coriander, cumin seeds and red chill that is then sliced, battered in a light spice mix and deep fried. it makes for an appetising start to a meal.
rs 120. (1.70 usd)
7.5/10

SOLKADI
this drink made of coconut milk, kokum juice, ginger, garlic and chilli certainly awakens the senses and the palate. a refresher with a bite.
rs 50 (0.70 usd)
7.5/10

Mangalore Pearl, 2nd Floor, 5/1, Assaye Road, Skywalk Building, Assaye Rd, next to YMIA or BodyCraft, Ulsoor, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042
Tel: +91 80 2557 8855
Google maps coordinates: https://g.page/mangalorepearlblr?share

Title: Tasting SOUTH CANARA VEGETARIAN THALI At NEW MODERN HOTEL Bengaluru | Making Of BADAM HALWA |Chiroti
Description:
#VegetarianMeals #RestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Most Popular Vegetarian Restaurants In Bengaluru. Masala Dosa At New Modern Hotel VV Puram Bangalore. South Indian Vegetarian Meals 

Located at VV Puram in South Bengaluru, New Modern Hotel is one of those rare, iconic establishments that has stood the test of time retaining it‚Äôs old world charm be it in its space and ambiance or in its recipes and way of cooking, simple honest homestyle fare.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna, visits the eatery to escape the hustle and bustle of the city meeting with 3 generations of the family that has been running the restaurant for over 60 years. He then gets special access into the kitchen and to a step-by-step making of the most popular sweetmeat on their menu, the Badam Halwa. Following this he tastes the Thatte Idli, a wholesome South Canara-style Thali and the ghee laden Badam Halwa and another favourite dessert in the region called Chiroti Milk.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

THATTE IDLI
generously smeared with ghee and served with a side of sambar and chutney, the thatte idli here is soft, almost breaking under its own weight. the chutney is rich in coconut with a mild chilli flavour while the sambar is thick, one in which you taste the hing and jaggery.
rs 30. (0.40 usd)
8/10

VEG MEALS
this vegetarian meal at NMH is a wholesome, south canara-style thali that is sure to remind you of home. this plate comes to you with a poori/ chapathi, vegetable of the day, sambar, saagu, tilisaaru, mosaru, rice, papad, pickle and majjige. a complete meal that‚Äôs honestly priced and delicious!
rs 80. (1.15 usd)
8.5/10

CHIROTI MILK
this popular dessert in the region is a puri made of semolina and maida that is crumbled and topped with sugar, badam powder and hot milk. the result is a sort of dessert that can bring a smile to anyone‚Äôs face. you taste the rich badam milk and occasionally crunchy bits of the ‚Äòindian‚Äô puff pastry.
rs 42. (0.60 usd)
8.5/10

BADAM HALWA
lusciously velvety, this dessert fill every pore of your palate with joy. served in small portions because it is super rich (1 part badam, 2 parts khova, 3 parts sugar and 6 parts ghee!) you can taste the granular texture of the almond and the fragrant flavour of cardamom.
rs 50. (0.70 usd)
9/10

FILTER COFFEE
Strong, piping hot filter coffee. just the sort you need after a meal here. order this with a side of the badam halwa. 
rs 23. (0.30 usd)
8/10


ADDRESS - New Modern Hotel, 143, Dr.A.N. Krishna Rao Road, Near Minerva circle, Vishweshwarapuram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel 080 2661 2625

LOCATION TAG-  https://goo.gl/maps/uomXAuRpAYo2oi447

Title: Day 2, 3 & 4 HYDERABAD VLOG PT 2 Behind The Scenes | Gourmet On The Road Bawarchi Biryani |Old City
Description:
#Vlogs #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Food Vlogging. Gourmet On The Road Bangalore To Hyderabad Journey. Popular Restaurants In Hyderabad. Places To Explore In Hyderabad City. 

This special two-part Hyderabad Vlog Series gives viewers a sense of how the Food Lovers team typically plans and conducts a Gourmet On The Road shoot from start to finish.

In the final part of the Hyderabad vlog series, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna maps his shoots across the city by meeting with locals and the Chef at Novotel. He takes viewers on the journey of day two which begins with shooting two collaboration videos with Ravitej Ravuri of Streetbyte at Chutneys for breakfast and Ulavacharu for lunch. Although the traffic and the rain cause minor roadblocks day two ends on  a high with an interaction with the family the owns Bawarchi and with an in-depth biryani making segment at the restaurant. On day three, he explores the Old City with Chef Iqbal visiting some of the cities oldest bakery followed by lunch at Hotel  Shadab. The evening ends with shooting two very special recipes with the Chef. On day 4, he extends his stay in the city only to cover the hugely popular Sri Kakatiya Mess.

Title: Exciting Street Food Trail VV Puram PT 2 | AVAREKALU VADA, OBBATTU, Badam Milk, FIRE PAAN & More
Description:
#ThindiBeedi #VegetarianFood #GourmetOnTheRoad
Street Food In Bengaluru. Best Street Food In Bangalore. VV Puram Food Street. Thindi Beedi. Vegetarian Street Food.

In part two, the final part of our street food trail at Thindi Beedi, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna tastes some of the more traditional and popular recommendations at VV Puram. He begins by tasting a super scrumptious Avarekalu Vada served piping hot, followed by a wholesome Avarebele Akki Rotti served with an saaru and crusty, Paddus. He then visits over 45 year old Guru Idlis to try their Mini Idlis. Rounding off the trail on a sweet note, he tastes two types of Holiges, a glass of nutritious Badam Milk and the super popular Gulcan Ice Cream. To help digest the 21-dishes he savours, he ends with a Fire Paan!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 

SRI VASAVI VAISISTA THINDI
AVAREKALU VADA 
this vada is every fried food lovers delight! made using a mixture of water hyacinth bean, dill, gram flour and aromats like onion, ginger, garlic, chilli and coriander this is as delicious and nutritious as a vada can get. in short, hot, crunchy and mouthwatering!
Rs 20 for two vadas. (0.30 USD)
9/10

SRI VASAVI MANE THINDI
AVEREBELE AKKI ROTTI 
this dish is a full meal. the akki roti has a crunchy crust and a soft inside. the gravy however, is quite tame. the avarekalu in the rotti makes for a tasty textural relief.
Rs 40. (0.56 USD)
7.5/10

PADDU
an enriched dosa batter that is cooked on a tava speckled with spherical cavities. it has a slight sour twang coupled with the crunch of the onions and freshness of the dill. delicious when eaten with coconut, chana dal and green chilli chutney.
Rs 20. (0.30 USD)
8/10

SRI GURU DEV IDLI MANE
MINI IDLIS
porous, soft fluffy idlis. the chutneys however are a little watery. the green chutney with gram flour is diluted in flavours. the idli though is the hero of this dish! 
Rs 10 for 3. (0.15 USD)
8/10

IDLI MANE
PLAIN OBBATTU 
a flaky, sweet paratha stuffed with lentil, cardamom and jaggery. the liberally slathered buttery ghee and that mild jaggery sweetness make this a delicious holige.
Rs 20 (0.30 USD)
8.5/10

KAI OBBATTU
much more weightier, this version of the obbattu has a rich, sticky, sweet coconut filling that lends a great bite to this obbattu.
Rs 20 (0.30 USD)
8.5/10


MUMBAI BADAM MILK AND LASSI CENTER
BADAM MILK
a rich, thick and nourishing badam milk flavoured with pista, kesar and cardamom. the super thick cream on top tastes almost like khova. one can run a mile after drinking this!
Rs 40. (0.40 USD)
9/10

SHIVANNA GULCAN ICE CREAM CENTER
GULKAND ICE CREAM
a crowd pleaser of a dessert here at vv puram. a mixture of gulkand or rose jam and butter topped butterscotch ice cream and mixture of fruits. the fruit helps cut through the sweetness of the ice cream and jam.
Rs 100. (1.40 USD)
8/10

PAAN POINT
FIRE PAAN
this unique version of the popular digestive, paan left me speechless, quite literally! you can absurdly taste the fire for a fraction of a second, followed by the cool ice and a mish mash of flavours from all the components inside!
Rs 50. (0.70 USA)
7/10

ADDRESSES
#78 3rd block 5th main road thyagarajnagar bull temple road, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560028; tel: 097432 69356; Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/9J5p8NzKefDyrtCx8

SRI VASAVI MANE THINDI, 11/3, 11/3, Market Rd, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 088888 88888; Location Tag- https://goo.gl/maps/hZGVAyCCMjz6KB8x8

IDLI MANE, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 097428 82625; Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/oKp1eM6cLo19cXEH9

MUMBAI BADAM MILK AND LASSI CENTER, Visvesvarapuram, Sudhama Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 097390 07875; Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/YNGss242Z6StfgGq7

SHIVANNA GULCAN ICE CREAM CENTER, Food St, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 094487 62723; Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/Vj1xbT38AZmnwcmC6

Title: Bengaluru‚Äôs Popular VV PURAM FOOD STREET PT 1 | VB BAKERY, Mosaru Kodubale, Bajji Chaats Chai & More
Description:
#ThindiBeedi #VegetarianFood #GourmetOnTheRoad
Street Food In Bengaluru. Best Street Food In Bangalore. VV Puram Food Street. Thindi Beedi. Vegetarian Street Food.
Bangaloreans love eating out and one spot every one frequents is VV Puram for its delicious vegetarian street food that can leave you spoilt for choice!

In part one of this two-part street food trail at Thindi Beedi, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna begins his trail at the legendary VB Bakery to taste three recommended treats, starting with the signature KBC or Khara Butter Bun Congress, a butter jam bun and the honey cake. Following this, he makes a trip to Shree Swamy Bajji Center to taste five scrumptious bajjis! Next on the list is a unique, smokey Tandoori Chai, special chaats from Chandra Chaat Center and highly recommended street snack, the Mosaru Kodubale or the Curd Kodubale.
Stay tuned to the final part of this trail coming up, this one covers some traditional snacks and tiffin and something sweet to seal the deal!
GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
VB BAKERY
KHARA BUTTER AND CONGRESS KADLEKAI BUN 
the first flavour to hit your palate is the savouriness of the curry leaves. you taste the buttery goodness, followed by the chilli and the crunch of the peanuts! this could very well be the Iyengar version of the peanut butter sandwich!
Rs 26. (0.40 USD)
9/10

BUN BUTTER JAM
This special bun is made with milk powder and has some raisins in it too. slathered with a generous lashing of butter and mixed fruit jam, this dish is a slice of nostalgia packed in a bun! 
Rs 27. (0.40 USD)
8/10

HONEYCAKE
made with pure coorg honey, this honeycake is dense and sticky. the top is light, airy and spongy but the bottom is where the sugary attack of the honey hits you. 
Rs 28. (0.40 USD)
8/10

SHREE SWAMY BAJJI CENTER
OOTY MENASINAKAI BAJJI
the ooty pepper in itself does not have too much heat but that raw chilli powder sprinkled on top certainly has a kick to it. this bajji will be a treat on a rainy day!
Rs 10 for a bajji. (0.15 USD)
8/10

CAPSICUM BAJJI
a whole capsicum fried to scrumptiousness. the capsicum still retains its fresh crunch despite being fried. ticks all the boxes if you are considering a nice evening snack.
Rs 20 for a bajji. (0.30 USD)
8/10

ALU BONDA
delightful fried snack that is super hot and made fresh. an absolute steal for a tasty snack! 
Rs 10 for 3 bondas. (0.15 USD)
8/10

BANANA BAJJI
love how the raw, starchy banana tones down the spice in that chutney and chilli powder sprinkled on top. the bajji is deliciously crisp when eaten seconds after it is fried!
Rs 20 for 2 bajjis. (0.30 USD)
8.5/10

PINEAPPLE BAJJI
a large slice of pineapple battered fried and then sliced and topped with a chutney and a garnish of onions and carrots! a definite first for me. Rs 20 for a bajji. (0.30 USD)
7/10

NAMMA KITCHEN
TANDOORI CHAI
certainly a tasty tea spiced with cinnamon and ginger. what makes this a tandoori chai is that smokey flavour present in every sip! perfect for a nippy evening. 
Rs 20. (0.30 USD)
8/10

CHANDRA CHAAT CENTER AND PAV BHAJI
MASALA PURI
this masala puri isn‚Äôt too spicy as one would expect. what you really taste is the fragrant spicing in the masala base and the slight sweet pop of the peas. 
Rs 30. (0.40 USD)
7/10

DAHI PURI
a loaded dahi puri. one bite and the puri just oozes all the delicious dahi with the stuffing of the boiled potatoes. you can also taste the spice of the garam masala. 
Rs 40. (0.56 USD)
9/10

GULAB JAMUN
this gulab jamun made using a special recipe is soft, creamy and perfectly sweet. the richness from the khova makes you want to keep going back for seconds.
Rs 20. (0.30 USD)
8/10

ARYA VYSYA
MOSARU KODUBALE
the mosaru kodubale was a scrumptious discovery. the crunchy exterior gives way to the gooey, porous inside. there‚Äôs a hint of chilli and cumin flavour. 
9/10

ADDRESSES
VB Bakery, No.20, Sajjan Rao Cir, Vishweshwarapura, Shankarapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 096203 90345; LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/XFaUnXNLLqgnq2hb7

Shree Swamy Bajji Center, Food St, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 9538581653; LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/sri-swamy-bajji-centre?share

Namma Kitchen, Shop No.8, 1, Old Market Rd, Vishweshwarapura, Shankarapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; https://goo.gl/maps/3BLLm11R5A1bMA9g6

Sri Chandra Chaat and Pav Bhaji Center, Shop No.8, 1, Old Market Rd, Vishweshwarapura, Shankarapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 9019838812; LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/97Zxk6QpZTfo7ueC8

Arya Vysya Refreshment Center, Old Market Rd, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004; tel: 099019 03396; LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/fDwhPUrhwcG2rT4v7

Title: MUTTON PULAV, PEPPER CHICKEN, KHEEMA UNDE At New Govind Rao Military Hotel| 110-Year Military Hotel!
Description:
#NonVegetarian #RestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

New Govind Rao Military Hotel, Bangalore serves up popular local style non vegetarian fare, and has amassed a loyal following drawing from its 110 year-old legacy. Customers flood the establishment as early as 6am for their steaming hot pulav that is prepared in an interesting fashion. The rice here is cooked in a meaty stock and not with the meat itself! One can order a Mutton/Chicken Pulav or a khaali (plain) pulav. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna samples a meaty spread that includes the mutton pulav, Kheema Unde, a Mutton Liver Fry and a couple of robust chicken sides. He also gives viewers an inside look at the kitchens of New Govind Rao Military Hotel to discover the making of these popular dishes.
 
GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
KHEEMA UNDE
The unde or meat ball is made of finely minced mutton mixed with a bit of fat and sinew. you can taste the roasted gram flour/ binder in the mixture too. this takes away from the meat flavour but a tasty dish nonetheless. 
Rs 100.
7/10

 MUTTON LIVER FRY
The liver itself tastes fine, but with topped with that well roasted masala, this dish tastes robust and complete!
Rs 100
8/10

CHICKEN PEPPER DRY 
Chicken that is big in flavour! the pepper and roasted spice masala coating is fingerlicking good.
Rs 90.
9/10

CHILLI CHICKEN
This chicken is cooked tender with a nice chilli heat that‚Äôs not overpowering. a great combo with the mellow pulao.
Rs 90.
8/10

ADDRESS - New Govind Rao Military Hotel, Opp Sudha Lodge, No 7, Cottonpet Main Road, Chickpet, Bengaluru 560 053; tel +91 97439 38590
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/new-govindarao-hotel-main-branch?share

Title: Must Try BREAKFAST DISHES In GOA |ROS OMELETTE & POI |GOAN SAUSAGE |MOOGACHI GAATI |FISH CROQUETTES
Description:
#GoaFood #BestBreakfastInGoa #GourmetOnTheRoad

Goa Food Vlog. Best Dishes For Breakfast In Goa. Exploring Goan Food. Goan Cuisine. Top Goan Breakfast Dishes.Top 4 Goan Breakfast Dishes 

This episode of Gourmet On The Road is one that was shot by Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna during his holiday in Goa! In this laid-back video he shares with viewers his favourite dishes to eat for breakfast when in Goa.

He meets with Chef Anthony Vaz, who makes him a lavish Goan breakfast spread with dishes from the staple Ros Omelette, an egg dish served with the classic xacuti gravy, the must-have spicy Goan Sausage, fish croquettes and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
ROS OMELETTE
Signature Goan breakfast of a fluffy masala omelette served in a flavourful, spicy xacuti gravy. A wonderful way to enjoy your eggs. Best eaten with the dry yet pillowy poi.

MOOGACHI GAATI
this Goan style sprouted moong curry is a great vegetarian breakfast option. Perfect to be mopped with some poi. 

GOAN SAUSAGE CHILLI FRY
gently sauteed with onions a copious amount of capsicum and chilli, this Goan sausage preparation is delicious. You taste the mellow tartness of the vinegar in this dish.

FISH CROQUETTES
a happy surprise for breakfast, these croquettes are made with King fish that imparts a lovely flavour together with the chilli and coriander! Not greasy at all. 

ADDRESS - Holiday Inn Resort Goa, Mobor Beach, Cavelossim, Goa 403731

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/iWJx7MCjucNvpCUX7

Title: BEST Andhra MEAL At SRI KAKATIYA DELUXE MESS| VEGETARIAN THALI| MUTTON, CHICKEN, PRAWN FRY|Hyderabad
Description:
#RestaurantsOfHyderabad #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Best Vegetarian Meals In Hyderabad. Affordable South Indian Meals. South Indian Meals. Mutton Pepper Fry.

An iconic eatery in Hyderabad‚Äôs Ameerpet area, Sri Kakatiya Deluxe Mess is a hotspot every local goes to for some delicious Andhra fare! The no-frills restaurant is all about quick service and homestyle vegetarian meals that one can add on some delicious seafood and meaty fries to, too.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna extends his trip in the city only to savour this highly recommended meal here. He meets with third generation owner, Varun Karthik to discuss the early beginning of the restaurant, it‚Äôs popularity and also takes a quick peek into the kitchen. He then sits down for a super-satisfying meal, tasting a wholesome pappu, vankaya with dried peas, thokku and other dishes part of the vegetarian meal together with piping hot rice, podi and ghee! He also savours some meaty sides of chicken, mutton and some seafood. You do not want to miss this review!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD
MEALS
a super satisfying, homestyle andhra meal. each dish unique, delicious and faultless! a must-try when at sri kakatiya deluxe mess.
rs 130. (1.80 USD)
10/10

PRAWNS FRY
these tiny freshwater shrimp are cooked to a tender bite. the masala is deep roasted, one with onions, chilli, curry leaf and a slightly coconutty note.
rs 200. (2.80 USD)
9.5/10 

CHICKEN FRY
the masala coating that chicken is finger licking good. the chicken cooked to absolute perfection has absorbed all those spices! you taste that flavour of the roasted masala right away, in the very first bite.
rs 150. (2.11 USA)
9/10 

OMELETTE 
this is an omelette that‚Äôs simply done. it‚Äôs got the tasty crunch of the onions and the spice of green chilli.
rs 30. (0.42 USD)
7/10 

CHICKEN CURRY
this is a homestyle chicken curry made using a family secret spice mix that is hand ground fresh! this is an assertive masala that takes over your palate with each bite.
rs 140. (1.97 USD)
9/10 

MUTTON FRY
the rich masala is a result of deep roasted onions and spices that lends this dish an irresistible savoury flavour. the texture of the mutton is almost velvety!
rs 200. (2.80 USD)
10/10

ADDRESS - Delta Chambers, Shop No. 1& 2, Mumbai Highway, Punjagutta Officers Colony, Ameerpet, Hyderabad, Telangana 500016; tel: 098850 66252

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/nCjkfFPM6U3gQjrG9

Title: Visiting SUBHAN BAKERY For FAMOUS DUM KE ROAT| OSMANIA & CHAND BISCUITS| Popular Bakery In Hyderabad
Description:
#BakeriesOfHyderabad #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Best Bakeries Of Hyderabad. Popular Bakery In Old City Hyderabad. Tasting Muharram Special Hyderabadi Dum Ke Roat.


A huge part of Hyderabad‚Äôs dining culture is of course, snacking on popular bakes at some of the city‚Äôs most popular bakeries. This tradition of savouring biscuits with Irani Chai or even presenting biscuits as gifts when visiting someone‚Äôs home was what brought us to Subhan Bakery located at Old City, Hyderabad to taste some of their very special offerings in this episode of Gourmet On The Road.


Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna, meets with Mr Syed Imran, the owner of Subhan Bakery to taste a Muharram delicacy, the Dum Ke Roat made especially during the holy month of Muharram. He also tastes the Hyderabadi essential, Osmania Biscuits, and a cardamom flavoured Chand or Moon Biscuit.¬†

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
SPECIAL DUM KA ROAT¬†¬†¬† 
this rich cookie is a muharram specialty at subaan. it is soft and chewy on the inside. you taste the delicious richness of the ghee right away followed by the crunch of nuts. this is one decadent cookie!
rs 600/ kg.
10/10

OSMANIA BISCUITS¬†¬†¬† 
a popular chai time snack, especially with the irani chai, osmania biscuits have a distinct salty-sweet flavour. the delicate crust melts on the palate giving way to buttery notes that linger.
rs 125/ half a kg box.
9/10¬†¬†¬† 

MOON/ CHAND BISCUITS
this cookie is as crumbly as it gets. the cardamom aroma is so gentle yet so effusive on the palate.
rs 130/ 400gm pack.
8/10

Title: Feasting on NIHARI, BHEJA FRY, PAYA MASALA At HOTEL NAYAAB | TRADITIONAL HYDERABADI DELICACIES
Description:
#OldCityHyderabad #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Hotel Nayaab Old City Hyderabad, Restaurants Of Old City Hyderabad, Muslim-Style Hyderabadi Cuisine

In this episode of Gourmet On The road we set out in search for some delicious Hyderabadi fare. This culinary conquest led us to the Old City, an area that boasts of some of the most iconic, traditional Hyderabadi eateries. 

Hotel Nayaab, an establishment over three decades old, located right at the entrance of bustling Chatta Bazaar, Nayapul Road, Charminar, is a favourite amongst locals and tourists. Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna catches up with Omer Aziz of Hotel Nayaab to understand the typical Hyderabadi fare served here. He explains how the Nihari, a broth that makes for the Paya Soup is slowly simmered over hours and also steps into the kitchen to discover the making of two extremely popular dishes.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

NIHARI  
this is a comforting dish perfect to be enjoyed on a nippy evening! you taste the nourishing goodness of the juices from meat bones and the warm spices. the thin veil of fat on top rounds off all flavours. the deep savouriness of fried onion and the fresh hit of coriander adds another layer to the nihari.
rs 100.
9/10

MALAI PAYA/ PAYA MASALA 
definitely an indulgent take on the austere paya! the gravy is enriched with thick cream. the trotter itself is melt-in-the-mouth. Perhaps not for the purist.
rs 240.
8/10

BHEJA MASALA 
this bheja preparation is as light as air! it melts away leaving behind the delicious, custardy flavour of the brain. the masala is unctuous, smoky yet delicate in flavour.
rs 160.
9/10

BHEJA PEPPER FRY
the gentle heat of the pepper creeps up the back of your throat. the bheja is cooked beautifully and the masala, heavy on pepper and coriander balances against the intense creamy bite of the brain.. 
rs 160.
9/10

MUTTON TALAHUA
the masala is reminiscent of an achari masala with its tart edge. it‚Äôs perfect to mop up with a piece of roti. the boneless mutton chunks are well cooked and have absorbed that masala.
rs 220.
8/10

DAL FRY 
this nourishing lentil curry is thick and rich. it is more of a south indian style dal that is slightly tart, tempered with curry leaves and mustard. 
rs 150.
8/10

MUTTON BIRYANI
every grain of rice is separate and has absorbed the flavour of the meat. the meat itself has its flavour and a bit of its bite intact. one can also taste the robustness of the spices that have gone into this biryani. the salan has a mild pickling flavour note that helps break the rich spice notes of the biryani. 
rs 200.
8/10

QUBANI KA MEETHA 
this dessert is a tad syrupy. the malai with its richness helps balance out the overwhelming sweetness. the nuttiness from the apricot kernels pack twice the flavour of almonds and breaks the monotony of flavours. 
rs 100.
8/10

ADDRESS - 22-8-111 & 112, Nayapul Road, Nayapul, Nassir Complex, Charminar, Chatta Bazar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002; tel: 040 2457 7656

Title: NAATU KODI PULUSU, GONGURA MUTTON, Kurnool Pot Biryani At FOOD PYRAMID | BANGALORE-HYDERABAD Highway
Description:
#LunchOnHighway #Telangana #GourmetOnTheRoad

Popular Restaurants On The Bengaluru - Hyderabad Highway. Restaurants For Lunch On Highways. Food Pyramid 24X7 Restaurant.

Food Pyramid, located on the Bangalore-Hyderabad highway or NH44, is a delightful spot to stop over for a meal. It boasts a large rest area, perfect for kicking back after a long drive and of course, has delicious food options, with a large list of local fare to choose from! 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna stops by Kothakota, at Food Pyramid for an Telugu-style lunch. He starts his meal with a fiery Natukodi Pulusu or sour and spicy Chicken curry, served with a wholesome Raagi Sangati. He then moves on to a rustic preparation of Gongura Mutton, and finishes with a Kurnool Kunda Chicken Biryani.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
NATUKODI PULUSU WITH RAAGI SANGATI 
the naati chicken is cooked to a tender texture in this hot, spicy, sour curry! you can feel the heat on the palate multiply with each bite!! the soft sangati, perfect to be drenched in this flavourful curry, makes for a wholesome accompaniment. 
rs 335.
9/10

GONGURA MUTTON CURRY
this is a rustic preparation that encapsulates the flavour of the region. the sour spinach or sorrel hits you right away. the meat is cooked nice and soft with generous bits of fat and has absorbed the sour punch of the gongura through and through.
rs 299.
8.5/10

KURNOOL KUNDA CHICKEN BIRYANI
this dish has a very smoky aroma, making it a tad overbearing. the rice is however, cooked beautifully with each grain separate. the chicken is soft and has absorbed all the flavor of the masala. the biryani tastes better with the accompanying salan. 
rs 260.
7/10
ADDRESS - NH 44, Near Kothakota Town, Bangalore - Hyderabad Highway At 127 KM Stone towards Bangalore, Telangana 509381; tel: 8431422079

Title: NIMRAH CAF√â | Hyderabad‚Äôs Most Popular IRANI CHAI & Osmania Biscuits |CHARMINAR|Making Of Irani Chai
Description:
Nimrah Cafe And Bakery, Popular Bakeries In Hyderabad. Most Famous Bakery In Hyderabad.

Nimrah Cafe and Bakery is a landmark establishment in Hyderabad. Since 1993, Nimrah Caf√© has been serving up delicious biscuits, buns, snacks and of course, great chai!

In this episode, Food Lovers‚Äô Kripal Amanna samples a selection of delicious biscuits studded with a variety of dry fruits and nuts. He starts with the Cherry Coconut Biscuit with it‚Äôs delicious coconut notes and the Osmania Biscuit with it‚Äôs crumbly salty, sweet flavour. He then moves on to the Star Cashew Biscuit and the Fruit Biscuit. The Bun and Rusk Toast that follow, provide a more wholesome, less indulgent pair of snacks. Lastly he tries the Pista Biscuit and the Coconut Dry Fruit Biscuit, both with the toasty flavours of nuts and dry fruit. Of course, he rounds off this tasting session with a cup of Hyderabad‚Äôs signature tea, the Irani Chai! 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
CHERRY COCONUT BISCUIT
this cookie has a pleasant gooey inside with a crunchy outside. it prominent notes of delicious toasty coconut.
rs 6/ biscuit.
8/10

OSMANIA BISCUIT
this is a biscuit with a delicate crust. it is soft and crumbly with a salty sweet flavour. perfect to snack on with a cup of chai!
Rs 3/ biscuit.
9/10

STAR CASHEW BISCUIT 
warm and delicious, this cookie is as fresh as it gets! it is slightly chewy and nutty in taste.
rs 6/ biscuit.
8/10

FRUIT BISCUIT
studded with colourful tutti frutti or candied fruit, this biscuit has more of a sugary bite. 
rs 5/ biscuit.
7/10

BUN
this bun has a lovely crust to it which is the sign of a skilled baker! it‚Äôs fresh, soft, fluffy and so satisfying!
rs 7/ bun.
8/10

RUSK TOAST
the rusk is studded with tutti frutti and nuts which give it a sweet bite as well as texture. it‚Äôs dry and crunchy with a sticky, gooey inside. 
rs 5/ biscuit.
9/10

PISTA BISCUIT
this is one crumbly cookie that just about holds together before disintegrating in your mouth! it‚Äôs studded with the pistachio which gives it a signature green tint. 
rs 6/ biscuit.
9/10

COCONUT DRY FRUIT BISCUIT 
these cookies are light, porous, and carry the light toasty notes of coconut. they have a restrained sweetness to them, reason why you'll keep going back for another!
rs 6/ biscuit
9/10

IRANI CHAI
the potent decoction cooked and reduced down for hours makes this chai unlike any other! you first taste the mildly bitter, tannic notes of the brew that catches hold of your palate, followed by the creamy milk. the sugar plays the second fiddle. this tea makes the perfect complement to osmania biscuits.
rs 12.
10/10

ADDRESS - #20-4-1238/39, Beside Mecca Masjid, Charminar, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002; tel: 098480 89343

Title: Making of The ORIGINAL BAWARCHI BIRYANI In Hyderabad | Tasting MUTTON DUM BIRYANI |CHICKEN BIRYANI
Description:
#HyderabadiBiryani #BawarchiBiryani #OriginalBawarchi #DumBiryani 

Most Popular Biryani In Hyderabad At Bawarchi RTC Cross Road. Best Hyderabadi Dum Biryani At Bawarchi Hyderabad.
When it comes to the best Hyderabadi biryani, there are many establishments vying for the top spot. And judging by their popularity, Bawarchi is definitely a strong contender in the city of Hyderabad. Their dum-style biryanis are iconic across the region and has led to several establishments operating under the same name!

In episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna visits the original Bawarchi on RTC Cross Road and meets the family behind the Bawarchi biryani. He also gets an exclusive demonstration of how their iconic biryani is made from scratch! He then sits down to a meal with the entire family to savour their Chicken Dum Biryani and the Mutton Dum Biryani accompanied by a flavourful sherva and refreshing
 raita.
 
GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
CHICKEN DUM BIRYANI
this biryani has an alluring aroma. every grain of rice and the succulent chicken has absorbed the aromatic, gently spiced masala. the sherva made with chilli powder and a base of sesame seeds helps moisten the biryani also lending it a layer of flavour.
rs.230
9.5/10
 
MUTTON DUM BIRYANI
this dish is comforting and flavourful thanks to the dum style of cooking. the rice and meat are cooked to perfect doneness. the succulent mutton lends the rice its meaty flavour. this is an expertly crafted biriyani.
rs.230
10/10

ADDRESS: Bawarchi Restaurant, Plot No. 44, RTC Cross Rd, Opposite Sandhya Theatre, Chikkadpally, New Nallakunta, Hyderabad, Telangana 500020, 040 2760 5308

Title: A Taste Of Old Hyderabad | HYDERABADI DUM KA BIRYANI At SHADAB | Chicken, Mutton Biryani |Boti Kebab
Description:
#OldCityHyderabad #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Authentic Hyderabadi Biryani at Hotel Shadab, Hyderabad. Restaurants In Old City, Hyderabad, Telangana.

For a taste of old Hyderabad, some would say that Hotel Shadab is the place to go. This is a no-fuss, humble eatery that serves up what is said to be authentic Hyderabadi Dum Ka Biryani, a fixture of the culinary landscape of the city.

In this episode, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna sits down to a meal at Hotel Shadab with Chef Mohammed Iqbal. They sample a flavourful plate of Boti Kebab and move on to taste both the chicken and mutton biryanis while Chef Iqbal walks us through some of the intricacies and nuances of each dish. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
MUTTON BOTI KEBAB
this chatpata boti kebab has retained its juiciness and a bit of its meaty bite, a tad overdone on the colour though. 
Rs 260.
8/10

CHICKEN DUM BIRYANI
the masala threading through the rice is rich and flavourful, thanks to the copious amount of fried onion. the whole spices however is a little harsh and not very rounded in its flavour.
Rs 190.
7.5/10

MUTTON DUM BIRYANI
this biryani packs a punch. the khada masala is much more pronounced in this dish but is well balanced and fully developed in its flavour. the meat is tender and yields with the gentlest of bite.
Rs 190.
9/10

Title: Making of Traditional PATTHAR KA GOSHT at Novotel Hyderabad Convention Centre | MUTTON KEBAB RECIPE
Description:
#PattharKaGosht #HyderabadiCuisine #GourmetOnTheRoad

How to make Patthar Ka Gosht. Patthar Ka Gosht recipe. Hyderabadi Patthar Ka Gosht. Mutton Kebab Recipe

Like many Hyderabadi dishes, Patthar Ka Gosht is a recipe that has royal origins. It is said to have been invented, when the royal chef of the Nizam, forgot his equipment while accompanying the Nizam on official matters. He therefore, improvised and used a marble slab to cook his kebabs. and thus, the Patthar Ka Gosht was born! 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna joins Chef Mohammed Iqbal, Sous Chef at the Novotel Hyderabad Convention Center, as he shows us what goes into the making of this iconic dish cooked over a hot granite slab! 

Here is an indicative recipe if you would like to try to recreate this dish at home. 

Patthar Ka Gosht Recipe 
(serves 4)

Ingredients:
500g mutton (boneless chunks flattened into 1cm thick slices)
1 tbsp ginger garlic paste
1 tsp raw papaya puree
2 tbsp lemon juice
1 tbsp deggi mirch (chilli powder)
1 tsp mustard oil 
1tsp garam masala powder
1 heaped tbsp rose petal powder
1 tbsp potli ka masala
1 tbsp pathar ka phool (stone flower) powder
¬Ω tsp turmeric powder
1tsp cumin powder
1tsp coriander powder
Salt to taste
Refined oil as needed.
Ghee to finish

Method:
1.Mix the mutton slices with all the ingredients, except the refined oil and ghee.
3. Massage this masala into the meat and set aside for 45 minutes.
4. In place of the stone, heat a cast iron skillet or a heavy bottomed pan over medium flame.
5. Grease the pan with oil. 
6. Grill the meat until it forms a brown crust on both sides and is cooked through.
7. A few minutes before taking the meat off the pan, pour ghee over the top and allow to cook.
8. Serve hot. 

ADDRESS - Near, Kondapur, Izzathnagar, HITEC City, Hyderabad, Telangana 500081

Title: Tasting POPULAR PULAOS At ULAVACHARU Hyderabad|Andhra, Telangana Food|RAJU GARI PULAO|BAMBOO CHICKEN
Description:
#BiryaniLovers #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Andhra,Telangana, Rayalseema food at Ulavacharu, Hyderabad. Pulao and biryanis in Hyderabad. Pulao restaurants in Hyderabad. Raju Gari Pulao, Rayala Vari Kodi Pulao.

This hugely popular establishment in Hyderabad is famous for its unique takes on traditional recipes. Their specialties are their biryanis or rather, their pulaos, of which they make 18 varieties! And each of them has its own unique flavour and character.
Food Lovers' Editor, Kripal Amanna joins Ravitej Ravuri of StreetByte on an epic pulao tasting session. He tastes a couple of unconventional starters namely, the Bamboo Chicken, an appetiser of chicken cooked in a bamboo stalk in a tandoor, and the Bangla Kodi. From their wide menu of pulaos, he tries the unique Raju Gari Pulao, a vegetarian Guthivankaya Pulao with eggplant, as well as the Rayala Vary Kodi Pulao with gongura leaves. He rounds off the meal with an indulgent rose milk and a sweet pudding called Junnu made from colostrum. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 

BAMBOO CHICKEN
this chicken is cooked in a fresh, tangy herb marinade and steamed in a bamboo shell. the masala has penetrated all the way into the chicken. the meat is juicy but a wee bit powdery in its texture. 
rs. 445
8/10

BANGLA KODI 
an interesting appetiser of chicken encased in a thick slice of potato that is marinated in a red spice paste and deep fried. almost resembles a mini taco! the slightly underdone potato adds a textural crunch.
rs. 399
8.5/10

RAJU GARI KODI PULAO 
this is unlike any biryani/ pulao i have ever tasted! the consistency is that of a khichdi or rice and gravy mixed together. the pulao is flavoured with pepper, whole spices and green chilli takes some getting used to, the chicken is here just to support the flavourful rice.
rs 335
9/10

GUTHIVANKAYA PULAO
a refreshing take on a vegetarian pulao or biryani. this masaledar pulao has an eggplant gravy ladled on the rice. the eggplant adds a meaty bite to the dish.
rs 285
8/10

RAYALA VARI KODI PULAO
cooked with a masala made of sorrel leaves/ sour spinach or gongura as it is popularly known in the region, this pulao is unique in its flavours. you taste the sour notes in the rich masala and chicken.
rs 345
8.5/10

RAJAHMUNDRY ROSE MILK
thick, rich milk infused with a sweet rose syrup. difficult to down an entire glass!
rs 125
8/10

JUNNU
this milk pudding is rich and creamy. visualise lightly sweetened khova in a custard form. 
rs 95
8/10

ADDRESS: Ulavacharu, 2-1/6 & 2-1/6/A, 1st Floor, 133, Fantasy Square Building, Old Mumbai Highway, Opposite Nissan Showroom, Biodiversity Circle, Gachibowli, Jayabheri Pine Valley, Gachibowli, Hyderabad, Telangana 500032

LOCATION TAG: https://maps.app.goo.gl/GFumXpewuFDYcrpM6

Title: Local Karnataka-style NON-VEGETARIAN Lunch At NAATI SOGADU | Bangalore | Naati Koli Bassaru | Gojju
Description:
#MealsInBangalore #NaatiFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

For a taste of Karnataka or for local non-vegetarian meals visit Naati Sogadu, Sahakar Nagar, Bengaluru. Non-Vegetarian Restaurants In Bangalore.

Heroing flavours of the land, this desi hotel, Naati Sogaadu serves homestyle fare and is especially known for its non-vegetarian offerings. 

Run by a family of four, the food here is made using family recipes, a reason why this spot is gaining popularity despite being less than a year old. The women of the house supervise the making of the base masalas to every dish on the menu. These distinctive masalas result in dishes that remind one of home. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna makes a trip from the South to the North of the city to indulge in a hearty non-vegetarian lunch here. He also interacts with the family and watches the making of a popular dish on the menu!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
KHEEMA BALL PEPPER DRY
The mutton mince ball is soft and meaty, with intense flavours and a prominent pepper kick! the healthy smattering of curry leaves adds a deep herbaceous note. A tasty dish! 
Rs 200.
9/10

CHICKEN LOLLIPOP
Crunchy outside, juicy, soft chicken inside. a tasty appetizer but seems a little out of place in a naati or local meal.
Rs 200
7/10

CHILLI CHICKEN
This masala has heaps of sauteed onions, that lends a savoury flavour and a slight sweetness. the chilli heat is mellow, not the kind that will not leave you in agony!
Rs 180
7.5/10

NAATI CHICKEN LIVER FRY
This naati chicken liver is firm, not powdery. the masala of pepper, coriander and onions perfectly complements the meaty flavours of the liver.
Rs 180
8.5/10

BOTI GOJJU
The boti here is cooked in a gojju, a semi dry gravy. the flavour is intensely gamey, not for the faint hearted.
Rs 180
7/10

MUTTON CURRY 
A curry flavoured with roasted spices. the meat is pink and succulent with a slight bite and some fat. perfect when savoured with the dry, spongy dosa.
Rs 220 
9/10

NAATI KOLI BASAARU
The thin gravy or saaru has the goodness of the chicken, bones, marrow, gelatin and all in a grainy masala. The chicken, cooked twice, in the saaru and as a dry preparation is flavourful and almost melt-in-the-mouth in its texture.
Rs 220
10/10

MUTTON BIRYANI
Made with short grain rice, this pulao has the gentle aroma and zing of the herbs - coriander, ginger, garlic and chillies, and the mellow, lilting sweetness of fennel or star anise. 
7.5/10
Rs 240 for a large portion and rs 180 for a small portion.

ADDRESS - 
Naati Sogadu, Ground floor, Site#28/1,15th Main, 1st Cross, E block, Sahakar Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560 092
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/CCsHPuxmF7rwBop77

Title: Visiting 75-Year Old G PULLA REDDY SWEETS Kurnool|MOST POPULAR SWEET SHOP Andhra Pradesh & Telangana
Description:
#IndianSweets #HyderabadFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

G Pulla Reddy Pure Ghee Sweets Top Sweet Shop In Hyderabad and all of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. Famous Indian Sweets.

If you‚Äôre looking for great sweets in Andhra Pradesh, look no further than G Pulla Reddy Sweet Shops. The company now has a presence all over Andhra Pradesh and Telengana. Established in 1948, the original owner set up shop in Kurnool. He insisted on making sweets of the highest quality which meant using pure ghee!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the original establishment set up by G Pulla Reddy himself. Here he samples a smattering of their most popular offerings including, a delicious Khova Puri, the ghee laden Mysore Pak and Badusha, as well as the paper thin, melt-in-your-mouth Sugar Pootharekulu. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
KHOVA PURI
this puri is flaky with layers of dough stuffed with creamy khova or cooked milk solids. the buttery goodness of the ghee makes you want to keep going back for a bite.
rs 580/ kilo
 8.5/10

BADUSHA
a crusty maida cookie. the texture is crumbly on the outside and gooey inside. you can taste the doughy goodness in every mouthful.
rs 540/ kilo
8/10

SPECIAL MYSORE PAK 
this version of the mysore pak is unbelievably soft! just melts on the palate leaving the delicious aftertaste of ghee!
rs 580/ kilo
8/10

MYSORE PAK
the older, original version. harder in texture and lighter in colour. It has a crumbly bite. this mysore pak lingers on the bite. 
rs 580/ kilo
7/10

SONA PATTI 
also called the gatti mithai, this one‚Äôs an interesting indian sweetmeat made of germinated wheat sprout flour, sugar and ghee. Has the texture of a hard candy and a mellow toffee-like sweetness. What you really taste is the ghee.
rs 620/ kilo
7.5/10

SUGAR POOTHAREKULU 
there‚Äôs nothing quite like this sweet creation that resembles and feels exactly like paper! These thin sheets are made of rice flour and ghee is stuffed with sugar. it disappears the minute it hits your palate!
Rs 30/ piece
 9/10

JAGGERY POOTHAREKULU
this version of the paper sweet is lined with bits of jaggery. its taste has much more of an earthy sweetness. a delightful find at g pullareddy!
Rs 32/ piece
10/10

KHOVA
can taste light, toasty caramelised notes in the milk of the khova or reduced milk solids. a simply yet soul satisfying dessert.
rs 540/ kilo
9/10

KAJU BARFI
Looks similar to a kaju katli but much thicker. You taste the richness of kaju and the subtle hint of cardamom and other sweet spices. garnished with the signature varak or silver leaf.
rs 1200/ kilo
8.5/10

ADDRESS - G Pulla Reddy Sweets, Old Bus Stand Rd, N R Peta, Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh 518001
085182 21445

Title: BEST Andhra Breakfast |Chutneys Hyderabad|LONGEST 70MM DOSA|Babai Idli| CHIRANJEEVI DOSA| 6 CHUTNEYS
Description:
#HyderabadFoodTour #BreakfastInHyderabad #GourmetOnTheRoad

Most Popular South Indian Vegetarian Restaurant In Hyderabad, Chutneys. South Indian Breakfast spread in Hyderabad.

This restaurant in Hyderabad is abuzz with patrons who flock here to savour some delicious South Indian breakfast, especially their bounty of different ‚Äòchutneys‚Äô as the restaurant's name suggests. 

In this special collab episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna meets with Ravitej Ravuri of Streetbyte to discover a great breakfast! He tastes the blockbuster of a 70mm dosa, some incredibly soft Babai Idli, a spongy Chiranjeevi steamed dosa, their delicious chutneys and more.

Streetbyte Channel link - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqA2ZPcBYbWqmKU3iFX2KwA

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

70MM DOSA 
This 70mm dosa is 4 feet long, thick in its texture with a slightly tart edge. Tasting this dosa with the six different chutneys, from the spicy and sweet ginger and jaggery, grainy lentil chutney to the sweet kobari chutney is a treat to the senses!
8/10

CHUTNEYS
each of these chutneys holds it own in its flavours. the kobari lausu is simple, you taste the coconut and a light sweetness. the coconut and peanut chutney has an endearing spicy edge while the putnalu chutney has that wholesome grainy texture from the lentils. The tomato and corn chutney dabbles in fusion! Another favourite here is the tangy, sweet and spicy allam bellam or ginger and jaggery chutney.
10/10

BABAI IDLI 
these steaming hot idlis topped with a dollop of butter are super soft! the white butter melts into the idli making it all the more crumbly! the chutneys give every bite a different dimension of flavour. 
10/10

GUNTUR IDLI 
smeared with a mixture of the guntur chilli podi mixed with ghee, this is a spicy idli! The chutneys help mellow the spice in the podi.  the Andhra style sambar is lusciously thick and great accompaniment.
8/10

CHIRANJEEVI DOSA
This thick dosa is steamed and uses absolutely no oil! This is a spongy dosa with a crunchy crust. It is served with a cheruku panakam or sugarcane syrup that is intensely sweet, perfect to be lapped up with this thick dosa.
9/10

MLA PESARATTU
A green gram pancake stuffed with upma. A unique dish.  you taste the crunch of the onion, cashew and the spice from the green chilli. grainy crunch of the pesarattu and the soft upma give this dish a contrast in its textures.
8.5/10

MANGO UTHAPPAM
A raw mango paste mixed with red chilli powder is smeared on top of this thick uthappam. you taste the tanginess that kicks in at the end of each bite. 
8/10

ADDRESS - Hi-tech City, Main Road, Beside @Home, Surya Enclave, Kothaguda, Hyderabad, Telangana 500081

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/vRNuxoSXbiT5LrHt6

Title: Tasting Traditional TELUGU DELICACIES At THE SPICY VENUE | Hyderabad | VEG THALI| MLA POTLAM BIRYANI
Description:
#HyderabadFoodTour #ApricotDelight #GourmetOnTheRoad

For the best Andhra / Telugu Food in Hyderabad visit The Spicy Venue at Jubilee Hills. Best Restaurants In Hyderabad. Most popular Andhra Vegetarian Thali.

The Spicy Venue, Hyderabad is a restaurant that comes highly recommended for its traditional fare from states of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The signature Vegetarian Thali featuring some of the most loved Andhra dishes such as Ulavacharu, Pesara Pulusu and Pappu Chaaru is sure to give one the taste of food served in an Andhra home.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna tastes this extensive thali together with some of the must try, traditional non-vegetarian preparations. He also meets owner, Mr Sampath who began the establishment nearly two decades ago and makes a quick kitchen tour to watch another popular dish, the MLA Potlam Biryani, a dish that Mr Sampath says draws inspiration from from the Japanese omurice and local MLA pesarattu. This one is a delicious fresh water shrimp  and mutton mince biryani in a spicy omelette blanket!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
MLA POTLAM BIRYANI
a unique surf and turf style biryani. the signature of this dish is the thin, veil-like omelette in which the fresh water shrimp and mutton mince biryani is wrapped!  the rice has a mellow spicing. the shrimp has a mild saline flavour yet is deliciously sweet.
rs 375.
9/10

VEGETARIAN THALI
this thali is complete with traditional telugu delicacies, all vegetarian! from a slightly tart and wholesome dosakaya pappu, to a crunchy bendakaya vepudu, to potatoes roasted with cashew - bangaladumpa vepudu, pesara pulusu, a tart drumstick ulavacharu and more, these dishes can be savoured with piping hot rice and loads of ghee!
rs 175.
10/10

KODI IGURU
this chicken dish has a rich, savoury onion base that also has a certain sweetness to it. toasted cashews and curry leaves further intensify the savoury notes in the preparation.
rs 315.
8/10

SPECIAL CHEPA VEPUDU
this is the traditional andhra fish fry. coated in a mellow, roasted masala the fish is moist in every bite. a simple dish made well. 
Rs 370.
8.5/10

KAKINADA  PEETHALA IGURU
the kakinada sea crab is sweet, juicy and has absorbed all the deep roasted masala. there‚Äôs a slight pepperiness that balances wells against the sweetness of the crab. Delicious!
Rs 370.
10/10

NELLORE CHEPALA PULUSU
this andhra delicacy is made using the local korameenu or murrel fish cooked in a tomato and onion gravy. the curry also has a puckering sourness from the use of tamarind and raw mango. This is balances out when eaten with that fleshy fish!
rs 345.
9/10

NAATU KODI PULUSU
a traditional homestyle curry made with country chicken. the aromatic masala base has a prominent fennel flavour. the naatu kodi is cooked pink and juicy!
rs 315.
8.5/10

LOOSE PRAWNS 
a popular appetiser at the spicy venue. the prawns are delicately flavoured with pepper, fresh coriander and chillies. 
rs 370.
8/10

APRICOT DELIGHT
the spicy venue‚Äôs take on the classic qubani ka meetha. a pudding made with a biscuit base, layered with sponge cake, apricot jam and topped with custard. s 120.
8.5/10

ADDRESS - No. 265/S, Road Number 10, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/oCqCYfsFaw8ZVFxP6

Title: Nagarjuna Vs Meghana Foods|Tasting Bengaluru‚Äôs Most Popular Andhra Biryanis|Mutton & Chicken Biryani
Description:
#BestAndhraBiryani #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Most Popular Biryani Restaurants In Namma Bengaluru. Best Restaurants For Spicy Andhra Biryani In Bangalore.

Widely famous for their Andhra & Hyderabadi style of biryanis, Nagarjuna and Meghana Foods are often pitted against each other. Without surprise both these eateries have a devoted following, most who swear-by the biryanis.

Nagarjuna, an establishment that was set up in the early 1980s serves two Andhra-style, dum biryanis, a Mutton and a Chicken while Meghana Foods, a relatively new eatery serves an array of biryani to choose from, the most popular of which is a spicy, Chicken Boneless Biryani.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna, tastes both biryanis at Nagarjuna and three of the crowd favourites at Meghana Foods, reviewing what makes each of these biryanis special.

In conclusion, he tells viewers what could be the biryani for them based on their preferences!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

CHICKEN BIRYANI
studded with a fair bit of whole spices - cloves, cardamom and cinnamon, which gives the biryani rice a fulsome flavour that serves well to embrace the chicken.
rs 265
8/10

MUTTON BIRYANI
the rice is similar in flavour to the chicken biryani, but the spices here seem more accentuated. The meat is soft, you can taste the gamey flavours of the fat.¬†
rs 305
8.5/10

CHICKEN BONELESS BIRYANI
made with long grain basmati rice, each grain is separate. topped with boneless chicken morsels coated in a thick, spirited masala, this is a biryani you can definitely share.
rs 248
8/10

CHICKEN DUM BIRYANI
served with a leg of chicken that is coated in a savoury, caramelised onion masala that threads through the long grained rice. the meat is cooked to the bone and is flavourful. a biryani that leaves you more than satisfied!
rs 242¬†
8.5/10

MUTTON BIRYANI
the spicing in meghana biryanis is apparent on the palate, but absent on the plate. one sees no hint of any of the spices that have gone into the dish, but you can taste its presence. the masala in the mutton biryani is mellower than in the chicken version, allowing the flavour of the meat to take precedence.¬†
rs 301
8/10

ADDRESS - Nagarjuna, 138, 1st Cross Rd, KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560 095;¬†
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/SpakUTUDED1wd45Q7

ADDRESS - Meghana Foods, Jyoti Nivas College Road NearJyoti Nivas College, No. 124, 1st Cross Rd, KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/cCxWRFu3X1k1H9vS6

Title: Mysore‚Äôs OLDEST Soda & Ice Cream Shop | 80-Year-Old Brahmin‚Äôs Soda Factory | Homemade Ice Cream
Description:
#DessertParlours #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad
Most Popular Juice And Ice Cream Parlour In Mysore, Brahmin‚Äôs Soda Factory. 

Located in the heart of the bustling Mysuru market, Brahmin‚Äôs Soda Factory, albeit a tiny nondescript shop/parlour is easily spottable thanks to the crowd this place gathers! Nearly three generations old, this shop that was setup in the early 1930s made soda, using a machine that was specially sourced from England. 

It is hugely popular during summer for its sodas of course, juices, homemade ice creams and fruit salads. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this iconic spot and taste a few of the soda, the Sarsaparilla soda, known for its medicinal benefits and a soothing ginger milk. He also tastes the homemade vanilla ice cream here. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
BRAHMIN SODA FACTORY
Captions
Sarsaparilla soda
slightly medicinal, herbal flavour coupled with the spritzy soda. definitely an acquired taste. said to be good for the stomach and aids digestion. 
7/10
Rs.17.

ginger milk
The refreshing cold milk has a touch of sweetness while the spicy warmth of the ginger envelopes your throat.  
8/10
Rs. 17.

lime masala soda
Very refreshing combination of lime and the masala. Definitely wakes you up! 
7/10
Rs. 15.

homemade vanilla ice cream  
The vanilla notes in this homemade ice cream is quite pronounced; texture-wise, it‚Äôs halfway between a gelato and sorbet
7/10
Rs. 15.
ADDRESS - Brahmin Soda Shop
Kali Temple St, Devaraja Mohalla, Mandi Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001
094839 01667

Title: Visiting GAYATHRI TIFFIN ROOM For The BEST TIFFIN/ BREAKFAST In Mysore! GTR Masala Dose |Kesari Bath
Description:
#Breakfast #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Visit Gayathri Tiffin Room or popularly called GTR in Mysore for a variety of dosas or tiffin time snacks like idli ! Breakfast or Tiffin Spots In Mysuru.

Gayathri Tiffin Room, widely known as GTR in the city of Mysuru, is a destination loved for its tiffin items, especially a variety of dosas! This over half a century old establishment serves up tongue-tickling dosa, the favourite being the Gayatri Masala Dosa here, not the typical Mysore Masala with red chutney, but a thick roast with a soft underbelly. 

Customers who patronise this restaurant have grown in number over the years and often frequent the place for breakfast or tea-time tiffin.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the eatery for tiffin in the evening and savours three dosas, the GTR Masala Dose of course, along with an unusual Green Dosa and an Open Butter Masala Dose. He also tastes one of the best Kesari Baths he has ever eaten!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
GTR masala dosa
a delightful crunchy dosa with a soft interior. has a nice buttery flavour. the potatoes are soft, creamy and have a generous amount of onion and fresh coriander for that sprightly freshness. the dosa itself is quite thick. served with a fresh spicy chutney. 
8.5/10
Rs. 45 

idli 
the idli has a grainy texture and a mildly vegetal flavour that suggests it may have been steamed in a leaf. the spicy chutney has the fresh flavour of coconut and body from the ground lentils. the sambar has a gentle sweetness typical of a south canara sambar. 
8.5/10
Rs. 30 

green dosa 
the heavy texture and thickness is reminiscent of an uthappam. nicely roasted at the bottom. served with a tasty vegetable saagu and a spicy chutney to lift all the flavours. there‚Äôs a mild lingering flavour of dill. 
7.5/10
Rs. 50 

open butter masala dosa
slightly thick, well-roasted dosa. the podi has a hint of sweetness and a bit of spice that is mellowed out by the butter. the palya is creamy and soft. the chutney helps lift the flavours of everything on the plate. 
9/10
Rs. 52
 
Uppitu
very gentle delicate flavour of tomato, fried lentils, and curry leaves. there‚Äôs the soft grainy texture of semolina with a hint of spice and onion for crunch. 
7.5/10

kesari bath
reminiscent of a badam halwa in terms of texture. silky, velvety with barely any graininess. restrained sweetness with the occasional gentle pop of raisins. the ghee makes it lush and seductively delicious. kesari bath at a whole new level! definitely one of the best I‚Äôve tasted.
10/10
Chow chow bath price 
Rs. 50 

filter coffee 
nice and frothy on top. sort of coffee that makes you happy! 
8/10
Rs. 10 


ADDRESS - 2954, 1, NS Road, near Ramachandra Agrahara, Chamundipuram, Ramachandra Agrahara, Mysuru, Karnataka 570004
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/mfDuLkdpsn36gzPk8

Title: Savouring the Taste Of Coorg In Mysore! SIMPLY KODAVAS | Pandi Curry | Chicken Curry | Pork Biryani
Description:
#Kodava #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad
Authentic Kodava Food In Mysore Only At Simply Kodavas!

Finding authentic Kodava food outside Coorg can be quite the task but for the citizens of Mysuru however, Simply Kodavas is the place to go! This family-run restaurant features traditional Kodava art and serves up classic Kodava dishes.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna pays a visit to this restaurant and chats with the owner and his son about this distinct cuisine. He samples the quintessential Kodava Pandi Curry a flavourful Pork Chilli, both finished with kachampuli. He also tastes a robust chicken curry and couple of unconventional dishes namely, the Pork Biryani and Pork Kebab. He savours all of this with some traditional Kodava rice-based staples like Kadamputtu, Noolputtu and Paaputtu. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
Pandi curry
you can taste roasted spices, fresh coriander, the tartness of the kachampuli and a peppery heat. A finger-lickingly good pork dish!
9/10
Rs. 160.

Pork chilli
the fat in this is spicy and flavourful! pork melts in your mouth and the delicious fat coats your palate. You have the deep brown roasted spices, a slight tartness from the kachampuli or coorgi vinegar, and the spice of the green chilli that lingers on the palate. a satisfying preparation!
9/10
Rs. 190.

Chicken curry
This curry definitely holds its own against the pork items in terms of flavour. Made with a spicy coconut base, the gravy has certainly been cooked for a while for the flavours to deepen!
9/10
Rs. 160.

Pork biryani
made more in the pulao style of cooking. The tiny morsels of tender pork have a certain smokiness that takes over your palate. Can also detect a hint of pickling spices. This is very different from a typical biryani. 
7/10
Rs. 180.

Pork kebab
The meat definitely has a bit of bite to it and the fat hasn't rendered down. Innovative dish but I‚Äôm not a fan. 
6/10
Rs. 200.

ADDRESS - Simply Kodavas, 6th Main Rd, Manchegowdana koppalu, Vijayanagar 1st Stage, Vijayanagar, Mysuru, Karnataka 570 017
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/vNcyHVMAAhZagSXd7
