Title: Tasting A Vegetarian MYSORE THALI & Non-Vegetarian KARNATAKA THALI At La Uppu | Grand Mercure Mysore
Description:
#LocalFlavours #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Must-visit restaurant for the best, traditional vegetarian and non-vegetarian thalis in Mysore! Restaurants To Lunch At In Mysore.

Karnataka has some delicious fare on offer and these iconic dishes can be savoured as a whole in its Thalis. To experience these traditional flavours Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits La Uppu, the all-day dining restaurant at Grand Mercure Mysore for not just one, but two thalis for lunch.

He interacts with local chef, Vijay in the kitchen understanding what goes into some of the dishes on the thali. At the table he begins lunch with the Mysuru Thali, a vegetarian thali featuring dishes such as Bisi Bele Bath, Mysore Bonda, Chitranna, Thilisaaru, Mysore Pak and Godhi Halwa. He then tastes the non-vegetarian Karnataka Thali that comes with a Donne Biryani, Gorikayi Kara and Koli Saaru among other dishes.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
Mysore Thali
MYSORE BONDA 
mildly seasoned bonda. dunk it into the thili saaru to perk up its flavours

THILI SAARU
there‚Äôs a puckering tartness in this rasam, gentle spice and slight, soothing sweetness in its flavours. 

BALEKAI FRY
raw banana fry with a nice masala coating. no-fuss, tasty, fried goodness.

BELE TAWE
Thick, creamy lentil preparation with chilli, mustard and curry leaves. the kind that would perhaps be served in a typical Mysuru kitchen.

GORIKAYI PALYA
Lightly tempered, this cluster bean preparation is delicious, savour it with the akki rotti.

BADNEKAYI GOJJU
loaded with onions, the flavours of the masala make this brinjal dish shine!

CHITRANA
a satisfying rice preparation, flavoured with tumeric, onions and lemon juice.

BISI BELE BATH
a tasty bisi bele bath! the rice is fortified with lentils and a gentle warmth from the red chilli. the ghee on top makes this dish all the more irresistible!

KOSAMBARI
the kosambari is quite generous in its use of grated coconut. perfect palate refresher in between tasting all the dishes on the thali.

MOSARANNA
the cool yoghurt and mild tempering makes the mosaranna the best way to end an all vegetarian meal.

MYSORE PAK
all the ghee makes this mysore pak melt in the mouth!

GODHI PAYASAM
the best part to this wheat payasam is that it isn‚Äôt very sweet. it‚Äôs a light dish for a dessert, not leaving you feeling too heavy!

The Mysore Thali is priced at Rs 999 +taxes per person.
9/10

Karnataka Thali

GORIKAYI PALYA
this version of the palya or veggie preparation is spicy and uses a mint, green coriander and chilli paste!

KOLI SAARU
a rich, thick gravy that is flavoured with methi or fenugreek. there‚Äôs also some chilli and whole spices that have been ground and added to the masala.

MUTTON DONNE BIRYANI
the rice in this biryani is very mellow in its flavours. you taste the signature donne masala or spicing but this isn‚Äôt overly powerful. the meat is soft and tender, cooked really well!

The Karnataka Thali is priced at Rs 999 +taxes per person.
8.5/10 

ADDRESS - Grand Mercure Mysore, 2203/60 Nelson Mandela Circle, New Sayyaji Rao Rd, Mysuru, Karnataka, 570021

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/RcAoi1CJ34Mc4cNk8

Title: GOTR VLOGS 01|Exclusive Behind The Scenes Shoot | Has The Taste In Food At Age Old Eateries Changed?
Description:
#BTS #TheShootLife #GourmetOnTheRoadVlogs

Food Lovers Vlogs and Gourmet On The Road Behind The Scenes

Hi folks!
This video is the first of our vlog series, something I hope to do at least once a week. 
While most of the time you see me tasting and reviewing food in every Gourmet On The Road episode, lately many of you have also been requesting to see what goes into shooting an episode.

In this vlog, I take you through my typical shoot day, giving you snippets of behind the scenes footage (in which you can also see part of my team that accompanies me)! I shall also be taking this series as an opportunity to engage with you all, answer frequently asked questions in the comments and more!

Thank you very much for watching this behind the scenes video and if you have any questions for me, be sure to let me know in the comments below. I‚Äôd like to know everything that‚Äôs on your mind regarding the shows we put together or food in general! :)\

Title: Popular Breakfasts Bengaluru Mysuru Highway|Bidadi THATTE IDLI|Shivalli KADUBU|Maddur Tiffany's VADA
Description:
#Breakfast #HighwayEateries #GourmetOnTheRoad

The best breakfast spots on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Highway: Bidadi Thatte Idli, MTR Shivalli Restaurant, Maddur Tiffany‚Äôs.

The Bengaluru Mysuru Highway is a busy one! And thanks to all that footfall, there‚Äôs definitely some great eateries that have popped up along the way. If you‚Äôre setting out early in the morning, these three eateries make for the ideal breakfast spots. 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna makes his first stop at Shri Renukambha Bidadi Thatte Idli, a small joint just off the highway in a town called Bidadi. The next stop on the highway is Shivalli, to sample their Rice Kadubu, a steamed rice-based dumpling served with chutney and sambar. The third and last stop is Maddur Tiffany‚Äôs. This famous eatery is popular for having invented the Maddur Vada, a delicious crispy, savoury, snack made with semolina, and flavoured with curry leaves, cashews and ghee! 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

Shri Renukhambha Bidadi Thatte Idli
THATTE IDLI
these idlis are springy and very soft! they have a slight sour edge but eaten with that butter, it tastes heavenly! the chutneys served have a fiery, spicy bite to jolt your tastebuds awake! 
9/10

MASALA VADE masala vada has a crispy, crunchy bite of the lentils along with the sweetness of onion and the surprise herbaceous note of dill. 
7.5/10

UDDINA VADA
crispy and very lightly seasoned. 
7/10

Plate of Idli Vada 
Rs. 50 


Maddur Tiffanys
SPECIAL MADDUR VADA 
this feels and tastes like a scrumptious savoury cookie. there‚Äôs a prominent flavour of caramelized onions, curry leaves and cashew. rava in the batter gives it that grainy bite. it can feel dry after a few bites and needs that minty spicy chutney to moisten it.
Rs. 23
9/10

COFFEE 
this is a frothy, well made coffee. it has the right amount of decoction and milk,  and is served at just the right temperature. 
Rs. 26
8.5/10

Shivalli 
RICE KADUBU 
the batter is steamed in jackfruit leaves. this imparts a mild fragrance to the dish. the kadubu dissolves in your mouth. it pairs well with the tart sambar and is delicious with the coconut chutney too. 
Rs 50.
8.5/10

FILTER COFFEE
frothy and strong, just the way coffee should be. make sure to pull it to cool the coffee down.
Rs. 25.
8/10
ADDRESS - Shri Renukambha Bidadi Thatte idli, Mysore Road, Near police Station, Bidadi, Karnataka 562109; tel: 098450 61490; LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/5MSfxPFvoJb3HSjS9

ADDRESS - Shivalli Restaurant, NH275, Mudagere, Karnataka 562160; LOCATION TAG - https://maps.google.com/?cid=10685406578336381720

ADDRESS - Maddur Tiffany's, Bangalore Mysore Highway, Shivapura, Maddur, Karnataka 571429; LOCATION TAG - https://maps.google.com/?cid=17775535769190595591

Title: Malgudi Coffee Shop Mysore | CAFE WITH A CAUSE | Mysore Filter Coffee| Lemon Drizzle| Chocolate Cake
Description:
#CoffeeShop #Dessert #GourmetOnTheRoad

Looking for a scenic cafe in Mysuru? The Malgudi Coffee Shop located at Green Hotel (formerly the Chittaranjan Princess Palace) is the place to visit!

This cafe set in a covered courtyard, surrounded by nature and natural interiors is the perfect spot to unwind with a cup of coffee and some scrumptious cakes or sandwiches.

The unique aspect of this culinary enterprise is that it seeks to employ and empower women who come from less privileged backgrounds, offering them a means of livelihood. All treats on the cafe‚Äôs menu is all made by the staff who run the show here! Their delicious coffee is also sourced from local farmers, supporting fair trade in the area. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna, visits the coffee shop, interacts with a member of the staff and orders himself some of the must-tries on the menu. He tastes a highly recommended Lemon Drizzle Cake, Walnut and Date Cake, and gooey Chocolate Cake together with a cup of strong Mysore Filter Coffee.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
LEMON DRIZZLE CAKE 
buttery with the citrusy edge of the lemon. slightly crumbly texture. an old fashioned cake that's comforting and delicately flavoured.
7.5/10
Rs. 50.

DATE AND WALNUT CAKE
this cake slices clean and holds together. one can taste the full-on nutty flavours of the walnut and the natural sugars of the date.
7.5/10
Rs. 75.

CHOCOLATE CAKE
dense and gooey! the sort of chocolate cake that a good home chef would bake using locally available  ingredients. 
7.5/10
Rs. 75.

MYSORE FILTER COFFEE 
this coffee has a strong, heady aroma and some terrific body! you get the fullness of the coffee in the first sip. it works well when relished with sweet cakes. 
8/10
Rs. 75. 

ADDRESS - Malgudi Coffee Shop and Bakery, 81, Hunsur Road, Near University of Mysore Campus, Mysuru, Karnataka 570006

LOCATION TAG -  https://goo.gl/maps/SQmMRPNsywkekViK7

Title: Local-Style Non-Vegetarian Meals At TEGU MESS In Mysuru | IDLI | PEPPER CHICKEN | MUTTON CURRY
Description:
#BestRestaurantsInMysore #NonVegetarian #GourmetOnTheRoad
When in Mysore, head to Tegu Mess for local-style non-vegetarian fare! This hole-in-the-wall eatery began as an establishment to cater to the needs of students in the area nearly 50 years ago! 

Known especially for its wholesome, hearty, meat dishes, each item on offer has its own unique masala ground in-house by the family. Open through the day for breakfast, lunch and dinner, the fare here is sure to remind one of home.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this humble eatery and meets second generation owner, Mr. Tegoji Rao and his son Shyam. He takes a look at the open kitchen, right next to the dining area and samples the Idlis with Gravy which is offered during breakfast hours. He also tries a nourishing Paya soup, a flavourful Pepper Chicken, a gently spiced Mutton Curry and much more as part of his lunch meal.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
IDLI WITH GRAVY
Steaming hot and fluffy idlis. can be savoured with a chicken gravy or a robust mutton gravy that packs heaps of flavour. 
8/10
Rs 30

PAYA
Has a nourishing, delicate flavour with a hint of pepper and fresh herby zing of coriander. the gelatinous trotter just melts in your mouth! 
8.5/10
Rs. 130

MUTTON CHOPS
A light, delicate stew cooked with mild spices allowing the meat flavour to be most dominant. The mutton is soft and peels effortlessly off the bone!
9/10
Rs. 130.

PEPPER CHICKEN
This is a delicious gravy. notes of pepper and fenugreek give it a deep flavour. the chicken is lushly flavoured with that masala, and is tender and juicy in every bite.
9/10 
Rs. 130.

GHEE RICE
A staple here made with long grain rice. it‚Äôs aromatic on its own but can also be paired with the delicious meaty sides!
7.5/10
Rs. 60.

CHILLI CHICKEN
Loaded with tomatoes and coriander this gravy has a gentle, roasted red chilli heat. it is very different from the green chilli heat that one is used to. the curry also has a certain smokiness to it. 
7/10
Rs. 130.

MUTTON LIVER
Made in green masala made that is loaded with fresh coriander. works well with the earthy, meaty, irony notes of the liver. the liver has a slight bite but yields quickly.  
9/10
Rs. 130.

MUTTON CURRY
A superb curry! The mellow spicing allows the meat to shine. all the flavour of the meat is in the gravy. the sort of dish your grandmother would cook for you.
9/10
Rs. 140.

ADDRESS- Tegu Mess, Adipampa Road, 6th Cross Rd, Vani Vilas Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570 002
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/k3BkbUi2VyKVCLQQA

Title: Tasting 28 dishes! KERALA SADHYA at Vembanad, Bangalore|Vegetarian Malayalee Food|4 TYPES OF PAYASAM
Description:
#Onam #VegetarianFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

The Kerala sadhya meal is an essential part of Malayalee cuisine. Traditionally served at festive occasions like Onam, Vishu, weddings and the likes, the sadhya on average consists of 25-28 dishes! 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna, samples the sadhya at Vembanad, the Keralan Hotel at The Paul. He savours this lavish meal of 28 dishes, each with its own unique character and flavour. The meal celebrates the use of vegetables, fruits, various lentils, spices, yogurt and of course coconut in various forms! He wraps up the meal with 4 varieties of payasams, a traditional dessert from Kerala. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD
NEI PARIPPU
very mildly flavoured. this lentil dish is meant to be eaten at the beginning of a sadhya.

SAMBAR 
slightly tangy with the nourishing feel of the vegetables. quite a satisfying sambar! 

INJI PULI
the sour hit of the tamarind and warm heat of the ginger in this pickle awakens your palate!

ULLI THEEYAL
the delicious savouriness from the onions plays off the sweetness from the jaggery. 

KOOTU CURRY
there‚Äôs the earthy texture of the yam with bite of the bengal gram and the slight crunch of the coconut. these veggies are coated in an aromatic, roasted masala. 

BEANS MEZHUKUPURRATI
this poriyal of sorts has a nice crunch of the beans with the mild sweetness and gentle crunch from the onions. 

OLAN
the coconut milk in this soothes and refreshes your palate. best eaten in between tasting the spicy dishes.

VENDAKYA MORRU CURRY
this yoghurt based gravy has a pleasant crunch from the sauteed okra and the savoury pop of the mustard seeds.

AVIAL
a lovely union of veggies. this avial has the gentle flavour of yoghurt, sweetness of the grated coconut and the crunch of the vegetables. you can taste that drizzle of coconut oil used to finish the dish.

CABBAGE THORAN
this cabbage thoran has a prominent sweetness from the copious amounts of fresh grated coconut. It‚Äôs mild tempering allows the cabbage to shine!

KAALAN 
the unctuous ripeness of the banana imparts a surprising sweetness to this dish. delicious!

RASAM
you can taste the tartness of the tamarind and tomato and the gentle heat of the peppercorn at the back of your throat in this rasam.

PACCHA MORRU
this buttermilk is thick unlike regular buttermilk. savour this combination of the buttermilk with the rice with kondattam or yoghurt-soaked, sundried and fried chilli!

PARIPPU PAYASAM 
the sweetness of this lentil payasam pairs well with the fruity flavours of the banana. the pappadam adds weight and body to your bite.

SEMIYA PAYASAM
this semiya payasam has the toasty notes of the fried cashews and the sweet jammy pop of the sauteed raisins.

PAAL ADA
a traditional malayalee dessert made with rice flakes, has a delicious, mild caramel flavour. 

JACKFRUIT PAYASAM
this payasam has the intense, pungent sweet flavour of ripe jackfruit. you also taste the lingering note of ground cumin with each bite.

SADHYA
This vegetarian meal gives one a delicious taste of Kerala, each dish unique and pleasing to the palate. a highly-recommended experience to savour!
10/10
This traditional sadhya is priced at Rs 1350 +taxes per person.

ADDRESS -  Vembanad, The Paul, 139/28, Domlur Layout Opp. Embassy Golf Links, Off, Intermediate Ring Rd, Krishna Reddy Layout, Amarjyoti Layout, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071
LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/the-paul-bangalore?share

Title: Making Of Artisan INDIAN CHOCOLATES In MYSURU | Tasting NAVILUNA Chocolates | Jamun | Gondhoraj
Description:
#ChocolateMaking #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad

Naviluna Artisan Chocolate in Mysuru is all about celebrating Indian chocolate, and artisan or handcrafted Indian chocolate at that!

Using certified single origin Indian cacao beans from the South of India, Naviluna conjures up chocolate bars with unusual, unheard of and unique flavour combinations. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the factory where this chocolate is produced in small batches, meeting with Founder & Head Chef, David Belo. He understands what it takes to be bean to bar chocolate makers, giving viewers an in-depth understanding of the chocolate making process. He also tastes some of the more popular flavours of chocolate on offer here!

Visit https://earthloaf.co.in/ for more details on Naviluna Artisan Chocolate.
Tel: 098806 29172
GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

JUNIPER & CHAMOMILE 
these initially disparate flavours come together with the help of that boldly flavoured unapologetic chocolate. the flavour is led by juniper with subtle notes of chamomile. fig and rose petal added in small amounts impart a hint of sweetness and round off the flavours in this bar. 
Rs. 330/ 60g bar
8.5/10

AMERICAN BARREL AGED 
this chocolate has a long and warm finish, a character that comes owing to the fermentation of the cocoa in a whiskey barrel.
Rs. 330/ 60g bar
8.5/10

GONDORAJ LEBU 
the dehydrated flecks of gondhoraj rind emit a fragrant tartness as you bite into this chocolate. a refreshing fragrance that you actually taste! A unique chocolate flavour.
Rs. 330/ 60g bar
10/10

JAMUN & ROSEMARY
a monsoon special, this chocolate bar is studded with jamun and a sprig of rosemary. the jamun feels jammy on the palate, and balances out against the dominant flavour tone of the rosemary.
Rs. 330/ 60g bar
9/10

Title: Melt-In-The-Mouth Mylari Dosa | Hotel Original VINAYAKA MYLARI Mysuru | Exclusive Kitchen Tour
Description:
#Dose #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad
Some say it is a sin to visit Mysuru and skip out on eating the famous Mylari Dosa. But what is it about this dish that demands such reverence? Food Lovers pays a visit to Hotel Original Vinayaka Mylari to find out! 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna gets a close look at the making of these soft, melt-in-the-mouth dosas and discovers that they are cooked on a massive iron tawa over a searing hot wood fire! He samples the Idlis here (One of the three items in total on the menu here) and of course, the famous Mylari Masala Dosa. He also ends his meal with a sticky, jammy Kashi Halwa. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Idli 
These woodfire steamed idlis are soft, fluffy, aromatic and slightly tart. saagu is robustly flavoured,  with a coriander accent. the vegetables still have their crunch intact.
9/10
Rs. 30 

Masala dosa  
This dosa is unbelievably soft and fragile. Holds together just enough to contain the vegetable saagu. After the initial crunch, the dosa dissolves in the mouth! The chutney adds a touch of freshness and spice. 
10/10
Rs. 40 

Kashi Halwa 
it's not overly sweet and is cooked down just right to a jammy consistency with an endearing stickiness
8/10
Rs. 25 

Address Tag- Hotel Original Vinayaka Mylari, Shop No, 79, Nazarbad Main Rd, Doora, Mysuru, Karnataka 570010 

Location Tag- https://maps.app.goo.gl/ncGgfiGKARrgGBpcA

Title: PAN ASIAN Lunch At BIG WONG XL | Chinese Dim Sum | Japanese Sushi | Cambodian Lamb Curry | Stir Fry
Description:
#AsianCuisine #LunchInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad
Big Wong XL, a Pan Asian restaurant serving up interesting dimsum and sushi, is just a stone‚Äôs throw away from the Food Lovers office, in 5th Block Koramangala. 

Exuding a laid back vibe, with contemporary decor together with oriental accents, this eatery features an extensive Asian menu, from Indonesian curries to Japanese Ramen Bowls and everything in between!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Ammana decides to check out Big Wong XL for some steamed dim sums, a variety of sushi as well as a couple of appetisers and a recommended Cambodian Style Lamb Curry. 

He books his table using Eatigo, a restaurant booking app now available in Bengaluru, through which he avails of 50% discount on the bill.  To avail of attractive discounts at interesting restaurants, download the Eatigo app at https://bit.ly/343K1XZ

Note: Although we have been invited by Eatigo to use the app in this episode, this is an independent review of the restaurant and its food as in all Gourmet On The Road episodes.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS
RAINBOW SUSHI 
This one‚Äôs a colourful seafood sushi but the pieces topped with tuna is where the flavour is!
7/10
Rs. 650 for 8 pieces.

CALIFORNIA ROLL
the california roll is stuffed with crab stick, avocado, and mayo. the salty pop of the tobiko (flying fish roe) livens up its flavours. eat it with a touch of wasabi!
8/10
Rs. 650 for 8 pieces.

VEG TEMPURA 
well wrapped sushi with the right balance of rice and filling. there‚Äôs a pleasing crunch to the fried vegetable tempura. 
7/10
Rs. 550 for 8 pieces.

ASPARAGUS TEMPURA
with this sushi, you first experience the crunch of the asparagus followed by the creaminess of the mayo. the perfectly seasoned, vinegar rice is the ideal vehicle to carry these flavours and textures. 
8/10
Rs. 550 for 8 pieces.

CRYSTAL VEG DIMSUM
a delightful ‚Äòmoney bag‚Äô dumpling stuffed with peppers and mushrooms. the skin is translucent and skillfully made. definitely a dimsum to try if you like robust, spicy flavours.
7.5/10
Rs 220 for 4 pieces.

VEG THAI HERBS DIMSUM
plump, flavourful dumpling. the filling is soft barring the bite of the water chestnuts. The accompanying chilli peanut sauce provides a spicy kick!
8/10
Rs. 220 for 4 pieces.

CHICKEN CHILLI FLAKE DIMSUM
served with a cheung fun sauce, this dumpling has a filling that does not hold back in its flavours but the wrapper however, feels a little doughy on the palate.
6/10
Rs 290 for 4 pieces.

PAK CHOY WRAPPED CHICKEN DUMPLING
well marinated chicken with great umami flavours and the herbaceous crunch of the wrapper/ pak choy. a delicious dumpling!
8.5/10
Rs 290 for 4 pieces.

THAI STYLE COCONUT PRAWN
there‚Äôs an appetising sweetness from the coconut milk, and a mellow warmth from the spicy chilli glaze. the curry leaves give it an unexpected herbaceous lift. The prawns are cooked perfectly and embrace the unctuous thickness of the sauce!
9/10
380 small/ 650 sharing.

CAMBODIAN STYLE LAMB CURRY WITH JASMINE STICKY RICE 
this delicious curry is fortified with coconut and shrimp paste. the lamb is tender, flavoured with the aromats in the curry.
9/10
Rs 500.

CRISPY SPINACH AND CORN 
the veggies are dusted in cornstarch and flash fried to help retain their crunch. the spinach is left whole as opposed to being shredded, this allows you to still taste its flavour. a simple yet tasty appetiser.
7/10
Rs 220.

ADDRESS Big Wong XL; KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560 095
LOCATION TAG: https://goo.gl/maps/hmbwNq4oydb7Nf9W8

Title: MYSURU‚ÄôS favourite Andhra-Style BIRYANI At HOTEL RRR | Chilli Chicken |Mutton Pepper Fry | Biryani
Description:
#Biryani #MysoreFoodTrail #GourmetOnTheRoad
This biryani establishment has been in existence for 40 odd years and the citizens of Mysuru swear by their biryani! 

Hotel RRR serves up classic Andhra-style fare with a menu that is limited to about 15 items only! They are most popularly known for their biryani and Andhra style starters that do not skimp on flavour. From robust whole spiced preparations, to an almost numbing but heavenly chilli kick to moist, aromatic biryani, this restaurant serves it all!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna starts his meal here with the Chilli Chicken and Mutton Pepper Fry. He also savours both the Chicken and Mutton Biryani here.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Chilli chicken
The chicken is tender and juicy, having soaked up that fiery chilli gravy. A squeeze of lemon helps tone down the spice slightly. 
8.5/10
Rs. 181.

Mutton pepper fry
This masala is well-roasted, with toasty notes of onion and pepper. The meat has its bite intact. there‚Äôs bits of organ meat, and the kidney especially has a nice, briny, meaty flavour that goes well with the masala. 
9/10 
Rs. 190.

Chicken biryani 
Fragrant biryani studded with flecks of tomato and chilli slices. every grain of the basmati rice has soaked in the spice and flavour of the chicken. the slightly tart gravy on the side helps transform the flavours of this mellow biryani.
8.5/10 
Rs. 176.

Mutton biryani
Has similar spicing to the chicken biryani but feels a little more moist thanks to the juices of  the mutton! every bite is flavourful. You can taste the flavour of the tender meat and the fat that has rendered into the rice. 
9.5/10
Rs. 195.
ADDRESS - Hotel RRR, Gandhi Square, Near, Mahatma Gandhi Statue, Lashkar Mohalla, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570 001
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/YevqsyLMv6SUhko79

Title: MYSORE PAK TRAIL IN MYSURU | Guru Sweet Mart | Shree Mahalakshmi Sweets | 5 Varieties Of Mysore Pak
Description:
#IndianSweets #Desserts #GourmetOnTheRoad
No visit to Mysore is complete without tasting the city‚Äôs most popular sweetmeat, the Mysore Pak! This concoction, born in the royal palaces of Mysore, takes only 4 ingredients to make, namely, gram flour, sugar, turmeric, and plenty of ghee! 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna samples various versions of the Mysore Pak across the city. The first Mysore Pak he samples is at Guru Sweet Mart. This sweet shop is run by the fifth generation of the family descended from Kakkasura Madappa, the chef at the royal palace, widely regarded as the inventor of the Mysore Pak. He then moves on to Shree Mahalakshmi Sweets, a sweet shop that specializes in varieties of Mysore Pak. Here he samples the Milk Mysore Pak, the Badam (Almond) Mysore Pak and the Kaju (Cashew) Mysore Pak. 

GURU SWEETS 
Vanaspati Mysore pak
made with vanaspati or vegetable oil. It has a hard, crumbly texture.
7/10
Rs 280/ kg

Special Mysore pak
made with pure ghee. Has a luscious, dissolve-in-the-mouth texture. You can feel the rich ghee coat your palate!
10/10
Rs. 400/ kg

SHREE MAHALAKSHMI SWEETS

Ghee mysore pak
It‚Äôs soft to the touch. Beautiful, luscious melt in the mouth quality! 
9/10
Rs. 483/ kg 

Milk mysore pak
Texture-wise, very similar to the ghee mysore pak. You have the flavour of khova or milk solids running through every bite.
8/10
Rs. 504/Kilo 

Badam mysore pak
You definitely taste the almond. Almost feels like a drier badam halwa. You have the grainy bite from the almonds, but this still is a buttery, luscious mysore pak!
10/10
Rs. 670/Kilo 

Kaju mysore pak
you can taste the slight nuttiness of cashew and slight graininess in texture. This mysore pak has more of a bite. 
9/10
Rs. 650/Kilo 

Vanaspati mysore pak
This mysore pak is hard and crumbly. it doesn't have the richness of the ghee but it certainly has the flavour of the besan and sugar. 
7/10
Rs. 294/Kilo 

GURU SWEETS ADDRESS - Shop No: 1, Devaraja Market Building, Near K.R. Circle, Sayyaji Rao Rd, Devaraja Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001; Location Tag: https://goo.gl/maps/kfv5seio9Tp5YvJb8

SHREE MAHALAKSHMI SWEETS ADDRESS - No 997, Near Chamundipurum Circle, 3rd Main Road, Vidyaranyapuram, Vijayanagar 2nd Stage, Vidyaranyapura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570008; Location Tag: https://goo.gl/maps/izWCtN6BYzvEtLSj8

Title: Traditional GOWDA & MANGALOREAN Cuisine At Bengaluru Oota Company |Kane Fry |Kaima Unde |Badam Halwa
Description:
#HomeDining #Communal #GourmetOnTheRoad
Bengaluru Oota Company is a unique dining experience run by two lady entrepreneurs Divya Prabhakar and Vishal Shetty. Divya is a Gowda, and Vishal is from the Bunt community of Mangalore. They bring together their respective cuisines in a marriage of flavours, represented in their customizable tasting menus. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, we learn how the two women started this enterprise. Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna sits down to sample their menu for the day which includes a Kane Rava Fry, Pelata Gatti (steamed jackfruit dumplings) with Kori Ajadina, a Bannur Mamsa Pulav. He rounds off the meal in true South Indian fashion with curd rice, rasam and a badam halwa. 

KOSAMBARI 
This cucumber based traditional salad has just the right amount of tempering to give it that savoury lift. A great start to a meal here. 
7/10

GARLIC SANDIGE 
scrumptious crunch with a strong garlick-y flavour.
7/10

GOLI BAJJI 
hot and freshly made! crisp, crunchy outside with a yielding inside. Makes for a spirited bite with the coconut chutney, owing to the green chilli heat in the chutney!
7.5/10

KANE RAVA FRY 
this rava-fried kane is just the right size. Ticks the right boxes - the flaky freshness of the fish, well- balanced masala and the perfect semolina crumb. 
9/10

KAIMA UNDE 
soft to the touch and literally melts in your mouth! you don't have to chew on it at all. A tava fried crust yields to the moist coriander flavoured mutton mince on the palate. 
9/10

PELATA GATTI 
similar in texture to an idli but with the mellow sweetness that emanates from flecks of ripe jackfruit. A happy discovery! 
9/10

KORI AJADINA 
the chicken has absorbed the savoury, creamy, coconut-ty flavours of this curry. when eaten with the pelata gatti, it is a divine combination. 
9/10

BANNUR MAMSA PULAV
the rice has all of the flavours of the meat, spices, and herbs, with a subtle citrusy twang. With a bite to it, the meat makes for a happy union with the flavourful rice, the pulav takes a zesty turn when eaten with the piquant pudina chutney. 
8/10

MUNCHI KORI (CHILLI CHICKEN)
served as a side to the pulav here. the chicken is braised in a lovely, savoury, onion masala with mild heat. 
8/10

AVAREKAI PALYA
the vegetable still has its crunch and fibre. the bite of the coconut gives it that added texture.
7/10

RASAM 
tangy rasam that‚Äôs low on spice. 
7/10

MOSARANNA (CURD RICE)
cool and refreshing with the sweet pop of the pomegranate seeds. lightly tempered with that roasted curry leaf flavor. the pineapple in the mensakai made for sweet and sour  combination with the curd rice.
8/10

ANANNAS (PINEAPPLE) MENSAKAI
more sour than spicy, with a mellow heat that stays on the palate. 
8/10

BADAM HALWA
made of almonds, cashew nuts, ghee, and khova this is a decadent, thick halwa. 
8.5/10

FILTER COFFEE
with a top layer of airy froth and deep, strong flavours. this coffee is brewed just right. 
8/10

A meal at bengaluru oota company is priced at Rs 950 upwards.

ADDRESS-Bengaluru Oota Company, 5, Cambridge Cross Road, Cambridge Layout, Jogupalya, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560008
Contact no. 094483 02628
LOCATION TAG- https://maps.app.goo.gl/hEELRpRd79nxk9Ym8

Title: BEST BREAKFAST In Malleshwaram AT VEENA STORES | SOFT FLUFFY IDLI | Chow Chow Bath | Sweet Pongal
Description:
#Idli #Breakfast #GourmetOnTheRoad

This tiny shop in Malleshwaram is popular for their fluffy idlis and crunchy vadas. Originally a condiment store in 1977, Veena stores has amassed a loyal customer base over three decades of service. 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna finds people of all ages, crowding around the tiny store to savour a delicious breakfast from Veena Stores. He samples some of the more popular items on the menu such as the Idli Vada, the Chow Chow Bath and a unique Sweet Pongal. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
IDLI 
the idlis have an inviting fragrance. soft but with just enough texture. the chutney packs a punch with coriander, chilli, and curry leaves. exactly what you need with the soft idlis.  
9/10
Rs 45

VADA
vada is crisp, and crunchy, with a porous inside. very mildly seasoned with tiny flecks of coconut. definitely needs the chutney for that flavour boost.
8/10

KHARA BATH 
soft, creamy, and flavourful, even without the onions and garlic. this khara bath packs all the flavour of the tomatoes, curry leaves, and chillies. its taste lingers on your palate. 
8.5/10

KESARI BATH
the kesari bath itself is not too sweet. the plump raisin gives it a burst of sweetness and the cashews add a toasty flavour!
8/10
Rs 35 for a plate of chow chow bath

KHARA PONGAL
A mellow-tasting pongal made of rice, with a certain creaminess that comes perhaps from lentils. Elevated with the sharp bite of whole peppercorns and the lingering flavour of cumin, and comes alive on the palate with the chutney.
7/10

JAGGERY PONGAL
The jaggery is very evident in this short-grained rice dish, as is the edible camphor that immediately engulfs the palate. A touch of lentils add some creamy graininess to the bite.
8.5/10
Rs 35 for a plate of sweet and khara pongal

COFFEE
the coffee is nice, thick, and strong. always the best end to a tiffin breakfast. 
Rs. 
7/10

ADDRESS- Veena Stores, 183, Margosa Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
080 2334 4838

Title: Tasting & Watching The Making Of Mysuru‚Äôs Most Popular MUTTON PULAV At Hotel Hanumanthu|Mysore Trail
Description:
#MysoreFoodTrail #MuttonPulav #GourmetOnTheRoad

The iconic Hanumanthu Hotel in Mysuru is famous for its mutton pulav that patrons relish from six am each morning! The restaurant, now looked after by the second and third generation, father-son duo of, Parmesh and Vishal  cooks all its food on firewood.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, we get an exclusive insider access to the kitchens of this legendary establishment and a closer look at how their iconic mutton pulav is made. Aside from the generous serving of Mutton Pulav, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna samples some Mutton Boti and a plate of Mutton Chops. 

This restaurant, part of Mysore‚Äôs rich culinary history is a must-visit!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
mutton pulav
the gentle masala spicing makes this a fragrant biryani. perfectly cooked pieces of mutton, with a slight bite. the organ meat and fat of the mutton intensifies the meaty flavours in this biryani. 
10/10
Rs. 200 for full plate. Rs 160 for half a plate.

mutton chops 
The gravy carries the flavour of the fat and meat. This style of preparation highlights the flavour of the meat through and through.
9/10
Rs.120 

mutton boti 
The liver, intestines and other offal meat are flavourful, perfectly tender, not leathery or rubbery! The gravy is thick, almost creamy and unctuous. The masala does not overpower the meat. 
8/10
Rs 120
ADDRESS - Hotel Hanumanthu Original 1930, 1720, Akbar road, Mandi Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001
LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/deBdrPPTQVbHkD4u7

Title: Tasting Muslim-Style MUTTON DUM BIRYANI At Chichaba‚Äôs Taj | Bheja Fry | Barrah Chops | Seekh Kebab
Description:
An offshoot of the restaurant that claims to be the only muslim restaurant in Bangalore to have been around since 1935, Chichaba‚Äôs Taj is known for serving up traditional muslim-style dum biriyani, kebabs and curries

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Ammana visits the crowd favourite at Frazer Town, Bengaluru, to quell his craving for a good biryani, and along the way also tastes some of the highly recommended kebabs, paya and a peppery bheja fry!

MUTTON SEEKH KEBAB
The right proportion of meat to fat makes this succulent kebab. The outer crust envelopes a flavourful mutton mince. This kebab is gentle on the palate despite its fiery red colour. Best eaten hot off the sigri! 
Rs.160.
7/10

MUTTON BHEJA FRY
Its unctuous bite coats the palate with its creamy texture. It's delicious, loaded with pepper, roasted onions, curry leaves and chillies. A must-try here!
Rs. 190
9/10

MUTTON PAYA
The paya or trotter is gelatinous and has rendered well into the aromatic broth. There‚Äôs a mild meatiness to this nourishing soup. 
Rs. 200
8/10

BARRAH CHOPS 
The meat peels away from the bone but still retains its bite. This dish is cooked to textbook perfection with the right amount of spicing that allows the meat to shine through. 
Rs. 400.
9/10

MUTTON DUM BIRYANI
This biriyani is aromatic with smoky undertones and gently spiced with whole spices. The mutton pieces are moist and succulent with pockets of fat! The baigan ka salan accompaniment with its tartness, adds a whole new dimension, making the biryani livelier!
Rs. 260.
8.5/10

CHICKEN DUM BIRYANI
Each grain of rice is separate. It has a nice gentle aroma, a hint of tartness from the tomatoes and fresh flavour of herbs. A mild biriyani that will not necessarily jolt your taste buds.
Rs. 200
7/10

CHICHABAS FRIED CHICKEN
Well marinated, succulent fried chicken that‚Äôs not dry. It has a pleasant spice marinade and gentle flavouring.
Rs. 200
7.5/10

Address - Chichabas Taj; 50, Madhavaraya Mudaliar Road, Frazer Town, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560005; 
Location- https://goo.gl/maps/cdMGLk1GaGQbT1xc6

Title: SOFTEST Idlis & Crunchiest VADAS at Brahmins‚Äô Coffee Bar|Delicious South Indian Breakfast |Bengaluru
Description:
#Breakfast #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad
This pillar in Bengaluru‚Äôs culinary landscape has always had only four items on its menu! For 5 decades Brahmin‚Äôs Coffee Bar has been serving up the softest idlis, crunchy vadas, and of course, thick, strong coffee in South Bengaluru. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna visits the famous coffee bar and samples everything on the menu (all four items that is), which consists of the Idli Vada, the Khara Bath, and the Kesari Bath. He also learns of the history of the restaurant and why this family-run establishment has resolved to stick to the only four-item menu they started with.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

Idli and Vada 
the idli is unbelievably soft, pillowy, and melts in your mouth with no effort! this is in contrast to the perfect crunch of the vada. the inside of the vada is almost cloud-like, speckled with slivers of coconut, chillies, and curry leaves. the chutney is spicy and slightly minty. this dish, especially the idli is a revelation! 
Rs 16 for one Idli
Rs 23 for one Vada
10/10

Khara Bath
this khara bath literally melts in your mouth. it is studded with all sorts of aromatics, fried lentils, carrots and peas for texture. with the signature chutney, this dish is divine! 
Rs 23.1
8/10

Kesari Bath
laden with ghee, raisins, nuts, and pineapple, and studded with cloves. the sweetness balanced with the acidity of the pineapple and the toasty notes of the cashew. the astringent flavours of the clove readies your palate for the next bite. every bite is delightful.
Rs 23.
9/10

Coffee
a coffee, nice, strong and thick coffee. just the way it should be!
Rs 16.
9/10

ADDRESS- Brahmin‚Äôs Coffee Bar, Near Shankar Mutt, Ranga Rao Rd, Shankarapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004
LOCATION- https://goo.gl/maps/gNrD64hvrJk3SiPZ9

Title: KOSHY‚ÄôS BEST BREAKFAST DISHES| Mutton Cutlet, Appam Stew, English Brekkie... Exclusive KITCHEN TOUR
Description:
#Breakfast #KoshysParadeCafe #GourmetOnTheRoad
 Koshy‚Äôs is a landmark establishment in Bengaluru that has been around since the 1950s, popular for its old world charm and vintage decor. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor Kripal Amanna, meets with Mr. Prem Koshy, third generation co-owner of this hallowed institution to discover its surprisingly humble origins. 

He savours some of the most popular breakfast items from their expansive menu, including the homemade Baked Beans on Toast, Chicken Liver on Toast, Club Sandwich and of course, their signature Appam and Stew, a signature dish that is served only on Sunday!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD 
BAKED BEANS ON TOAST
Homemade baked beans generously slathered on a thick slice of Koshy‚Äôs bread. The earthy flavours of the beans and tangy tomato, make this dish very comforting. 
Rs. 130
7/10

MUSHROOM ON TOAST
A simple dish of mushrooms sauteed in some garlic and pepper, spread over buttered toast. The earthiness of the mushroom is what‚Äôs most prominent. A must-try for every mushroom lover. 
Rs. 130
7.5/10

TOMATO AND CHEESE ON TOAST
A beautiful plate popping with contrasting colours of the sauteed tomatoes and cheese. The jammy flavours of the tomatoes are delicious. Acidic and salty flavours, yum!
Rs. 130
8/10

VEGETABLE CUTLET
An old fashioned cutlet made from a medley of veggies, peas, carrots and potatoes, spiced delicately. There's a certain creaminess that takes over the palate.
Rs. 75
8/10

MUTTON CUTLET 
Hot and crisp to the touch. A delicious mutton cutlet, the crumbed exterior holds that flavourful spiced mutton mince. A textbook mutton cutlet. Old fashioned, like mum would make.
Rs.100
9/10
 
MR. K's BIG EASY ENGLISH BREAKFAST
Tawa toast slathered with baked beans and fried sunny side up eggs, crisp, plump pork sausage, fries, and a side of veggies. Layered with flavours, this is definitely an indulgent breakfast. 
Rs. 450 
7.5/10

SPANISH OMELETTE.
This old-fashioned omelette is a big, protein-packed meal in itself, especially with the fries. This is a loaded omelette. It's cheesy; it has the meaty bite of the chicken, a salty hit from the bacon, and a crunch from the peppers.
Rs.300
9/10

MR K'S GINGER FRUIT PUNCH
You can taste an assortment of fruits like papaya, apple, banana, and grape. You get the mellow spike of ginger and its wellness boost. Quite a filling drink. 
Rs. 75
8/10

CHICKEN LIVER TOAST 
A must-try dish for liver lovers! There‚Äôs very little that gets in the way of the rich deep flavour of the liver. The peppers pick up the flavour. The thick soft bread has absorbed liver gravy.
Rs.130
9/10

CLUB SANDWICH
Fried egg, slice of ham. roast lamb, chicken, tomatoes, onions, and some lettuce all encased in that soft bread from Koshy's bakery. You get the flavour of the roast meat, the pungent bite of onions. There‚Äôs the creaminess of the egg enveloping it. 
Rs. 190
8.5/10


APPAM AND MUTTON STEW 
Traditionally only served on a Sunday. The mellow, creamy coconut milk has a hint of whole spices. The meat has soaked in the flavours of the stew but the flavour of the meat itself shines through. 
Rs.170
10/10

COFFEE
Nice and strong with a robust hit. Just the thing you need to pick you up after a big heavy breakfast here.
Rs. 39
8/10 

ADDRESS- Koshy‚Äôs Parade Cafe, No. 39, St Marks Road, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001
LOCATION TAG- https://goo.gl/maps/N8rjbD3qRNwwdu8x8

Title: Mumbai Vada Pav & Maharashtrian Street Food In Namma Bengaluru |Rajvardhan Foods |Dabeli |Misal Pav
Description:
#StreetFood #MumbaiStreetFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

Nothing quite like Maharashtrian street fare and Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna who spent his early in the city of Mumbai absolutely agrees!

In this Gourmet On The Road episode, he visits Rajvardhan Foods, to take a trip back to Mumbai, tasting an authentic Vada Pav, spicy Misal Pav, Poori Bhaji with some lusciously thick shrikhand and some upvaas chi faraal or fasting foods such as Thalipeeth and Sabudana Vada. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

VADA PAV
The pav is perfect in its taste and texture. the plump batata vada, with a thin casing is stuffed with an appetising potato mix. The garlic chutney and customary fried chilli makes every bite an explosion of flavours! 
Rs 35
8.5/10

KUTCHI DABELI 
a riot of flavours and textures. sweet, spicy, tangy potato patty, topped with the crunch of peanuts and fruity pop of the pomegranate seeds. the pav is toasted to perfect scrumptiousness. the fried sev adds another layer of texture. 
Rs 50
7/10

KANDA POHA
maharashtrian breakfast special made with beaten rice. tempered with onions, mustard, chilli, peanuts and topped with generous amounts of sev. a very simple flavoured dish that needs that twist of lemon to amp up flavours. the thick, slightly sweet yoghurt with the poha is delicious! 
Rs 65
7/10

SHRIKHAND POORI BHAJI 
fluffy pooris but the bhaji is a little low on flavour. best way to savour this is with the lusciously thick, sweet, cardamom flavoured shrikhand.
Rs 115
7/10

KOLHAPURI MISAL PAV
spicy rassa cooked with moth beans and topped with crunchy sev and mixture. a hearty dish to be enjoyed with the pav. the lemon helps tone down the heat. 
Rs 90
7.5/10

SABUDANA KHICHDI
a wholesome dish prepared with minimal fuss. Simply seasoned with flecks of chilli and ajwain seeds.
Rs 90
8/10

SABUDANA VADA
crunchy outside and soft inside. generous flecks of green chilli. minimally seasoned. enjoy this with mint chutney.
Rs 55
8.5/10

ONION THALIPEETH
the almost burnt onions gives this filling pancakes a strong onion-y flavour and bite. 
Rs 90
7/10

UPVAAS THAALIPEETH
made with tapioca flour and rajgira this is a high on nutrition pancake. it‚Äôs slightly dry. the butter and the sweet and bitter lemon pickle helps add flavour to this fasting snack.
Rs 95
6.5/10

CHAAS/ MASALA BUTTERMILK
just the drink you need to help you settle your stomach after eating all the spicy street fare served here!
Rs 25
6/10

ADDRESS - 1291, 25th Main Rd, Putlanpalya, Jayanagara 9th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560069

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/Q7XjR5wdmMGNsUas8

Title: Epic Bangalore DOSA TRAIL Part 2 |CTR |Hanchina Mane|Airlines|Umesh Dosa|Chikkanna Tiffin|99 Variety
Description:
#Dosas #BangaloreFoodTour #GourmetOnTheRoad 

In this exciting Gourmet On The Road episode, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna takes off on a trip across Namma Bengaluru exploring the city‚Äôs most popular dosa destinations!

The second and final part to this dosa trail begins at Shri Sagar - CTR, an establishment with legions of loyal fans. Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna tastes a Benne Masala Dose and the Set Dosa here. He then relishes a unique dill flavoured dosa at a streetside dosa haunt in the bylanes of Basavanagudi. He then tastes a smashing Podi Dosa at Umesh Dosa Point, and a Bath Masala and Khaali Dosa at Chikkanna Tiffin Room located in the narrow bylanes of Cubbonpet.

He finally rounds off this dosa trail in the evening with the famous Pav Bhaji Dosa at Shree Balaji 99 Variety Dosa. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

CENTRAL TIFFIN ROOM 
BENNE MASALA DOSA 
Love the texture of this thick yet crisp dosa roasted with oodles of ghee. it takes skill to roast a dosa like this. the chutney is fresh while the ghatti chutney is nice and spicy.
Rs 52.
10/10

SET DOSA
Fluffy yet crisp set dosa. the saagu here is unlike any other loaded with a bunch of seasonal veggies. An absolute find here!
Rs 47.
9/10

GOLI BAJJI 
The ultimate tea or coffee time snack! crisp and stretchy outside, soft and porous inside.
Rs 32.
9/10
7th Cross Rd, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003
080 2331 7531
https://maps.app.goo.gl/hdJWku2LcF4TGLcBA

HANCHINA MANE 
SABAKKI DOSA 
An aromatic dosa, made with a batter infused with dill. very different in flavour. The freshness of the dill takes over the palate.
Rs 20.
6/10
Netkalappa Circle
Subram Chetty Rd, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004
https://maps.app.goo.gl/2AR4518mGf72T7RDA

AIRLINES HOTEL 
BUTTER MASALA DOSA 
Crisp buttery dosa, stuffed with loads of potato. dining here is more about the experience than it is about the actual dosa.
Rs 120.
7/10
No 4, State Bank of India Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001
080 2227 3783
https://maps.app.goo.gl/qS8RE3mKTaqKQFwM7

UMESH DOSA POINT
PODI PLAIN DOSA 
Smeared with a homemade podi, made of gram flour, spices, and jaggery. love this dosa it‚Äôs got the sweet, spice and the crunch! Perfect balance of flavours. Certainly a discovery for me.
Rs 65.
9/10
21, 1st Main Rd, 4th Block, Kumara Park West, Seshadripuram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560020
098454 15768
https://maps.google.com/?cid=12853698143630628717

CHIKKANNA TIFFIN ROOM
KHAALI DOSA
Order this with the extra ghee. the dosa just by itself is absolutely dry. You need to mix the chutney, aloo gadde palya and the tuppa to enjoy this dosa melt in your mouth.
Rs 54.
8/10

BATH MASALA DOSA
Plain dosa topped with ghee, pulao, chutney, palya and ghee. a loaded dosa! Personally a little too much for me. But if you're looking for something filling this is your dosa. 
Rs 70.
7/10
#32, 30th Cross Rd, Kanchan Nagar, Cubbonpete, Nagarathpete, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560002
098459 17991
https://maps.app.goo.gl/NoVFKn28eRSzFfM38

SHREE BALAJI 99 VARIETY DOSA
PAV BHAJI DOSA
This dosa is where the story of the 99 variety dosa began. bite into this and you could well be biting into a pav bhaji. A chatpata, butter laden, spicy dosa for the adventurous. 
Rs 60.
7/10

DIL KHUSH DOSA
Loaded with cabbage, spring onions, paneer and schezwan chutney. you taste all the salty cheese and then you taste the schezwan chutney. a whole new concept on dosa, a tasty one but not for the purist. 
Rs 120.
5/10
Police Station Road, Koramangala 5th Block, Near Ganesh Temple and Opposite Bajaj Storeroom, Bangalore 560 034; tel 81470 48251
https://goo.gl/maps/j6eNMDScDi2i3wub9

Gourmet On The Road Dosa Trail In Bangalore Part 1: https://youtu.be/GN1g70_pbUk

Title: Epic Bangalore DOSA TRAIL Part 1 |MTR |Janatha| NMH |Vidyarthi Bhavan |Davangere Benne |Taaza Thindi
Description:
#Dosas #BangaloreFoodTour #GourmetOnTheRoad 

In this exciting Gourmet On The Road episode, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna explores Namma Bengaluru's most popular dosa destinations!

In part one of this two part episode, he begins his trail at Mavalli Tiffin Rooms or MTR tasting a plain dosa and a masala dosa. He then visits Hotel Janatha and New Modern Hotel in South Bangalore for ragi and rava dosas.

Vidyarthi Bhavan had to be part of this list, together with smaller eateries such as Davanagere Benne Dosa and the crowd favourite Taaza Thindi!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
MASALA DOSA - MTR
the quintessential triangular MTR masala dose served with a tuppa da batlu. Perfectly roasted crust that glistens, stuffed tempered mashed potatoes with a side of thick, spicy chutney.
this dosa is a ritual for many here and when you taste it you certainly understand why!
Rs 86.
10/10

PLAIN DOSA - MTR
this dose has a spicy green chutney smeared inside for that flavour burst in every bite. a simple dose done well. 
Rs 81.
8/10
MTR
#14, Lal Bagh Main Rd, Doddamavalli, Sudhama Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027
080 2222 0022
https://maps.app.goo.gl/JfzrF2A9ypAUQCzr9

HOTEL JANATHA 
KHAALI DOSA - HOTEL JANATHA
called ‚Äòkhaali‚Äô or ‚Äòempty‚Äô this dosa is served simply, with chutney on the side. the dosas are light and fluffy but definitely need the chutney to perk up its flavours. 
Rs 30.
6/10

RAVA DOSA - HOTEL JANATHA
a paper thin rava or semolina dosa studded with flecks of onion. a really tasty dosa. the saagu makes for the right accompaniment but this dosa doesn't need one! 
Rs 40.
8/10
Hotel Janatha
Plot No.26, Diagonal Road, Sajjan Rao Cir, Parvathipuram, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560026

NEW MODERN HOTEL 
GHEE MASALA DOSA 
crisp thin dosa with a very inviting lustre. you can taste the ghee in this one. The aloogadde palya is soft and mellow. the chutney and slightly sweet sambar with the dosa is a great combination.
Rs 50.
8/10

RAGI DOSA
this dosa looks wholesome. can feel the weight of the ragi as you tear into it. the saagu, a medley of veggies with a tangy taste brings this slightly dry dosa to life.
Rs 20.
8/10
New Modern Hotel
143, Dr.A.N. Krishna Rao Road, Near Minerva circle, Vishweshwarapuram, Parvathipuram, Vishweshwarapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004
080 2661 2625
https://maps.app.goo.gl/BgtqRBnPXYLDp6Hr5

VIDYARTHI BHAVAN
SAAGU MASALA DOSA
this dosa is roasted perfectly with a crackly exterior and a soft interior. that slight tartness of the batter is present in every bite. the delicious saagu is a wholesome change from the typical potato stuffing. 
Rs 50.
9/10

MASALA DOSA 
a traditional masala dosa in every sense, served with chutney. the dosa is roasted to a nice deep brown crisp around the edges, yet soft and fluffy within. The flavourful potato palya is gently tempered.
Rs 46.
10/10
Vidyarthi Bhavan, 32, Gandhi Bazaar Main Road, Basavanagudi, Bangalore 560 004; tel +91 080 2667 7588 https://goo.gl/maps/nFsBwv9yM6DoRwL69

DAVANGERE BENNE DOSA
BENNE DOSA 
this dosa makes you salivate. so buttery! the minimum seasoning in the white potato stuffing helps the buttery notes shine even further. a coarsely ground coconut chutney with flecks of chilli packs a fiery punch. 
Rs 40.
9/10
Davangere Benne Dose Hotel
13, 32nd E Cross Road, 4th Block, Jayanagar, 4th T Block East, KV Layout, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560011

TAAZA THINDI
MASALA DOSA
light gold crust, with a soft potato mash stuffing. the batter is a little short on salt but the perfectly tempered chutney more than makes up for this. at Rs 25 this one‚Äôs a steal!
Rs 25.
7/10
Taaza Thindi
1004, 26th Main Rd, 4th T Block East, Jayanagara 9th Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560041
https://maps.google.com/?cid=6433592298080048138

Title: Easy Recipe For A Finger Licking Spanish Chicken Appetiser | Chicken Al Ajillo | Simple Recipes
Description:
#Chicken #Recipes #FoodLoversRecipes 

With only a handful of ingredients, you can make this richly flavored Spanish garlic chicken dish.

It‚Äôs called pollo al ajillo in Spanish which literally translates to chicken with garlic. That should give you an idea about how much garlic goes into the dish. If you‚Äôre going to be shy about using garlic, you won‚Äôt get the maximum flavor that makes pollo al ajillo so tasty.

Title: MANGALORE FOOD TRAIL Part 2 |Bunder |Giri Manja‚Äôs |Narayana‚Äôs |Rooster Masalas |The Balli Shop
Description:
#MustVisits #MangaloreFoodTour #GourmetOnTheRoad

Abounding in eateries that dish out delicious vegetarian fare, freshest of seafood, traditional meaty preparations and more, Mangalore leaves one spoilt for choice! We round up top restaurants and spots to dine at when in this port city. 

The second and final part to this food trail starts off in the wee hours of the morning as Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna explores Bunder, the largest seafood market in the city. He then samples some delicious fish fries at Giri Manja‚Äôs and Narayana‚Äôs. Following this, he visits the home of a couple that runs Rooster‚Äôs. A small scale business selling homemade ground masalas. The evening ends at Halli Mane Rotties and concludes with an exciting street food trail across the city.

Chef Nimisha Verghese, demonstrates Meen Moilee, a delicate preparation of fish in coconut milk, flavoured with green chilli, curry leaves and turmeric, typical to Kerala.

This curry can be enjoyed with a side of steamed rice. Make your own today!

Title: Mangalore‚Äôs Best | Food Trail Pt 1 |Shetty Lunch Home|Taj Mahal |Janatha Deluxe| Marybai‚Äôs|Pabba‚Äôs
Description:
#MustVisits #MangaloreFoodTour #GourmetOnTheRoad

Abounding in eateries that dish out delicious vegetarian fare, freshest of seafood, traditional meaty preparations and more, Mangalore leaves one spoilt for choice! We round up top restaurants and spots to dine at when in this port city.

In episode one of this two part series, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna begins with breakfast 96-year-old Hotel Taj Mahal and Hotel Janatha Deluxe, a spot popular with the masses. Shetty Lunch Home, a must-visit seafood restaurant is next on the list, followed by a home cooked meal at Marybai‚Äôs.

He then ends, this episode on a sweet note indulging in some delicious ice creams at Pabba‚Äôs!

Title: BIG FAT MEDDITERANEAN Lunch At Fava Bistro | Salads | Mezze | Burgers |Peri Peri Chicken |Bangalore
Description:
#Lunch #Mezze #GourmetOnTheRoad
Fava Bistro, a laidback Mediterranean restaurant in the suburb of Koramangla is Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna‚Äôs go-to spot for lunch, on the rare work day that he is not shooting or producing a Gourmet On The Road segment. 

Unfortunately, however, Fava Bistro is set to soon close doors. In this episode, he shares a final lunch at the bistro, tasting dishes he would typically order including a selection of mezzes, a filling wrap, a faultless burger, and a fruity salad!

He also briefly touches upon the challenges involved in running a restaurant.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Organic chickpea hummus
Spiced with paprika, light and creamy. the tahini or sesame paste balances the prominent chickpea flavour. the pita with hummus makes for a great bite. 
Rs 200
8/10

Multigrain fava bistro hamburger with grilled bacon 
A loaded burger that you should dig into when you're really hungry.  multigrain bun, juicy patty, bacon, gherkins, coleslaw, caramelized onions and salty cheddar make this a super delicious burger! can't fault this one!
Rs 395
10/10

Mango caesar salad 
Dressed just enough enough to moisten the salad and your palate. the mango, the Mallika mango in this case  is nice and sweet. eating this salad will not leave you feeling guilty!
Rs 295
8/10

Lamb kebab and avocado wrap
The weight of the wrap gets your palate going. a wholesome, whole wheat wrap loaded with hummus, labneh and avocado salsa. the lamb is spiced just right. 
Rs 375
8/10

Peri peri grill chicken 
A flavourful dish that will fill you up yet leave you feeling light. The chicken is juicy and the spice of the peri peri marinade asserts itself in every bite. the sweetness of the barbecue sauce keeps the chilli heat down.
Rs 375
9/10

Labneh with spinach 
You can taste the perfect balance of sour and a hint of sweet from the honey in the this yoghurt mezze. the wilted garlic seasoned spinach provides a slightly bitter edge making it a great amalgam of flavours!
Rs 300
10/10

Fava Bistro, No.8 Jailakshmi Nivas, 1st Cross Rd, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095; tel: +91 077600 18751

Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/LFd5HgUE37J76oPn8

Title: The Perfect South Indian Breakfast At VIDYARTHI BHAVAN | Bengaluru‚Äôs Iconic MASALA DOSA & TIFFIN
Description:
#Breakfast #RestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Bringing its patrons exceptional benne masala dosa, soaked in ghee, heavenly kesari bhath and filter coffee since 1943, Vidyarthi Bhavan is a landmark in Bangalore that is simple yet inviting.¬†

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this highly endorsed eatery. He converses with third generation owner Arun Adiga, understanding what keeps patrons coming back. He also relishes a full breakfast of all the items on the menu, tasting from the iconic dosas to poori saagu and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Idli Vada
A delightful plate of pillowy soft idlis and traditional uddina vada bathed in a tasty, hot sambar. The chutney, although a little runny, is enhanced with a punch of spice and a delicious tempering.¬†
Rs 14 for one Idli and Rs 26 for vada.
8/10

Poori Saagu
This poori saagu is a humble yet delicious dish at VB. A medley of beans, carrots, brinjal, and sweet pumpkin all harmoniously brought together. The pooris are light and fluffy as you would expect. The chutney adds a flavorful punch.¬†
Rs 36.
8/10

Khara bath
Spicy and savoury, this semolina concoction with veggies like carrots, onions and the simple tempering has a pleasing texture. A dish that needs no accompaniment.
Rs 26.
8/10

Kesari Bath
This bath is laden with copious amounts of ghee, and tiny morsels of pineapple to give it that sweet, tart flavor. The intense flavour of clove cuts through the richness, making this an irresistible bite.¬†
Rs 26.
8/10

Saagu masala dosa
This dosa is roasted perfectly with a crackly exterior and a soft interior. That slight tartness of the batter is present in every bite. The delicious saagu is a wholesome change from the typical potato stuffing.¬†
Rs 50.
9/10

Masala dosa
A traditional masala dosa in every sense, served with chutney. The dosa is roasted to a nice deep brown crisp around the edges, yet soft and fluffy within. The flavourful potato palya is gently tempered.
Rs 46.
10/10

Filter coffee
Strong, robust coffee topped with a frothy cream. Pull your coffee to cool it down and end your meal in an authentic way.¬†
Rs 16.
9/10

Vidyarthi Bhavan, 32, Gandhi Bazaar Main Road, Basavanagudi, Bangalore 560 004; tel +91 080 2667 7588
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/nFsBwv9yM6DoRwL69

Title: Non Vegetarian FEAST At RANGANNA MILITARY HOTEL|Famous Mutton Pulao, Kheema Gojju, Mudde |Bangalore
Description:
#MilitaryHotel #RestaurantsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad


Drop in at Ranganna Military Hotel for breakfast, lunch or dinner to chow down on rustic meaty dishes full of flavour. 


Established way back in 1964, this eatery swears by its food and so do its patrons. Presently run by a husband-wife duo and their sons, the USP of the restaurant lies in the functioning of its kitchen. 


In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the 60-year-old establishment to explore its kitchen with third generation Co-owner, Sendil Kumar. He discovers that the prep here begins as early as 7am, and every dish is prepared using secret recipes and local ingredients!

He also relishes a meaty spread for lunch, tasting from a hearty mutton leg broth, to steaming hot mutton pulao, kheema gojju, ragi mudde and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Bannur Mutton chops
Mutton has a decent amount of bite. Most of the fat from the meat has rendered into the gravy enhancing the meaty flavours of this dish.
Rs 150
9/10

Bangude fry
Love the masala coating on this deep fried mackerel! The crunch, spice from the batter and prominent fish flavours make this a tasty fish fry!
Rs 150
8/10

Mutton head
a strong, deep flavoured dish, definitely for a hardcore carnivore to savour! Not my cup of tea though. 
Rs 125
7/10

Chicken leg masala
spicy leg of chicken cooked with the skin on. The gravy is robust and rich and the meat is cooked right down to the bone yet juicy!
Rs 80
9/10

Raagi mudde and saaru
Wholesome, filling mudde served with a spicy saaru or meat gravy.
Rs 36
7/10

Goat leg soup
A hearty broth that can make a sick man walk! Mellow in flavours, one can taste the intense flavours of the bones that‚Äôs extracted into the broth.
Rs 150
8/10

mutton pulao 
An aromatic pulao, where the meat is cooked with the short grain jeeraga samba rice. The rice is intense in its meaty flavour and studded with flecks of coriander and chilli. 
Rs 190
9/10

Mutton Kheema Gojju
Coarse mince, with flecks of fat, fresh peas and coriander. the kheema is coarsely ground, soaking up the masala. the peas pop in the mouth and the fat adds a burst of savouriness.
10/10
Rs 130

Kheema unde 
Very different from the gojju, the meat here is more finely ground and comes together as a ball or unde. The springy texture gives this meatball a chewy bite. The gravy, is lighter, with flavours of coriander. 
Rs 190
7/10

ADDRESS - Ranganna Military Hotel, New 61, 1st floor, opp to Indian oil petroleum, Krishna Rajendra Road, 7th Block, Jayanagar, Bangalore 560 070; tel +91 80 4302 7346


LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/DLEdQ8Y4fKB6zYzq7

Title: Make This Delicious Restaurant Style PRAWN GHEE ROAST | Easy Step-By-Step Recipe | Seafood Recipes
Description:
#Prawns #FoodLoversTV #Recipes
The Mangalorean prawn ghee roast is piquant and indulgent at the same time, thanks to a host of spices and copious amounts of clarified butter.

A divine dish, thanks to oodles of ghee and a robust base masala made from a host of spices, the prawn ghee roast originated and is a well-known favourite in the Southern state of Mangalore.
 
With this easy, step-by-step recipe you can make your own at home.

Title: Eating An Enormous Breakfast At HOLE IN THE WALL CAF√â|Bangalore‚Äôs MOST Popular Eggs Breakfast Spot!
Description:
#AllDayBreakFast #Cafes #GourmetOnTheRoad

Popularly known for its breakfast options, mouthwatering egg creations (an omelette pizza too!), fluffy pancakes, loaded burgers and loaded toasts, The Hole In The Wall Caf√© is perfect for lazy mornings and mid day brunches when in the city of Bengaluru!

In this episode of Hole In The Wall, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna meets proud owner, Nathan Harris, and shares  exclusive details on how the caf√©  actually started out as a literal ‚Äúhole in the wall‚Äù.
 
He also tucks into a large breakfast spread, tasting everything from a scrumptious English Breakfast, perfectly cooked Skillet Eggs, an all-time favourite Chicken Liver on Toast and sweet decadent waffles and pancakes!
  
The Hole In The Wall Caf√©, No 4, 8th Main Road, Koramangala 4th Block, Koramangala, Bangalore 560 047; tel + 91 80 4094 9490

LOCATION TAG - https://g.page/THITWC?share


GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

English breakfast
a hearty breakfast platter of eggs, juicy bacon, cooked just right and juicy, crunchy bacon! Not a big fan of the texture and flavour of the chicken sausage, the mash however, was seasoned well. 
Rs 320
8/10

Skillet eggs with chicken pepperoni and cheese
perfectly cooked eggs with the yolk still runny, savoury chicken pepperoni and slivers of chilli make for a creamy, meaty, spicy mouthful. easy to miss out on the flavour of the cheese, so make sure to order with extra cheese!
Rs 175
7/10

Meaty beef cheeseburger 
the juicy tenderloin patty, topped with fried egg, lettuce, tomato and cheese makes this a rustic burger that will leave you satisfied! The crumbly bun however,struggles to hold the burger together.
Rs 265
8/10

Chicken Liver On Toast
Love the savoury, deep flavour of the liver and its soft yielding texture. Cooked simply with lightly caramelised onions this is a dish every liver lover must try!
Rs 170
9/10

Veggie pizza Omelette
An interesting discovery, this pizza with an ‚Äòeggy‚Äô twist is tangy, savoury and has a nice crunch, thanks to the veggies. Order this dish when out with a bunch of friends.
Rs 165
7/10

Guava Juice
Surprisingly available all year round here, this pink guava juice is nourishingly tasty. The grainy texture of the guava is a great indicator of its freshness! 
Rs 75
8/10

Triple Chocolate pancakes
Chocolate nirvana! The chocolate pancakes, chocolate sauce and chocolate shavings ensure that every bite is decadent and super chocolatey!
Rs 220
8/10

Apple pie waffles
Two thick slices of perfectly cooked waffle topped with caramelised, cinnamon apples, caramel sauce and ice cream. The doughy texture of the waffle makes you want to keep eating! Look out for the slightly burnt edges, they are the best bits!
Rs 240
9/10

Title: Tasting The Sula Chenin Blanc Reserve 2017 From Nashik, Maharashtra |Indian Wines |Food & Wine
Description:
#SulaWines #PairingFoodWithWines #The3MinuteWineReview

In this episode of The 3-Minute Wine Review, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna explores an aromatic and medium-bodied Chenin Blanc Reserve from Sula Vineyards, speaking of how this wine pairs with a variety of food.

Aged in French oak barrels, the grapes for the Sula Chenin Blanc Reserve, 2017 come from select plots of the winemaker‚Äôs Dindori Estate, in Nashik, Maharashtra. 

The wine is pale yellow with hints of green, and has an inviting nose boasting of fruity aromas. Its subdued sweetness, well balanced acidity and lingering finish make it a very drinkable wine that is also a great companion to food, especially strong Asian flavours!

Watch this quick review for an in-depth analysis on the wine and its food pairings.

Title: Exploring Authentic Tamil-Brahmin Vegetarian Banana Leaf Meal At Iyer Mess In Bengaluru|Malleshwaram
Description:
#SouthIndianMeals #Bangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Serving authentic Tamil-Brahmin style meals for close to 60 years now, Iyer Mess is a go-to spot for lunch at Malleshwaram, Bengaluru. 

Founded in 1959, the mess is located in the home of owners, Venkatesh and Kamala Iyer.

The couple who have carried forward the tradition of serving homestyle vegetarian fare, use recipes handed down by Mr Iyer‚Äôs father to maintain taste and style of cooking.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the well-known mess to explore its kitchen and taste the ‚Äòveg homely meal‚Äô.

The kitchen starts as early as 5:00 am every morning, preparing a standard banana leaf meal, comprising of Rice, Sambar, Rasam, Poriyal, Kootu, Pickle, Yoghurt, Vada and Appalam. On Sundays the menu features a special additions of Payasam and Mor Kuzambu.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Rs 70 for a vegetarian meal

Kose/ Cabbage Poriyal
A fresh, crunchy medley of cabbage and flecks of coconut, simply seasoned with mustard. 8/10


Kumbalakai/ Sweet Pumpkin Kootu
A mildly tempered, delicious preparation. Can taste the sweetness of the pumpkin, a tasty combination with the chapati.
9/10

Paruppu Vada
deep fried yet wholesome because of the lentil or paruppu in the vada. Flecks of onion impart hints of sweetness and the green chillies give it that spicy kick.
8/10


Chapati
Soft and light, a homestyle chapati.
7/10

Thayir Sadam/Curd Rice
thick and creamy, homemade curd. the milk for the curd is cooked on a coal stove!
9/10

Pickle
Spicy, bitter accompaniment called oorukka in Tamil.
7/10

Moolangi/ Radish Sambar
Big in flavour, the spicy, fiery kick from the chilli is very prominent in this sambar. The radish is cooked just right!
10/10

Rasam
a bit mellow. not as robustly flavoured as one would expect.
6/10

Appalam
Crunchy, deep fried, perfect when eaten with rice and rasam or sambar.
8/10

ADDRESS - Iyer Mess, No 4/3, West Park Road Between 7th and 8th Cross, Malleshwaram West, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003; tel: 098860 78290

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/JLGgTcL8MC5Pfs7L9

Title: Tasting the BEST Chicken and Mutton BIRYANI In Vellore! Making of Famous JOTHIE BIRIYANI
Description:
#Biryani #BiryaniInIndia #GourmetOnTheRoad

Gorge on mouthwatering biryani at Jothie Biriyani in Vellore, a 37-year-old establishment that has stood the test of time in the city.

This humble eatery has held onto a traditional recipe and way of making, for nearly four decades. Skilled cooks recreate this recipe by layering meat, rice and a rich, flavourful stock to make some of the most deliciously moist biryani. 

Large deghs fired using tamarind wood charcoal are used to make batches of Mutton and Chicken biryani at different times in day.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the kitchen to understand what goes into making this extraordinary dish!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Mutton biryani
Fingerlicking rice! taste it just by itself and you are hit with a savoury kick of the meat that gets to your palate. the meat makes its presence felt even without it being your mouth! such a find. 
Rs 120
10/10

Chicken biryani 
Mildly coloured rice, flavours of the stock layered into it while cooking takes over the palate! flavours of the chicken biryani is in the rice and not the meat. just eat the rice to be totally happy and totally satisfied! the enne katrikai has a crunch, ¬†sour edge, but this biryani rice needs no accompaniment. not even the meat! it's moist light leaving you wanting another bite. 
Rs 100
10/10

Chicken varuval
An appetising preparation. flavoured with onion, tomato also the curry leaf.skin on the chicken also gives it that flavour burst. 
Rs 90.
6/10

ADDRESS - Jothie Biriyani, CMC Hospital, 65, Bangalore Road, Near Old Bus Stand , Near, Balaji Nagar, Vellore, Tamil Nadu 632004; 098846 42297

LOCATION TAG https://maps.app.goo.gl/P6nsuk2JZUWM7vms9

Title: The Perfect FAMILY BREAKFAST Stop | Sai Sangeet, Vaniyambadi | South Indian VEGETARIAN | TamilNadu
Description:
#Breakfast #HighwayFoodSpots #GourmetOnTheRoad

Sai Sangeet located between Vaniyambadi - Ambur NH 48, On Bangalore-Chennai highway is a delightful spot to stop over for breakfast!

More than any typical highway eatery, this restaurant has an interesting store out front that sells everything from windchimes, to clay pots and pans and also has animals and birds for entertainment!

The fare here is South Indian, with typical, Tamil Nadu breakfast dishes such as the podi uthappam, idli vada and ragi poori. 

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna relishes some delicious highly recommended.
 breakfast staples in this episode of Gourmet On The Road also sharing a quick review on each dish!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

Idli & chutneys

light and fluffy idli with a perfect wobble. a beautiful combination with the sweetness of coconut chutney. The podi with idli hits you right in the throat!
Rs 25.
8/10

Vada & chutneys
Nourishing vada with the bite of the lentil intact. vada is crisp, studded with onions chillies and peppercorns. crunchy on the outside, soft and coarse within. a seriously delicious vada!  
Rs 35.
10/10

Ragi poori
only place where I've tasted a ragi poori. can feel the weight and the bite of the ragi millet. filling and nourishing, two of these with some lightly spiced sagu and chutney and you're good to go!
Rs 65.
7/10

Podi uthappam
a specialty here. podi is completely smeared on the soft, fluffy texture of the dosa. the crunch of the podi and spices together with chutney rounds off all the sharp flavours. the sambar is a nourishing accompaniment. 
Rs 75.
10/10

Black jaggery halwa/ karupatti halwa
nice and warm on the palate. Toasty, intense jaggery flavours. copious amount of ghee makes this a super-rich halwa. a halwa you can't finish on your own!
Rs 70.
8/10

Milk and date halwa 
can taste the milk solids and flecks of date in the halwa. not too sweet, not too rich. A dessert I can finish entirely on my own. 
Rs 40.
9/10

Filter coffee
nice, thick and strong! don't forget to pull your coffee to cool it down and for that extra froth. 
Rs 30.
8/10

ADDRESS - Sai Sangeet Vegetarian Restaurant, Banglore to Chennai Highway, Between Vaniyambadi - Ambur, NH 48, Chengilkuppam, Vellore, Tamil Nadu 635 807; 099418 99099
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/78BKZtkbZtb1mZRV9

Description:
#MilitaryHotelsOfBangalore #Bangalore #LocalFlavours

Known for its host of non vegetarian delights SG Rao Military Hotel has been serving its patrons delicious military fare for 110 years now!

From paya soup, idlis and keema curry served for breakfast at 6 am everyday, the restaurant also dishes out a toothsome mutton biryani, a must-try on the menu! Other dishes include mutton pepper fry, chilli chicken, mutton head curry, mutton liver and ragi mudde.

Title: Exploring the Vaniyambadi BIRYANI at 40-year AHMEDIA HOTEL| Mutton Biryani | Chicken | Quail Masala
Description:
#Biryani #TamilNadu #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Established in 1975, Ahmedia Hotel, a name highly familiar with the locals of Vaniyambadi is the quintessential non-vegetarian lunch stopover in town!

Especially known for its aromatic Biryani made using long grain basmati rice, unlike the typical jeeraga samba rice used in biryanis elsewhere in Tamilnadu, this restaurant claims that its biryani is what brings patrons back each time. 

Aside from the biryani, the mutton and quail preparations here are what one should definitely indulge in here. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the kitchen to discover what makes this biryani great and also orders a full lunch meal complete with piping hot Mutton Biryani, Mutton Chukka, Chicken Chukka, Teetar Pepper Masala, Chicken Kebab and more to savour the whole experience of dining here.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Mutton chukka
meat is roasted superbly well. not your typical Chettinad/ Kongu chukka. very mild and gentle, allows you to enjoy the flavours of the meat. deep brown on the outside and moist and pink on the inside. 
Rs 150.
8/10

Chicken chukka
crisped curry leaves add an extra dimension to the dish. excellent dish for a chicken lover!
8/10

Quail pepper dry
Cooked well although quail is tough to get right. Prominent pepper flavours together with the characteristic crispy curry leaves makes this an intense dish.
Rs 130
9/10


Quail phaal/masala
thick gravy with the quail having soaked in all the masala. delicious! a dish to definitely order here! all you need is a piece if parota to mop up all the goodness. 
Rs 150.
10/10


Bheja/brain pepper fry
in-your-face pepper hit with underlying flavours of curry leaves, onion and tomato. ¬†Can be enjoyed both with roti and biryani.
Rs 140
8/10


Vanjaram fish fry 
Fish tastes fine but doesn't really make the cut. slightly overcooked. the masala hasn't penetrated inside. I prefer the meat dishes here. 
Rs 160.
5/10


Chicken kebab
Tastes like a regular kebab. A tad bit dry. if you love your kebab, this dish is worth trying. 
Rs 140.
6/10


Mutton Biryani
certainly an aromatic biryani! made with the long grain basmati. very delicate in it's flavours. pink juicy pieces of mutton, you can taste the pure flavour of the meat. no heavy spices weighing down the meat. this is a delicious biryani!
Rs 200.
10/10

ADDRESS - Ahmedia Hotel‚Ñ¢Ô∏è Since 1975
3/7, CN Annadurai Road, Near Bus Stop, Vaniyambadi, Tamil Nadu 635751; tel: +91 97893 29139

LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/rhEktWnTVXjprXKM7"

Title: Celebrating Traditional Italian Cuisine | 7-Course Dinner | Flavours Of Alloro | Food Lovers Event
Description:
#Italian #Bangalore #FoodLoversExperiences

An evening of fine dining specially curated by Food Lovers, Gusto d‚ÄôItalia: Flavours Of Alloro is a bespoke dinner hosted to celebrate classic Italian cuisine. 

This 7-course dinner set to be held at Alloro, the Italian restaurant at The Oterra, showcases a selection of exceptional curated dishes such as a light Summer Minestrone, Risotto all'Aragosta served with rock lobster, a rich Osso Buco served with a side of creamy polenta and root vegetables, Tortellini stuffed with cavolo nero, spinach and pecorino, an interesting Insalata made with Burrata and candied kalamata olives and an impressive Italian classic for dessert. 

To know more about Gusto d‚ÄôItalia, watch this video where Food Lovers‚Äô Founder & Managing Editor, Kripal Amanna talks to Raghu Nair, General Manager of The Oterra Hotel Bengaluru and Suvaranjan Banerjee, Executive Chef,  The Oterra Hotel Bengaluru, over a tasting in preparation for this exclusive dinner.

And to be part of this exclusive soiree on the 13th of July 2019, visit https://www.foodlovers.in/events/gusto-ditalia-flavours-of-alloro-the-oterra/ and book a seat today!
