Title: Desi Gourmet OMELETTES! Streetfood Eggs Taken To A Whole New Level| Egg Factor! Bangalore Food Tour!
Description:
#Eggs #StreetFoodInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

Egg Factor ‚Äì Street House, a street kiosk whips ups gourmet-style omelettes that are a far cry from the regular masala or cheese versions.

Using ingredients such as chicken, prawn, grilled fish, goat brain and even fruits such as pineapples or strawberries, ex-cruise line chef, Kumar is dishing up fancy, exotic and unheard of toppings and fillings to go with the humble omelette, in a street shop setting.

In this Gourmet On The Road video, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna discovers what inspired this well-travelled, ex-cruise line chef‚Äôs vision, the incidents that led to the creation of offbeat toppings and fillings, the delectable omelettes you can try here and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

Chicken and Cheese Omelette
A loaded omelette! chicken is well marinated. The crunchy veggies complement the gooey savouriness of the cheese. Can definitely feel the chilli kick in the seasoning!
Rs 150.
8/10

Pepper Prawn Omelette
You smell the inviting aromas of freshly ground spices and fresh herbs. This makes all the difference! the prawns are torched, cooked just right, can taste the sweetness. The use of desi eggs gives this omelette a wholesome touch!
Rs 200
8/10

Goat Brain Omelette
Luscious, creamy, custardy! The heavy masalas balance the rich flavours of the brain. The lush buttery texture of the brain with the fluffy egg is a delightful mouthful.
Rs 200
10/10

Pineapple And Cheese Omelette
A sweet, hot and sour medley on the palate! The garlic and chilli in the pineapple is a surprising touch. a tart zingy acidity and a chilli heat in the back of your throat. A savoury fruit omelette. This is definitely a first for me!
Rs 130
6/10

ADDRESS - Eggfactor, # 367, 80th feet road, 17th Main Road, HSR Layout, Sector 3, Opposite to Sri Muneshwara Swamy Temple, Bengaluru 560102; Tel: +91 82484 54360/ 99028 05592

LOCATION TAG - https://goo.gl/maps/Mfcwwje694kJvdYeA
Please note this is the latest location of Egg Factor, disregard the other two 'Egg Factor' locations that pop up on google maps.

Title: Exploring Traditions & Tasting the VEGETARIAN LUNCH THALI At Mavalli Tiffin Rooms | MTR | Bangalore
Description:
#VegetarianRestaurants #IconicEateriesInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

One of Bengaluru‚Äôs most iconic restaurants for traditional South Indian breakfast and meals, Mavalli Tiffin Rooms or MTR is a culinary institution.
 
Nearly 100 years old, located in a quaint double-storey building with halls packed full of patrons, both old and new, Mavalli Tiffin Rooms, Lalbagh is part of the history of Bengaluru.
 
The eatery today is known for its rich culinary traditions, that has struck a chord with people not just in the country, but across the world! 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor visits the iconic eatery to lunch with Hema Malini Maiya, Managing Partner. He explores the nuances of what makes MTR so special over a traditional lunch.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Lunch Thali - Rs 270

Black grape juice
No lunch at mtr has begun without this refreshing drink, that is served no matter grape season or not!
7/10

Kosambari
Fresh, crunchy salad. Typically to be eaten at the start of the meal.
7/10

Raw banana palya/ balekai palya
tasty fibre. coconut adds a nice texture. made with a south canara masala, that is very gentle. Looks spicy but isn‚Äôt!
8/10

Poori Sagu
Fluffy pooris best eaten with the sweet and tangy saagu and thick chutney. the savoury and slight sweetness from the potatoes are balanced with the spice hit from the chutney.  
8/10

Sabbakki kadle bele payasam
Perfectly sweet dessert. has some chana dal that adds texture and breaks the gluten and the sweetness. helps you refresh your palate in between all the food.
8/10

Mini masala dosa
dosa has a slight tartness from the batter. can taste the masala in every bite. the chutney adds flavour and spice. the slightly grainy bite of fried gram in the chutney makes it the perfect accompaniment to the dosa.
10/10

Rave vade
a delicious, crunchy fritter. this accompaniment on the thali is different everyday.
6/10

Bisibelebath
a flavourful bisibelebath. the bite of the vegetables is what makes this dish. it is robustly spiced. Best eaten with the raita.
10/10

Kara pongal with hunase hannu gojju
A Thursday special. This flavourful dish sings on your palate. the tangy tamarind chutney helps cut through the spice from the ginger and peppercorns in the dish. 
9/10

White rice and bendekai huli with ghee
typical south Canara Style huli/ sambar. super tasty! Slightly tart in flavour, you can taste the spices and the crunch of the vegetable. Best eaten with ghee to round off all its flavours.
9/10

Rice and rasam 
piping hot rasam/ saaru! can taste the spices that are well balanced. sourness from tomato and tamarind is balanced with a slight sweetness from the jaggery. The spice comes from the red byadgi chilli. great when eaten with the appala and uppinakayi or pickle.
9/10

Curd rice 
lightly seasoned. curd rice helps settle your tummy. makes for a lovely end to the rice courses. 
7/10 

Ice cream and fruit mixture 
this ice cream, made in house and with very little fat - almost like a rich sorbet -  is only available at mtr and is called the american ice cream. served with a ‚Äòfrench fruit mixture‚Äô as they call it. 
8/10

Gulab jamoon
Flat, oblong jamoon. Light, not cloyingly sweet, a bit of camphor traditionally added for flavour.
8/10

Beeda or pan 
Stuffed with fennel, gulkand and betel nut to refresh your mouth. a perfect digestive. rounds up a perfectly satisfying and happy lunch here. 
7/10

ADDRESS - MTR, #14, Lal Bagh Main Road, Doddamavalli, Sudhama Nagar, Bengaluru 560 027; tel +91 80 2222 0022

LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/JfzrF2A9ypAUQCzr9

Title: Lunch At SHIVAJI MILITARY HOTEL |Bangalore‚Äôs most popular Mutton, Chicken Donne Biryani|Best Biryani
Description:
#DonneBiryani #MilitaryHotelsInBangalore #GourmetOnTheRoad

An age-old, iconic establishment in the city of Bengaluru, Shivaji Military Hotel is renowned for its Maratha cuisine.

The crowd favourite, ‚Äúdonne-style‚Äù biryani here is cooked on dum using coal and robustly flavoured with stock, chunks of meat and a secret masala blend all made in-house. The biryani can be enjoyed with other meat heavy preparations like Mutton Dry, Chicken Kalmi, Liver Fry and more.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this bustling eatery to discover what makes it popular with the locals while he indulges in a full-fledged meal!

GOTR RATING
Chicken Dry
the chicken is smothered in masala, making every bite flavourful. Chicken cooked just right. 
Rs 160
8/10

Mutton Dry
great quality meat. cooked dry with fat trimmings that imparts a deep savouriness, a meaty bite. So good!
Rs 190
9/10

Chicken Leg/ Kalmi Masala
plump, spicy chicken thighs. it's juicy, succulent inside and has a peppery bite.
Rs 160
8/10

Mutton Donne Biryani
piping hot biryani with gentle inviting aromas. the rice has all the flavours of the biryani, is cooked perfectly well and even has a bite to it. the meat is soft, juicy, fatty, all things you want in a piece of meat! a seriously tasty biryani!
Rs 220
10/10

Mutton Liver
cooked in a green chilli, coriander and mint masala that has a freshness to it. meaty piece of liver. a tad dry for my liking.
Rs 150
6/10

Chicken Donne Biryani
pleasantly surprised with the flavours for a chicken biryani. lightly spiced with a chilli kick that you feel at the back of your throat. chicken with the rice makes for a lovely mouthful. the pachadi (yoghurt salad) helps cool off the heat.
Rs 180
8/10

Chilli Chicken
not your typical chinese-style chilli chicken. this maratha chilli chicken uses tons of green chilli. if you love your food spicy then this dish is for you.
Rs 160
7/10

ADDRESS- Shivaji Military Hotel, No. 718, 1st C Main, 45th Cross, 8th Block, Jayanagar, Bangalore 560 082; tel: +91 98451 49217

LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/7Mra39VE7Jf7Rvj97

Title: A ‚ÄòCHEESY‚Äô Spin on Tandoori Chicken Made Without A Tandoor! | Easy Recipes| Scamorza Stuffed Chicken
Description:
#TandooriChicken #Recipes #FoodLoversRecipes
A contemporary spin to good ol‚Äô tandoori chicken, the scamorza filled tandoori chicken breast at Lazy Suzy, Bangalore is a coming together of interesting flavours that perfectly mimic the essence of the popular Indian delicacy!

Chef Udayshankar Shenoy of Lazy Suzy recreates the flavours of tandoori chicken with this recipe that boasts of various delicious elements. And it isn‚Äôt cooked in a tandoor!
 
He begins by stuffing a tandoori spiced chicken breast with scamorza cheese, this adds the the most important smoked flavour to the dish. Once pan-fried, and finished in the oven, the breast is served on a bed of chokha or Indian spiced potatoes and a tomato butter sauce.
 
Recipe by Chef Udayshankar Shenoy, Lazy Suzy, Bangalore

Title: Special Chettinad Feast At HOTEL RAJAGANAPATHY SALEM| Pigeon Roast| Mutton Chukka| Naati Chicken Fry
Description:
#ChettinadCuisine #Salem #GourmetOnTheRoad

Hotel Rajaganapathy, a tiny eatery located at Arthanari Nagar, Salem is frequented by locals for its non-vegetarian meals and Chettinad style meat fries. 

Carrying forward its 40-year old legacy is owner, Vaidyanathan, a gentleman who has been working the stove since he was a 7-year-old.

In this episode of Gourmet Of On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, tastes a lavish non-vegetarian meal with a variety of dishes as interacts with the owner and his sons to find what makes this spot special!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Mutton Chukka
Roasted with a bunch of spices and cooked on the bone with the marrow rendered into the gravy.  The meat definitely has a bite to it. Rs 200. 9/10

Natti chicken fry
pieces of shredded country chicken roasted in a dry masala with loads of curry leaves. Rs 200. 7/10

Mutton boti
boti cooked to perfection, almost melts in the mouth. Rs 150. 8/10

Pigeon roast 
Intense, gamey flavours. The curry masala made using hard spices complements the meat. 
Have to wrestle with tiny bones to get to the meat! Rs 200. 9/10

Natti Chicken biryani
The flavour in this biryani runs deep. the country chicken has a chewy texture but the flavourful rice makes up for this. pairs well with the special, rich chicken gravy. Rs 200. 9/10

Country chicken pepper chukka
very distinctive, peppery taste. Rs 200. 7/10

Chicken chintamani fry
Simple preparation of chicken tossed with shallots and red chillies. A bit on the salty side. Rs 150. 5/10 

Address- Hotel Rajaganapathy, Arthanari Street, Arthanari Nagar, Swarnapuri, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636 016; tel; +91 88075 11606
Location Tag - https://goo.gl/maps/kMeR3b7ndNKoTPP87

Title: Tasting A Sauvignon Blanc From Hampi, India's Newest Wine Growing Region | KRSMA | Food & Wine
Description:
#IndianWines #KRSMAVineyards #The3MinuteWineReview 

The KRSMA Sauvignon Blanc, a wine that comes from KRSMA Estates set in Hampi, Karnataka, is delightful white wine for the summer.

Tasting a 2018 vintage of the wine in this episode of the 3-Minute Wine Review,  Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna speaks of how the wine is atypical of a Sauvignon Blanc, stating that its unusual pale gold colour could be because a small part of the wine was aged in new French oak.

He adds, that the lush mouthfeel and ripe acidity of the wine lends itself very well to food. Catch the full review in this 3-minute video!

Title: Move over, ALPHONSO! Blown away by these local MANGOES At Dharmapuri, Salem-Krishnagiri Highway
Description:
#LocalMangoes#TropicalFruits #GourmetOnTheRoad

This Gourmet On The Road Extra celebrates the fruit of the season! 

The vibrant mango stalls lining each side of the Krishnagiri-Bangalore Highway, especially Dharmapuri was full of surprising and sweet mango discoveries and made for a pleasant stopover on our way back from Salem.

In this episode watch as Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna tastes and purchases some local mango varieties in and around Dharmapuri.

Title: CHETTINAD non-veg Lunch at Salem‚Äôs most popular SELVI MESS |Biryani |Mutton|Turkey Chukka |Prawn Fry
Description:
#ChettinadCuisine #Salem #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Selvi Mess, in Salem, Tamil Nadu, known for its Chettinad-style fare dishes out specials in true country style. Although a tiny eatery, this spot is unmissable to the traveller‚Äôs eye owing to the clamour coming from a full house of diners. In nearly 35 years of its existence, the iconic mess called a ‚Äòmess‚Äô has amassed a devoted audience, turning into the perfect pit stop for a delicious meal!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna tastes a full meal of the most highly recommended dishes here including a piping hot Catla Fry, robust Mutton Chukka and the signature Turkey Chukka, the special for the day. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Prawn fry 
A semi dry preparation of tiny prawns cooked in roasted spices and onions. the tiny prawns add flavour and punch to the dish.
Rs. 210  
9/10

Turkey chukka
Cooked just right although turkey is a tough meat to nail. The deeply roasted masala adds an extra dimension to the dish.
Rs. 200
8/10

Mutton chukka
A true blue Chettinad preparation made with tiny bits of meat cooked on the bone. You can taste the signature spice mix and pepper with every bite. 
Rs 200
10 /10

Goat Head Curry
Delicious! The meat and fat melts in your mouth with each morsel.  
Rs 180
8 /10

Country chicken chukka
Naati style chicken cooked with the skin, deep flavour. Rs 215
7/10

Mutton biryani
Served with a customary egg, this biryani is made with the short grain jeerga samba rice. This style of making a biryani uses copious amounts of tomato that lends a tart flavour to the dish.
Rs 210
8/10

Mutton gravy
The mutton gravy is a delicious side to the biryani. The spices are raw and coarse, with the fat perfectly rendered into the gravy.
 8/10

Catla fry
Caught in the Mettur dam, a specialty of the region. Lightly coated in masala and deep fried, it makes for a scrumptious, mildly spicy dish..
Rs 110
9 /10

Rice & Rasam 
The unlimited rice and rasam are perfect to be eaten with the robust meat fries. The tangy rasam is a great wash down to a non-vegetarian meal! 
Rs. 100
 8/10

Selvi Mess, No 212, Opp New Bus stand, Arthanari Nagar, Swarnapuri, Salem,
Tamil Nadu 636004; tel: 088700 44455; 
Location Tag - https://maps.app.goo.gl/ZtUjQh1P2AwqVfb98

Title: Tasting SEVEN Kinds Of HALEEM |Haleem Festival|Turkey|Jackfruit|Prawn| Duck Haleem |Ramadan Special
Description:
#RamadanFeast #Haleem #GourmetOnTheRoad

Haleem, a delicacy especially during the month of Ramadan is a filling, wholesome meal  packed with essential nutrients. Made with ingredients like lentils, spices and broken wheat, along with spices, ghee, dry fruits, and saffron, the haleem is said to be easy on the stomach but also full of nourishment that helps restore energy. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna indulges in seven variations of the haleem at Punjab Bistro to celebrate this holy month in full swing! From a Vegetable Haleem made with over five kinds of veggies, Raw Jackfruit Haleem, to Prawn, Duck and even Turkey Haleem, this haleem festival has something for everyone! 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATINGS

Vegetable Haleem
Great choice for vegetarians on the lookout to try haleem, its texture mimics a meat haleem! The fried veggies as a garnish adds a beautiful crunch.
Rs 275 for a full portion. 8/10

Kathal Haleem
meaty bite for a vegetarian haleem. can taste the subtle sweetness of the raw jackfruit.
Rs 295 for a full portion. 7/10

Prawn haleem
Light in its flavours. Definitely needed the birista and coriander for added depth. The spicy prawn chutney accompaniment is overpowering.  
Rs 475 for a full portion. 6/10

Chicken haleem
mellow flavours with a bit of an underlying tartness. a great combination with the sheermal.
Rs 340 for a full portion. 8/10

Turkey haleem
light in colour but deep and bright in flavours! the fried turkey is a little salty perfect to cut through the monotony of flavours. Rs 575 for a full portion. 9/10

Duck haleem
The haleem for duck lovers. deep flavours of the duck are balanced when eaten with birista and coriander. Personally, a bit strong for my liking. Rs 450 for a full portion. 6/10

Mutton haleem
Classic, textbook haleem. Its rich, meaty savouriness shines in every bite. piece of ghee fried mutton on top makes for a wonderful bonus! Rs 400 for a full portion. 10/10



Punjab Bistro, SJR Primus Ground Floor Opposite Forum Mall, 20th Main Rd, 7th Block, Koramangala, Banaglore 560 095; tel +91 80 4090 2161; Location Tag - https://maps.app.goo.gl/yAVBZrdm1aWMV8VU8

Title: Breakfast at the Original Krishnagiri SREE SARAVANA BHAVAN, Tamil Nadu |PODI DOSA |PONGAL |IDLI VADA
Description:
#Breakfast #SouthIndianBreakfast #GourmetOnTheRoad 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the Krishnagiri outpost of Sree Saravana Bhavan that has spawned several other restaurants trying to imitate its menu under its name. 

Savouring some of Tamil Nadu‚Äôs breakfast staples, the idli vada, masala dosa including a fiery podi dosa, catch Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna‚Äôs full review in this video.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING

Idli Vada
Soft, almost-pillowy idlis served with an assortment of chutneys, leaving you spoilt for choice. Vadas are perfectly crunchy. Rs 60. 10/10 


Pongal
Lightly spiced, mellow pongal that is delicately tempered with ghee and studded with cashews. The peppercorns help cut through the richness! Rs 62. 8/10

Masala Dosa
A thin, crisp dosa, surprisingly light on oil! Each bite with the spiced mash potato is super satisfying! Rs 71. 9/10

Podi dosa
You can taste the fire of the podi. This spirited condiment is a Tamil Nadu staple made with lentils, chillies and garlic. Rs 76. 7/10

Idiyappam
A simple dish but delicious! The steamed rice flour noodles are best when lapped up with the sweet coconut milk flavoured with cardamom. Rs 55. 10/10

Filter coffee
Dark, deep-roasted coffee topped with a frothy foam. Rs 25. 8/10


Sree Sarvana Bhavan, Vangli Towers National Highway 7, Avathanapatti 635 101; 94437 66655
LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/4bEbeBGCpeupr5ZXA

Title: Make Your Own Fluffy KETO EGG ROLL Loaded With Cheese & Avocado | Easy Recipes | Keto Recipe
Description:
#EasyRecipes #KetoDiet #Eggs 

In this episode of the Food Lovers‚Äô Cooking With Eggs series, Chef Ashish Uggal of Taj Bangalore hands out a refreshing recipe for the keto diet lovers that heroes the humble egg. 

Using just six ingredients, this egg roll is made by whisking together and frying a mixture of eggs, soy, mirin, that is then stuffed with avocados, melty brie and crisped bacon! 

Make your own today and serve either warm or at room temperature.

Recipe by Chef Ashish Uggal, Taj Bangalore

Title: Mosque Road Food Trail BANGALORE  | Mutton Chops | Shahi Tukda | Sulaimani | Mosque Road Part 2
Description:
#RamadanFoodTrail #FrazerTown #GourmetOnTheRoad

In the second episode of the Gourmet On The Road Food Trail at Mosque Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna and Mr Aslam Gafoor indulge in some juicy kebabs, some staple Ramadan time beverages and finish on a sweet note, with some royal desserts like the shahi tukda and more!

Take this journey with them as they visit famous eateries like Charminar Kebab Paradise and Savera Tea Cafe.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Royal Shadi biryani
PATTHAR GOSH 
These chunks of meat cooked on a polished stone have a meaty bite. Rs100. 7/10

SEEKH KEBAB
expected the kebab to be much more juicier, the meat is tasty and smokey nevertheless. 
Rs100. 6/10

Charminar Kebab Paradise
BAIDA ROTI
Greasy and delicious! the roti fried crisp, stuffed with a mixture of eggs, kheema, onions is  just what a egg and meat lover needs! Rs100. 8/10

fried bread soaked in condensed milk and topped with a nuts, everything a dessert lover needs! Rs 60. 9/10

 A rice pudding made of rice and milk, infused with the right amount of sweetness and cooled in a matka. Rs 50 7/10

Savera Tea Cafe
HARIRA

SULAIMANI CHAI

Rs10. 10/10

Title: Mosque Road BANGALORE FOOD TRAIL | Albert Bakery, Pista House | KHEEMA SAMOSAS| HALEEM| NALLI NIHARI
Description:
#RamadanFoodTrail #FrazerTown #GourmetOnTheRoad

Frazer town located in the heart of Bangalore is nothing less than a food lovers heaven! 

With streets like Mosque Road and MM Road lined with restaurants and eateries dishing out some of the most delicious non vegetarian fare, this spot in the city is a must-visit.

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna takes off on this busy street, during the month of Ramadan together with a friend to taste and review much loved dishes such as the Haleem, Kheema Samosa, a delectable Nalli Nihari and more! 

Gourmet On The Road Ratings
MUTTON KHEEMA MINI SAMOSA 
a speciality at Albert, he thin skin is fried to a crisp with a moist kheema filling. Delicious! Rs 480 a kilo. 10 /10

BRAIN PUFF
piping hot, flaky puff stuffed with a custardy mutton brain that dissolves in your mouth!  Rs 35 per puff. 
9/10

KHEEMA NAAN
prominent taste of onions and a meaty savouriness makes the kheema naan a tasty, filling indulgence! Rs120 6/10

KHOVA NAAN 
the filling of the khova or reduced milk solids shine in this dessert puff that isn‚Äôt overly sweet. Rs100 7/10

HYDERABADI MUTTON HALEEM 
A wholesome dish, this haleem is velvety, gooey and is crowned with fried onions, mint and lemon juice. The twang of the lemon and texture from the onion helps cut through the richness. Rs 250 8/10

QUBANI KI MEETHA
This Hyderabadi speciality is a rich and pulpy apricot dessert laced with a  hint of saffron. The sugary goodness makes the perfect accompaniment to the haleem. Rs 190. 7/10

PAYA WITH NAAN
This gelatinous, warm and nourishing stew made with lamb trotters is to be enjoyed steaming hot with some naan! Rs150. 8/10

NALLI NIHARI
The slow cooked, rich nihari is superbly flavourful. You can tell that the gravy has been cooked for hours to intensify the deliciousness! Rs 350. 10/10

KARACHI NAAN 
The Karachi naan is a light yet dry making it the right accompaniment to soak up all the gravy and its unctuous goodness. Rs 45 for 2. 9/10

Food Lovers is India‚Äôs finest content and experience platform on food, wines & spirits and dining. Watch our thrilling videos capturing fine dining, culinary traditions, new experiences and trends in the world of food.

Title: Non Vegetarian Haven At Bellur Cross | MURLI MILTRY HOTEL|MUTTON CHOPS| Bangalore Mangalore Highway
Description:
#MilitaryHotel #NonVegetarian #GourmetOnTheRoad

Murli Miltry Hotel on Bellur Cross is the quintessential non-vegetarian lunch stopover on Bangalore-Mangalore highway.

The mutton preparations here are what one should definitely indulge in here. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna orders a full Mutton Thali served 
with chapathi, Mutton Chops, Mutton Kurma, Rice and Buttermilk including a Mutton Pepper Dry and A naati-style Mutton Biryani, to savour the whole experience of dining here. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
Mutton Meal 
A delicious thali of Mudde/ Rice/ Chapathi served with Mutton Chops, Mutton Korma, Egg, Rasam and Butter Milk. Rs 240.  8/10

Mutton Chops
A spirited naati style curry made in a delicious green masala. The mutton is melt-in-the-mouth and flavoured with cardamom, coriander and green chilli. 8/10

Mutton Pepper Dry
The roast and the pepperiness is what makes this dish shine. Mutton is braised well with a crisp outside and juicy, soft inside. The dish to order here! Rs 160. 10/10

Fish Fry Mackerel
Butterflied fish, layered with masala. Not high on appeal to the fish purist, but okay otherwise. Rs 200. 5 /10

Chicken Kebab
a typical kebab, good but not brilliant. the meat is a bit dry and stringy.. Rs 140. 5/10

Mutton Dum Biryani
Crowned with some kurma gravy on top. Tasty but not what I would order here. Found the meat a bit chewy. Rs 180. 6/10

ADDRESS - Murli Miltry Hotel; Bangalore - Mangalore Highway, Nagatihalli A, Karnataka 571 448; tel: +91 99866 87676

Title: BREAKFAST SPECIALS At HOTEL MAYURA |Set Dosa Idli Vada |Bangalore Mangalore Highway Breakfast Spots
Description:
#Breakfast #SouthIndianCuisine #GourmetOnTheRoad 

Hotel Mayura Veg located at Bellur Cross, on Bangalore-Mangalore highway is a delightful spot to stopover for breakfast!

Known for its South Indian fare, dishes such as the masala dosa, idli vada and kesari bath come highly recommended.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna relishes some delicious South Indian breakfast staples in this episode of Gourmet On The Road also sharing a quick review on each dish!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING  
Filter Coffee
Fresh decoction, strong and does the work. Rs. 35.  9/10

Idli Vada
Crunchiest vadas, perfect in each bite! Idlis are light and fluffy. This dish is served with a rich coconut chutney and tasty sambar. Rs. 80. 8 /10

Benne Masala Dosa
Buttery goodness! Crispy yet light and fluffy. Rs 100. 10 /10

Set Dosa
Fluffy, almost spongy served with a sagu mom would approve of! Rs. 80.  8/10

Kesari Bath
A must try dish at mayura. Sweet, crunchy and the tart edge makes this kesari bath stand apart!  Rs. 45. 10/10

ADDRESS - Hotel Mayura, Bengaluru - Mangaluru Highway, Bellur Cross 571 448; tel + 91 92424 55574

Title: Check out Bangalore‚Äôs 99 VARIETY DOSA|INDIAN STREET FOOD| Buttery Paneer Cheese, Noodle Dosa & MORE!
Description:
#StreetFood #Bangalore #99VarietyDosa 

This small kiosk located at Kormangala, Bengaluru serves up to 99 kinds of dosas!

From Pizza dosa, Mysore Masala, Schezwan noodles to over 20 kinds of cheese dosas, they‚Äôve got it all. This particular street cart is believed to be the first 99 variety stall in the city and witnesses a multitude of customers every day.

Food Lovers finds out what makes this street treat so popular in this Local Flavours video!

Description:
#MarketsAroundTheWorld #LocalVegetableMarkets #GourmetOnTheRoad

Mangalore‚Äôs rich culture is a reflection of its cuisine and its markets that feature some of the freshest produce and ingredients unique to its region.

To understand what makes Mangalorean food so special, in this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna explores a local market brimming with local chillies, rice varieties and veggies!

Title: Make This Robust CHICKEN SUKKA W/ NEER DOSA|Traditional Mangalorean Dish|Easy-To-Make|Food Classics
Description:
#EasyRecipes #ChickenSukka #MangaloreanCuisine
A classic combination in coastal Mangalorean cuisine, neer dosa with chicken sukka is a favourite in every household in the region. Food Lovers shares a traditional family recipe, both delicious and easy to make!

In this episode of Recipe & Traditions, Ms Roopa Baliga shares with us her journey of turning into a cook for the love of her family, from somebody with no practice in the kitchen. She talks about the importance of neer dosa, a staple in the community and how it is a natural accompaniment with a delicious chicken sukka made with heaps of grated coconut and a special chicken sukka masala.

Title: Homemade ROOSTER Masala|Cooking HOMESTYLE FISH CURRY|Traditional MEAL At HOME|Mangalore Food Trail
Description:
#IndianMasalas #HomeMadeMasalas #GourmetOnTheRoad 

In order to preserve the traditional flavours of Mangalorean cuisine, Mr & Mrs. Gunakar and Sangeetha Furtado, owners of Rooster Homemade Masala in Mangalore, weaned away from a lucrative restaurant  business to manufacture and retail, readymade masalas and marinades.

From masala mixes for traditional Fish Pulimunchi, Kori Rotti, to Chicken Sukka and Prawn Fry, this family owned business has helped ease the elaborate steps involved in making just the masala, let alone the dish!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the couple‚Äôs home to learn how these traditional masalas are stone ground using fresh and locally sourced ingredients.

In the process he also makes a delicious fish curry and tastes some of Mangalore‚Äôs most recognisable dishes prepared using Rooster Homemade Masalas!

To order, call +91 98803 52345 (Mangalore) or +91 90198 80547 in Bengaluru.

Title: A Tasting Of Indian Wines From SULA & KRSMA|TASTING TABLE|Pairing Food & Wine|White Wines For Summer
Description:
Exploring three very distinct Indian white wines, perfect for summertime, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna hosts a tasting table with wine and food lovers at Ebony, one of Bengaluru‚Äôs oldest free standing restaurants. 

They taste and pair India‚Äôs first Riesling from Sula, a lush and bright Sauvignon Blanc from KRSMA and the Sula Chenin Reserve with dishes from across cuisines like Asian, Southeast Asian, North Indian to South Indian. The wines are also for the very first time paired with desserts! 

To find out what food works best with this trio of white wines, click on the video!

Title: HOTEL NARAYANA‚ÄôS Famous FISH FRY with Masala|Mangalore Food Trail|Top Seafood Restaurant|Fish Meals
Description:
#SeafoodThali #GourmetOnTheRoad #MangaloreanCuisine

Located close to the old port, Hotel Narayana, or Narayana, is flooded with customers come lunch time. Locals who frequent the eatery almost everyday claim that the restaurant serves the best fish fry in Mangalore. 

Known especially for its fish meals that come with a fried piece of fish, depending on the catch of the day, the food here is simple yet delicious. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers Editor, Kripal Amanna visits the quaint restaurant to discover what makes it this popular. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
BUTTERMILK 
Cool  and spicy refresher! The right accompaniment to the thali. Rs 10. 8/10 

THALI 
Humble thali served with boiled rice, fish curry, a vegetable and pickle. Simple, no fuss meal. Rs 40. 6/10

SAUTHEKAYI
Tastes nice and bright. the Mangalore cucumber isn‚Äôt overcooked, can taste the crunch.  7/10

PULIMUNCHI FISH CURRY
Slightly tart, slightly spicy curry where the piece of fish is just a formality! 7/10

WHITE POMFRET FRY
Absolutely fresh fish that tastes great when eaten by itself minus the pan trimmings that can be way too salty! Rs 380. 9/10

ADDRESS - Hotel Narayana, Behind Indian Overseas Bank Azizuddin Road Bunder, Mangaluru 575 001; tel +91 94482 55025

Title: Make This Delectable Bengali Patali Gur Mousse Today! | Indian Dessert Recipe | Jaggery Sweet Treats
Description:
Nothing captures the essence of a community the way its food does. Food Lovers brings to you recipes and traditional cuisine handed down through generations while sharing fond memories and cherished emotions of its maker. 

In this episode of Recipes & Traditions, Ms Ajantha Purkayastha, a social worker, reminisces enjoying delicious desserts made with jaggery and thickened milk or pancakes topped with melted jaggery, growing up. 

She also shares how she wanted her love for gur to pass on to her kids. To make sure the custom of enjoying jaggery continues, she concocted a dish that made use of jaggery in a more inspired-by-the-West way. She calls it the Patali Gur Mousse, that is light, perfectly sweet and might we also add, eggless!

Watch this video to make your own!

Title: Mangalore‚Äôs LARGEST SEAFOOD MARKET|Incredible Variety Of Seafood|Mangalore BUNDER|Affordable, Fresh!
Description:
#Seafood #FishMarket #Fishing

Bunder or the Old Port, is a landmark in the city of Mangalore with dozens of trawl boats bringing in marine wealth of all kinds. Heaps of freshly caught prawns, clams, crabs, squid, an abode of different varieties of fish is up for auction day in and day out. 

Locals including vendors of hotels and restaurants flock to this forever bustling market to purchase seafood at affordable prices. In this episode, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna explores all kinds of seafood at the Bunder while he discovers the means of livelihood of fishermen and vendors who strive hard so that we can enjoy the bounty of the sea! 

Fresh stocks of tiger and zebra prawns, seer fish, octopus, blue sea crab, prawns, lizard fish, pomfret, and other fishes locally called batfish, madmal, and a type of green lipped mussel were on sale on this day.

Title: Must-have BREAKFAST Delights At HOTEL JANATHA| Mangalore Food Trail |NEER DOSA| KHOTTIGE|KASHI HALWA
Description:
#Breakfast #GourmetOnTheRoad #MangaloreanCuisine

A favourite among the residents of Mangalore, Hotel Janatha Deluxe is over two decades old and is preferred by the masses for its hearty breakfast options.

What‚Äôs special on the menu is an array of Mangalorean breakfast specials such as Khottige served with a dal or Tove, Neer Dosa and Bella, Buns, Sheera and Kashi Halwa, among others. 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna revisits his childhood whilst he tastes and reviews these must-tries at Hotel Janatha Deluxe. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
SHEERA 
Not too sweet and studded with the right amount of nuts and raisins! A great way to begin breakfast! Rs 32. 8/10

KASHI HALWA
A rich, decadent dessert with the right touch of sweetness. Best way to make use of ash gourd! Rs 32. 9/10

KOTIGE AND DAALI TOVE
Fragrant cousin of the idli steamed in jackfruit leaves. Much coarser yet light, served with a daali tove or daal seasoned with coconut and local, spicy chillies.
Rs 30. 9/10

BUNS
Fluffy, airy texture! A dish exclusive to Mangalore! Rs 26. 8/10

NEER DOSA WITH COCONUT BELLA
Light dosa, the perfect accompaniment to the coconut and jaggery! My childhood happy meal! Rs 36. 10/10

FILTER COFFEE
A deliciously strong coffee buzz rounds off this breakfast meal. Rs 25. 9/10

ADDRESS - Hotel Janatha Deluxe, Shan Plaza Building, K.S. RAO Road, Mangaluru 575 001; tel + 91 82424 26889

Title: Home Cooked Christian Food At MARYBAI‚ÄôS Mangalore| MEATY DELIGHTS!|PORK BAFAT|FISH FRIES|Food Lovers
Description:
#NonVegetarian #MangaloreanCuisine #GourmetOnTheRoad

If one is looking for a simple yet sumptuous home-cooked meal, Marybai‚Äôs in Valencia, Mangalore is the place to visit! 

Located in a small home, this eatery has been making its patrons happy with authentic Mangalore Christian cuisine since 1984, when Marybai, the founder set up the restaurant.

Dishes that have been coined to be delicacies at Marybai‚Äôs are its meat preparations such as pork chilli, chicken pepper, beef bafat and pork bafat. These dishes are meant to be eaten with a humble thali to enjoy a complete experience here.

Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna, digs into this delicious spread together with some local, tasty fish fries!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
BOILED RICE AND PICKLE MEALS 
A nourishing, home cooked meal worth its price. Rs 40. 7/10

SARDINE FISH CURRY 
A curry with a tart edge, made with the humble boothai or sardine. Perfect when eaten with boiled rice. 7/10

CHICKEN PEPPER 
This dry preparation is loaded with coriander and pepper. Rs 70 9/10

PORK PEPPER 
Fat has rendered down beautifully. meat is unctuous with a smokey flavour. A must-try here! Rs 80 10/10

BEEF BAFAT  
The meat and masala sing in unison. Very unique in its style and preparation. Rs 90 9/10

PORK BAFAT 
Pork heaven! The meat is well roasted in the bafat masala. Every bite is delicious! Rs 80 10/10

MACKEREL FRY 
Fleshy and coated with the perfect crust. Skin almost fried to a crisp. Rs 70 10/10

SARDINE FRY 
Lightly battered, flavour of the sardine is prominent. Rs 60 8/10

MOORI MEEN FRY
Pungent notes of the fish is balanced with a robustly spiced masala crumbing. Rs 70 7/10

ADDRESS - Marybai‚Äôs, 17-7-412, Silva Cross Road, Valencia, Kankanady, Mangalore 575 002; tel +91 99457 36146

LOCATION TAG - https://maps.app.goo.gl/mPbLcFErANKmEi5Q9

Title: Explore BEST Mangalore STREET FOOD | Spicy CHARMURI | HOT BAJJIS At Balli Shop | Food Lovers
Description:
#MangaloreFoodTour #StreetFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

Mangalore is full of delicious street treats, perfect to snack on anytime of the day.

A favourite with the locals, Seetharam‚Äôs is the place to visit for Mangalorean chaat. This van that has been converted into a chaat counter, is a hangout for not just the college students but also hungry customers from all over the city. The mainstay here is the charmuri, a puffed rice mixture that will set your mouth on fire. What gives Mangalorean charmuri its characteristic flavour is the coconut oil used!

Another hotspot is The Balli Shop located on Carstreet is known for its crispy, crunchy and tongue tickling fritters! 

Tag along as Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, explores these institutions in the city, telling you what you can expect. 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
CABBAGE VADA PODI 
Big, large cabbage fritter! Perfect for a big appetite. Rs 10. 8/10

VEGETABLE CUTLET 
Potato and cauliflower crumbed in rava for a crisp bite. The cauliflower adds a new touch! Rs 12. 9/10

MEDU VADA 
Roundels of deliciousness studded with curry leaves and chilli. Can definitely feel the kick of the chilli. Rs 10. 10/10

BATTATA AMBADE 
The casing is just enough to contain the potato filling without interfering with the flavors. Bright in colour and bright in flavours. Rs 10. 10/10

Title: Delicious NON-VEGETARIAN FARE | MARATA DARSHAN | Desi Marathi Style  | MUTTON FRY | Food Lovers
Description:
#MilitaryMess #NonVegetarianFood #LocalFlavours

Gorge on mouthwatering military-style food, especially robust mutton dishes at Marata Darshan in Bengaluru.

Established by Shantharaj Lad back in 1989, this humble eatery is known for its wholesome military style meals served for breakfast and lunch. Presently run by the father, mother and son trio, the reason behind the restaurant‚Äôs success are traditional recipes by the mother, Hemavathi Bai.

Dishes that are not to be missed you find yourself here is the Mutton Kheema Thali served with either rice, roti or the restaurant‚Äôs signature Ragi Mudde, Koli Saaru, Mutton Kheema Curry and a tumbler of Soppina Saaru. Must-try sides include a peppery Mutton Liver Fry, Chilli Chicken made with a unique yoghurt based gravy and Mutton Korma. 

Marata Darshan, 4 Queens Road, Behind Shifa Hospital, Bengaluru 560 051; tel +91 99020 21970

Title: NORTH KARNATAKA DELICACIES In Mangalore |HALLI MANE ROTTIES| Must Visit FOOD Truck | Food Lovers
Description:
#MangaloreFoodTour #StreetFood #GourmetOnTheRoad

This mobile eatery that exclusively serves North Karnataka delicacies is a raging hit in the city of Mangalore!

Run by Shilpa, a homemaker turned entrepreneur, Halli Mane Rotties was set up to introduce a different style of cuisine to Mangaloreans, especially when it came to street food. On their daily menu, the canteen offers three types of Rottis made of Ragi, Jowar and Rice, along with Thatte Idli, rice based dishes, a special Chicken Leg Masala or veg accompaniments.

In this episode, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna makes a quick stop at the joint to savour some of the must-haves!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD 
AKKI ROTI 
Light as air! Made with zero oil, this is the healthiest thing you can eat if you love your rice. Rs 30 for 2 Rotis. 10/10

RAGI ROTTI
Ragi in its fluffiest avatar. Nonetheless two of these wholesome rotis will fill you up. Rs.30 for 2 Rotis. 9/10

CHICKEN LEG MASALA 
The meat is slow cooked in a rich, flavourful gravy. The best chicken leg in all of Mangalore.  Rs 120. 10/10

VEG CURRY 
Packed with veggies, including the delicious, local ‚ÄòMattu‚Äô gulla (eggplant), served with the rottis. 8/10
    
Chutney
Made with local green chillies. The spice hit is sure to clear up your sinuses. 8/10

BASIL SEED DRINK  
A refreshing accompaniment, to wash down the spicy flavours. Rs 10. 7/10

ADDRESS - Halli Mane Rotties, Pentland Pet Road, Gandhinagar, Mangaluru 575 003; tel +91 80504 56379

Title: Most Loved GADBAD Ice Cream At PABBA‚ÄôS MANGALORE | Best VEGETARIAN ICE CREAMS |TIRAMISU| Food Lovers
Description:
#IceCream #MangaloreFoodTour #GourmetOnTheRoad

Mangalore‚Äôs favourite spot to hangout at, Pabba‚Äôs and Ideal Ice Creams is ‚Äòthe‚Äô place to flock to if one wants to relish rich flavoured ice creams! 

While locals swear by the hugely popular Gadbad, this ice cream house also creates inspired and innovative ice creams, made just cream, sugar, fruits and nut! All vegetarian!

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits Pabba‚Äôs, to indulge in this delicious summer treat and be transported to ice cream heaven! 

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
DIL KHUSH ICE CREAM 
3 flavours for the value of one! Rs 110.  8/10

GADBAD 
Secret proportions and the layering makes this ‚Äòconfusion‚Äô of an ice cream a delight! No surprise that this is Mangalore's favorite dessert, it's a happy dessert and will brighten anyone's day! Rs.100.  10/10

TIRAMISU
The coffee hit! A wake-me-up sort of a dessert! Rs 120. 9/10

BELLA CANDY
Jaggery popsicle with a cardamom coconut hit! Like a sorbet! Rs 10. 8/10

AAMBULI CANDY 
Raw mango popsicle with jeera ginger pepper black salt! Great local flavoured candy! 
Rs 10. 8/10

Title: Mangalore‚Äôs BEST FISH FRY RESTAURANT | GIRI MANJA‚ÄôS | PRAWN GOLDEN FRY | ANJAL FRY | Food Lovers
Description:
#SeafoodThali #GourmetOnTheRoad #MangaloreanCuisine

A name that is highly familiar among the locals of Mangalore, Giri Manja‚Äôs is a landmark restaurant known for its mouthwatering and fingerlicking seafood specialities! 

In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna visits this forever bustling eatery on recommendation, to try some of its best known dishes, the anjal tawa fry, prawn golden fry, sardine hing fry, squid fry and more!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING
FISH THALI
A wholesome meal that is also unlimited, slightly stingy on the fish, but at just Rs. 50 you can‚Äôt complain! 7/10

PRAWN GOLDEN FRY 
Crisp to the touch with the sweetness of the prawn not overpowered by the masala! Freshest possible prawn that you can have here! Rs 180. 10/10

ANJAL TAWA FRY 
Flakey, meaty piece of fish best eaten with a squeeze of lemon on the top to help sober down the chilli! Rs 220. 9/10

CRAB CURRY
A mellow curry with juicy, sweet-fleshed sea crab! Perfect with rice. Rs 140. 8/10

SILVER FISH FRY 
Scrumptious! The fish is fleshy yet light to eat. Best dish to snack on! Rs 90. 9/10

BONDAS OR SQUID FRY
Crisp yet soft. There‚Äôs a bit of bite just before the squid disappears in your mouth! Rs 150. 9/10

SARDINE HING FRY
The masala is not overpowering and the fish just shines through and through! Superb! Rs 80. 8/10

Giri Manja‚Äôs, Kalikamba Temple Cross Road, Mangaluru 575 001; tel +91 99000 00080

Title: Sriracha Brings UNEXPLORED EAST ASIAN CUISINE To Bengaluru | Sriracha Bengaluru | Food Lovers
Description:
#Sriracha #AsianCusine #NewRestaurants
Chef Vikas Seth, Culinary Director of Sriracha traces the path taken by their team of chefs across the Orient, making stops at Thailand, Malaysia, Japan, Indonesia, Vietnam, China, Cambodia and Singapore. 

The result is a menu with creations that blend the age-old East Asian traditions with the new.

Diners can savour an array of dishes from across, beginning with robust grills made live with choices of turmeric and red chili king prawns with plum and pineapple salsa or scallops with togarashi dust;  Taiwanese hamburgers or baos and charcoal seafood or roasted pumpkin and water chestnut dumplings.

The restaurant continues the tradition of som tam made tableside, alongside introducing charcoal Khmer barbecue for the first time in India. Other Cambodian specials include, lemongrass poached shrimp fresh spring roll and fish amok trey, a traditional Cambodian dish steamed in a cup made from banana leaves.

The menu comprises popular desserts such as the banana cake with homemade coconut ice cream and Sumatra dark chocolate mousse.

To add to the personalised experience, the restaurant also makes its own sriracha!

Sriracha, 608, 12th Main Road, 7th Cross, HAL 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru 560 038; tel +91 80 4220 0081

Title: Enjoy Vegetarian MANGALOREAN BREAKFAST At 96-Year-Old Taj Mahal Restaurant | Mangalore | Food Lovers
Description:
#Breakfast #GourmetOnTheRoad #MangaloreanCuisine
Although popular for its seafood delicacies, Mangalore is also home to some of the oldest culinary institutions that serve up traditional vegetarian fare. 

The Taj Mahal Veg Restaurant is one such establishment that is nearly a 100 years old. In this episode of Gourmet On The Road, Food Lovers‚Äô Editor, Kripal Amanna enjoys Mangalorean breakfast classics at the restaurant, with dishes like the tuppa dosa, biscuit roti, kashi halwa and more!

He also interacts with co-owner, Vishnu Shenoy, discovering how the restaurant and the kitchen functions.

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
TUPPA DOSA 
Crisp yet soft, slightly tart and loaded with the goodness of ghee! Delicious breakfast choice! Rs 40. 10/10

TEEK ROTI 
Subtle chilli hit. Not as spicy as the name suggest. Rs 20. 7/10

BISCUIT ROTI
Deep fried wheat flour roti stuffed with coconut and spices. Best eaten with chutney. Rs 25. 8/10

GOLI BAJJI
Crisp on the outside and airy inside, with a hint of sweetness that complements the chutney. Rs 25. 9/10

BUNS
Flavoured with ripe banana and fried! Great for a snack! Rs 25. 8/10

GODHI HALWA
An over 90-year-old dessert made with wheat and pure ghee! Sticky, sweet and seriously addictive! Rs 25 per piece. 9/10

BAALE HALWA
Intense caramel flavour and not overly sweet! A halwa you can go back to! Rs 25 per piece. 9/10

FILTER COFFEE
Strong like a filter coffee should be with a nice roast on the beans! Rs 27. 10/10

SAATHU 
Crumbly texture and perfectly sweet! Comfort snack! Rs 280 per kilo. 10/10

KASHI HALWA
Won‚Äôt be able to tell that this dessert is made with a vegetable! Delicious! Rs 30. 10/10

Taj Mahal Veg Restaurant, Mangalore Railway Station Road, opposite government wenlock, hospital, Hampankatta, Mangaluru 575 001; tel +91 82424 23195

Title: Tasting Enormous SEAFOOD THALI At Shetty Lunch Home JUICY CHICKEN GHEE ROAST| KANE FRY | Food Lovers
Description:
#Seafood #Mangalore #ShettyLunchHome
 Food Lovers‚Äô Founder & Editor, Kripal Amanna stops by Shetty Lunch Home for the perfect Mangalorean lunch. 
Tasting dishes that the restaurant is said to have invented - Chicken Ghee Roast and Kane Masala Fry together with a sumptuous Seafood Thali, he tells viewers why a meal at this place is a must when in Mangalore!

GOURMET ON THE ROAD RATING 
CHICKEN GHEE ROAST - 
Copious amounts of ghee and the original ghee roast masala! The one dish you must definitely try in Mangalore! Spices are smooth and balanced by the ghee. Rs 500 for a whole chicken. 10/10

KANE MASALA FRY -
The spices sing on the palate! Flaky yet firm with the goodness of the secret masala! Rs 300 per fish. 10/10

SPECIAL FISH THALI 
A plate of ten absolutely fresh and delicious seafood dishes! Worth the price! Rs 380. 8/10

Bondas Ghee Roast -
Beautifully cooked, soft textured squid!
Marwai Sukka 
These tiny clams roasted in coconut and dry spices are a flavour bomb! 
Prawn Curry 
Flavourful curry made with the small variety of prawn.
Anjal Fish Fry 
The flavour of the fish overpowers the masala slightly. Pick the kane fry over this!
Yetti Chutney 
Pungent, salty, delicious!
Buttermilk 
Perfect drink to wash down all the heavy spices used in the thali! 

ADDRESS - Shetty Lunch Home, Don Bosco Hall Cross Road, Hampankatta, Mangaluru 575 001; tel +91 99456 18222

Nothing captures the essence of a community the way its food does. Food Lovers brings to you recipes and traditional cuisine handed down through generations.

Sharing anecdotes related to her cooking experience, she emphasises on dal dhokli representing the coming together of wholesome ingredients in a flavoursome one pot dish, just like members of joint families live together harmoniously in traditional Gujarati communities.

Title: Make A Hearty Middle Eastern Shakshuka For Breakfast | Easy Recipe |  Food Lovers
Description:
#Eggs #Breakfast #CookingWithEggs

An exciting new way to cook with eggs is to use the protein rich ingredient to create this go-to breakfast choice that is a meal on its own. 

This simple one pan dish is made by slowly poaching or baking eggs in a smoky sauce. The final dish makes a statement with its bright colours and enticing aromas and is great enjoyed for breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner!
 
Recipe by Chef Ashish Uggal, Taj Bangalore.

Title: Experience A Live Taco Bar And Tex-Mex Fare At Sanchez | Mexican Cuisine | Bengaluru | Food Lovers
Description:
#Tacos #Taqueria #TexMex

Inspired by Chef Vikas Seth‚Äôs travels to Mexico, Sanchez Taqueria & Cantina features a live taco bar that dishes up signature tacos like Mexican Blue Corn Hard Tacos, Sea Flavored Charcoal Corn Tacos, and Soft Roasted Beet Corn Tacos. 

The menu also boasts of other Mexican favourites and inspired dishes with a Mexican touch. Avocado toast made with in-house Bolillo bread, Chilaquiles, a traditional breakfast choice, Garnachas and Tex-Mex wet Burritos topped with a choice of sauces are dishes to look forward to. 

Accompanying the delicious fare are margaritas with seasonal fruits as well as micheladas and a range of tequilas.

Sanchez Taqueria & Cantina, 608, 12th Main Road, 7th Cross, HAL 2nd Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru 560 038

Title: Taste Karnataka Style Food At This 60-Year-Old Hotel  | Ranganna Military Hotel | Food Lovers
Description:
#NonVeg #MilitaryHotel #Bengaluru

Drop in at Ranganna Military Hotel for breakfast, lunch or dinner to chow down on rustic meaty dishes full of flavour. 

Established way back in 1964, this eatery swears by its food and so do its patrons. Presently run by a husband-wife duo and their sons, the USP of the restaurant lies in the functioning of its kitchen. With prep beginning as early as 7am, every dish is prepared by using secret recipes by the couple.  

Fluffy dosas and idlis for breakfast with paya soup, steaming mutton pulao, and keema gojju, ragi mudde, mutton chops, mutton head, chilli chicken and seafood too, make for dishes one must try on the restaurant‚Äôs tempting menu!

Ranganna Military Hotel, New 61, 1st floor, opp to Indian oil petroleum, Krishna Rajendra Road, 7th Block, Jayanagar, Bangalore 560 070; tel +91 80 4302 7346

Nothing captures the essence of a community the way its food does. Food Lovers brings to you recipes and traditional cuisine handed down through generations while sharing fond memories and cherished emotions of its maker.

Title: 500 Year Old Groundnut Fair In Bengaluru | Kadalekai Parishe | Basavangudi | Bangalore | Food Lovers
Description:
#Bangalore #India #GroundnutFestival
Held annually on the last Monday of Karthika Masa, (an auspicious month in the Hindu calendar dedicated to Lord Shiva) the Kadalekai Parishe is a tribute to Lord Basava. Farmers from across Karnataka and states of Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh offer their annual harvest of groundnuts at the Bull Temple in Basavanagudi.

Mounds of peanuts adorn the lanes of this neighbourhood for two days, as multitudes of locals purchase peanuts - raw, dried, boiled, roasted, salted, spiced, fried and sugar coated - at bargains.

A range of snacks such as bajji, bonda, batthaas, bendu and coloured sodas are also on sale, alongside stalls selling bangles, traditional toys and clay trinkets and plastic and glass dolls. 

Kadalekai Parishe, Bull Temple Road, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560 004

Inspired by his travels to Cambodia, Chef Vikas Seth is bringing Khmer cuisine to Sriracha and adding his own spin to it with the Khmer barbecue table. 

This immersive dining experience engaging all senses, has the chef cooking tableside.  
Diners can watch their meal being made in front of them on live charcoal or a fire mountain as it is traditionally referred to and delight in the fragrant aromas. 

At Sriracha, one can choose between a number of marinated meats and vegetables, from tofu, shrimp, chicken, to catch of the day fish, mushroom and tenderloin. Diners can also make their on bowl with a choice of either noodles or jasmine rice to accompany the meat and vegetables.

Description:

Title: A Commitment to Tradition
Description:

66
Save to My Food Lovers
RESTAURANTS & TRAVEL
A Commitment to Tradition
This chef cooked his first Sadhya at the tender age of 13 in a tiny village of Kerala. 25 years on, his commitment to preserving tradition and authenticity remain steadfast.

Ramachandran, Chef de Parte at the iconic restaurant, Karavalli, hails from a tiny village in the Kannur district of Kerala. Fascinated by the kitchen since an early age, he cooked his first sadya at the age of 13. The appreciation that he received for this endeavour encouraged him to pursue a career in the field.

He says his greatest blessing is when a guest tells him that his food reminds them or their mothers cooking.

Title: Single Malts And Kebabs ‚Äì Bharwan Aloo
Description: The ubiquitous Indian kebab, Bharwan Aloo finds its whisky soulmate in a single malt that has hints of spice, smoke and peat.

Title: Exploring Sri Lankan Cuisine with Priya Bala
Description:
Fresh ingredients and simple cooking techniques are characteristic of Sri Lankan cuisine with preparations that are rich in flavour and tradition, says noted food critic and writer, Priya Bala.

Priya Bala spent her formative years in Sri Lanka. Her ancestors arrived in the island nation generations ago to work in the tea plantations. And that was the bedrock of Priya‚Äôs 18 years in Colombo, assimilating the culinary traditions of the land.

 

‚ÄúIf you give me a basket of ingredients, my instinct would be to cook Sri Lankan,‚Äù she says speaking to Food Lovers TV of her passion for curating Sri Lankan food festivals on the sidelines of a promotion she is curating at The Lalit Ashok, Bangalore. ‚ÄúSri Lankan cuisine, like India, has many variations‚Ä¶ Sinhala cooking, Tamil cooking, Kandyan cooking and so on,‚Äù she adds. Watch this video for the complete low-down on the cuisine.

Title: Single Malt and Artisanal Chocolate
Description:
Chocolatier David Belo plays the alchemist at this pairing session, matching artisanal chocolates with three nuanced expressions of Paul John Indian Single Malt Whisky.

Chocolates and single malts are a prominent part of the artisanal food renaissance that is making waves in the country, explains chocolatier David Belo from Earth Loaf Artisan Chocolates.

 

In this pairing session, he shares three bespoke artisan chocolates that pair beautifully with three expressions of Paul John Indian Single Malt Whisky, namely Brilliance, Edited and Bold.

 

A tannic 72% Karnataka chocolate with hints of rose and black pepper works wonderfully with the light-bodied Brilliance; a 72% Kerala chocolate with flavours of raisins, caraway and mint is a match for the peated and fruity Edited; and a fruity chocolate creation featuring flavours of Ladakhi apricots, rock salt and wild honey pairs with the aromatic Bold.

Title: Preparing a Traditional Lasagna
Description:
Italian Chef Giuseppe Lioce shares the recipe for a traditional home-style lasagna.

Show more for the full recipe.


A comforting family recipe for this staple dish from northern Italy, that layers the creaminess of b√©chamel sauce and the tangy flavours of bolognese with al dente sheets of pasta.

Ingredients

For pasta

100 gms semolina flour
10 ml egg white
2 egg yolks
Salt to taste

For b√©chamel sauce

500 ml milk
100 gm roux
200 gm parmesan cheese
A pinch of nutmeg

For bolognese sauce

100 gms beef mince
300 gms tomato sauce
50 gms carrot
50 gms celery
50 gms leek
50 gms onion
3 gms rosemary
100 ml red wine
10 ml olive oil
2-3 sprigs of basil
1 bay leaf
Salt to taste

Method

For the pasta

To make the pasta dough, knead together mix semolina flour, egg yolk, egg white and salt.
When the dough is ready, leave it to rest for 30 minutes to an hour.
Now roll the pasta dough to sheets to 5 mm thickness.
Blanch the pasta in boiling water and keep aside.
 
For b√©chamel sauce

Make a b√©chamel sauce by adding the milk to the roux, made with butter and flour.
Add parmesan cheese and a pinch of nutmeg into the sauce.
 
For bolognese sauce

In a pan add olive oil and saut√© the carrots, leeks, celery and onions.
Add rosemary to the vegetables.
Once the vegetables are cooked, add beef in to the pan and cook through.
Add red wine and allow the beef to simmer for a while.
Add the tomato sauce, basil and bayleaf and cook on a low flame for 2 hours.
Keep stirring the sauce at regular intervals.
When the bolognese has thickened, check for seasoning add salt to taste.

Title: Modern Interpretation of Duck Confit at Artisan
Description:
Chef Manav Koul shares a glimpse into Wild Duck, his creative rendition of a French classic.

Chef Manav Koul‚Äôs signature creation, which he has given the deceptively simple name of Wild Duck, is a modern take on the classic French duck confit. A roulade is created with the slow-cooked duck meat, and a duck skin wafer adds a textural contrast. Wild mushrooms, confit potatoes and raspberry granita further add unexpected flavours to the dish.

Title: Lebanese Cuisine
Description:
Chef Dany Deeb shares a delicious glimpse into the rich cuisine of his homeland.

An essential characteristic of a traditional Lebanese meal is that you can barely see the table, because it is covered with plates and bowls of food, explains Executive Arabic Chef Dany Deeb from Sofitel Bahrain.

 

A typical meal begins with cold and hot mezze (Lebanese appetizers), which include dips such as hummus and muhammara, cheese platters, chicken wings and kibbeh, which are then followed by main course mainly consisting of mixed grills such as chicken shish taouk, lamb tikka and many such dishes.

Chef Dany also recommends Arak, a popular anise-flavoured spirit, which is a must with any Lebanese meal!

Title: Anglo Indian Cuisine
Description: Anglo Indian, one of the world's first fusion cuisines combines the spices and flavours of India with British cooking styles. Bridget White-Kumar, author of six Anglo Indian cook books, and Chef Sandip Narang present an insight into the culinary culture of the cuisine.
